entries.title: Business

translations.tha: ธุรกิจ

entries.description: <p>The <b>Business</b> component of the Open Directory generally lists and categorizes English-language sites that cover:</p> <h3>Business as an activity:</h3> <ul> <li>Sites covering industrial and commercial activities involving the exchange of commodities, services, or financial resources.</li> <li>Sites offering supporting services, information and resources to business and business people, such as trade associations, educational institutions and training programs, business and economic news, events, etc.</li> </ul> <h3>Business as an entity:</h3> <ul> <li>Official web sites for and about corporations and commercial enterprises (including subsidiaries) that manufacture, distribute, market and sell goods and services to other businesses (B2B) and/or consumers (B2C). <b> Note:</b> If the purpose of the site is to serve as a Shopping destination for consumers (or consumers <u>and</u> businesses), the site should be listed in the <a href="/Shopping/">Shopping</a> branch.</li> <li>Sites that exist solely to provide information about a company and its goods and services. <b>Note</b>: a company's brand name sites that focus on providing information to consumers are listed under <a href="/Home/Consumer_Information/">Home: Consumer Information</a>. See the <a href="/Home/Consumer_Information/faq.html#10">Consumer Information FAQ</a> for more information.</li> <li>Sites that focus on the theoretical, practical or operational aspects of a business enterprise: accounting, finance, human resources, management, marketing, etc.</li> </ul> <b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in the Business category:</b> <ul> <li><b>Online shopping</b>: Sites that exist primarily to sell goods and services directly to the consumer should be listed in the <a href="/Shopping/">Shopping</a> category. See the <a href="/Shopping/desc.html">Shopping category description</a> for more detail. </li> <li><b>Commercial sites (particularly "dot.coms")</b> whose main purpose is to provide information and resources to the consumer, as an end-user of the product or services (e.g. <a href="http://www.google.com/">Google</a>, <a href="http://www.consumersearch.com/">ConsumerSearch.com</a>, <a href="http://www.xml.com/">XML.com</a>, <a href="http://www.mp3.com/">MP3.com</a>, etc.)</li> <li>Sites that <b>focus on providing information to consumers</b> are listed under <a href="/Home/Consumer_Information/">Home: Consumer Information</a>. See the <a href="/Home/Consumer_Information/faq.html#10">Consumer Information FAQ</a> for more information.</li> <li><b>Local businesses</b>: Sites for inherently local businesses -- such as types of business that are commonly found in most localities and serve primarily the people and businesses in that area -- are in most cases listed exclusively in <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> categories.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Accounting

translations.tha: การบัญชี

entries.description: This category contains sites pertaining to the accounting profession.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is strictly for accounting organizations.

entries.title: Business-to-Business
entries.description: Contains links to sites which provide services for the accounting professional, to enable the accountant to better serve his clientele.

entries.title: Firms
entries.description: Sites at this level are for accounting firms with a physical presence -- not only clients -- in many countries. Most accounting firms are listed in a sub-category for their appropriate specialty or in a regional country/state sub-category.

entries.title: Accountants
entries.description: For individuals and firms offering a full range of accounting services to the general public. In many countries, this involves a license, such as a CPA.

entries.title: Bookkeeping_and_Tax_Preparation
entries.description: For individuals and firms offering bookkeeping and tax preparation services to the general public. Depending on the services and the country, this may involve certain types of license or certification.

entries.title: Networks
entries.description: For the sites of for-profit networks of individual accounting firms. Individual member firms in the network may have their sites listed separately in the appropriate <a href="/Business/Accounting/Firms/Accountants/">Accountants</a> category.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: For sites about information helpful to accountants, bookkeepers and related professionals.

entries.title: Tax_Negotiation_and_Representation
entries.description: Tax negotiation services, other than law firms. Law firms can be found <b><a href="/Society/Law/Services/Lawyers_and_Law_Firms/Taxation_Law/">HERE</a></b>. Most businesses in this category represent individuals and businesses with delinquent Federal and state tax debt. U.S. firms representing individuals and businesses before the Internal Revenue Service and state taxing agencies may be comprised of Enrolled Agents (EA), Certified Public Accountants (CPA) and/or attorneys.

entries.title: Sales_and_Use_Tax
entries.description: Sales and Use Tax consulting firms and related resources

entries.title: VAT_Related_Services
entries.description: VAT (Value Added Tax) is a tax on spending and is therefore known as an indirect tax. While the VAT imposed in each country varies, in general as a tax on expenditure, the burden of VAT is intended to fall just on consumers. However, it is paid on all transactions by all VAT-registered firms, so how can this be? The way it works is that the firm pays VAT on all the goods and materials it buys and it also charges VAT on all the goods it sells. At the end of each month or quarter, the firm then works out all the VAT it has paid out to its suppliers and all the VAT it has received from its customers.

entries.title: Aerospace_and_Defense
entries.description: <p>The <b>Aerospace and Defense</b> category comprises industries and establishments primarily engaged in one or more of the following:</p> <ul> <li>Development, manufacture, and distribution of civil and military aircraft, missiles, space vehicles, military equipment, and the auxiliary equipment, parts and supplies.</li> <li>Development, manufacture, and distribution of aerospace engines, propulsion units, and auxiliary equipment or parts.</li> <li> Development and production of aerospace and military product prototypes. </li> <li> Aircraft conversion (i.e., major modifications to systems). </li> <li> Complete aircraft or propulsion systems overhaul and rebuilding (i.e., periodic restoration of aircraft to original design specifications).</li> <li>Services that specifically support these industries (e.g., consulting, marketing, associations, etc.).<br> </li> </ul> <p>In general, the aerospace industry is engaged in the research, development, and manufacture of flight vehicles, ranging from unpowered gliders, sailplanes and lighter-than-air craft up though space vehicles. The term aerospace is derived from the words aeronautics and spaceflight.</p>

entries.title: Aeronautical
entries.description: Companies which manufacture components, parts or subsystems of aircraft, rockets or space vehicles should be listed in this category.

entries.title: Aircraft_and_Components
entries.description: Manufacturers of aircraft or aircraft kits.

entries.title: Airships_and_Balloons
entries.description: Lighter than air craft are those aircraft for which lift is principally generated by enclosing a large volume of gas that is lighter than the surrounding air. This includes aerostats, airships, balloons (sealed and hot air), blimps, dirigibles and Zeppelins.

entries.title: Components_and_Parts
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers of components used in aircraft manufacture.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category will list companies that purchase products from Producers and Manufacturers in bulk and resell it without transformation to re-sellers. The Wholesalers and Distributors that will be listed in this category are associated with aerospace. Companies that provide services to these Wholesalers and Distributors will be listed here.

entries.title: Fixed_Wing
entries.description: Fixed wing aircraft are those aircraft for which lift is principally generated by means of one or more aerodynamic wings, the airflow for which is generated by an engine pushing or pulling the aircraft through the air. This includes aircraft on which the wing geometry can be altered during flight (eg. "swing wing" fighters).

entries.title: Gliders
entries.description: Sailplane or glider manufacturers .

entries.title: Kits
entries.description: Aircraft kits are prefabricated to a certain degree by the manufacturer and then completed by the owner of the aircraft.

entries.title: Gliders
entries.description: This category contains manufacturers of glider aircraft kits .

entries.title: Light_Aircraft
entries.description: This category contains manufacturers of light aircraft kits .

entries.title: Rotary_Wing
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of helicopter kits, gyrocopter kits and other rotary wing kit airplanes.

entries.title: Ultralight
entries.description: This category contains manufacturers of ultralight aircraft kits .

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Software for controlling and tracking maintenance and repairs of aircraft. This may include defining and tracking maintenance requirements, or process control for parts and and repairs.

entries.title: Recycling
entries.description: Sites about or published by aircraft recyclers.

entries.title: Rotary_Wing
entries.description: Rotary wing aircraft are those aircraft for which lift is principally generated by one or more aerodynamic wings rotating about one or more fixed points on the aircraft. This includes autogyros, gyroplanes and helicopters.

entries.title: Safety_Briefing_Cards
entries.description: Manufacturers and suppliers of aviation passenger safety briefing cards.

entries.title: Systems
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers of complete aircraft subsystems. These range from engines to landing gear, from de-icing systems to braking parachutes.

entries.title: Manufacturing
entries.description: This category lists sites that sell or distribute commercial aircraft avionics. Avionics manufacturers are listed in a separate category. Avionics includes flight instruments, navigation systems, communication and data link systems, and aircraft monitoring equipment. Avionics does not include electrical and power systems, intercomms, and passenger information/entertainment systems.

entries.title: Sales,_Installation,_and_Repair
entries.description: Installation services of avionics parts and equipment.

entries.title: Unmanned
entries.description: Unmanned aircraft aircraft are those aircraft designed to carry a payload but no pilot or passengers. This includes drones and UAVs used as targets or for data gathering.

entries.title: Aircraft_Rental_and_Instruction
entries.description: This category will list web sites that offer aircraft rental and pilot training. All levels of pilot training will be listed here from discovery flights up through airline transport pilot. All levels of aircraft rentals will be listed here.

entries.title: Fixed_Wing
entries.description: This category will list web sites that offer aircraft rental and pilot training. All levels of pilot training will be listed here from discovery flights up through airline transport pilot. All levels of aircraft rentals will be listed here. What will not be listed in this category: o Aircraft owned and operated as fractional ownership. o Aircraft that is leased to multiple owners. o Pilot training for type ratings of jet and turboprop airplanes. o Aircraft ownership clubs that require substantial capital investment to join.

entries.title: Pilots
entries.description: This category will list web sites that offer aircraft rental and pilot training. All levels of pilot training will be listed here from discovery flights up through airline transport pilot. All levels of aircraft rentals will be listed here. What will not be listed in this category: o Aircraft owned and operated as fractional ownership. o Aircraft that is leased to multiple owners. o Pilot training for type ratings of jet and turboprop airplanes. o Aircraft ownership clubs that require substantial capital investment to join.

entries.title: Directories_and_Portals
entries.description: This category will list URLs of Aviation Directories and Portals to instruction and rentals sites.

entries.title: Personal_Pages
entries.description: This category contains sites related to aviation which are created by individuals who wish to share stories and photos of their experiences in learning to fly.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category will list manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, repairers and renters of tools and equipment used within the Aeronautical industry including companies that provide services to these companies. It is not for raw materials or industrial supplies, these should be submitted to the "Materials and Supplies" category .

entries.title: Transportation
entries.description: This category will list companies and organizations that support the Aviation Transportation Industry.

entries.title: Defense
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Air_Force_and_Aerospace
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply air force and aerospace products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Biodefense
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply biodefense products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Communications,_Radar_and_Vision
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply communications, radar and vision products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Consultancy,_Logistics_and_Intelligence
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply consultancy, logistics and intelligence products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category will list web sites that contain alphabetical or classified lists of resources covering Defense companies. This category will also list Guides that provide information on this subject that goes beyond simple listing and description.

entries.title: Electronics,_Engineering_and_Software
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply electronics, engineering and software products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Guns,_Missiles_and_Munitions
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply guns, missiles and munitions products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Military_Equipment_and_Parts
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply military equipment, parts and products to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Military_Transport_and_Combat_Vehicles
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply military transport and combat vehicles products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Naval_and_Marine
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply naval and marine products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category will list URLs for news services, newspapers, books, magazines and e-zines, and journals that are dedicated to the defense industry.

entries.title: Training_and_Recruitment
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who supply training and recruitment products and services to the military and defense industries.

entries.title: Agriculture_and_Forestry

translations.tha: การเกษตรและการป่าไม้

entries.description: <p>The Agriculture and Forestry sector comprises industries engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats. </p> <p> The companies in this sector are often described as farms, ranches, dairies, greenhouses, nurseries, orchards, or hatcheries. This sector includes supporting industries such as equipment, supplies, consulting and administrative services, etc. </p><br><i>(Source: This category description is based on the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS), 1997)</i>.

entries.title: Pilot_Training
entries.description: This category will list companies and individuals that specialize in training pilots for agriculture aircraft and applications.

entries.title: Aquaculture
entries.description: Welcome to our on-line directory of the aquaculture industry. Here you will find groups, organizations, companies, growers and other resources engaged in or supplying information, equipment or services to the industry. Your feedback is encouraged.

entries.title: Aquatic_Animal_Producers
entries.description: This category is for producers and suppliers of live aquatic animals . Primarily these will include fish and crustracian farming of both freshwater and saltwater species for supply to the commercial and recreational ( pets ) industries . It does not include submissions related to the commercial fishing industry. Such sites should be submitted to the Commercial Harvesting category .

entries.title: Crustaceans
entries.description: This category is for producers, breeders and suppliers of crustaceans ( shrimp, lobster, crab ) for supply to the commercial and recreational ( pets ) industries.

entries.title: Fish
entries.description: This category is for producers and suppliers of live fish . Primarily these will include both freshwater and saltwater species for supply to the commercial and recreational ( pets ) industries. It does not include submissions related to the commercial fishing industry. Such sites should be submitted to the Commercial Harvesting category .

entries.title: Freshwater
entries.description: This category is for producers and suppliers of live freshwater fish for supply to the commercial and recreational ( pets ) industries.

entries.title: Breeders
entries.description: This category is for breeders of freshwater fish for supply to the commercial and recreational ( pets ) industries.

entries.title: Saltwater
entries.description: This category is for producers and suppliers of saltwater fish for supply to the commercial and recreational ( pets ) industries.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for organizations such as trade associations and societies whose interests are directly concerned with the aquaculture industry .

entries.title: Equipment_Suppliers
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers and distributors of equipment specific to the aquaculture industry . Typically products will include equipment for fish farming, water treatment and electronic lighting, counting and data control devices.

entries.title: Fish_Farming
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers and distributors of equipment specific to the fish farming industry . Typically products will include complete systems, traps and creels, incubators and hatchery equipment .

entries.title: Water_Treatment
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers and distributors of water treatment equipment specific to the aquaculture industry . Typically products will include filters, aeration equipment, oxygen diffusers and skimmers .

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the import and export of fish, aquatic plants, and other similar marine products.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category is for news services, newspapers, books, magazines and e-zines, and journals specific to the aquaculture industry .

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: This category is for informational resources related to aquaculture .

entries.title: Accessories
entries.description: This focuses on the accessories to barns and similar structures.

entries.title: Designs
entries.description: This category is intended for all websites that focus on the designs and plans for barns and agricultural structures. This includes sites that offer CAD services, blueprints and DIY building plans.

entries.title: Biologicals
entries.description: <p>The <b>Biologicals</b> category focuses on living organisms, or products derived from, and utilized for pest and disease control or growth enhancement and regulation. These include: </p> <ul> <li><strong>Parasitoids</strong>,</li> <li><strong>Predators</strong>,</li> <li><strong>Pathogens</strong>,</li> <li><strong>Weed Feeders</strong>,</li> <li><b>Organic Extracts</b> used as stimulants, controls, or soil improvement, and </li> <li><strong>Enzymes and Microbial.</strong></li> </ul> <p><strong><u>Not listed</u></strong> in this category are:</p> <ul> <li> Sites covering <strong>scientific and technical</strong> issues which are found under <a href="/Science/Agriculture/Pests_and_Diseases/Biological_Control/">Science: Agriculture: Pests_and_Diseases: Biological_Contro</a>l.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Listings of firms that offer international services and expertise in business, marketing and economy of agriculture and allied industries.

entries.title: Cooperatives
entries.description: Agricultural businesses that follow a cooperative (i.e., worker-owned, farmer-owned, or consumer-owned) business model. Includes cooperative farms, farming supplies, and seed banks.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category contains websites that provide listings of business related internet links and resources pertaining to agriculture and related industries.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Employment resources related to Agriculture or Forestry industries.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Business and trade associations for equipment and material suppliers to the agricultural and forestry industries.

entries.title: Auctions
entries.description: The category is for listings of companies in the farm and ranch equipment auction business.

entries.title: Frost_Protection
entries.description: Wind machines can be used to keep ice from freezing fruit orchards.

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the import and export of agricultural equipment and supplies.

entries.title: Irrigation_Equipment
entries.description: Irrigation equipment as used in agriculture. Here you will find manufacturers, wholesalers, retailers and distributors of agricultural irrigation systems.

entries.title: Retail
entries.description: Listings of farm equipment dealers around the world by regions. Suppliers of new and used equipment.

entries.title: Tractors,_Machinery,_and_Implements
entries.description: This category is for tractors, tractor accessories (such as plows or spreaders), combines, and other agricultural machinery and implements.

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the import and export of agricultural plant and equipment including harvesters, tillage, planting, grading, pumping and spraying parts and machinery.

entries.title: Retail
entries.description: Includes sites related to tractor, farm machinery, and farm implement retailers as well as businesses offering used equipment.

entries.title: Spraying_Equipment
entries.description: Spraying Equipment, Application Technology, Chemical Products & Traits.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: For wholesalers and distributors, who do not offer retail sales, of tractor, machinery, and implements.

entries.title: Used
entries.description: Used farm equipment for sale.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: For wholesalers and distributors, who do not offer retail sales, of agricultural or forestry related equipment and/or supplies.

entries.title: Farm_Real_Estate
entries.description: Agricultural or wooded farm land for sale.

entries.title: Field_Crops
entries.description: Listings of websites concerned with the business and commercial side of raising field crops or arable farming as it is called in some areas.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Organizations and trade associations of and for growers of field crops.

entries.title: Seed
entries.description: Agricultural, vegetable, and flower seeds are used to grow plants for many purposes, such as providing food for people and animals, raw materials for pharmaceuticals, and ornamental landscaping. Many companies specialize in a particular type of seed - these are listed in the more specialized categories linked from this one. The sites collected here are those whose specialty does not have its own category, or whose offerings span multiple specialty categories without particularly emphasizing any one of them.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Business organizations serving members in the seed trade.

entries.title: Processing
entries.description: Companies specialized in providing processing services in the field of seed production, including coating and delinting.

entries.title: Forestry
entries.description: <p>The <strong>Forestry</strong> category contains sites offering products, information and equipment relating to the forestry industry. Areas of focus include:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Planting and Maintenance</strong>,</li> <li><strong>Harvesting and Production</strong>,</li> <li><strong>Fire Fighting</strong>, and</li> <li><strong>Timber and Tree Products</strong></li> </ul> <p>Also included are support industries such as associations, wholesalers, importers, and media companies which focus on the forestry industry. </p> <p> Sites<b> <u>not listed</u> </b>in this category include:</p> <ul> <li>Companies growing and harvesting Christmas trees are found under <a href="/Business/Agriculture_and_Forestry/Horticulture/Christmas_Trees">Business: Agriculture and Forestry: Horticulture: Christmas Trees</a>.</li> <li>Topics related to the scientific or academic aspects of forestry are categorized under <a href="/Science/Agriculture/Forestry/">Science: Agriculture: Forestry.</a></li> </ul>

entries.title: Arborist_Supplies
entries.description: This category is for websites primarily offering arborist supplies and accessories.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Submit sites about Forestry associations or organizations that are involved in the harvesting, sustainable use, or economic and societal development of forest resources.

entries.title: Chippers_and_Grinders
entries.description: Websites for firms offering sales, service, or hire of chippers and grinders. These are machinery for reducing trees, branches, and stumps into small chips.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Listings of firms that offer international services and expertise in business, marketing and economics related to forestry and woodlands.

entries.title: Fire_Fighting
entries.description: This category is primarily for forest and wild land fire fighting equipment, education, and information. There is quite a bit of overlap with the Urban fire fighting category (Business/Business_Services/Security/Products_and_Equipment/Fire_Fighting_Equipment/), so you may want to check both. The sites are not duplicated in each category, they are put into the category that fits their main focus.

entries.title: Logging_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for firms offering to supply, service, or hire machinery and equipment for tree felling and logging. This does not include equipment for further processing of the timber. For these, see the 'Production Equipment', and 'Chippers and Grinders' categories.

entries.title: Chainsaws_and_Axes
entries.description: This category is for chainsaws, parts, supplies, and repair services related to chainsaws as well as axes, hatchets, mauls, and other tree cutting implements.

entries.title: Firewood_Processing_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for firewood processing equipment such as log splitters and racks. Please send chainsaws and mauls to their category.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Forestry industry news sites and publications. Includes both print and online sources.

entries.title: Private_Forest_Land
entries.description: This category is intended to provide private landowners of smaller forest areas with information sources such as professional assistance, vendor services, financial assistance, organizations, and research relevant to helping them steward their trees, wildlife, water, and the other components of the forest.

entries.title: Production_Equipment
entries.description: Listings of firms offering equipment, or the hire and service of equipment, for the processing of logwood and other forestry products.

entries.title: Filing_Room
entries.description: This category is for saw, blade, and knife filing and maintenance equipment, information, service, supply, and accessories. Generally most anything related to or found in a filing room; including saws, knives, and blades themselves.

entries.title: Sawlogs_and_Mulch
entries.description: This category is for suppliers, producers and manufacturers of mulch and "generic" hardwoods products such as pallet lumber and saw logs. For veneers and exotic/fine millwork grade hardwoods, see the Veneers and Fine Hardwoods category. Wholesalers and retail companies can be found in Business: Industries: Construction and Maintenance: Materials and Supplies: Wood and Plastics .

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Software for forest and woodland management and production.

entries.title: Trucks_and_Vehicles
entries.description: This category is for transport vehicles of all types, providing they are specifically designed or offered for the forestry industry.

entries.title: Horticulture
entries.description: <p>The <strong>Horticulture</strong> category focuses on businesses engaged in the cultivation of fruits, vegetables, flowers, turf grass, and ornamental plants. Generally production involves relatively small acreage and more intensive methods as compared to that of field crops, although this distinction is not always precise. Businesses in this sector may be described as:</p> <ul> <li><b>Nurseries</b>, including trees, shrubs, exotics, perennials, bedding plants, and bulbs,</li> <li><b>Market Gardeners</b> or <strong>Produce Growers</strong>,</li> <li><b>Greenhouses</b>,</li> <li><b>Orchards</b>,</li> <li><b>Christmas tree farms</b>,</li> <li><b>Seed companies</b>,</li> <li><strong>Turf farms</strong>, or</li> <li><strong>Floral companies</strong>.</li> </ul> <p>Companies offering materials and supplies specifically designed for horticultural producers are also found here, as well as sites related to the import and export of horticultural products. </p> <p>Industries included are those who typically supply wholesalers, retailers, landscapers, other growers, supermarkets, and occasionally home consumers.</p> <P> <b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b> <ul> <li>Sites providing information about <strong>home or hobby</strong> aspects of horticulture are listed under <a href="/Home/Gardening/">Home: Gardening</a>.</li> <li>Industries involved primarily in the <strong>processing, packing, and delivery</strong> of produce to retailers or end users are listed under <a href="/Business/Food_and_Related_Products/Produce/">Business: Food and Related Products: Produce</a>. </li> <li><strong>Field Crops</strong> are found under <a href="/Business/Agriculture_and_Forestry/Field_Crops/">Business: Agriculture and Forestry: Field Crops</a>.</li> <li>Sites related to <strong>scientific, research and technical</strong> aspects are found under <a href="/Science/Agriculture/Horticulture/">Science: Agriculture: Horticulture</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Sites for industry and advocacy groups and other organizations serving or aimed at the horticultural sector.

entries.title: Edible_Fungi
entries.description: This category is for websites about businesses engaged in the growing and production of mushrooms and other edible fungi, as well as industrial and commercial associations and information for these businesses. <p /> Websites for businesses engaged in the treatment of the finished products should be listed in one of the linked categories.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: This category will list all career and employment sites for the Horticulture area, including job listings and resumes. This category will also list companies that provide services to the companies and individuals that are listed here.

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: This category lists sites for companies and business entities engaged in import and export of a broad range of horticultural products.

entries.title: Materials_and_Supplies
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers, distributors, and wholesalers of products used by the horticulture industry.

entries.title: Containers
entries.description: Manufacturers and suppliers of pots, baskets, trays, and other containers used in the horticulture and nursery trades.

entries.title: Greenhouses
entries.description: Suppliers, manufacturers, and installers of greenhouses and associated equipment, accessories, and systems.

entries.title: Hydroponics
entries.description: This category is for suppliers of commercial and laboratory equipment for hydroponic growing.

entries.title: Soils_and_Media
entries.description: Producers and suppliers of planting media, including peat moss products, horticultural mineral supplies such as vermiculite and perlite, and soil testing supplies.

entries.title: Oils,_Fats,_and_Waxes
entries.description: Plants and the cultivation of plants grown to produce fatty acids, including fatty acid esters and glycerides for use in cooking and nutrition, soap, cosmetics, and industrial products such as paints and other coatings, linoleum, and plasticizers.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Business associations aimed at the ornamental green industry, including landscaping and nursery associations.

entries.title: Cut_Flowers_and_Greens
entries.description: Floral growers are the farms where ornamental crops are actually grown for ultimate distribution to a retail outlet. Products include any variety of live cut flowers, filler or tropical flowers, for example; roses, chrysanthemums, gypsophila, heliconia, protea, lily, orchid, carnation and liatris. Web sites will be listed in the category that describes the major part of their production, with secondary crop production listed in the description.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for organizations such as trade associations whose interests are directly concerned with the growing of commercial cut flowers and foliages.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Companies that also sell to the general public will be considered in the Wholesale/ category only if those sales are a MINOR part of company's trading. Double listing in both Shopping/ and other Business/ categories will be extremely rare and considered on a case by case basis. NO company whose primary focus is to sell flowers to the general public will be listed here.

entries.title: Irrigation_and_Drainage
entries.description: <b>Irrigation</b> of turfgrass is the artificial provision of water, both subsurface and overhead, through pipes, canals, and flooding, using either a fixed or movable supply system. The most common form of turfgrass irrigation involves small orifice emitters in sprinkler heads flush at ground level, connected to a pressurized pumping system by means of rigid pipes. <b>Drainage</b> is the artificial removal of water through subsurface pipes, lateral ditches, siphoning, and grading. <p> Related products and services that belong in the Irrigation and Drainage category are water quality including salinity, water conservation, including water monitoring, fertigation (the injection of fertilizers into the irrigation system), chemigation, soil moisture sensing, wetting agents, and antitranspirants. <p> Related products and services that belong in other categories include perched water tables, e.g., the USGA (United States Golf Association) specification for greens, which belongs under <b>Soils and Soil Amendments</b>; and liquid fertilizers which belong under <b>Fertilizers and Nutrition</b>.

entries.title: Industrial_Hemp
entries.description: Industrial Hemp is an annual plant that can be grown in almost any climate and can be used to produce over 25,000 products including: food, paper, clothing, plastics, building materials and fuel. It is currently grown in more than 25 countries including Canada, England, Germany, France, Russia and China but it is still prohibited in the United States. <br><br>Please see the <a href="/Business/Agriculture_and_Forestry/Industrial_Hemp/faq.html">FAQ</a> for more information about Industrial Hemp .

Huacayas are by far the most common and produce dense crimpy fiber. Suris long "ringlets" with less crimp and density but greater luster. This category contains breeders of both huacayas and suris.

entries.title: Guanacos
entries.description: Guanaco are classified in the family Camilidae and are South America's largest land mammal. This family includes the Old World camelids; the Dromedary camel, Camelus dromedarius, and the Bactrian camel, Camelus bactrianus, and the South American Camelids (SACs), the Llama, Lama glama, alpaca, Lama pacos, guanaco, Lama guanicoe and the vicuna, Vicugna vicugna. All of the SACs can produce fertile crosses and indeed the alpaca and llama are run so closely together that cross breeding is a very common occurrence and at one time threatened the true line of species. Although Camelids have a complex three part stomach, they are in fact not ruminants as the digestive system is slightly different, they do not have horns or antlers and instead of a cloven hoof, they have callous pads ending in two claws. Camelids have been described in the suborder Tylopoda, meaning pad-footed, in the Order Artiodactyla. Alpacas and Llamas exist only as domestic species whereas the guanaco and vicuna are wild. Guanaco can be found at altitudes ranging from sea level in Tierra del Fuego to 4000 metres along the Andes of northern Chile, Peru and Argentina. The environments that they inhabit range from the Atacama desert, one of the driest in the world to snow capped, wind swept peaks, glaciers and even forests. Guanaco have to cope with bleak winters, driving snow, freezing temperatures, fierce winds and a generally poor vegetation. There are areas of lush bog areas known as bofadels which are prized territories for breeding males. Guanaco are both grazers and browsers able to take opportunity of any potential food source. Guanaco are found in relatively small numbers outside of South America, mainly in the USA, Europe and Australia. Zoos and wildlife parks are the main locations but growing numbers of people are keeping them on small holdings, either as tourist attractions, as pets or as hobby fibre producers. A minority keep them as 'farm' animals such as here at Esgyrn. They have excellent digestive systems that enables them to graze on marginal land that other livestock won't accept and they also mix well with other livestock.

entries.title: Murray_Grey
entries.description: The original Murray Greys were a genetic phenomenon. One particular Shorthorn cow when bred with various Aberdeen Angus bulls would always throw a silver (grey) calf instead of the expected "blue roan". Starting in 1905 these animals were saved and through selective breeding the breed was created. The location was southern New South Wales on the Murray River, hence the name Murray Grey.

entries.title: Breeders
entries.description: Breeders and farmers raising Scottish Blackface sheep.

entries.title: Shetland_Sheep
entries.description: Shetland Sheep originated on the Shetland Islands off the coast of Scotland and the roots for this breed probably go back over a thousand years to sheep brought to the islands by Viking settlers. Having survived for centuries under harsh conditions and on a meager diet, they maintain desirable characteristics including natural hardiness, thriftiness, and are know to lamb easily. The smallest of the British breeds of sheep, the animals are primairly raised primarily for their beautiful wool. Shetland wool is considered one of the finest and softest of any British breed, with a Bradford count usually in the upper 50's to lower 60's and an average fiber diamerter of 23 microns.

entries.title: Breeders
entries.description: Breeders of Shetland Sheep

entries.title: Shropshire
entries.description: Sites about the Shropshire sheep and for Shropshire breeders.

entries.title: Soay
entries.description: Soay sheep are an ancient, primitive breed that originate from the British Isles thousands of years ago; the name comes from the island of Soay in the St Kilda archepelago off the coast of Scotland. Soay sheep are tiny, naturally hardy, have short tails that do not require docking and are known for parasite resistance. The fleece sheds naturally in the summer, and will generally vary from light to dark brown. Rams are horned, and ewes can be horned, scurred or polled.

entries.title: Breeders
entries.description: Breeders and farmers raising Soay sheep.

entries.title: Southdown
entries.description: The Southdown is a polled white sheep with short wool staple that produces an early maturing meaty carcass.

entries.title: Babydoll
entries.description: Miniature or babydoll variation of this breed.

entries.title: Standard
entries.description: Full-size or standard Southdown sheep breeders and organizations.

entries.title: South_Suffolk
entries.description: South Suffolk, a distinct breed of sheep.

entries.title: St._Croix
entries.description: The St Croix sheep, also known as Virgin Island White, are a hair sheep that is well suited to warm climates, with exceptional parasite resistance. Both rams and ewes are polled. They are usually white, but can be found in solid tan, brown, black, or white with brown or black spots. They are prolific, averaging 150% to 200% lambing rates, with two lambings per year not uncommon. While St Croix are most suited to warm climates, they adapt to colder climates by producing a heavy winter coat of mixed wool and hair that is shed in spring.

entries.title: Targhee
entries.description: Targhee sheep are one of the youngest North American breeds, having been developed in the middle of the 20th century. Rams weigh between 200 and 300 lbs, with ewes weighing between 125 and 200 lbs. Ewe fleeces average 10 to 14 lbs, with a micron measurement of 21 to 25 and a Bradford count of 58 to 64. Staple length is 3 to 5 inches.

entries.title: Breeders
entries.description: Breeders of Texel Sheep.

entries.title: Tunis
entries.description: Tunis sheep are one of the oldest breeds indigenous to the United States. They are born red or tan and fade to a creamy color, retaining the birth color on their faces and legs. This is a medium sized breed, and both rams and ewes are polled. They are known for disease resistance and tolerance to various climates. Tunis wool can have 24 to 30 microns, with a Bradford count of 56 to 58.

entries.title: Breeders
entries.description: Breeders and farmers raising Tunis sheep.

entries.title: Vendeen
entries.description: Vendeen sheep are a polled breed developed in France.

entries.title: Wensleydale
entries.description: Wensleydale Sheep

Think "Diesel," "Stussi," "Guess." <br> <br> If your site is selling a product, please consider <a href="/Shopping/Clothing/"> Shopping </a>. No sites which offer sales will be listed here.

entries.title: Post_Production
entries.description: Contains sites concerned with post production aspects of film, video, and television, including facilities and services involved in editing, sound, special effects, language versioning, graphics and many other activities.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Sites of academic department, private schools and other institutes offering courses of audio and recording engineering.

entries.title: Subtitles_and_Dubbing
entries.description: Subtitles are text that appears upon the screen during a movie, displaying the dialog in a different language. Dubbing or voice-over is the replacement of the original dialog or voice-over with another language version. These techniques are intended to make a film, video or television program more accessible to those who do not speak the language it was originally shot in.

entries.title: Visual_Effects
entries.description: This category lists businesses or commercial services which relate to the creation of visual effects in film, television, or video. The category limits itself to effects created after production, predominantly on computers.

entries.title: Animals_and_Wranglers
entries.description: The animals used in motion pictures and television are no ordinary house pets. Nor are they as intelligent as they seem in the finished product. They have been rigorously trained to perform individual tricks upon command, in the sometimes difficult environment of the movie or television set. <P> While at work, "Animal actors" are accompanied and handled by their own professional wranglers, often the same individuals who trained them in the first place. Therefore the two are inseparable in a directory listing. <P> When searching for an animal to play a role in a production, one might search for specific animals or one might choose a trainer first who will work with the production to find and train the right animal for the job.

entries.title: Steadicam
entries.description: Steadicam, manufactured by Cinema Products, is a weighted camera mount system which allows a human to walk with the camera without jiggling the picture. It is used primarily in the motion picture and professional video industries. To use the Steadicam effectively requires a good deal of practice and skilled operators are in high demand. For the purposes of this category, "Steadicam" is considered to include similar products made by other companies as well.

entries.title: Set_Medics
entries.description: A Set Medic is a person who provides on-location standby medical services for a film production. The medic is available to provide immediate care in case of accident or emergency. The medic is often familiar with the medical personnel, transportation and facilities available in the surrounding area. The medic is also able to evaluate a location as to potential or past medical and safety issues.

entries.title: Sound
entries.description: This category contains resumes and CVs of individuals working as sound personnel in the film, video and television production industries.

entries.title: Studio_Teachers
entries.description: Studio Teachers, also sometimes called Welfare Workers, are teachers who specialize in educating child actors while they are at work on movie productions. This is necessary because filming schedules are often too lengthy and intense to allow attendance at a regular school. Studio Teachers are also responsible for the health and safety of the children while they are at work. In some localities their presence is required by law.

entries.title: Technical_Advisors
entries.description: Technical advisors provide expert advice on specific subjects in order that a movie or show will be as realistic as possible. Some examples of areas in which advice might be needed are military or police operations, hospital procedures, and historically accurate technology.

entries.title: Specialty_Productions
entries.description: This category lists organizations and individuals who specialize in producing in a particular environment or discipline. Examples include sports, underwater, air-borne productions.

entries.title: Special_Effects
entries.description: Effects created on the set during production, which generally do not require further image manipulation. Special effects include pyrotechnics, animatronic creatures and make-up effects. Pyrotechnics is the controlled use of incendiary materials to create explosions, fires, and smoke. Animatronics is simulating human, animal, or creature forms, controlled manually or remotely. Make-up effects involve changing an actor's physical appearance, using conventional make-up or the addition of artificial parts.

entries.title: Television
entries.description: This category lists companies that focus on producing content for broadcast television.

entries.title: Commercials
entries.description: This category lists companies that focus on producing commercials for broadcast television.

entries.title: Mobile_Broadcast_Production
entries.description: Companies that own vans, trucks and or trailers that contain portable television studio equipment for recording events occurring outside of normal television studios. This is how sporting events, live concerts, and other live events are recorded for broadcast on television. programs can be recorded on videotape for later broadcast, or can be sent direct to the television station or networks by microwave or satellite uplink. These are complete television studio on wheels.

entries.title: Teleprompters
entries.description: Teleprompters display the dialog or other cue information for a production, allowing actors, announcers and others to read their lines as needed.

entries.title: Video
entries.description: Companies specializing in non-broadcast video production and post-production.

entries.title: Family_Memories
entries.description: Producers of family history video, family tributes, video photo montages for consumer markets.

entries.title: Wedding_and_Events

entries.title: Production_Companies
entries.description: Listing for production companies and/or recording studios providing voiceover services for entertainment-related, commercial and industrial recording.

entries.title: Models
entries.description: This category is for sites about models and the modeling industry. This includes fashion, character and photographic models.

entries.title: Agents_and_Agencies
entries.description: Agencies listed directly under this category header have intercontinental offices.<br><br>Only <u>fashion</u> modeling agencies get listed here.<br>Please do <i>not</i> submit here if the agency charges an application fee.

entries.title: Internet
entries.description: Agencies that book, manage, and promote models only online. These agencies only receive payment by commission from completed work assignments.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Training facilities, and materials for people interested in pursuing a career in modeling.

entries.title: Hosting
entries.description: Sites that provide internet exposure to models by offering online composite card or portfolio display services, web design and hosting, or directory listings. These services may charge a registration fee, and/or monthly membership fees. Warning: These services are NOT agencies. Legitimate agencies will not require fees for evaluation, information, or work. Research a company thoroughly, prior to spending money on their services.

entries.title: Free
entries.description: Sites that provide online composite card or portfolio display services, hosting, or directory listings to models. The sites do not require payment for these services at any time.

entries.title: Image_Galleries_and_Fan_Pages
entries.description: Image gallery and fan sites listed here feature two or more models. Sites can include fan sites or image galleries showing editorial, catalog, or advertising campaign images.

entries.title: Individual
entries.description: Sites dedicated to one particular model.

entries.title: Music
entries.description: <p><center>The music business is a global industry that reaches people all over the world. It starts with the <b>artist side</b>, when a musical composition is created and performed, but behind, there is a whole industry with many different jobs that supports it during its way to the audience. That is, the <b>business side </b>of the music industry.</center> </p>

entries.title: Agents_and_Managers
entries.description: <p><b>Jobs/Services</b> included under <b>Agents and Managers</b> Category are:</p> <p><b>A&R(Artist and Repertoire)</b>: They are primarily responsible for finding and signing new talent and acting as the point person at the record company for the recording process.</p> <p><b>Artist Managers</b>: They are responsible for the whole artist's career. The services usually include: getting and negotiating deals, finding a booking agent, setting the strategic orientation, receiving and filtering requests, and many others.</p> <p><b>Booking Agents</b>: They generally make possible for an artist to perform at a concert venue, getting opportunities of live exposures to the audiences. </p> <p><b>Tour Managers</b>: They are in charge of securing everything related to taking artists and their acts on the road will run smoothly.</p>

entries.title: Composers_and_Arrangers
entries.description: Dedicated to business aspects of making music, particularly sites that are aimed at music professionals and of individuals or studios whose listings focus on soliciting business for themselves.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: <p>Consulting includes firms offering all kind of professional services to the music industry, such as Business Development, Marketing, Financial, Legal, and many others.</p>

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Online Guides and Directories related to the music business, including the comprehensive ones and those focused on a certain specialty within the industry.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Jobs' offer and demand in the music business.

entries.title: Individual_Resumes
entries.description: Personal Resumes for Jobs in the music business.

entries.title: Engravers
entries.description: Music engravers accept handwritten music and use computer software to make publishable quality pages of music notation, replacing engravers of old who engraved music on metal plates for printing presses. Music engraving is also called music typesetting, music copying and music preparation.

entries.title: Instruments
entries.description: <p><center>Manufacture and services related to <b> music instruments </b> .</center> </p>

entries.title: Labels
entries.description: <p><b>Music Labels </b> are companies with a primary business: the creation of CDs, LPs, MP3 files, or other audio media. They work with a number of different artists, in one or more styles or genres.</P> <p>Because of the number of very small labels which appear, and disappear, overnight, businesses listed here are selected because they have a portfolio of several artists, conduct business in a particular city, and distribute their audio material in stores, as well as from their website.</p>

entries.title: Licensing
entries.description: They research music rights and secure all licenses and permissions for the use of copyrighted works and recordings for television, motion pictures, commercials, corporate productions and the Internet.

entries.title: Production
entries.description: <b>Production</b> involves the integration of different roles that make recordings possible. It goes beyond Artists and <b> Recording studios </b>. A key role is played by <b> Producers </b>, who make the musical decisions before, during and after the recording sessions, manage the whole process and control the results. From the technical point of view <b> Audio engineers </b>, are the professionals who apply their skills to achieve the best quality of recordings. They handle recording, edition, mixing, and mastering processes.

entries.title: Audio_Engineers
entries.description: More submission details in <b> <a href="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Music/Production/desc.html"> Business: Arts and Entertainment: Music: Production </a> </b> </center>

entries.title: Producers
entries.description: <b>Producers</b> play a very important role in the process of making a recording. They are the ones behind the scene deciding who is going to record what and how... from contracting the studio, making the musical decisions, and controlling the quality of the final master tape. More submission details in <b> <a href="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Music/Production/desc.html"> Business: Arts and Entertainment: Music: Production </a> </b> </center>

entries.title: Recording_Studios
entries.description: Recording studios are facilities designed to provide the quiet environment, specialized technology and equipment, and professional personnel needed to make a music recording. The category also includes mobile studios and facilities dedicated to music edition, mixing, and mastering.

entries.title: Promotion
entries.description: <p><b>Promotors</b> are responsible for artists´ presence in the media, specially TV and video, and other promotional places. <p><b>Publicists</b> are focused on obtaining coverage and interviews for their clients, developing relations with the media and positioning the artists through their personal angles or stories.<p><b>Event Planners</b> are responsible for organizing events with the participation of musicians.

entries.title: Demo_Recording
entries.description: Please go to <b> <a href="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Music/Promotion/desc.html"> Business: Arts and Entertainment: Music: Promotion</a> </b> </center> for more submission details.

entries.title: Event_Planning
entries.description: Please go to <b> <a href="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Music/Promotion/desc.html"> Business: Arts and Entertainment: Music: Promotion</a> </b> </center> for more submission details.

entries.title: Web
entries.description: Please go to <b> <a href="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Music/Promotion/desc.html"> Business: Arts and Entertainment: Music: Promotion</a> </b> </center> for more submission details.

entries.title: Tour_Support
entries.description: For companies assisting touring productions, as well as sites with tips for roadies and other tour workers.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Here you can find websites of <b>wholesalers and distributors of music products </b> such as recordings, instruments, accessories, and publications , but <b>not of retailers </b>.

entries.title: Instruments
entries.description: More submission details in <b> <a href="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Music/Wholesale_and_Distribution/desc.html"> Business: Arts and Entertainment: Music: Wholesale and Distribution </a> </b> </center>

entries.title: Recordings
entries.description: More submission details in <b> <a href="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Music/Wholesale_and_Distribution/desc.html"> Business: Arts and Entertainment: Music: Wholesale and Distribution </a> </b> </center>

entries.title: Photography
entries.description: This category is for sites about the professional/commercial photography industry.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for professional organizations that support photography. These are organizations whose members are professional photographers.

entries.title: Photographers
entries.description: This category is for photographers whose web sites focus on photographic services they can provide to clients. These photographers are available for hire to create images for a client. Included are Commercial-Advertising, Portrait, Wedding and Events, Aerial, Fashion, Sports, Travel and Landscape, and Architectural photographers.

entries.title: Aerial
entries.description: This category is for photography businesses which offer aerial photography services from aircraft, blimps, balloons, or portable booms.

entries.title: Agencies
entries.description: Contains details of photographic agencies and the photographers they represent. Additionally, stock image libraries are listed .

entries.title: Fashion_and_Beauty
entries.description: Photographic agencies that contribute to advertising campaigns, editorial photos, beauty and fashion shows.

entries.title: Portraits_and_Weddings
entries.description: For sites whose primary focus is portrait and wedding photography .

entries.title: Architectural
entries.description: This category is for photographers or studios who specialize in architectural photography. This includes exterior, interior, interior design, and structural photography.

entries.title: Commercial-Advertising
entries.description: This category is for photographers or studios who specialize in commercial, and/or advertising photography.

entries.title: Digital
entries.description: This category is for professional "for-hire" photographers who specialize in either digital capture or computer enhanced photography.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Directories of photographers for hire .

entries.title: Fashion
entries.description: This category is for the sites of photographers or studios who specialize in fashion and/or glamour photography.

entries.title: Portrait
entries.description: This category is for photographers or studios who specialize in producing portraits for sale to consumers. Generally, that consumer is also either the subject of the photographs or a relative of the person[s] being photographed.

entries.title: Sports
entries.description: This category is for photography businesses which offer sports photography services.

entries.title: Travel_and_Location
entries.description: This category is for professional photographers <b>who are available to work for-hire</b> to take travel, and/or location photographs for editorial, tourism, and advertising uses. Any site which does not include any information about for-hire availability of the featured photographer <b>will not be listed in this category.</b>

entries.title: Restoration
entries.description: <p>The <b>Restoration</b> category focuses on the business related to photo restoration restoration services.</p>

entries.title: Digital
entries.description: This category is for businesses offering digital <b>services</b> such as retouching, manipulation, and CD storage, which are available by online ordering.

entries.title: Stock
entries.description: This category lists directories, resources, companies and photographers who have stock imagery available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased, or royalty-free, unlimited use may be acquired.

entries.title: Companies
entries.description: This category lists companies and sites with more than two photographers who have stock imagery available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased.

entries.title: Nature
entries.description: This category lists companies and sites with more than two photographers who have stock imagery of nature, including wilderness landscapes, wildlife, flowers, plants, astronomy, and weather, available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased.

entries.title: Sports
entries.description: This category lists companies and sites with more than two photographers who have stock imagery of sports, available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased.

entries.title: Travel_and_Location
entries.description: This category lists companies and sites with more than two photographers who have general stock imagery of travel and / or locations, available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased.

entries.title: Photographers
entries.description: This category lists photographers who have stock imagery available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet. Sites may not feature more than two photographers. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased.

entries.title: Fashion_and_Glamour
entries.description: This category lists photographers who have stock imagery of fashion, beauty, and glamour topics available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased.

entries.title: Nature
entries.description: This category lists photographers who have stock imagery of nature, including wilderness landscapes, wildlife, flowers, plants, astronomy, and weather. Stock photos must be available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet.

entries.title: Agriculture
entries.description: All sites in this section are titled by the photographer's name, listed Last Name, First Name. Please submit your site with the title properly formatted. Specific information on how to obtain, acquire, and license the rights for the use of stock images MUST be included on the site. A simple statement like "to inquire about stock, please contact..." is not sufficient. Ideally, the web site should include information about the type of stock, format, submission, delivery, pricing guidelines, and information as to the type of rights that may be licensed. Web sites must also include a phone contact number for clients, in addition to email. Samples of the type of stock available also must be shown on the site. Web sites should also meet a minimum level of professional quality, design and presentation. Stock companies, and sites about more than two photographers will be listed in <A HREF="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Photography/Stock/Companies/">Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Photography/Stock/Companies</A>, and should be submitted to that category, not this one. Sites offering images for unlimited use, i.e. royalty free, will be listed in <A HREF="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Photography/Stock/Royalty_Free/">Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Photography/Stock/Royalty_Free</A>. If you are a photographer available for assignments, please submit your site to the appropriate category in <A HREF="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Photography/Photographers/">Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Photography/Photographers/</A>. Thank you.

entries.title: Animals
entries.description: This category is primarily intended for working professional photographers who specialize in supplying top-notch, stock imagery of animals, including birds, mammals, reptiles, amphibians, insects, fish, etc.. Stock photos must be available to art buyers for use in publications, advertising, on the Internet, or other forms of media. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased (Rights Protected).

entries.title: Underwater
entries.description: This category is primarily intended for working professional photographers who specialize in supplying top-notch, stock imagery of underwater marine life and environs. Stock photos must be available to art buyers for use in publications, advertising, on the Internet, or other forms of media. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased, (Rights Protected).

entries.title: Sports
entries.description: This category lists photographers who have stock imagery of sports, both competitive, and recreational, available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased.

entries.title: Travel_and_Location
entries.description: This category lists photographers who have general stock imagery of regions and locations around the world available for use in publications, television, or on the Internet. Limited rights to use the photographs may be purchased.

entries.title: Royalty_Free
entries.description: This category lists companies and sites who have stock imagery available for purchase, for unlimited use, i.e. royalty free, for use in print publications or on the Internet. Note: This category does NOT list sites offering free photos, just professional-level sites offering 500 quality images or more to creative professionals. Please submit sites, offering limited rights to use the photographs, to the respective category in Business/Industries/Arts and Entertainment/Stock/Photographers or Business/Industries/Arts and Entertainment/Stock/Companies.

entries.title: Specialized
entries.description: Specialized royalty-free photo sites are dedicated to a single theme.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers of cameras, darkroom supplies, and other photographic products, as well as directories of manufacturers. Retail and shopping sites can be found in <b><a href="/Shopping/Photography/">Shopping/Photography</a></b>. Descriptions and reviews of photographic equipment can be found in <b><a href="/Arts/Photography/">Arts/Photography</a></b>.

entries.title: Accessories
entries.description: <p>This category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing products related to photography accessories such as filters, slide accessories, dark room accessories, enlargers, rail systems, shooting tables or everything that not fit in other categories. Sites about lenses and luggage and bags will be in their subcategories.</p> <p>It is for appropriate for the sites of manufacturers, wholesalers, trade associations, and other sites about the consumer and professional photography business.</p>

entries.title: Bags_and_Cases
entries.description: This category is for sites whose primary focus is consumer and professional luggage and bags to transport cameras, photography equipment and accessories.

entries.title: Lamps_and_Lighting
entries.description: This category is for sites whose primary focus is lightning, lamps and flashes products for consumer and professional, including cameras flashes, light sources, lighting systems for digital imaging and studio lighting.

entries.title: Cameras
entries.description: This category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing products related to consumer and professional cameras products, such as 35mm cameras, digital cameras and professional cameras. Accessories must be submitted in <A HREF="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Photography/Tools_and_Equipment/Accessories/"Accessories</A> category

entries.title: Lenses
entries.description: This category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing products related to consumer and professional consumer and professional lenses and mirrors for cameras and microscopes.

entries.title: Photofinishing_Equipment
entries.description: This category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing products related to consumer and professional equipment and supplies intended for use in consumer and commercial photofinishing stores.

entries.title: Minilab
entries.description: This category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing products related to consumer and professional mini photo laboratory equipment.

entries.title: Resellers
entries.description: Resellers are companies manufacturers use to resell their items.

entries.title: Projectors
entries.description: <p>This category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing products related to projectors such as slide projectors.</P>

entries.title: Producers
entries.description: The producer is a company or individual who puts up the money required for the creation of a film, television show, concert, music recording or other arts-and-entertainment related endeavour. The producer oversees the entirety of the project and is responsible for its success or failure. Though the producer often does not generate art him or herself, the producer has a good deal of influence on which music, films, and shows get produced and how.

entries.title: Production_Services
entries.description: Production services companies provide all or part of the equipment, tools, expertise and labor needed to make arts and entertainment happen. <P> For example, a turnkey concert production services company can provide sound, lighting, a stage, crowd barriers, security, logistics, transportation, and everything else required to make a concert go. On a smaller scale, a rentable recording studio might provide one part of the studio time required to make a music album, or a location service might be able to find the perfect spot for recording a scene during filmmaking.

entries.title: Sports
entries.description: While many sports fans don't like to acknowledge it, "big time" sports is "big time" business. Agents, bond referendums for new stadiums, corporate sponsorships, collective bargaining agreements and other topics have nothing to do with the sport itself but everything to do with the "Business of Sports." This isn't limited to Professional Sports, either. Parents can pay someone to help their child get an athletic scholarship, there are services to help college coaches find and recruit high school athletes, and don't forget the big business that is the Olympic games. Here you will find sites from and about sports agents, recruiting services, labor disputes/collective bargaining, corporate sponsorship and anything else on the Business of Sports.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Includes links to professional or trade associations related to the sports industry.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Web sites that deal with career and job placement in the sports industry. Site may be a jobs database, or an informational site dealing with the issues involved in this industry.

entries.title: Event_Planning_and_Production
entries.description: Includes links to businesses, companies and firms that offer <strong>full-service</strong> event promotion, management, marketing and consulting services. In other words, you need to put on an athletic event and you call these people to do everything. A common example, are companies that offer event promotion, record and timekeeping for running and multisport events, such as the local 10 km race.

entries.title: Facilities
entries.description: This category contains links to businesses associated with facilities development, maintenance and repair, and management. This category does <strong>NOT</strong> contain listings of sporting arenas, facilities, structures, and buildings.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: Includes links to sites related to the marketing and advertising of sports. Sites may include, but not limited to: sports marketing, sports marketing communications firms, sports-related public relations, sports-related direct marketing, sports-related marketing research firms, sports-related positioning, and related resources.

entries.title: Scouting_and_Sports_Agents
entries.description: This category is for listing sports agents, agencies, and scouting services. In addition to these core listings, web directories containing related information may be submitted. Instructional websites that teach individuals how to gain entry to these specific career fields are also welcome.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: The "behind the scenes" of the entertainment industry requires a lot of specialized equipment. While there is some overlap between equipment used in individual sectors of the entertainment industry (theatre, motion picture production, music, and so on) most of this equipment is manufactured specifically for the entertainment industry and not found outside of it. <P> Some examples are professional grade sound and lighting equipment, stage scenery, large format movie projectors, and customized support vehicles such as mobile broadcast vans.

entries.title: Film_and_Video
entries.description: This site contains web sites upon which film and video production equipment belonging to many different individuals and companies is bought and sold. This includes classified ads sites, auction sites, and the websites of equipment brokerages.

entries.title: CD_Manufacturing
entries.description: In the entertainment industry, CD manufacturing is a process by which music and audio becomes a packaged CD product. Depending upon the methods used the process might include sound production, mastering, duplication, replication, graphic design and/or packaging. Some companies offer turnkey CD manufacturing services while others specialize in one or more of the individual processes.

entries.title: Media_Restoration_and_Conversion
entries.description: Many older audio recording media (such as vinyl records and 8-tracks) are no longer considered practical storage media for music and audio. Also, due to their age many recordings existing in those formats have become degraded by time and usage. Some businesses offer services to either repair the sound quality of these recordings or transfer the contents of the older media to new formats such as CD.

entries.title: Camera
entries.description: This category contains sites pertaining to the design, manufacture, distribution, sales, rental or operation of professional camera requipment and related items. Consumer camera equipment does not belong here. When submitting consumer camera sites please look through the following categories for your best fit: Arts/Photography/Cameras Business/Industries/Manufacturing/Consumer Products Shopping/Photography

entries.title: Circus
entries.description: Manufacturers and supplies of circus equipment and supplies.

entries.title: Communications
entries.description: The equipment used by back-stage personnel to talk to each other (and sometimes the artists) during the production of a show, program or other event. Often referred to as "Intercom", "Talkback", or "Comms".

entries.title: Dance
entries.description: Different styles of dance performance, such as ballet, tap, clog, etc. require different types of dance floors and some companies specialize in supplying these. There is also other dance-related equipment such as costumes, chalk, and practice barres.

entries.title: Distributors
entries.description: According to Websters dictionary, a distributor or wholesaler is a merchant middleman who sells chiefly to retailers, other merchants, or industrial, institutional, and commercial users mainly for resale or business use.

entries.title: Aerotechnics
entries.description: Aerotechnics are special effects that involve launching items into the air, for example confetti.

entries.title: Pyrotechnics
entries.description: This category contains commercial sites pertaining to professional fireworks and pyrotechnics used in the entertainment industry. This includes manufacturers, designers and licensed operators of display fireworks, stage pyrotechnics, and explosives special effects. For consumer fireworks manufacturers, see: Science/Technology/Pyrotechnics/Commercial Sites

entries.title: Manufacturers
entries.description: Manufacturers of display pyrotechnics

entries.title: Stage_Pyro
entries.description: Indoor fireworks, for example rock concert pyrotechnics.

entries.title: Cables_and_Connectors
