entries.description: This category contains websites of companies dealing in cables and connectors specific to the entertainment industry. These might be manufactures, custom cable assemblers, retail sales or any other business with a strong focus on entertainment industry connectors and cables. For manufacturers of non-entertainment-industry related connectors, please see the related category Business: Industries: Manufacturing: Electronics: Hardware: Connectors and Terminals For computer cables, please see Computers: Hardware: Cables For bulk cable and wire, please see Business: Industries: Manufacturing: Cable and Wire

entries.title: Installation_Services
entries.description: This category is for businesses specializing in full service supply and installation of equipment for permanent entertainment facilities such as theaters, night clubs, theme parks, and places of worship. Consultants and designers will also be included if they specialize in installed (rather than temporary) systems and cannot be placed in another category such as Lighting. This category will not include businesses specializing in full service equipment support for live performances and recordings; those have their own category at Business: Industries: Arts and Entertainment: Equipment: Production Services.

entries.title: Cinemas
entries.description: This subcategory contains websites belonging to companies which specialize in the design, consultation, and/or permanent installation of equipment for cinemas. This includes projection equipment, automation systems, screens, and related products and systems. Installers specializing in other types of installations should be placed in the appropriate subcategories of Business: Industries: Arts and Entertainment: Equipment: Installation Services. For companies focused more upon the rentals, sales, or manufacture of the equipment, see the appropriate subcategories of Business: Industries: Arts and Entertainment: Equipment.

entries.title: Sound_Systems
entries.description: Sound system installations involve the design, supply and physical placement of complete permanent audio systems including source, wiring, amplification and loudspeakers. This may be in theaters, auditoriums, churches, restaurants, theme parks, or similar settings.

entries.title: Architectural
entries.description: This category contains manufacturers, sellers and installers of architectural lighting for entertainment industry related applications. Examples include lobby, front of house, and stair/aisle lighting, or lighting intended for integration into A/V systems.

entries.title: Searchlights
entries.description: This category contains websites belonging to companies whose primary business is the rental, distribution, or manufacture of searchlights used for entertainment and promotion. This includes all free-standing, trailer or truck mounted large lights meant to be used outdoors pointed at the sky to attract customers or during special events. This category does not contain sites pertaining to equipment for marine or aviation use or any other non-entertainment or promotion purpose. For theatrical spotlights, see Business: Industries: Arts and Entertainment: Lighting: Theatrical.

entries.title: Magic
entries.description: Manufacturers of products and supplies for magicians.

entries.title: DJ
entries.description: DJ equipment is used by professional disc jockeys in the course of their performances, for example specially designed audio mixers and turntables.

entries.title: Components
entries.description: Some companies specialize in manufacturing parts and subassemblies used in loudspeakers for professional audio. These parts may be purchased in large quantities by speaker manufacturers, or they may be used by end users (such as PA rental houses) and speaker repair services in the repair of existing loudspeakers.

entries.title: Furniture
entries.description: Just as home computer users find special computer desks convenient, so entertainment industry professionals find custom cabinets and desks make work easier.

entries.title: Theatrical
entries.description: This category contains manufacturers of lighting equipment and accessories for theatrical and entertainment industry applications.

entries.title: Production_Services
entries.description: This category is for businesses specializing in full service equipment support for live performances and recording projects. Consultants and designers will also be included if they specialize in temporary (rather than installed) systems and cannot be placed in another category such as Lighting. This category will not include businesses specializing in permanant installations; those have their own category at Business: Industries: Arts and Entertainment: Equipment: Installation Services.

entries.title: Lighting
entries.description: Lighting production companies provide turnkey lighting services for concerts, concert tours, and special events. This includes design of the lighting system and supply of the equipment and operating personnel.

entries.title: Sound
entries.description: Live sound production companies provide turnkey sound services for concerts, concert tours, and special events. This includes design of the sound system and supply of the equipment and operating personnel.

entries.title: Special_Effects
entries.description: Effects production services provide full support for special effects for film production, special events, and so forth. This means they supply not only the equipment, but also equipment operators and in some cases a design team to help create the desired effect.

entries.title: Fireworks_Displays
entries.description: Large scale, outdoor fireworks displays such as those featured at major holiday special events require specially trained and licensed personnel to operate legally and safely. There are companies specialized in supplying (and sometimes manufacturing) the shells for the fireworks as well as licensed operators. They make it their business to be aware of the local laws and regulations regarding fireworks. They can also do the artistic design of the fireworks show, and handle all safety related preparations.

entries.title: Laser_Shows
entries.description: Laser light has been adds an ultimate effect at any event. Pin-sharp beams created by gas or diodes are projected into the air producting amazing displays.

entries.title: Props
entries.description: Props, or Properties, are accessories, furniture and other objects used to decorate or enhance a scene in theatre, film or television. A prop might be as innocuous as a picture on a wall in the background, or as important as the gun the villain uses to "murder" another character. <P> Some props companies specialize in designing and building custom props such as armor, creatures, and over- or under-size models, while other companies focus on collecting everyday objects and renting them out to productions. <P> Related topics are scenery (backgrounds and large items such as floors, walls, and doors) and costuming.

entries.title: Computers_and_Electronics
entries.description: Computer and electronics props are fake or real, working or nonworking equipment used on film, theatre and television sets to visually complete a scene. For example a scene taking place in a busy office might require several computers for the employees' desks. If the show is set in the past, then the computers would have to be of a type that fits the year the scene takes place.

entries.title: Creatures_and_Characters
entries.description: Donald Duck, Alien, R2D2... what do they have in common? They are all creatures and characters. Some companies are specialized in all or part of the process of conceptualizing, designing, and building creatures and characters props for the entertainment industry. For example, animatronic robots, puppets, models, and prosthetic costumes.

entries.title: Bodies_and_Parts
entries.description: Sometimes in theatre, movies, television, and themed entertainment, realistic dead bodies, bones, and severed limbs are needed. These companies sell and custom-build such items.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Some websites do not offer props themselves, but list links, telephone numbers or addresses of prop companies by location or by what they offer. There are also directories which list items available as props but owned by individuals. In these cases there is often a way to sign up online to have your items listed.

entries.title: Food,_Fake
entries.description: Real food is too delicate for use as visual props in extended use or under harsh conditions. Therefore some companies manufacture highly realistic fake foods. These can be kept on display in restaurants or stores, or used under hot lighting as on a film set, without any adverse affects.

entries.title: Vehicles
entries.description: Many films and television shows require cars, trucks, emergency vehicles or even military vehicles as background traffic or as part of the action. The vehicles must match the location, era, and general atmosphere of the scene in question. Some companies specialize in collecting large numbers of specific types of vehicles, restoring them, and making them available to productions, often along with mechanic and/or driver services. There are also websites which collect listings of available individually-owned vehicles for a fee.

entries.title: Weapons
entries.description: The weapons which appear on stage or on screen may be real, or they may be fake. Often the actors portrayed as using them had to take lessons on how to fight realistically with these stage weapons without anybody getting hurt seriously. And there are certain companies which specialize in supplying stage weapons and training as well as remaining aware of the most up to date local regulations and safety procedures.

entries.title: Speaker_Repair
entries.description: Many pro audio speakers are designed to be repairable. Typically the speaker is mailed or brought in to the shop where any torn, burnt or worn components are replaced. Speaker repair shops often specialize in certain brands and stock an extensive supply of parts for those brands.

entries.title: Camera
entries.description: Repair of film camera's, including still photography, and film projectors, their peripherals, and accessories.

entries.title: Rigging
entries.description: Theatrical rigging is the system of ropes, chains, cables, counterweights, pulleys and motors that move and control objects that are suspended overhead on stage. Theatre rigging technology and practices have their roots in sailing ship rigging. Because it deals with lifting objects above performers' heads, and sometimes lifting the performers themselves, professional rigging is highly formalized and safety is a prime concern.

entries.title: Flying_Effects
entries.description: When Peter Pan flies on stage, that effect is usually being brought about using rigging techniques. The performer wears a harness of some type and his or her "flight" is controlled by means of cables and pulleys. Because of the liability inherent in flying a performer, there are certain theatrical rigging companies which specialize in this type of job.

entries.title: Scenic
entries.description: Scenery is the "background" for a scene in a play, movie, or themed environment. It is made up of backdrops, painted flats suspended from above, and large free-standing set pieces that the actors might climb upon or inside. (Props, a related subject, consist of smaller items that are hand-held, or furniture such as tables and chairs.) <P> A typical scenic studio might offer design services as well as construction and installation. They might serve only the theatre industry, or only television, or some combination of several industries. Some companies offer scenic elements, such as doors or realistic-looking rocks surfaces, instead of building entire sets.

entries.title: Backdrops
entries.description: Backdrops are cloths which can be hung as a background for a scene in theatre, film, or photography. Scenic backdrops typically have sky, buildings, landscape or other scenery painted on it to give depth and atmosphere to a scene, and to work together with the set and props being used.

entries.title: Parade_Floats
entries.description: Parade floats are large scenic displays used in parades. They usually represent various organizations or businesses and are designed to be as eye catching and spectacular as possible. They are often built based upon automobiles or other driveable platforms, and have costumed performers riding along on top. Some floats are home made while others have been designed and built by professional float-makers.

entries.title: Show_Control
entries.description: Many concerts, shows, themed attractions, and other entertainments involve complex pre-programmed effects, lighting and audio. Each subsection of the event has its own control system, for example lighting is often controlled by a lighting console and motion control often has individual controllers for each manufacturer's product. <P> Show control systems are intended to gather automated control of all parts of a show under a common umbrella. The central show control hardware or software typically does not control lighting, audio, etc. directly, but instead cues the existing control systems as to when to do their thing. This allows precise synchronization of different systems, which is particularly helpful for repetitious shows such as installed theme entertainment.

entries.title: Soft_Goods
entries.description: Soft goods are, essentially, curtains and other cloth products used on stage. For example, cloth backdrops, different sorts of drapes, and scrims or see-through drops. Some companies manufacture only the raw materials while others produce finished curtains, and even supply curtain rigging systems and so forth. Therefore there is some overlap with the stage rigging and stage equipment industries.

entries.title: Staging
entries.description: Concerts, theatrical productions, and large outdoor events typically require a stage where the performance takes place and somewhere for the audience to sit or stand. Many companies specialize in supplying stages and the accompanying truss and roofs, as well as stairs, ramps, crowd barriers, seating, and other related items.

entries.title: Mobile_Stages
entries.description: For the purposes of this category, mobile stages are stages which are built into a truck or trailer and intended to be driven to the event location then unfolded for use.

entries.title: Platforms_and_Risers
entries.description: Lightweight, portable stage sections, often folding. Used for drums, choirs, and other light duty applications particularly in rentals and for venues where the setup is constantly changing and stage sections need to be easy to move about and store.

entries.title: Tents_and_Canvas_Structures
entries.description: These are very large tents used by circuses and other large shows. This category also contains canvas stage covers, tents intended for use as theatres, and other entertainment industry specific canvas structures.

entries.title: Truss,_Roofs_and_Towers
entries.description: Large concert stages often have towers or overhead lighting rigs made of welded aluminum or steel truss. The truss is usually modular, designed to be taken apart and transported by truck from venue to venue. Sometimes it is curved or in other custom shapes.

entries.title: Theatre
entries.description: The technical, behind-the-scenes aspects of theatre involves equipment specially designed for entertainment industry use. This includes sound and lighting equipment, scenery, props, and so forth. Some theatrical equipment is similar to that used in the motion picture industry (scenery for example) and others share more with the music industry (lighting for example).

entries.title: Vehicles
entries.description: There are many specialized vehicles used in the entertainment industry, from mobile broadcast vans to movie star dressing rooms to vehicles modified to carry cameras.

entries.title: Camera_Platform_Vehicles
entries.description: Camera platform vehicles are cars, motorcycles, planes, etc. which have been specially modified to carry a camera for the purposes of film and television production. These vehicles are typically used for filming other vehicles while moving.

entries.title: Visual_Arts
entries.description: Sites submitted to this category must describe a business offering goods or services to consumers and/or professional artists and others in the visual arts industry.

entries.title: Appraisal_and_Valuation
entries.description: For sites that offer the service of establishing the value of specific artworks (paintings, drawing, prints, sculpture, etc.).

entries.title: Art_Consultants
entries.description: Sites listed here will offer Art Consulting services to art collectors and buyers in corporate, public or private sectors. Art consultants are groups (firms) or individuals who primarily advise, value, and secure desired artworks for clients through a existing inventory or through connections within the art community.

entries.title: Calligraphy
entries.description: This category lists sites offering custom calligraphic services for private and corporate clients. Services may include wedding invitations, scrolls, awards, calligraphy combined with artwork, inspirational quotes and other custom design work available for purchase.

entries.title: Promotion
entries.description: Agencies and individuals which offer advertising and marketing services specifically to the Visual Arts industry.

entries.title: Sculpture
entries.description: Site for businesses providing sculptures (ice, sand, stone, etc) for business events, weddings or private parties.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: The <b>Business Associations</b> category only lists sites for trade associations which have global membership across multiple business industries. <p><b>Excluded</b> from this category are:</p> <ul> <li>Industry-specific associations are listed according to the <a href="/Business/">industry which they serve</a>. For example, associations of real estate professionals are listed in <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Associations/">Business: Real Estate: Associations</a>.</li> <li>Regionally-specific associations (local, state/province, or national) are listed according to the <a href="/Regional/">geographic area from which they draw their membership</a>. For example, a local chamber of commerce will be listed in the category for the town or city it serves.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Automotive

translations.tha: ยานยนต์

entries.description: This category will list the companies that manufacture and support the manufacture of automotive products. Automotive is defined as vehicles that are self powered such as cars, trucks, racing cars, snowmobiles and motorcycles.

entries.title: Auto_Racing
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers specializing in parts and components for auto racing. This includes both professional and amateur racing.

entries.title: Car_Rentals
entries.description: This category lists only global car rental companies or general resources for travellers interested in renting cars.

entries.title: Consolidators
entries.description: Car rental consolidators are businesses that negotiate bulk contracts with car rental companies, and then sell rentals to the general public.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Sites related to Automotive training and education.

entries.title: Salesmanship
entries.description: This category is for sites related to Automotive salesmanship training.

entries.title: Electric_Vehicles
entries.description: Manufacturers of electric-powered vehicles (two, three and four wheeled)

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Contains sites offering employment opportunities in the automotive industry.

entries.title: Job_Search
entries.description: Resources that allow job seekers to search for automotive jobs from <b>multiple companies or recruiters</b>.

entries.title: Financial_Services
entries.description: Includes automotive lending, insurance, and credit companies and the companies that support them.

entries.title: Kit_Cars_and_Replicas
entries.description: This category covers companies that manufacture kit-cars and replicas.

entries.title: Off_Road_Vehicles
entries.description: Vehicles such as dune buggies and 4 wheel drive cars can be driven off road.

entries.title: Road_Cars
entries.description: Kit cars are generally hand built vehicles, either by a specialist manufacturer or at home by the kit car enthusiast.

entries.title: Tracks_Cars
entries.description: Kit cars that are not road legal can be driven on purpously built tracks providing they pass a noise test.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: This category includes advertising and marketing company websites which provide advertising and marketing services for the automotive industry. These sites could include any marketing/advertising web pages for automotive dealerships and any parts or services related to the industry.

entries.title: Marketplaces
entries.description: E-commerce marketplaces facilitate interactions and transactions between buyers and sellers within the automobile industry.

entries.title: Motorcycles

translations.tha: รถจักรยานยนต์

entries.description: This category is for manufacturers of Motorcycles.

entries.title: Retailers
entries.description: This is the category for ATV Dealers - those businesses which sell All Terrain vehicles.

entries.title: Off-Road
entries.description: <p>This category focuses on the business of manufacturing <B>and</B> importing or exporting, distributing or marketing products related to offroad motorcycles or parts and components.

entries.title: Retailers
entries.description: Retailers of Dirt Bikes and Parts and Accessories for Dirt Bikes.

entries.title: Parts_and_Accessories

translations.tha: อะไหล่และอุปกรณ์ตกแต่ง

entries.description: Manufacturing sites of Motorcycle parts and accessories.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Wholesale businesses for motorcycle parts and accessories.

entries.title: Scooters
entries.description: <p>This category focuses on the business of manufacturing <B>and</B> importing or exporting, distributing or marketing products related to gas-powered, street-legal, motorcycle-style motorscooters (not stand up scooters) or parts and components. Business that <B>only</B> manufacture scooters must be listed in the sub-category <a href="/Business/Automotive/Motorcycles/Scooters/Manufacturing/">Manufacturing</A> category.</p> <p>It is appropriate for the sites of manufacturers, wholesalers, trade associations, and other sites about the scooter business.</p>

entries.title: Manufacturing
entries.description: <p>This category focuses on the business of manufacturing products related to gas-powered, street-legal, motorcycle-style motorscooters, parts and components; not stand up scooters.</p>

entries.title: Retailers
entries.description: <p>This category focuses on the retailers of gas-powered, street-legal, motorcycle-style motorscooters (not stand up scooters) or parts and components. Business that <B>only</B> manufacture scooters must be listed in the category <a href="/Business/Automotive/Motorcycles/Scooters/Manufacturing/">Manufacturing</A> category.</p> <p>It is appropriate for the sites of manufacturers, wholesalers, trade associations, and other sites about the scooter business.</p>

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category includes sites that offer news and/or articles about the automotive industry with a business rather than a general interest or enthusiast focus.

entries.title: Aftermarket
entries.description: News and media sites for and about the aftermarket industry, including vehicle servicing and customization, parts suppliers and retailers.

entries.title: Design_and_Engineering
entries.description: Media such as magazines, ezines and professional journals with a focus on design and engineering in the automotive industry, from vehicle development to production.

entries.title: Off-Road
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers specializing in parts and components for offroad vehicles. This includes both professional and amateur.

entries.title: Rentals
entries.description: Sites that have information on renting offroad vehicles and guided tours.

entries.title: Retailers
entries.description: Retailers of offroad vehicles and accessories.

entries.title: Parts_and_Accessories

translations.tha: อะไหล่และอุปกรณ์ตกแต่ง

entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers. Automotive OE's buy parts from all over the world and frequently buy systems rather than parts. (e.g. they buy brake systems rather than separate brake parts) Some of these manufacturers are tier 1 (they sell directly to the automotive OE's) others are tier 2 (they sell to the tier 1 manufacturers)

entries.title: Air_Conditioning
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of air conditioning equipment. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Alarm_Systems
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture or distribute automotive alarm systems and/or accessories

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category will list URLs of Associations of automobile manufactures and distributors.

entries.title: Audio_and_Video
entries.description: <p> This category lists sites for automotive parts <b>manufacturers</b> of audio equipment. </p> <p> Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. This category covers OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturers), after market replacement parts manufacturers, as well as manufacturers of after market upgrades. </p>

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category is for sites related to the distribution and wholesale of audio parts and accessories for cars and trucks.

entries.title: Brakes
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of brakes and related equipment. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Drive_Train
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of engines, engine related components, transmissions, drive shafts, differentials, u-joints and exhaust components. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Electrical
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of electrical and electronic equipment. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Engineering
entries.description: This category will list the companies that provide engineering to the Automotive Electronics industry.

entries.title: Engines
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers and resellers of electrical systems and components for combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>, electronic engine management and related equipment.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market(AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Engine
entries.description: This category lists business sites for automotive part (re-)manufacturers of combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>, engine components and related equipment.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Control_Systems
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers and resellers of embedded control systems for combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>, electronic engine management and related equipment.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market(AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Conversion
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers and resellers of conversion equipment for combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Cooling
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers and resellers of cooling equipment of combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>. It includes radiators, cooling systems, heat exchanger and related components. Cooling pumps should be submitted in the <a href="/Business/Automotive/Parts_and_Accessories/Engine/Pumps/">Pumps</a> category.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Cylinder_Head
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers and resellers of cylinder heads and related equipment (like valves, camshafts) for combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Engine_Block
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers and resellers of engine blocks and related equipment (like pistons, connecting rods, crankshafts) for combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Fuel
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers and resellers of fuel, fuel efficiency systems, fuel additives and fuel related equipment (like fuel injectors and fuel injection systems) for combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers. Manufacturers of integrated electronic Engine Management Systems (e.g. fuel + ignition control) systems should submit to the <a href="/Business/Automotive/Parts_and_Accessories/Engine/Control_Systems/">Control Systems category</a>.

entries.title: Performance
entries.description: This category lists sites offering a wide range of performance enhancement products for combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Pumps
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers and resellers of engine pumps and related equipment for combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Rebuilt
entries.description: This category lists sites for remanufacturers and rebuilders of combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Turbochargers
entries.description: This category lists sites for manufacturers and resellers of turbochargers and related equipment for combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>.<br>It covers both Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) and After Market (AM) replacement part manufacturers.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Comprises business companies engaged in wholesaling engines and engine related equipment, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of this merchandise.

entries.title: Exhaust
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of exhaust system including, tail pipe, muffler, convert, manifolds, hangers, and resonators. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Exterior

translations.tha: ภายนอก

entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of components used in or on the body of the car or truck. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Paint
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive paint manufacturers. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market refinishing paint manufacturers.

entries.title: Interior

translations.tha: ภายใน

entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of components used in the inside of passenger compartment. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Light_Commercial_Trucks
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of Light Commercial Trucks. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers. If your URL offers shopping it should be listed in Shopping: Vehicles: Parts and Accessories If your URL is a distributor it should be listed in Business: Industries: Wholesale: Vehicles

entries.title: Parking_Accessories
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of devices that aid parking of cars, including both mechanical and electrical devices. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Safety_Devices
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of safety devices. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Seal_and_Rubber_Products
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of seals, gaskets, rubber mounts, and other rubber products. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Steering
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of steering components for both manual and power steering. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Suspension
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers of suspension components. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Tires
entries.description: manufacturers of tires

entries.title: Tire_Accessories
entries.description: Manufacturers of Tire Accessories: Pressure gauges, values etc.

entries.title: Trailers
entries.description: This category lists sites for trailers, manufacturers of trailers, parts, hitches and other towing components. Parts refer to any part that is used on trailers or tow vehicle. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers.

entries.title: Trucks,_Vans,_and_Sport_Utility
entries.description: This category lists sites for automotive parts manufacturers for light and medium duty trucks, 4X4s, and SUVs. Parts refer to any part that is used in an automobile. The category covers both OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and After Market replacement parts manufacturers. If your URL offers shopping it should be listed in Shopping: Vehicles: Parts and Accessories If your URL is a distributor it should be listed in Business: Industries: Wholesale: Vehicles

entries.title: Wheels
entries.description: Businesses, who manufacture automotive wheels.

entries.title: Recreational_Vehicles
entries.description: Recreational Vehicle manufacturers are companies that build Recreational Vehicles. Recreational Vehicles are vehicles designed for recreational use in camping. These include pop-ups, truck campers, Class A motorhomes, Class B motorhomes (conversion vans), Class C motorhomes (mini motorhomes), travel trailers, 5th wheel travel trailers, and caravans.

entries.title: Retailers
entries.description: This category is for sites dealing with selling and/or servicing recreational vehicles including Class A, B, and C motorhomes, travel trailers, fifth wheel travel trailers, pop-ups, truck campers, and caravans. This may include sites for dealers as well as sites with information or services pertaining to selling RVs.

entries.title: Teardrop_Trailers
entries.description: Teardrop trailers are small and streamlined, named because they resemble a teardrop. Usually, they consist of a sleeping cabin that accommodates two or three persons, and a separate outside cooking area hidden under a hatch at the rear of the trailer.

entries.title: Retail
entries.description: The <b>Automotive Retail</b> category contains sites for International automotive retail chains or automotive retail industry resources.

entries.title: Exotic_Cars
entries.description: The <b>Automotive Retail of Exotic Cars</b> category contains sites for exotic cars retailers.

entries.title: Snowmobiles
entries.description: For manufacturers of snowmobiles and snowmobile parts and accessories.

entries.title: Parts
entries.description: For manufacturers of snowmobile parts and accessories.

entries.title: Snow_Clearing
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers of snow clearing equipment.

entries.title: Specialized_Vehicles
entries.description: This category will list companies that manufacture vehicles other than cars, trucks, vans, competition and RVs. It will also list companies that support the manufacture of specialized vehicles. The general type of vehicles listed in this category will be, snow clearing, school buses, postal vehicles, etc.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: <H1 align="center"><font color="red">Wholesale</font></H1> The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.<br> The wholesaling process is an intermediate step in the distribution of merchandise. Wholesalers are organised to sell or arrange the purchase of sale of (a) goods for resale (i.e. goods sold to other wholesalers or retailers), (b) capital or durable nonconsumer goods, and (c) raw and intermediate materials and supplies used in production.<br> Wholesale/ contains sites of companies of whose primary focus is to purchase goods and merchandise from producers and manufacturers and to sell them to re-sellers in bulk.<br> <H2 align="center"><font color="red">Business/Wholesale_Trade</font></H2> Wholesale/ lists the sites of companies which concentrate to the definition (a) above.

entries.title: Biotechnology_and_Pharmaceuticals

translations.jpn: 薬品・バイオテクノロジー

entries.description: Biotechnology refers to the use of cellular and molecular processes in drug discovery and manufacturing, research, and biologically engineered food production. <p> Pharmaceuticals include over-the-counter and prescription medications, vitamins and nutritional supplements. The term also covers drug delivery systems and diagnostic compounds.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category should contain trade associations and other organized groups focused on biotechnology and pharmaceuticals businesses.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Portals for company listings and industry news.

entries.title: Careers
entries.description: This category is intended primarily for sites which offer careers advice and guidance to scientists seeking careers in the life science sector, but additionally features those which offer employment opportunities.

entries.title: Pharmaceuticals
entries.description: Pharmaceuticals include over-the-counter and prescription medications, vitamins and nutritional supplements. The term also covers drug delivery systems and diagnostic compounds.

entries.title: Biopharmaceuticals
entries.description: Refers to the research and development of therapeutic compounds which depend on living organisms for their production.

entries.title: Delivery_Systems
entries.description: <p>Sites specifically about methods of delivering biological drugs, genes and cells to their therapeutic target.</p>

entries.title: Manufacturing
entries.description: <p>This category links to manufacturing companies in the biopharmaceuticals industry, as well as sites about the manufacturing component of this industry.</p>

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: <p>Sites targeted specifically at promotion and sales of drugs and therapeutics derived from biological processes, especially by genetic manipulation.  This includes marketing and PR firms serving pharmaceutical companies, who may have other products, but which do not feature as the site's focus.</p>

entries.title: Research_and_Development
entries.description: <p>This category links to companies actively involved in research and development of their potential therapeutic products, derived from biological rather than chemical synthesis.</p>

entries.title: Vaccines
entries.description: <p>Vaccines are used to stimulate the immune system into producing antibodies, so that the individual is thereafter protected from the disease.&nbsp; Some vaccines have lifelong effects, and others may need to be repeated.</p>

entries.title: Veterinary
entries.description: <p>Sites about manufacture of vaccines and antitoxins approved for use in pets, wildlife or agricultural livestock.</p>

entries.title: Cancer
entries.description: <p>Sites about the pharmaceutical sector specializing in treatments and cures for leukemia, lymphoma and other diseases of oncology.</p>

entries.title: Products_Evaluation
entries.description: <p>For sites about methods and services to test putative treatments for leukemia or other cancers, which describe the stages, either before, during or after clinical trials.</p>

entries.title: Research_and_Development
entries.description: <p>Sites for companies specializing in research focusing on the treatment or curing cancer, using drugs, cellular and subcellular materials. </p>

entries.title: Delivery_Systems
entries.description: Devices, formulation and drug delivery technologies that improve the performance of pharmaceutical drugs/compounds.

entries.title: Devices
entries.description: Companies and technologies relating to delivery devices (parenteral or non parenteral e.g. pulmonary) of non biologics.

entries.title: Ayurvedic
entries.description: This category houses sites for businesses that manufacture or wholesale Ayurvedic herbal remedies.

entries.title: Cancer
entries.description: A cancer clinical trial is a sanctioned experiment typically involving a drug-agent or medical device with the aim of ascertaining its value in the treatment or support of cancer.

entries.title: Pre-Clinical
entries.description: The pre-clinical CRO category lists companies and organizations which conduct in-vivo research studies in non-human species for pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device products being developed for human and veterinary use.

entries.title: Research_and_Development
entries.description: <p>This category links to companies actively involved in research and development of their potential products.</p>

entries.title: Skin
entries.description: This category lists sites primarily concerned with development and manufacture of medications used in dermatology.   Where a more suitable category does not exist, sites for drugs applied topically are included here.

entries.title: Veterinary
entries.description: Sites listed here will be for companies and businesses involved in the manufacture and distribution of pharmaceutical products for use in livestock and domestic animals. These will include vaccines, antibiotics, anthelmintics ( wormers ), algicides and topical preparations.

entries.title: Business_and_Society
entries.description: The Business and Society category contains sites which pertain to the interaction between businesses, organizations, and governmental bodies. Most sites in this category will focus on the social, economic, or environmental impact of businesses, while many will deal with ethics and social responsibility as it pertains to business.

entries.title: Ethnicity
entries.description: <p>The <strong>Business and Society/Ethnicity</strong> category contains sites which pertain to the interaction between businesses, organizations, and governmental bodies for specific ethnic groups. Most sites in this category will focus on the social, economic, or environmental impact of businesses, while many will deal with ethics and social responsibility as it pertains to business. </p> <p>Sites about ethnic societal issues not directly related to ethnic business should be submitted to a subcategory of <a href="/Society/Ethnicity">Society/Ethnicity</a>. <em><strong>Sites for businesses will not be listed in this category, but should be submitted to the specific category for the type of business.</strong></em></p>

entries.title: Business_Services

translations.tha: บริการธุรกิจ

entries.description: The <b>Business Services</b> sector broadly covers establishments and industries that provide professional and administrative support services to a variety of&nbsp; businesses (e.g. B2B) and organizations (e.g. B2G). In some cases, these companies also provide services to consumers, but providing services to other enterprises is their main focus.<br> <br> The common theme in this category are B2B industries where human capital is the major input. The companies classified in this sector sell expertise.<br> <br> The <b>Business Services </b>hierarchy is implicitly grouped into the following two areas.<br> <ol> <li><b>Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services</b>:&nbsp;These activities require a high degree of expertise and training. Much of the expertise requires academic degrees, though not in every case. Activities performed include: legal advice and representation; accounting, bookkeeping, and payroll services; architectural, engineering, and specialized design services; computer services; consulting services; information and research services; corporate communication services; translation and interpretation services; and other professional, scientific, and technical services.</li> <br> <li><b>Administrative Services</b>: Industries in this subsector include establishments engaged in activities that support the day-to-day operations of other organizations. The processes employed in this sector (e.g., clerical activities) are often integral parts of the activities of companies found in all sectors of the economy. The establishments classified in this subsector have specialized in one or more of these activities and can, therefore, provide services to clients in a variety of industries and, in some cases, to households. The individual industries of this subsector are defined on the basis of the particular process that they are engaged in and the particular services they provide.

entries.title: Auctions
entries.description: The sites within this category include businesses that host or provide real-world auctions or that provide auctioneering services for either real-world or online auctions.

entries.title: Auction_Houses
entries.description: <H2>Welcome to Auction Houses</H2> This section consists of traditional auction establishments; though they may have an online catalog and may accept E-mail. NO ONLINE-ONLY AUCTION SITES<HR> <B> OFF LINE AUCTION HOUSES</B><br>or<br> <B> AUCTION HOUSES with On-line Services</B>

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: This category is for sites related to auctioneer training and education.

translations.tha: เสียงและภาพ

entries.title: Equipment
entries.description: This category is for business services, multiple product line equipment related audio visual sites. Sites must be authorized dealers for the products listed.

entries.title: Audience_Response_Systems
entries.description: This category is for companies that provide audience response systems for sale or rent.

entries.title: Manufacturers
entries.description: Audio Visual equipment manufacturers.

entries.title: Europe
entries.description: Audiovisual installation companies based in Europe.

entries.title: Model_Making
entries.description: This category is for professional model making firms providing physical (not 3D digital) scale models of the following types: architectural (exterior and interior) and topographical (urban) models; scale models and replicas of vehicles, aircraft, spacecraft, ships and such; museum models and dioramas; prototypes; props, custom objects, sets and micro scenes for photographing, TV and movie production.

entries.title: Presentations
entries.description: <strong> This category is for listing companies where the core of the business is audio-visual design, i.e. training videos, multimedia CD-ROMs and presentations. Firms specializing in graphic designs of identity and print materials should submit to Business: Advertising: Design Services: Corporate Identity </strong>

entries.title: Video_and_Film
entries.description: Video production companies which are principally engaged in business-to-business / corporate video productions.

entries.title: Restoration_and_Conversion
entries.description: Many older recording media are no longer considered practical storage media for music and audio. Also, due to their age many recordings existing in those formats have become degraded by time and usage. Some businesses offer services to either repair the sound quality of these recordings or transfer the contents of the older media to new formats such as CD. Such services may also be used as a matter of convenience when converting an existing recording for use in new situations.

entries.title: Videoconferencing
entries.description: Videoconferencing for Business. This category of videoconferencing is within the category of overall Business Audio/Visual Services and as such requires that equipment, solutions and services be intended for and Business applications. Those applications intended for hobby or consumer applications should refer to Computers/Internet/On_the_Web/ for an appropriate listing.

entries.title: Bridges
entries.description: Multi-Point bridging services for videoconferences.

entries.title: Consultants
entries.description: This Category is reserved for groups or individuals that have demonstrated their ability to provide expertise regarding the implementation of videoconferencing suitable for business application. This Category is NOT available to organizations that have a stake in or make their living through the sales of videoconference equipment or specialized/managed network product. Submissions to this Category will be judged on this criteria and references/projects published on the submitted website. Please submit reseller websites to the /Dealers, /Distributors or /Manufacturers Categories.

entries.title: Dealers
entries.description: Videoconferencing equipment stocking resellers. Dealers provide equipment, services and support to videoconferencing end users.

entries.title: Distributors
entries.description: Videoconferencing Distributors whose primary business purpose is to provide videoconferencing equipment and support to stocking resellers.

entries.title: Internet
entries.description: Business Videoconferencing via the Internet This Category is for equipment, solutions and services intended to support business applications with visual communications utilizing the public Internet. Consumer, hobby or other non-business applications should refer to Computers/Internet/On_the_Web/Web_Applications/for a listing.

entries.title: Public_Rooms
entries.description: Publicly accessible videoconference rooms for rent. Sites identifying specific locations only please.

entries.title: Brokers
entries.description: A Videoconference Public Room Broker is an independent business that maintains a list of qualified Videoconference Public Rooms, and makes arrangements for point-to-point or multi-point videoconferences for a fee for client. A Videoconference Public Room Broker is a business that does NOT own, build or supply equipment or services such as bridging or proprietary network, or network management to a videoconference Public Room, or rooms as it's principal business.

entries.title: Guides
entries.description: Videoconference Public Room Guides that supply access to lists or databases of Videoconference Public Rooms intended for the end user to search with or without a fee. Please note the following Definitions: A Videoconference Public Room Guide is a web-based database containing names, locations and specifications of Videoconference Public Rooms. A Videoconference Public Room Broker is an independent business that maintains a list of qualified business quality Videoconference Public Rooms, and makes arrangements for point-to-point or multi-point videoconferences for a fee for client. A Videoconference Public Room Broker is a business that does NOT own, build or supply equipment or services such as bridging or proprietary network, or network management to a videoconference Public Room, or rooms as it's principal business.

entries.title: System_Integration
entries.description: This category contains companies which design and install videoconferencing systems for business.

entries.title: Telepresence
entries.description: Telepresence is a set of technologies which allow remote people to appear and feel like they are nearby. This technology is used applications such as business conferences, education, hazardous materials handling, and remote surgery.

entries.title: Barter
entries.description: Web sites that facilitate trade between businesses using the exchange of goods or services as payment, informational sites about barter, and associations representing trade exchanges or others in the barter industry.

entries.title: Communications

translations.tha: การสื่อสาร

entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses involved in preparing verbal communications, including writing, editing, proofreading, indexing, and translating. It also includes businesses involved in improving communication skills between various groups, such as between cultures and in the workplace.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Includes links to membership organizations, professional and trade associations focused on improving human communications within the business community.

entries.title: Crosscultural
entries.description: Cross-cultural communication business services can include cross-cultural training of ex-patriates, cross-cultural team building, cultural sensitivity training, and briefings. It also includes intercultural management consultancy as applied for instance in cross-border post-merger integration process in mergers, acquisitions, joint ventures and other international strategic alliances, where people issues arising from both organizational and national cultures have to be addressed.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Communications training programs, institutes or software as well as communications schools. Category does not include Internet developers, web developers, or communications aimed at certain audiences. Rather, the category is meant to be inclusive of "how to" approaches to communication as well as business related evaluations of such approaches. See regional categories for smaller or local communication training and schools.

entries.title: Regional
entries.description: Listing of related communications categories within dmoz.org.

entries.title: Writing
entries.description: Formal, professional courses, workshops, coaching and training for writers.

entries.title: Public_Speaking
entries.description: This category is for the listing of professional speakers, training materials for them, associations, and for organizations which represent speakers.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for associations that offer support and fellowship to speakers.

entries.title: Corporate
entries.description: This category is for those who speak to corporations and businesses to help these improve sales and customer service.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Improve presentation skills. Learn how to become a better speaker.

entries.title: Education_Field
entries.description: For those who speak to teachers or administrators of schools, or school boards and districts, and for the education of children in classes and assemblies. Speakers who encourage, inspire or motivate young people will submit their site to http://dmoz.org/Business/Business_Services/Communications/Public_Speaking/Youth/

entries.title: Health_and_Wellness
entries.description: This category is for sites where the speaker is most likely to give speeches to those in the health or health care professions, or has a special interest in health and wellness.

entries.title: Motivation
entries.description: Motivational Speakers. Focusing on motivating and inspiring audiences.

entries.title: Personal_Growth
entries.description: This category is for speakers who give speeches and/or workshops on personal growth topics. Coaches <b>do not belong here</b>, but should instead be suggested to the appropriate sub category at <a href="http://www.dmoz.org/Health/Alternative/Coaching"> Health/Alternative/Coaching</a> or at <a href="http://www.dmoz.org/Business/Management/Consulting/Executive_Coaching/"> Business/Management/Consulting/Executive_Coaching/</a> </p>

entries.title: Religious
entries.description: This category is for those speakers who have a religious message in their speeches.

entries.title: Speakers_Bureaus
entries.description: A speakers bureau specializes in professional speaking engagements for a group of individual speakers. Also known as a lecture agency or speakers agency.

entries.title: Sports_and_Adventure
entries.description: Sites listed here are for speakers who have a special interest in, or experiences with, a sport or adventure.

entries.title: Youth
entries.description: The speakers listed here specialize in talks to young people.

entries.title: Translation
entries.description: <b>Translation</b> (noun) - the process of rewriting a text into another language.<br><br> <b>Translator</b> (noun) - [1.] a person who translates. [2.] a person who performs any language practice related task (such as proofreading, editing, interpreting, copywriting, terminology, localisation, etc).<br><br> <b>Translation</b> (category) - an Open Directory category for web sites of or about professional translators (see "translator"[2]) and agencies.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: For professional translation associations.

entries.title: Education
entries.description: This category is for web sites or web pages containing information about training for translators and related professions. It is <i>not</i> for translators offering language training. To put it another way: it is not for translators offering education - it is for education of translators.<br><br> Also, note that this category is specifically for professional training (in other words, translation as an industry - not translation as a topic or subject), not for general linguistics training/education.<br><br> Sites offering mainly translation services should be submitted in either Multiple_Language or Single_Language (whichever the case may be). Sites offering language teaching or language training should be submitted in the appropriate Regional/ category (such as Regional/Central_America/Costa_Rica/Education/Spanish_Schools ).

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: This category is for web sites or web pages offering translators employment, as well as for translator directories. Web sites offering translation services should be listed in either Multiple_Language or Single_Language (whichever the case may be).

entries.title: Interpreting
entries.description: This category is for web sites or web pages about or of companies or individuals that offer mainly interpreting services. Sites offering both translation and interpreting should be submitted according to the most prominent service.<br><br> If the most prominent service is interpreting, then the site should be submitted here. If the most prominent service is translation, then it should be submitted in either Multiple_Language or Single_Language (whichever the case may be).

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Professional interpreting associations, focusing specifically on interpreting and not both translation and interpreting.

entries.title: Medical_and_Legal
entries.description: For sites about companies offering translation services primarily in the medical and legal fields, which require specialised knowledge and vocabulary.

entries.title: Multiple_Language
entries.description: The Multiple_Language category contains all sites offering translation services (or primarily translation services) in more than one language combination. Sites offering only one language combination are listed in Single_Language.<br><br> Site in Multiple_Language are listed according to the locality (domicile) of the translator or agency. If your site is already listed, and you feel that it is listed in the wrong regional category, please contact the relevant editor. <br><br> Please take note that any site can only be listed *once* in the entire Translation/ category. <hr> <b>All sites must be submitted to the appropriate subcategory, according to your domicile (location)</b>. Sites submitted in this (the parent) category will be moved to the appropriate subcategory. No sites will be listed in this (the parent) category. <ul> <li>Sites with a single domicile will be listed in the appropriate subcategory. <li>Sites with more than one domicile (for example co-workers in several countries, or offices in several countries) will be listed according to the seemingly most prominent domicile. No site will be listed in multiple subcategories, regardless of the number of countries represented on the site. <li>Sites with no clear indication of domicile, will be listed based on mentioned street addresses, e-mail addresses or telephone numbers. <li>Sites with absolutely no indication of domicile, will be listed according to the WHOIS records of the domain, if appropriate. <li>Where not appropriate (for example when the site is on a free host), an editorial guess will be made based on the language of the site, or the language of keywords (such as the company's name), or any other country indicators. </ul>

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: This category is for web sites or web pages with resources related to professional translation services. <br><br> Web sites offering or containing non-professional resources (in other words, non-business related) should be submitted in Science/Social_Sciences/Language_and_Linguistics/Translation . <br><br> Web sites offering translation services should be submitted in either Multiple_Language or Single_Language (whichever the case may be).

entries.title: Single_Language
entries.description: The Single_Language category contains sites offering translation services (or primarily translation services) in one language combination. Sites offering more than one language combination are listed in Multiple_Language (see also that category's description for submission guidelines).<br><br> If your site is already listed elsewhere in the Translation_Services category, and you feel that it should be listed in the Single_Language category, please contact the relevant editors. <br><br> Please also take note that any site can only be listed *once* in the entire Translation/ category.

entries.title: Writing_and_Editing
entries.description: <font size=+2><b>Category Description</b></font><br><br> This category and its subcategories contain the sites of commercial enterprises offering writing and writing-related services. It also includes sites offering supporting services to these enterprises, such as the sites of trade associations, educational and training programs, and industry news and profiles.<br><br> When a group of websites specializes in services being offered to a specific field, a subcategory is created and named for that field. (For example, all sites related to technical writing are listed in the "Technical" subcategory.)<br><br> Most sites, however, are about enterprises offering services to a broad range of fields. These sites are listed in the main category if they focus on both writing and editing services, but are listed in a more specific category if their services are more specialized.

entries.title: Academic
entries.description: <font size=+2><b>Category Description</b></font><br><br> This category contains the sites of commercial enterprises focused primarily on editing, proofreading, and related services involving academic theses, dissertations, journal articles, and research documents.

entries.title: Business
entries.description: <font size=+2><b>Category Description</b></font><br><br> This category offers service providers engaged in writing and editing services for business. Service providers may be companies, corporations, and freelancers.

entries.title: Editing_and_Proofreading
entries.description: <font size=+2><b>Category Description</b></font><br><br> This category and its subcategory contain the sites of commercial enterprises focused primarily on the writing-related services of editing, proofreading, and indexing.<br><br> Please note that sites offering these services <i>as well as</i> other writing services will be found in the "parent" category to this one. In addition, sites offering these services <i>primarily to a specific field</i> will be found with other sites related to that field. (Look in the "parent" category to see which fields have a separate category.) Please submit a regional location in the description of your site in order for the site to be listed.

entries.title: Technical
entries.description: This category contains links to businesses and firms that focus on technical communication, including technical writing. Technical writers are often referred to as technical communicators, technical authors, technical editors, documentation managers, content managers, information designers and everything in-between. Technical writing professionals create technical documentation, publications, instructions, policies and procedures on a variety of subjects for multiple mediums, including print brochures, guides and manuals. Also, online, online Help, CD-ROM, and e-learning instruction. Recent trends in technical communication involve 'single sourcing' - a content management method which allows companies to create and edit documentation from a single information source to produce multiple formats, including but not limited to: print, online, PDF, and Help files.

entries.title: Computer_Documentation
entries.description: This category is for sites about technical writing focused on computer hardware and software documentation.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: For resumes of individuals seeking positions in technical writing as employees.

entries.title: General_Practice
entries.description: This category is for websites about technical writing that does not fit any one specialty.

entries.title: Writers
entries.description: Individuals who perform medical writing either as freelance writers or as one-person businesses.

entries.title: Writing
entries.description: <font size=+2><b>Category Description</b></font><br><br> This category contains the sites of commercial enterprises focused primarily on writing services, and not on any related services such as editing or proofreading.<br><br> Please note that sites offering writing services <i>as well as</i> related services will be found in the <a href="/Business/Business_Services/Communications/Writing_and_Editing/">Writing and Editing</a> category, rather than this one. In addition, sites offering writing services <i>primarily to a specific field</i> will be found with other sites related to that field. (Look in the <a href="/Business/Business_Services/Communications/Writing_and_Editing/">Writing and Editing</a> category to see which fields have a separate category.) Every site must include a location of the business in the description. Sites without this will not be listed.

entries.title: Business_Letters
entries.description: Offering to write custom business letters and/ or providing templates.

entries.title: Comedy_Writing
entries.description: For sites of individuals or businesses that specialize in comedic writing.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Business consultants are individuals or firms with expertise in business procedures, practices and policy. Organizations of all types use consultants, and these consultants examine these organizations from a broad operational perspective applying a variety of skills to achieve a specific outcome, solution, or result. Through analysis and study, consultants provide problem resolution and prevention solutions related to business operations, infrastructure, and performance. Consultants have many roles, varying from a supportive one within an existing team, to providing temporary leadership over an identified problem area, to other independent activities conducted at the request of the organization. This category has been divided into three areas to reflect the many functions and roles within the business consulting profession. The top level is divided by some of the various specialty or focus areas typical to the business consulting industry (e.g., business formation, financial, management, manufacturing, outsourcing, etc.). The second level contains a variety of industry specific subcategories (e.g., construction, energy, engineering, science and industry, security, etc.). Within the lowest level is a list of closely related "See also" categories that may contain other types of consultants. Before you submit your site please take the time to look around the category to ensure that your site is appropriate to this category. Also, be sure to review the <a href="/Business/desc.html">general guidelines for the Business categories.</a> The editors reserve the right not to list your site, and to delete it after its addition. Multiple submissions may be considered when appropriate (for example, a site that contains valuable resources pertinent to multiple subcategories) but repeated submissions, especially to inappropriate categories, will not be tolerated. Please, submit only to those categories most appropriate to the content of your site.

entries.title: Archives_and_Records_Management
entries.description: Sites in this category include firms offering consulting services in the area archives and records management. Services of these firms typically include creating, organizing and managing archival and records systems; preparing corporate histories; and setting records retention and preservation programs.

entries.title: Junior_Enterprises
entries.description: A Junior Enterprise (JE) is a student run company. The concept has been first developed in France during the 1960s. Its aims are to bridge the gap between education and employment and to provide students with the skills that will appeal to employers. In order to achieve this, students realize consulting projects in several business areas for companies and institutions. The client lists contain small to medium sized enterprises as well as international companies. They receive individual and high-quality solutions based on the latest scientific research for a comparatively cheap price. Nowadays there are about 300 Junior Enterprises mainly in Europe and South America.

entries.title: Talent_Auctions
entries.description: Services that use an auction format to match consultants and freelancers who are looking for work with the employers who need them.

entries.title: Parliamentarians
entries.description: Features Certified Parliamentarians, Registered Parliamentarians, Certified Professional Parliamentarians and Professional Registered Parliamentarians. Also lists national organizations that can refer you to other parliamentarians. ALL NAMES AND TITLES ARE LISTED ALPHABETICALLY.

entries.title: Research_Services
entries.description: Here you will learn about the firms which provide a wide-range of research services to businesses/organizations throughout the world. You can also expect to see descriptions and abstracts of recent work completed by these firms. So what are research services? A good question with no clear cut answer. In this category, we are including professional service organizations which offer a range of services to business and governmental organizations.

entries.title: Customer_Management
entries.description: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) consists of the gathering of detailed information about a company's customer base, the history of their purchases, requests, general buying patterns, and feedback, both positive and negative.

entries.title: Industry_Analysts
entries.description: <p> Industry Analysts are businesses focusing on research of industry sectors or technology areas. Their research is mainly produced "on speculation" as opposed to research to a specific client specification (which would be a research consultant). </p> <p> (Many industry analysts also offers research consulting services, and it is appropriate that many of the entries in this category should also be listed elsewhere in the directory. However, to be listed here, the organization should have a large component of Industry Analysis.) </p> <p> To be included in this category, the Analyst should have a practice area dedicated to Customer Management with recent research publications. The Analyst can cover technology, business issues, or other areas of interest to Customer Management. </p>

entries.title: Sales_Force_Automation
entries.description: Sales Force Automation is for sites that give information about software for automating a Sales Force. This can involve Contact Management as well as Customer Relationship Management. A product like ACT, would really not fit well in this category, because it is limited to a role of contact management, but does not really extend to a large scale Sales Automation project.

entries.title: Furniture_Design
entries.description: Information on commercial furniture designers. These designers typically specialize in design service only and do <em>not produce</em> the furniture that they have designed.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category contains sites that compile links to sites of furniture designers and other related commercial enterprises.

entries.title: Manufacturing
entries.description: Sites in this category are for companies that manufacture furniture pieces, systems or units that cross multiple industry lines. For instance, a company that manufactures for two or more of the restaurant, hotel, dorm room, laboratory, technical or hospital industries is likely to be sent to this category.

entries.title: Graphic_Design
entries.description: <p>Graphic design is the applied art of arranging image and text to communicate a message. It involves the page layout, arrangement of type and elements as well as color scheme, navigation buttons (for websites) and specifications for paper, ink colors and printing processes (for print media).Graphic Design may be applied in any media, such as print, digital media, motion pictures, animation, product decoration, packaging, and signs. </p>

entries.title: Designers
entries.description: <p>This category is for professional graphic design firms, agencies, companies or individuals providing services internationally. If your services are limited to a particular geographical area, please suggest to the most appropriate <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> category. If it is in a language other than English, please suggest it to the most appropriate category in <a href="/World/">World</a>. </p>

entries.title: Freelance
entries.description: Freelance graphic designers are those who hire out their services for a specific project or for a specific / finite period of time, often performing the services at the client's location.

entries.title: Multi-Discipline
entries.description: <p><font color="#660000"><strong>Multi-Discipline</strong></font> firms will offer two or more distinct graphic design services. This category contains sites for graphic designers whose services include website design, web elements (such as animated gif's, banner ads, buttons, icons), multimedia, and/or design for electronic output in addition to the traditional graphic design area of printed media.</p> <p> If your services are limited to a particular geographical area, please suggest to the most appropriate <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> category. If it is in a language other than English, please suggest it to the most appropriate category in <a href="/World/">World</a>. </p>

entries.title: Resumes_and_Portfolios
entries.description: <p>Sites listed here contain the <font color="#000000">R&eacute;sum&eacute;s, Curriculum Vitae, and Portfolios of Graphic Designers, Art Directors, Creative Directors and other individuals seeking employment in the Graphic Design industry.</font> Freelance designers and businesses (including sole proprietorships) should suggest to the most appropriate <font color="#000000"><a href="/Business/Business_Services/Design/Graphic_Design/Designers/">Designers</a> or <a href="/Business/Business_Services/Design/Graphic_Design/Designers/Freelance/">Freelance</a> category.</font> </p> </body>

entries.title: Multi-Discipline
