entries.description: <p>Sites listed here contain the <font color="#000000">R&eacute;sum&eacute;s, Curriculum Vitae, and Portfolios of Multi-Discipline Graphic Designers, Art Directors, Creative Directors and other individuals seeking employment in the Graphic Design industry.</font> Freelance designers and businesses (including sole proprietorships) should suggest to the most appropriate <font color="#000000"><a href="/Business/Business_Services/Design/Graphic_Design/Designers/">Designers</a> or <a href="/Business/Business_Services/Design/Graphic_Design/Designers/Freelance/">Freelance</a> category.</font> </p>

entries.title: Traditional
entries.description: <p>Sites listed here contain the <font color="#000000">R&eacute;sum&eacute;s, Curriculum Vitae, and Portfolios of Traditional Graphic Designers, Art Directors, Creative Directors and other individuals seeking employment in the Graphic Design industry.</font> Freelance designers and businesses (including sole proprietorships) should suggest to the most appropriate <font color="#000000"><a href="/Business/Business_Services/Design/Graphic_Design/Designers/">Designers</a> or <a href="/Business/Business_Services/Design/Graphic_Design/Designers/Freelance/">Freelance</a> category.</font> </p>

entries.title: Traditional
entries.description: <p><font color="#660000"><strong>Traditional (Print Design)</strong></font> firms will offer services that are focused on product packaging, brochures, print advertising, logos and collateral, newsletters, magazines and/or other items for printed media. .</p> <p> If your services are limited to a particular geographical area, please suggest to the most appropriate <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> category. If it is in a language other than English, please suggest it to the most appropriate category in <a href="/World/">World</a>. </p>

entries.title: Product_Design
entries.description: Firms and individuals offering industrial design services specifically including product design. Product design refers exclusively to the design of physical products.

entries.title: Product_Designer_Resources
entries.description: Resources for Industrial Designers, specifically product designers include best practices, descriptions of techniques, professional organizations, etc.

entries.title: Domestic_Services
entries.description: Staffing Services for the household, which include, but are not limited to Estate Managers, House Managers, Personal Assistants, Chefs, Chauffeurs, Security, Gardeners, Cleaning Services, Butlers, Maids, etc. Sites offering exclusively childcare staffing (e.g. Nannies, AuPairs, Daycare, Babysitters, etc.) should be placed in Home/Family/Childcare

entries.title: Cleaning
entries.description: <p>This category lists sites for Home Cleaning businesses that serve large geographic regions, such as national and multi-state areas.<p>

entries.title: House_Sitting
entries.description: Professional services whereby someone lives in an unoccupied home for varying lengths of time. This may be in exchange for payment or perhaps in exchange for free rent.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Companies providing education and training in Business Services and to Business Services companies.

entries.title: Event_Planning_and_Production
entries.description: Professionals, firms, providing any service or product that builds, maintains, supports or evaluates Event Planning. This includes conventions and trade shows as well as corporate and private special events.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Sites for associations or other organizations supporting event planning and production.

entries.title: Consultants
entries.description: Event planning businesses. Corporate conferences are no longer just thrown together or left to corporate staff with some extra time. Services abound to make conferences and events work with the overall corporate goals to build and enhance corporate functioning and public relations.

entries.title: Online_Events
entries.description: This topic lists companies that organize and plan online events, tradeshows and conferences. It does not include companies that sell event planning software. Event planning software sites should be submitted to Business/Hospitality/Software/Event_Planning

entries.title: Reunions
entries.description: This category lists companies that specialize in the planning, organizing and production of school, family, social and military reunions.

entries.title: Convention_and_Trade_Show_Services
entries.description: Companies that offer production and ancillary services for conventions, trade shows and exhibitors.

entries.title: Custom_Exhibits
entries.description: Manufacturers of custom tradeshow exhibits.

entries.title: Portable_and_Modular_Displays
entries.description: Portable and modular display manufacturers, sales, rental, and service companies.

entries.title: Manufacturers
entries.description: Portable and modular display manufacturers

entries.title: Registration_Services
entries.description: Contains web sites whose primary business is online and/or offline registration for large-scale events.

entries.title: Crowd_Control
entries.description: Practically speaking, during any large event the attendees must be managed for their own safety and for proper traffic flow. Some companies specialize in products for crowd control at events, including portable barriers, posts with ropes or chains, turnstiles, and so forth. These products are also useful in subways, and other high foot traffic situations.

entries.title: Entertainment
entries.description: Variety artists for hire, usually managed by specialized agencies, catering to performing arts.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, magazines, and e-zines which cover event planning and production.

entries.title: Venue_Locating_Services
entries.description: Sites about finding a venue for an event and companies which assist their customers in finding a venue.

entries.title: Fire_and_Security

translations.tha: ไฟและความปลอดภัย

entries.description: This category contains sites that offer fire and security services, products, or other professional, scientific, or technical services to persons, government, and private industry.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for professional fire and security associations that have active members. This can include organizations representing a range of products, services, or a commercial business sector. Most fire and security associations promote professionalism, and provide education and training opportunities for its members. Many provide certifications, code of ethics, standards of conduct, best practices, legislative oversight, develop professional standards, allow for networking, and information exchange. Fire and security associations can require minimum qualifications for membership, professional licensing, or prior employment within a private sector.

entries.title: Central_Station_Monitoring
entries.description: Companies that provide monitoring of security and/or fire alarms as their primary business.

entries.title: Equipment_and_Supplies
entries.description: Companies that manufacture or supply central station equipment or software. Examples are: racks and rack systems, dedicated computers, or central station receivers.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Companies that produce software for the operation of central stations including: alarm receiving, payroll, human resources, and scheduling.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Fire and security consultants generally give advise to business entities and sometimes individuals regarding security, fire, crime prevention, and loss prevention. True security consultants are independent and non-product affiliated. Consultants provide expertise in environmental design, fire and security system design and specification, access control, physical security, protection of assets, theft prevention, crime prevention, loss prevention, executive protection, information security, special event security, emergency and disaster planning, and security training. Some consultants in this field perform fire and security surveys and risk analysis and make recommendations on how to reduce the threat. Some consultants make crime foreseeability assessments and adequacy of security evaluations. Some security consultants testify as an expert witness in litigation.

entries.title: Emergency_Management
entries.description: <p>This category organizes sites for businesses that provide emergency planning, disaster preparedness, and related services to other businesses and corporations (B2B), communities, and government agencies (B2G).</p> <p>The following categories list other types of sites on this topic.<br> <ul> <li> <a href="/Home/Emergency_Preparation/">Home/Emergency_Preparation/</a> - consumer-oriented resource sites about emergencies and disaster preparedness. </li> <li> <a href="/Health/Public_Health_and_Safety/Emergency_Services/"> Health/Public_Health_and_Safety/Emergency_Services/ </a> - EMS, Rescue, and Ambulance Services, and other immediate response services, organizations and companies.</li> <li> <a href="/Science/Earth_Sciences/Natural_Disasters_and_Hazards/">Science/Earth_Sciences/Natural_Disasters_and_Hazards/</a> - Reference and information sites about natural disasters and hazards.</li> </ul> </p>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Sites promoting and describing disaster recovery and emergency management consultancy services.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: This category includes sites that offer disaster recovery and emergency management training and education.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: Websites outlining conferences, meetings and workshops dedicated to emergency and business continuity planning.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This category contains sites covering software products and systems to support emergency management and disaster recovery planning.

entries.title: Fire
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture, distribute or install fire alarm systems or fire fighting equipment.

entries.title: Alarm_Systems
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture or distribute fire alarm systems and/or accessories

entries.title: Installation_and_Service
entries.description: Companies that primarily install and/or service fire alarm systems.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for professional fire associations that have active members. This can include organizations representing a range of products, services, or a commercial business sector. Most fire associations promote professionalism, and provide education and training opportunities for its members. Many provide certifications, code of ethics, standards of conduct, best practices, legislative oversight, develop professional standards, allow for networking, and information exchange. Fire associations can require minimum qualifications for membership, professional licensing, or prior employment within a private sector.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Fire consultants generally give advise to business entities and sometimes individuals regarding fire safety, system design, and specification.

entries.title: Fire_Fighting_Equipment
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture or supply fire fighting equipment for urban use.

entries.title: Vehicles
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture or supply fire and/or emergency vehicles.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category is for business fire related books, newsletters, magazines, and other publications. Online and printed versions.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category is for business fire and security related books, newsletters, magazines, and other publications. Online and printed versions.

entries.title: Security
entries.description: The <Strong>Security Industry</STRONG> comprises establishments primarily engaged in the protection of people, property, and information. Nearly <em>every</em> Legal or Law Enforcement entity is mirrored in the security industry, in many cases government agencies utilize civilian security professionals in a consulting or contract capacity.</P> <P>This category contains sites that offer security services, products, or other professional, scientific, or technical services to persons, government, and private industry.</p> <hr> <P> <EM>Please submit sites, with brief descriptions (please no key words, excessive capitalization, or superfluous language), to the appropriate subcategory. </EM> </p>

entries.title: Access_Control
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture or distribute access control systems and/or accessories.

entries.title: ID_Cards_and_Systems
entries.description: Please submit sites that offer ID cards as well as systems that create and use them.

entries.title: Installation_and_Service
entries.description: Companies that primarily install and/or service access control systems.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This category is for software used in access control applications.

entries.title: Alarm_Systems
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture or distribute security alarm systems and/or accessories

entries.title: Installation_and_Service
entries.description: Companies that primarily install and/or service security alarm systems.

entries.title: Wireless
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture or distribute wireless alarm systems and/or accessories

entries.title: Armored_Vehicles
entries.description: Sites offering armored vehicles and/or the service of adding armor to vehicles.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for professional security associations that have active members. This can include organizations representing a range of products, services, or a commercial business sector. Most security associations promote professionalism, and provide education and training opportunities for its members. Many provide certifications, code of ethics, standards of conduct, best practices, legislative oversight, develop professional standards, allow for networking, and information exchange. Security associations can require minimum qualifications for membership, professional licensing, or prior employment within a private sector.

entries.title: Bail_Recovery
entries.description: The Bail Enforcement industry involves the use of <strong>civilian security personnel</strong> in the apprehension of persons, released from legal custody on bond or bail, that fail to meet the conditions of their release.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Security consultants generally give advise to business entities and sometimes individuals regarding security, crime prevention, and loss prevention. True security consultants are independent and non-product affiliated. Security consultants provide expertise in environmental design, security system design and specification, access control, physical security, protection of assets, theft prevention, crime prevention, loss prevention, executive protection, information security, special event security, emergency and disaster planning, and security training. Some consultants in this field perform security surveys and risk analysis and make recommendations on how to reduce the threat. Some consultants make crime foreseeability assessments and adequacy of security evaluations. Some security consultants testify as an expert witness in litigation.

entries.title: Event
entries.description: Security consulting for events such as concerts and trade shows.

entries.title: Fraud
entries.description: Security consultants specializing in the reduction of fraud.

entries.title: Intelligence
entries.description: Security consultants in intelligence and information gathering.

entries.title: Personal
entries.description: Personal security consultants for high profile people.

entries.title: School
entries.description: Security experts for school facilities.

entries.title: Systems
entries.description: Security consultants specializing in security systems.

entries.title: Transportation
entries.description: Security consulting related to transportation.

entries.title: Workplace
entries.description: Security consulting related to the work environment.

entries.title: Counterfeit_Detection
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture or distribute counterfeit detection equipment and/or accessories

entries.title: Close_Protection
entries.description: Companies that offer training for close protection and bodyguard services.

entries.title: Guard_and_Patrol
entries.description: Security and Protection Officers are <strong>civilian</strong> personnel charged with the protection of facilities, personnel, and property.

entries.title: Investigation
entries.description: This division of the Security Industry covers investigative activities of all types. Four subcategories have been created to assist visitors in locating information from the websites of Licensed Private Investigators, International Investigators, Process Servers, and Public Records Research Firms. For your protection, before hiring any prospective agency to undertake an investigation on your behalf, you should verify their credentials, experience, license, insurance and bond. Government agencies that serve an investigative function are located elsewhere in the Open Directory.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Sites for organizations promoting and representing the investigation industry throughout the world.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Directories of private investigators and investigative services.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: <p>This category guides users to sites for courses, and professional qualifications in Investigation worldwide. </p>

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: This category is reserved for links to Internet websites that provide investigative and security support to the Human Resources departments of all types of business, professions, and, government agencies. Examples would include pre-employment background checks of civil and criminal records, motor vehicle records, and driving histories of prospective employees. Also included in the security industry would be loss prevention specialists who attempt to deter employee theft. Although this category may contain listings for licensed private investigators who specialize in providing those services, generally these listings will be for information brokers, or, researchers who furnish such reports from public records, or, are not otherwise categorized.

entries.title: Investigators
entries.description: This category is reserved for private investigators and detective agencies. It is meant to distinguish between websites for investigators, and those of information brokers such as public records research firms, skip-tracers, cross reference directory providers, and the like.

entries.title: Process_Service
entries.description: Process serving sites that provide general information, useful resources or process server lists are on this page. Process server sites are also listed by state.

entries.title: Records_Research
entries.description: Although this category may contain links to Internet websites belonging to licensed private investigators, it is primarily meant to list information brokers who are typically public records research firms, or, skiptracers, and do not perform the services of a traditional detective agency. Most of the links in this category are not required to be licensed by any state agency, insured or bonded, and the public should ask about the credentials of the company before hiring them to do undertake any investigation.

entries.title: Law_Enforcement
entries.description: Equipment for the Law Enforcement Industry, bullet proof vests, search & retrieval tools, light bars, safety nets, etc.

entries.title: Accessories
entries.description: Law Enforcement Accessories may include virtually any product or tool used in the course of Law Enforcement occupations. This could include items as diverse as emergency lighting and communications equipment, uniform accessories, body armor, restraints, investigative supplies, specific software, or basic duty gear.

entries.title: K9_Dogs_and_Supplies
entries.description: Businesses that specialize in K9 equipment and the breeding and training of K9 dogs.

entries.title: Books
entries.description: Non-fiction books for and about law enforcement professionals.

entries.title: Firearms
entries.description: Features sites that primarily sell firearms to law enforcement organizations and individuals.

entries.title: Locks_and_Safes
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, distributors and import/exporters of locks and safes. Websites related to local locksmiths must be submitted to the proper category in /Regional.

entries.title: Locks
entries.description: This category contains lock manufacturers and/or lock importers/distributor's sites.

entries.title: Locksmithing
entries.description: This category is for sites about locksmiths and locksmithing that have broad geographical significance. It is not for sites of locksmiths who serve a specific local area. Those sites are found in the <a href="/Regional">Regional</a> branch of the Directory, listed in the area they serve.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Sites about education and training on the subject of locksmithing.

entries.title: Safes
entries.description: This category contains safe manufacturers and/or safe wholesaler's sites.

entries.title: Metal_Detectors
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture or distribute metal detectors.

entries.title: Infrastructure_Protection
entries.description: Protection and security of telecommunications, energy, banking and finance, water systems, government operations, and emergency services.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category is for business security related books, newsletters, magazines, and other publications. Online and printed versions.

entries.title: Perimeter_Protection
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture, distribute, or install perimeter intrusion detection products and/or accessories

entries.title: Personal_Protection
entries.description: This subcategory is for those sites offering personal protection products for sale.

entries.title: Special_Services
entries.description: Specialized security services and operations, systems, IT & communications counter-systems. Examples of these services include; contract explosive and patrol dog handling, high-risk reaction teams, covert operatives, and other services that would not fall under the realm of normal Security Officer or Investigative functions. Inclusions here might be new technical advances in a submitting firm's product or services offerings.

entries.title: Explosives_Detection
entries.description: Explosives Detection pertains to agencies who specialize in the detection of weapons and ordnance by means of mechanized units or canine services.

entries.title: Surveillance
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture, distribute or install surveillance equipment and/or accessories

entries.title: Installation_and_Service
entries.description: Companies that primarily install and/or service surveillance systems.

entries.title: Mirrors
entries.description: Companies that primarily manufacture, distribute or install security mirrors and/or accessories

entries.title: Tamper-Proofing_and_Tamper-Evident_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for internet pages about tamper-proofing and tamper-evident equipment. For example, tamper-evident seals, tamper-proof holograms etc.

entries.title: Technical_Surveillance_Counter_Measures
entries.description: Businesses offering bug sweeping and other associated counter-surveillance services. These businesses employ a number of different techniques to detect and/or prevent the operation of unauthorised installations of surveillance technology.

entries.title: Government_Contracting
entries.description: Businesses whose focus is exclusively on government contracting, and websites offering Business-to-Government information.

entries.title: Agencies
entries.description: Websites of government agencies.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Companies and Individuals providing consulting services to government agencies or government contractors.

entries.title: Office_Services
entries.description: If you walked into an office and observed a staff of people doing various functions, that is what this category is for. Various functions and services provided by humans in an office atmosphere now made available via the Internet.

entries.title: Concierge_Services
entries.description: Businesses providing personal services to individuals and/ or groups. Services like a personal assistant or concierge, whatever needs doing.

entries.title: Data_Management
entries.description: The <b>Data Management</b> category broadly covers companies that provide data management, record storage, and data entry services to other businesses (b2b) and organizations. In some cases, these companies also provide services to consumers, but providing services to other enterprises is their main focus.

entries.title: Data_Entry
entries.description: Companies that provide data entry services to other businesses.

entries.title: Document_Shredding
entries.description: Sites listed in the Document Shredding category are those companies that provide secure document shredding services in either by: plant based shredding (Off-site), mobile truck based shredding (On-site) or a combination of both.

entries.title: General_Transcription_and_Word_Processing
entries.description: This category is for sites offering solely or predominantly general transcription which is non-medical or non-legal in content. These businesses specialize in producing transcripts from audio or video tape, and/or from digital audio sources. This category is also for sites offering solely or predominantly straight-text copy typing and/or word processing which is non-medical or non-legal in content. These businesses specialize in producing typed documents, such as manuscripts, from printed or handwritten sources.

entries.title: Secretarial_Services_and_Virtual_Assistants
entries.description: The terms, Secretarial Services and Virtual Assistants, are interchangeable and their need has increased with the use of the Internet and the downsizing that has occurred in many businesses. Virtual Assistants (VA's) are those who work from home or in a different office location, and provide professional secretarial and administrative support to individuals or small businesses. Many are certified and highly skilled. Secretarial and Virtual Assistants services may consist of word processing, desktop publishing, website design and maintenance, transcription, proofreading, marketing, faxes, writing, mailings, bookkeeping, plan meetings and events, data base management, and other miscellaneous office duties.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Resources for virtual assistants and those who want to begin self empployment as a VA. Includes online communities, weblogs and forums.

entries.title: Schools_and_Instruction
entries.description: This category is used for schools; as well as training and instructional programs for Secretarial Services and Virtual Assistants. Sites here may include courses, schools, training centers or programs, certification, and other miscellaneous educational instruction.

entries.title: Virtual_Office_Management
entries.description: Virtual Office MANAGEMENT is administrative services that an office manager would provide overseeing an entire office staff and the smooth overall running of office procedures, delegation and organization. Virtual Office MANAGEMENT is not secretarial services, but rather the person that would organize and prioritize the outsourcing of all secretarial and clerical needs.

entries.title: Physical_Asset_Management
entries.description: Businesses offering <b>comprehensive</b> "physical asset" management services. A physical asset (in this category) would be an item purchased by a business in order to help that business make money. If one of these items is poorly or inefficiently used, then it hasn't been "managed" well. Clearly, maximizing the moneymaking "power" of an asset is of great importance to any business. <p> When properly executed, Physical Asset Management can significantly impact on an organization's bottom line by <ul><li>reducing maintenance costs <li>increasing the economic life of capital equipment <li>reducing company liability <li>increasing the reliability of systems and components <li>reducing the number of system and component failures </ul>

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Computer based programs that help quality professionals implement quality.

entries.title: Standards
entries.description: Global quality standards and certification information for organizations, business and trade.

entries.title: Signage
entries.description: <p>The <b>Signage</b> category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing of signs, including related products such as frames, stakes, brackets, and posts. </p> <p>The Signage businesses listed in this category include <ul> <li>businesses focused on a specific kind of signage. <li>businesses focused on providing many kinds of signage to a relatively large geographic area, such as more than one state (or equivalent), or an entire country. </ul> <p><b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b> <ul> <li><b>Locally focused businesses:</b> Businesses focused on providing varied types of signage for a local area -- such as a single state (or equivalent), city, or metro area -- belong in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> category.</li> <li><b>Businesses that focus on a specific industry</b> are generally listed with that industry. For example, businesses whose primary focus is real estate signage are listed at <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Marketing_and_Advertising/Signs_and_Displays/">Business: Real Estate: Marketing and Advertising: Signs and Displays </a>. </ul>

entries.title: Advertising_Display_Equipment_and_Posters
entries.description: Sites that focus primarily on sell of displays and the display prints that are used. These include scrolling and similar display cases as well as the reprographics and large format prints that are used.

entries.title: Architectural
entries.description: On premise signs and sign systems that help building users to find their way around the site and buildings on the site, and to locate and use facilities of the site and buildings. Architectural signs identify, direct and inform. They instruct in the use of the facilities and architectural elements on the site. One special category of architectural signs is ADA signs, or signs which are compliant with ADAAG, the ADA Accessibility Guidelines. Some of these signs have Braille and raised characters.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: <ul><li>Please do not submit sites for individual sign companies or suppliers.</li> <li>Directories are listed in a separate category - <b>Business: Business Services: Signage: <a href="/Business/Business_Services/Signage/Directories/">Directories</a></li></b> <li>Please look at the sites in this category before submitting here.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Digital
entries.description: Digital signs are electronic devices used to display informational, educational, experiential or advertising content to a target audience at a specific place and time.

entries.title: Content
entries.description: Content sources, including electronic media streams, web feeds and multimedia stock resource libraries specifically made for digital out-of-home media.

entries.title: Hardware
entries.description: Digital signage hardware includes devices like electronic displays, video or data distribution systems and media players whose primary purpose is to distribute or play back content on out-of-home digital signage networks.

entries.title: Networks
entries.description: Digital signage networks are managed networks of digital displays used to show information, entertainment content, and/or advertisements in out-of-home environments.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Web sites, magazines, blogs and forums dedicated to (or primarily focused on) the digital signage industry.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Digital signage software includes content management software, content distribution systems, remote management software, media consumption measurement software and other software technologies for enabling digital out-of-home networks.

entries.title: Value_Added_Resellers
entries.description: Value Added Resellers, or VARs, of digital signage products take packaged solutions from other vendors and resell them, typically along with other products or services that make the solution as a whole more useful or valuable to customers.

entries.title: System_Integrators
entries.description: Digital signage system integrators assist clients with the selection and assembly of products and services needed to build, deploy and manage digital out-of-home networks.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Signmaking resource and listing directory

entries.title: Electric
entries.description: <p>The <b>Electric Signage</b> category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing of electric signs, including related products such as frames, stakes, brackets, and posts. </p>

entries.title: LED
entries.description: <p>The <b>LED Signage</b> category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing of LED signs. </p>

entries.title: Neon
entries.description: <p>The <b>Neon Signage</b> category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing of neon signs. </p>

entries.title: Equipment_and_Supplies
entries.description: Suppliers of equipment and materials to the sign trade

entries.title: Flags_and_Banners
entries.description: Flags, banners, and signs are often sold by agents who sell advertising specialties or as part as sales promotions, in that context they belong in this category. Large scale producers and manufacturers of signs should be listed under <A HREF="/Business/Business_Services/Signage/"> Business_Services/Signage/<A>

entries.title: Online_Sales
entries.description: This category contains sites that focus on allowing the consumer to buy signs over the Web. These sites include information about signs, related products, prices, and ordering details.

entries.title: Promotional
entries.description: <p>Submit sites whose primary focus is the manufacturing, distributing, and marketing of Promotional signage, including related products and services.</p> <b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b> <ul> <li><b>Locally focused businesses:</b> Businesses focused on providing signage for a local area -- such as a single state (or equivalent), city, or metro area -- belong in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> category.</li> <li><b>Businesses that focus on a specific industry</b> are generally listed with that industry. For example, businesses whose primary focus is real estate signage are listed at <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Marketing_and_Advertising/Signs_and_Displays/">Business: Real Estate: Marketing and Advertising: Signs and Displays </a>. <li><b>Online shopping</b>: Sites that exist primarily to sell goods and services directly to the consumer should be listed in the <a href="http://editors.dmoz.org/Shopping/">Shopping</a> category. See the <a href="http://editors.dmoz.org/Shopping/desc.html">Shopping category description</a> for more detail. </li> <li>Sites that <b>focus on providing information to consumers</b> are listed under <a href="http://editors.dmoz.org/Home/Consumer_Information/">Home: Consumer Information</a>. See the <a href="http://editors.dmoz.org/Home/Consumer_Information/faq.html#10"> Consumer Information FAQ</a> for more information.</li> </ul> Please take the time to find the most appropriate category for your submission, click on the link leading to that area, and then submit your site. This will allow your submission to be reviewed <i>much sooner</i>. <br><br> Please do <b>NOT</b> submit affiliate sites, mirror sites, non-English sites or sections of a larger site (deeplinks). Non-English sites should be sent to the correct category in <a href="/World/">World/</a>. </ul></td></tr></table></center> <blockquote> <p>The <b>Promotional Signage</b> category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing of Promotional interior and exterior sign products. </p>

entries.title: Varied_Media
entries.description: <p>The <b>Signage: Varied Media</b> category focuses on businesses that design, manufacture, and install signs made of a wide range of materials. </p>

entries.title: Decals
entries.description: Sites that produce decals, specifically on a smaller scale in sizes of less than approximately 3' square.

entries.title: Online_Sales
entries.description: For sites selling vinyl signs over the internet. To be listed in this category, a site must list specific products, along with prices and ordering information.

entries.title: Vehicle_Graphics_and_Lettering
entries.description: Sites that focus on selling vehicle graphics and lettering for any form of vehicle are listed here. Included could be cars, trucks, commercial vehicles, race vehicles, emergency or fleet vehicles.

entries.title: Wraps
entries.description: For sites who focus primarily on the production or offering of vehicle wraps for cars, trucks, fleet vehicles and associated vehicles.

entries.title: Supplies_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for sites with a world-wide reach that offer supplies and equipment specifically for other businesses and for where no other suitable category exists.

entries.title: Mail_Handling_and_Sorting
entries.description: This category covers the mailing operations from small business to large Mail houses. Both incoming and outgoing mail are covered.

entries.title: Time_Recording_and_Management
entries.description: Business to business supply of employee time recording and management systems.

entries.title: Technical_Assistance_Programs
entries.description: This category is for programs that foster technology-based economic development in multiple fields. <br><br> Sites focused on programs specific to a particular industry, such as healthcare or telecommunications, will be found in the category specific to that industry.

entries.title: Chemicals

translations.tha: เคมีภัณฑ์

entries.description: <p>The <b>Chemicals</b> category focuses on industries and companies engaged in chemical manufacturing, including: <ul> <li>Basic organic and inorganic chemical compounds, resins, additives, pigments, dyes, and petrochemicals which are generally used as raw materials for other chemical products,</li> <li>Intermediate and end products for both industrial and consumer use, including cleaning agents, adhesives and coatings, and agricultural chemicals,</li> <li>Synthesis of polymers and plastics, as well as companies which provide contract processing such as extrusion or molding,</li> <li>Support industries such as producers of chemical manufacturing equipment as well as associations, wholesalers, importers, and media companies focussing on chemical sectors</li> </ul> <b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b> <ul> <li>Topics related to <b>scientific or academic</b> aspects of either <b>chemistry</b> or <b>chemical engineering</b> are organized in <a href="/Science/Chemistry/">Science: Chemistry</a> and <a href="/Science/Technology/Chemical_Engineering/">Science: Technology: Chemical Engineering</a>, respectively.</li> <li><b>Pharmaceuticals</b> are listed in <a href="/Business/Biotechnology_and_Pharmaceuticals/Pharmaceuticals/">Business: Biotechnology and Pharmaceuticals: Pharmaceuticals</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Agrochemicals
entries.description: <p>This category is for websites representing companies or agents that specialize in the agrochemicals industry, ranging from manufacturers to consultants for farmers. </p>

entries.title: Fertilizers
entries.description: <p>The <b>Fertilizers</b> category comprises major manufacturers and distributors, trade organizations, and other sites specific to the fertilizer industry.</p>

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the import and export of agricultural chemicals and fertilizer.

entries.title: Pesticides
entries.description: <dl><dt>This category is for websites representing establishments which are primarily engaged in the production of pesticides for agricultural or household use.</dt><dt>Also included are support industries such as associations, wholesalers, importers, and media companies focussing on the agrochemical pesticide sector.</dt><dt>There may be sub-categories for those that specialize in one of the following:</dt><dd>fungicides, herbicides, insecticides, and rodenticides, or other agricultural chemicals.</dd></dl>

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Sites specializing in transfer of chemicals for agriculture within a country or continent from manufacturers to wholsalers or bulk users.  This includes websites that offer a brokering service for agricultural chemicals, such as price negotiations between the customer and the supplier for farm chemicals, including animal health products and fertilizers. </p>

entries.title: Basic_Chemicals
entries.description: This category comprises establishments which are primarily engaged in production of chemicals using basic processes, such as thermal cracking or distillation. Basic chemicals are generally used as raw materials for further chemical intermediates or final chemical products. Also included in this category and its subcategories are support industries such as associations, wholesalers, importers, and media that focus on the basic chemicals sector.

entries.title: Gases
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers and suppliers of gases for the Specialty Gas Industry, rare gases, and industrial use gases.

entries.title: Generators
entries.description: This category is for companies that provide oxygen, nitrogen, and ozone generating and delivery systems for medical and industrial use.

entries.title: Industrial
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers and distributors of gases intended for industrial purposes such as welding, pressurants, propellants, and general manufacturing. Typically these gases are provided in large quantities and are not as pure as Specialty gases are.

entries.title: Specialty
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers and distributors of gases intended for medical or research purposes. Typically these gases are provided in smaller quantities than industrial gases and are very pure.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers and suppliers of equipment used in manufacturing, separating, purifying, and storing gases.

entries.title: Phosphorus_Compounds
entries.description: Companies and business activities focused on the production and sale of phosphorus and its inorganic compounds, including phosphoric and phosphorous acid, and phosphate salts.

entries.title: Oleochemicals
entries.description: <p>Oleochemicals are derived from vegetable and animal oils and fats, as well as from petrochemicals. They are themselves an intermediate chemical group used in diverse chemical sectors such as detergents, plastics, and coatings.</p>

entries.title: Organic
entries.description: The <b>Basic Organic Chemicals</b> category comprises sites for businesses and business activities related to the production, distribution, and sale of commodity organic chemicals. These chemicals are typically manufactured using basic processes, such as thermal cracking or distillation, and serve a variety of uses in the chemical and other industries. They can be used in their final form (e.g., as solvents) or as intermediates in the production of more complex chemicals. Sites for businesses who focus on a particular subcategory of basic organic chemicals are listed in that subcategory; businesses whose activities range across two or more subcategories, or whose products are not covered by one of the subcategories, are listed in this main category.

entries.title: Alcohols_and_Solvents
entries.description: Businesses and business activities related to the manufacture, purification, distribution, and sale of alcohols and common organic solvents.

entries.title: Aromatics
entries.description: Aromatic petrochemicals are those with one or more conjugated ring systems. The most common examples are benzene, toluene, and xylenes. Only producers of chemicals that can be directly derived from oil feedstocks are listed here. Other aromatic chemicals, such as those incorporating hetero-atoms such as chlorine, oxygen, or nitrogen, are found in other categories.

entries.title: Biochemical
entries.description: <p>Sites for the industrial sector specializing in chemicals derived from animals and plants.<br />Biochemicals differ from Organic Chemicals in that they were discovered from their synthesis within living cells, but many can now be produced synthetically from simple chemicals.</p>

entries.title: Amino_Acids
entries.description: <p>Sites for manufacturers of amino acids, intermediates in their synthesis, or related products.</p>

entries.title: Biopolymers
entries.description: <p align="left">This category is for manufacturers' sites where the specialty is polymers that have biological significance. This includes proteins, oligosaccharides and oligonucleotides which may be extracted from living things, produced in cell culture, or by cell-free technology.<br>It may also include sites for synthetic polymers where there is no appropriate sub-category in <a href="/Business/Chemicals/Polymers/"><b>Business:&nbsp;Chemicals:&nbsp;Polymers</b></a>, <a href="/Business/Biotechnology_and_Pharmaceuticals/"><b>Business:&nbsp;Biotechnology_and_Pharmaceuticals</b></a>, <a href="/Business/Healthcare/"><b>Business:&nbsp;Healthcare</b></a> or <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/"><b>Business:&nbsp;Industrial_Goods_and_Services</b></a>.</p>

entries.title: Polysaccharides
entries.description: <p>Sites for industrial scale manufacture of polymers of sugars and glycans, to include oligosaccharides and polysaccharides.<br />Compounds consisting of less than four monomers may be found in <a href="/Business/Chemicals/Biochemical/Sugars/"><b>Sugars</b></a>, including those sites selling monomers as a predominant part of their business.</p>

entries.title: Proteins
entries.description: <p>Sites representing the Proteins manufacturing industry.<br />In general this refers to all sequences in excess of those that can be manufactured from constituent <a href="/Business/Chemicals/Biochemical/Amino_Acids/"><b>Amino_Acids</b></a>, and in quantities exceeding those generated by chemical means alone; <a href="/Science/Chemistry/Analytical/Bioanalytical_Chemistry/Peptides/Products_and_Services/Contract_Services/"><b>Peptide Synthesis</b></a>.<br />Proteins are usually extracted from biological material and purified prior to sale.  This category is for industrial manufacture of natural proteins (non-GMO), in which the genetic material of the source has not been altered.</p>

entries.title: Enzymes
entries.description: <p>Sites representing the Enzymes manufacturing industry.<br />In general this refers to all catalytic proteins and extracts from biological sources.<br />Enzymes are usually extracted from bacterial or cell culture, cadaver or plant material, and purified prior to sale.  This category is for manufacture of enzymes for use in industries such as textiles, biotechnology, and consumer goods such as washing powder.</p>

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: <p>Sites for agents, traders, consultants, trade portals and other intermediaries specializing in distributing chemicals derived from biological sources, across country borders.</p>

entries.title: Lipids
entries.description: <p>Sites for the industrial sector specializing in natural waxes and fatty acids, fat and oils of animal and plant origin, including glycolipids, phospholipids, sphingolipids and terpenoids.</p>

entries.title: Manufacturing
entries.description: <p>This category links to manufacturing companies in the biochemicals industry, as well as sites about the manufacturing component of this industry.</p>

entries.title: Plant_Extracts
entries.description: <p>Sites for manufacture of chemicals extracted from herbs and other plants, which have not been genetically modified (GM).<br/ >For GM products and those produced by fermentation, bacteria or cell culture see <a href="/Science/Biology/Biotechnology/Products_and_Services/"><b>Science: Biology: Biotechnology: Products and Services</b></a></p>

entries.title: Sugars
entries.description: <p>For manufacturers' sites showing products, where the primary focus is on production of carbohydrate monomers, for sale to markets other than just <a href="/Business/Biotechnology_and_Pharmaceuticals/Pharmaceuticals/"><b>Pharmaceuticals</b></a> or <a href="/Business/Food_and_Related_Products/"><b>Food&nbsp;and&nbsp;Related&nbsp;Products</b></a>.<br></p>

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: <p>Sites of companies that supply biochemicals without manufacturing themselves.</p>

entries.title: Catalysts_and_Adsorbents
entries.description: Manufacturers and suppliers of catalysts and adsorbent materials. Catalysts interact with chemical substances and induce reaction of these substances, without themselves being converted. They are commonly divided into heterogeneous catalysts (solids that are not soluble in the reaction media), and homogeneous catalysts (which are miscible or soluble in the reaction media). Adsorbents are solid materials that interact with chemical substances in a gas or liquid phase, but do not chemically convert these substances. They are typically used in separation processes, for example to remove impurities. Catalysts and adsorbents are closely related because they share similar surface properties, and are often manufactured by the same companies.

entries.title: Activated_Carbon
entries.description: Activated carbon is a material derived from organic materials, including fibrous natural materials such as coconut husk and sawdust. Their high surface area renders them effective as adsorbents or as supports for heterogeneous catalysts. Companies involved in the production and distribution of activated carbon materials are listed here.

entries.title: Commercial_and_Industrial
entries.description: Sites for and about businesses and business activities aimed at providing cleaning products for commercial and industrial applications. Examples include commercial janitorial supplies and chemicals for cleaning process equipment.

entries.title: Adhesives
entries.description: This category and its subcategories list sites for businesses and business organizations active in or supplying the adhesives industry.

entries.title: Equipment
entries.description: Equipment used for producing, mixing, packaging, dispensing and other related ancillary products and processes.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category is comprised of companies that distribute or handle adhesive related products, but do not manufacture any of the products.

entries.title: Corrosion
entries.description: Corrosion protection with paints and coatings Paints, coatings and high performance organic coatings have been developed as a need to protect equipment from environmental damage. This category is primarily for the listings of coating manufacturers of products like: conventional epoxy primers, zinc rich epoxy products and polyurethane anticorrosive paints and primers. </br> Other methods for surface protection against corrosion can be found at the categories below: <p><a href="/Business/">Business</a> : <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/">Industrial Goods and Services</a> : <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Casting,_Molding,_Machining/">Casting, Molding, Machining</a></p>

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for *directories* of coating manufacturers (including plating, anodizing, and similar finishing processes) , and is not a listing of individual coating manufacturing firms. The category includes coating manufacturing directories worldwide.

entries.title: Paint_Booths
entries.description: <p>This category is for sites dedicated to the Paint Booth Industry.&nbsp; It is primarily for manufacturers, but includes sites for companies offering consultancy, distribution, installation and service in more than one country. <br /><br />The category also includes sites providing internet sales of parts and supplies, specifically for paint booths and related equipment.</p>

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: Hand tools used within the painting and decorating industry.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: Sites in this category are concerned with the manufacture, service, and, in a few cases, assessment of systems and equipment, consumable products, and associate accessories used by companies involved in applying and curing paint and several other forms of coating to a variety of products and surfaces. Paint spraying, powder coating, and metal as the recipient surface are frequently featured, but other technology and targets aren't altogether uncommon. For example, exceptions can be found in companies employing the Physical Vapor Deposition (PVD) process and selling pavement marking machines. Note: For practical reasons, companies that simply provide spraying and coating services invariably confine themselves to a local area and therefore more properly belong -- and will be found indexed -- in their appropriate Regional/Localities categories.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: Conferences, trade shows, and conventions for the chemical industry and its customers.

entries.title: Custom_Manufacturing
entries.description: Custom manufacturers of chemicals, also called tollers, make use of general-purpose equipment to meet chemical manufacturing needs of their customers. They are often called upon during the development stage of a product cycle, when less than full-scale production is required for demonstration purposes. However, the arrangement may also be longer or indefinite, when a toller has production capabilities that its customer does not have and wishes to permanently outsource. Many chemical companies engage in some custom manufacturing activities as part of their business model. Only companies for which this is a primary activity are listed in this category.

entries.title: Blending_and_Processing
entries.description: Companies that have as a primary business focus the blending or otherwise physically processing raw material products into custom formulations for a third party. For example, a company that offers custom blending of cleaning products to meet a specific need or custom blending of pure material to match a customer specification. Besides blending and mixing, typical services offered including packaging and warehousing, and sometimes other physical manufacturing or separations processes.

entries.title: Engineering
entries.description: <p><a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Engineering/Chemical/"><u><b>Chemical Engineering</b></u></a> <br> <br> This category is a combination of company listings and informational/resource Web sites for Chemical Engineering.</p> <p>The main Engineering category page contains only listings of informational/resource web sites of interest to Engineers. Informational resources specific to a certain Engineering field are listed under that sub-category.</p> <p>No companies are listed directly under Engineering, but are listed in their most appropriate subcategories of Engineering, such as Engineering:Chemical.</p> <table bgcolor="#ffffcc" cellpadding="6" border="0"> <tr> <td><small><b>Before submitting your site, please review the <a href="/Business/desc.html">Guidelines for Submitting a Site</a>.</b></small> </td> </tr> </table> <p>If you do not see a subcategory that you think should be included included in <strong>Business:Industries:Engineering</strong>,<br> please email an Editor in the <a href="/Business/">Business</a>: or <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/">Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services</a> section and ask them to consider including the new subcategory. (You may find a list of editors at the bottom of the category pages.)</p>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Chemical Engineering is a subset of the regulated profession of Engineering.

entries.title: Explosives
entries.description: General information and suppliers of explosives . Not intended for general "how to make your own" sites.

entries.title: Special_Services
entries.description: Lists company that provide Special Services to the explosives/blasting industry.

entries.title: Technical
entries.description: This is for listing Technical papers and descriptions of explosives materials.

entries.title: Fine-Chemical_Intermediates
entries.description: Manufacturers and suppliers of organic intermediates to downstream manufacturers, for example in the pharmaceutical and agrochemical industries. The actual products do not fit any particular chemical classification, as they cover a wide range of basebones and functionalities, from aliphatics to aromatics and heterocycles, derivatized with all manner of functionalities.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: This category lists Marketing and PR firms which offer services to the Chemicals industry.

entries.title: Polymers
entries.description: The <b>Polymers</b> category comprises establishments which are primarily engaged in the production of:<ul> <li><b>Resins</b> (raw materials of plastics),</li> <li><b>Basic Plastics</b> and companies which provide custom processing such as extrusion or molding,</li> <li><b>Rubber</b> (natural, synthetic, or reclaimed), <li><b>Foam</b></li> </ul> Also included are support industries such as associations, wholesalers, importers, and media companies which focus on the polymer/plastics industry. <b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b> <ul><li><b>Most plastic or rubber final products</b> are listed in <a href="/Business/">Business</a> categories according to the application of the product. For example, many consumer products made from plastic are listed in <a href="/Business/Consumer_Goods_and_Services/">Business: Consumer_Goods_and_Services</a>.</li> <li><b>Polymer-based man-made fabrics</b> are listed in <a href="/Business/Textiles_and_Nonwovens/Fibers/Man-made/">Business: Textiles and Nonwovens: Fibers: Man-made</a>.</li></ul>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This site is for firms which are engaged in providing consulting services as their primary business. Companies who sell equipment or manufacture goods should not be listed here but in a category specific to their product.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for *directories* of plastics manufacturers (including rubber), and is not a listing of individual plastics manufacturing firms. The category includes plastics manufacturing directories worldwide.

entries.title: Distributors_and_Fabricators
entries.description: This category lists organizations that primarily distribute, convert or fabricate foam. They may do one or more of these activities. They may distribute different types of foam from a variety of manufacturers and also convert, fabricate and process the material. Additionally, manufacturers of foam may also offer distribution, conversion and fabrication services. See the categories for each type of foam for listings of manufacturers.

entries.title: Diversified_Manufacturers
entries.description: This category lists organizations that primarily manufacture a variety of different foam. The variety is such that a listing in a specific category would not sufficiently indicate the involvement in others. Manufacturers may also be involved in processing, converting and fabricating foam or in other activities, although none of these are the primary activity. Individual listings provide descriptions of the types of foam produced.

entries.title: Polyolefins_and_Copolymers
entries.description: This category lists organizations that primarily manufacture polyolefin based foam and copolymers. Popular types of foam included here are polyethylene, polypropylene and ethylene vinyl acetate. Manufacturers may additionally be involved in processing, converting and fabricating foam or in other activities, although none of these are the primary activity. A polyolefin is a polymer produced from a simple olefin as a monomer. Examples are polyethylene and polypropylene. A copolymer is a polymer derived from two (or more) monomeric species. An example of a popular copolymer is ethylene vinyl acetate (EVA), which is the copolymer of ethylene and vinyl acetate.

entries.title: Polystyrene
entries.description: This category lists organizations that primarily manufacture polystyrene foam. It might be expanded polystyrene (EPS) and/or extruded polystyrene (XPS) types of production. Manufacturers may additionally be involved in processing, converting and fabricating the foam or in other activities, although none of these are the primary activity. Polystyrene is an aromatic polymer. It is a thermoplastic substance, normally existing in solid state at room temperature, but melting if heated (for moulding or extrusion), and becoming solid again when cool. Syrofoam is a well know trade name for an extruded variety of polystyrene.

entries.title: Polyurethane
entries.description: This category lists organizations that primarily manufacture polyurethane foam. Manufacturers may additionally be involved in processing, converting and fabricating foam or in other unrelated activities, although none of these are the primary activity. Polyurethane foam is perhaps the most commonly produced foam material. It is made from the reaction of two key chemicals, a polyol and an isocyanate . Polyether and polyester are common forms of polyols. The foam is usually produced using either a continuous slabstock method or a molding process where individual items are produced.

entries.title: Specialty_Manufacturers
entries.description: This category lists organizations that primarily manufacture specialist foam. The foam produced is such that one of the specific categories does not correctly reflect the nature of the material. Manufacturers may also be involved in the processing, converting and fabricating of foam or in other activities, although none of these are the primary activity. Individual listings include a description of the type of foam produced.

entries.title: Syntactic_Foam
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers and organizations involved in syntactic foam. Syntactic foam is a composite material synthesized by filling a metal, polymer or ceramic matrix with hollow spheres. These spheres, or microballoons, give syntactic foam its light weight and low thermal conductivity. Syntactic foam offers a resistance to compressive stress that exceeds that of other foam. In some cases syntactic foam also offers radar or sonar transparency. Syntactic foam is used for buoyancy modules in marine drilling risers, in deep ocean submersibles, boat hulls and components in aircraft. New developments in the sports industry are appearing including snow skis and soccer balls.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category lists organizations that provide plant and equipment including machinery and tools specifically designed for the foam industry. This will include, but is not limited to, equipment and systems for foam manufacturing, foam processing and foam fabrication.

entries.title: Marketplaces
entries.description: This category lists sites which are specifically designed for internet trading of materials, products, and machinery and equipment related to the polymer, plastic and rubber industries.

entries.title: Plastics
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers and distributors of all types of plastics as raw materials. Companies which work plastics in such ways as molding or machining should be submitted to a category under <A HREF="/Business/Chemicals/Polymers/Contract_Processors/"> Contract_Processors</A> category. Specific items manufactured from plastics should be listed in a category appropriate to their application.

entries.title: Wire_and_Cable
entries.description: Please submit only sites of manufacturers who are engaged in producing plastic coated wire and wire harnesses. Companies which work wire other than plastic jacketed should be listed under the category appropriate to their application. Distributors and sellers of plastic coated wire may also be included.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Journals relating to plastic news, products, innovations and shows.

entries.title: Fluoropolymers
entries.description: Fluoropolymers are a class of polymeric materials whose molecular formula includes fluorine. The most well-known example is PTFE (Teflon). This category includes manufacturers and suppliers of these materials in their raw form. Producers of the related class of fluoroelastomers are listed in the <a href=/Business/Chemicals/Polymers/Rubber/Synthetic/>Synthetic Rubber</a> category.

entries.title: Thermoset
entries.description: A thermosetting resin is defined as a resin which polymerizes to a permanently solid and infusible state upon the application of heat.

entries.title: Processing_Methods
entries.description: This category is for contract manufacturers of plastics parts and products which will be used as a component in finished goods. This category has four subcategories: Extruders, Molders, Fabricators Formers Assemblers, Vacuum Formers. Companies which work plastics with these specific processes should be listed under the category appropriate to their application. Companies performing contract processing of plastics which do not belong in any of the specific subcategories should be listed here.

entries.title: Extrusion
entries.description: This category is for contract manufacturers of extruded plastics parts and products which will be used as a component in finished goods. Companies extruding finished goods such as pipe or wire and cable, etc. and companies selling equipment should not be listed here, but under the category appropriate to their application.

entries.title: Fabrication_and_Assembly
entries.description: This category is for contract Fabricators, Formers and Assemblers of plastics parts and products, which will be used as a component in finished goods. Included in the above categories are companies which work plastic by cutting, sawing, shaping, swedge molding, pressure forming, adhering, and assembling.

entries.title: Molding
entries.description: This category is for contract Molders of plastics parts and products, to be used as components in finished goods. This category has three subcategories, Blow, Injection and Rotational. Companies which work plastics by these specific processes should be listed under the category appropriate to their application.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for the sites of Manufacturers of Blow molding equipment for plastics. Do not list manufacturers of blow molder plastic products. They should be entered under the appropriate category.

entries.title: Injection_Molding
entries.description: This category is reserved for companies who transform plastic resins into molded articles by injection molding. Companies molding thermo set and thermoplastic resins are included. If you are primarily a mold maker or a maker of molding equipment - please submit to: Business: Chemicals: Polymers: Processing Methods: Molding: Injection Molding: Tools and Equipment.

entries.title: Specialty
entries.description: This category is for the sites of manufacturers performing insert, two component, gas assist, and structural foam injection molding.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of injection molding machinery only.

entries.title: Rotational_Molding
entries.description: This category is for contract manufacturers of rotational molded plastic parts and products to be used as a component in finished goods. Companies selling equipment or resellers of rotational molder parts should not be listed here, but under the category appropriate to their application.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of rotational molding machinery only.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of molding machinery and equipment, and mold makers, for the plastics and rubber processing industry.

entries.title: Mold_Making
entries.description: This category lists tool and mold makers for the plastics and rubber processing industries only.

entries.title: Cast
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of molds for material casting processes.

entries.title: Injection
entries.description: This category lists makers and finishers of injection molds only.

entries.title: Research_and_Education
entries.description: This category lists educational and research institutions and independent companies, and on-line courses related to the plastics and rubber industry.

entries.title: Rubber
entries.description: Manufacturers, suppliers and distributors of raw rubber and rubber compounds. Finished rubber products are found in the subcategory "Manufactured Product" and its linked categories.,

entries.title: Manufactured_Product
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers and distributors of finished rubber products. It is not for sites dealing with raw rubber and compounds. Submissions to this category include international and United States businesses whose operations extend throughout the 48 states. If your organization does not meet this criteria please submit your site to the appropriate regional category instead.

entries.title: Synthetic
entries.description: for Business: Industries: Manufacturing: Polymers: Materials: Rubber: Synthetic_Silicone_Urethane

entries.title: Converters
entries.description: This category lists companies involved in the provision of converting services to the plastics and rubber processing industries.

entries.title: Design_and_Prototyping
entries.description: This category lists companies, involved in product design and custom prototyping services in the plastics and rubber industries.

entries.title: Maintenance_and_Repair
entries.description: This category lists companies involved in the provision of maintenance and repair services for machinery, auxiliaries, and molds in the plastics and rubber processing industries.

entries.title: Testing_Facilities
entries.description: This category is for sites of companies which provide services as their primary business. Those companies providing services as an adjunct to their main business should not be listed here but under the category appropriate to their main business.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with the availability and servicing of new and pre-owned equipment used in the plastics manufacturing and processing industry and also, at least to some degree, by rubber and ceramic processing companies. Note: The emphasis in this category is not on producing plastics or making something out of plastic but on the equipment used for such purposes. Companies involved in producing parts and products out of plastic will be found in the <a href="/Business/Chemicals/Polymers/Contract_Processors/"> Contract_Processors </a> category; and companies producing plastic raw materials are indexed in the <a href="/Business/Chemicals/Polymers/Materials/"> Materials </a> category.Sites that more properly belong in these categories should be directed to them.

entries.title: Auxiliaries
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers of plastic equipment which is not primary to the process. This category has three co-categories, Extrusion, Molding, Thermoforming. Companies which produce equipment for these specific processes should be listed under the category appropriate to their application. Companies manufacturing down stream equipment such as, but not limited to: grinders, dryers, pelletizers, callendaring stacks, pullers, winders, sizing and calibration tanks, etc which do not belong in any of the specific subcategories should be listed here. category description

entries.title: Components_and_Spares
entries.description: This category is intended for after market spare part suppliers to the plastics machinery industry such as extruder screws and barrels, heaters and heater bands, temperature controllers, grinder knives and other components required to repair major primary plastics machinery and auxiliary equipment.

entries.title: Reaction_Molding_Machinery
entries.description: This category is specifically for companies making machinery and tooling for use in thermoset reaction molding applications. Machines, dispensors, mixers and molds for use with these specific machines would be placed here.

entries.title: Recycling_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for the manufacturers and dealers in machines for recycling plastic polymers. Dealers of used recycling equipment may be included.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category lists distributors, dealers, agents and representatives for machinery and equipment used in the plastics and rubber industries only.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category lists wholesale distributors, agents and manufacturers' representatives in the polymer, plastics and rubber industries.

entries.title: Manufactured_Product
entries.description: This category lists distributors, wholesalers, dealers, agents, manufacturers' representatives, etc., involved in the trade in finished plastic and rubber products.

entries.title: Specialties
entries.description: This category and its subcategories contain sites for businesses and business activities related to the manufacture, distribution, and sales of specialty chemical products. This includes primarily products defined by their suitability for a particular niche application or purpose, rather than by their chemical structure. Many of these are known in the chemical industry as specialty chemicals or performance chemicals. Sites for companies who focus on one particular specialty are listed in the corresponding subcategory; companies active in two or more specialty areas, and companies whose specialty does not fall within one of the subcategories, are listed in this main category.

entries.title: Flavors_and_Fragrances
entries.description: Sites pertaining to the manufacture of chemicals used for their flavor or fragrance are listed here. Downstream users of these chemicals are found elsewhere, for example in <a href="/Business/Food_and_Related_Products/Additives/Flavors_and_Extracts/">Food flavors and extracts</a> and <a href="/Business/Consumer_Goods_and_Services/Beauty/Fragrances/">Fragrances for beauty produces</a>.

entries.title: Bittering_Agents
entries.description: Bittering agents are commonly added to household items such as toiletries and cleaning products, and to outdoor products such as pesticides to prevent accidental poisonings. The primary bittering agent is denatonium benzoate, the bitterest substance known.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Groups related to the lubricant industry.

entries.title: Automotive
entries.description: Manufacturers specializing in automotive lubricants and related products.

entries.title: Dry
entries.description: Business involved in the production and supply of solid lubricants, including molybdenum disulfide and PTFE-based products.

entries.title: Silicones
entries.description: Businesses involved in the production and supply of silicone-based oils and greases.

entries.title: Refrigerants
entries.description: This category contains sites for businesses that manufacture and distribute refrigerant gases for use in automotive, business, and home air conditioning and refrigerating applications.

entries.title: Water_Treatment
entries.description: Web sites that have content relevant to water treatment chemicals(commercial, industrial, municipal) such as boilers, cooling towers, process, wastewater and of course drinking water.

entries.title: Construction_and_Maintenance
entries.description: <p> The <b>Construction and Maintenance</b> sector category includes resources on industries and companies primarily engaged in the design and construction of buildings and other structures, heavy construction (e.g. such as highways, power plants, and pipelines), additions, alterations, reconstruction, installation, and maintenance and repairs.  Demolition or wrecking of buildings and other structures, clearing of building sites, and sale of materials from demolished structures are also included. Finally, industries and companies that manufacture and distribute construction supplies and equipment are included in this branch.<br> <p>This category also includes information resources covering these industries, such as associations, reference resources, news, etc.<br> <p><i>(Source: This category description is based on the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS), 1997).</i></p>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: <B>This category is for Non Profit, educational and trade associations that inform, enable the support the development of the Construction and Maintenance Industries. </B> Associations that deal specifically with business within a locality, should be found at that locality's regional business category. Associations that deal specifically with business within a country, should be found at that country's regional business category, for example: Regional/North_America/Canada/Business_and_Economy/Associations/

entries.title: Commercial_and_Industrial
entries.description: This category is for those establishments primarily responsible for the complete construction of new work, additions, alterations and repairs of buildings. Typically it will include general and specialist building contractors, design builders, and construction management companies concerned with office, retail and industrial buildings .

entries.title: Geodesic
entries.description: This category contains links to suppliers and resources of geodesic domes . Geodesic domes are structures created from a complex network of triangles that form a roughly spherical surface. The greater the network of triangles, the closer the dome forms to the shape of a true sphere .
