entries.title: Monolithic
entries.description: This category contains links to suppliers, builders and resources related to monolithic domes . A monolithic dome is defined as an insulated, steel reinforced concrete structure used for various applications which may typically include homes, schools, bulk storage facilities, churches, and offices.

entries.title: Prefabricated
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers and distributors of prefabricated dome structures . Typical products will include air inflated, fabric and wooden structures .

entries.title: Health
entries.description: This category is for those establishments primarily responsible for the complete construction of new work, additions, alterations and repairs of hospitals and other medical buildings. Typically it will include general and specialist building contractors, design builders, and construction management companies .

entries.title: Modular
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers, distributors and constructors of non-residential modular and portable structures . Modular structures are those which are 60 to 100 percent factory built in a modular unit, designed to be built in one location and used in another. Typical applications include hospitals, educational facilities, daycare centers, correctional facilities, airports, military installations, retail businesses, restaurants and police stations. They can be used as an addition to existing buildings or as stand alone structures.

entries.title: Portable
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers and distributors of PORTABLE buildings. It does not include the raw product used to manufacture these goods or similar buildings best listed under another category.

entries.title: Housing
entries.description: This subcategory is for temporary housing such as trailers or cabins in which they can be easily relocated and not for permanent use.

entries.title: Offices
entries.description: This subcategory is for those companies offering PORTABLE offices and classrooms in which they can be easily relocated and not for permanent use.

entries.title: Storage
entries.description: This subcategory is for those companies offering PORTABLE storage buildings in which they can be easily relocated and not for permanent use.

entries.title: Toilets
entries.description: This subcategory is for those companies offering PORTABLE toilets/restrooms.

entries.title: Toilet_Stalls
entries.description: This is for sites that deal with portable individual toliet stall units. These toilet stalls are generally used at smaller events but can be set up in multiples for larger events.

entries.title: Parking
entries.description: This category is for those establishments primarily responsible for the complete construction of new work, additions, alterations and repairs of parking structures. Typically it will include general and specialist building contractors, design builders, and construction management companies .

entries.title: Religious
entries.description: This category is for those establishments primarily responsible for the complete construction of new work, additions, alterations and repairs of churches and other religious buildings. Typically it will include general and specialist building contractors, design builders, and construction management companies .

entries.title: Sports
entries.description: This category is for those establishments primarily responsible for the complete construction of new work, additions, alterations and repairs of sporting stadiums, arenas and other sports related buildings. Typically it will include general and specialist building contractors, design builders, and construction management companies

entries.title: Sustainable_Architecture
entries.description: From the description of the Sustainable Development category: The World Commission on Environment and Development (the Brundtland Commission), defined "sustainable development" as follows in the report Our Common Future (Oxford : Oxford University Press, 1987): "Sustainable development is development that meets the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs. It contains within it two key concepts: the concept of "needs", in particular the essential needs of the world's poor, to which overriding priority should be given; and the idea of limitations imposed by the state of technology and social organization on the environment's ability to meet present and future needs." Sustainable architecture is design and construction that supports these goals. Also known as green architecture or environmentally sensitive architecture. Through the use of building technologies, design strategies, and materials it seeks to minimize the impact we have on the environment.

entries.title: Consultants
entries.description: Non-architect firms that specialize in sustainable architecture and construction.

entries.title: Earthships
entries.description: "The Earthship is a completely independent globally oriented dwelling unit made from materials that are indigenous to the entire planet. The major structural building component of the Earthship is recycled automobile tires filled with compacted earth to form a rammed earth brick encased in steel belted rubber. This brick and the resulting bearing walls it forms is virtually indestructible." from the Earthship Biotecture site

entries.title: Earth_Construction
entries.description: <b>Earth Construction Description - </b>Any building technology using earth as the dominate material, including: Adobe, Clay & Cob, Rammed Earth, Underground and Earth Shelters, Earth Blocks, Earth Bags, Papercrete, and Earthen Floors. From the beginning of recorded history earth has been the most widely used building material in the world. Because of its low cost, ease of construction, and control over temperature extremes, earth architecture long ago set the standard for comfort and efficiency. Beautiful, energy efficient, environmentally friendly, safe, durable and economic.

entries.title: Green_Roofs
entries.description: Green roofs, also known as eco roofs and nature roofs, are vegetated roof coverings consisting of living vegetation on top of a modified conventional roof system.<p> Extensive systems are similar in weight to conventional gravel roofs and can be installed on any roofing deck, flat or sloped up to 45 degrees. Heavier intensive systems, which can include landscape planters and walkways, are intended for flat roofs with additional structural support.<p> The sod roofs and walls of buildings in Iceland provided the inspiration for the green roof concept. The technology emerged in Germany over 30 years ago and is in widespread use across Europe.<p>

entries.title: Suppliers
entries.description: Manufacturers of green roof systems.

entries.title: Organizations
entries.description: Groups, associations, and organizations that promote, research, and provide resources for sustainable architecture.

entries.title: Publications
entries.description: Publications related to sustainable architecture are often marketed to professionals, and therefore not always commonly known to the layman. News collecting e-mail newsletters and other online methods are another way that sustainable information is disseminated.

entries.title: Straw_Bale_Construction
entries.description: Professional Straw Bale builders and associations, plans, and resources. DEFINITION (Sustainable Building Sourcebook): Straw bale construction uses baled straw from wheat, oats, barley, rye, rice and others in walls covered by stucco. Straw bales are traditionally a waste product which farmers do not till under the soil, but do sell as animal bedding or landscape supply due to their durable nature. In many areas, it is also burned, causing severe air quality problems. Straw is the dry plant material or stalk left in the field after a plant has matured, been harvested for seed, and is no longer alive. Hay bales are made from short species of livestock feed grass that is green/alive and are not suitable for this application. Hay is also typically twice the price of straw.

entries.title: Thatched
entries.description: Barns

entries.title: Yurts
entries.description: Yurts are portable dwellings that orginated over 2500 years ago in Mongolia. Used by nomadic people they are windowless circular shaped structures with lattice walls and wood roof beams. Erected on the ground the floors typically covered with oriental style rugs. Exterior cover is made of Yak felt. Modern day yurts typically have vinyl windows, a skylight and are made of vinyl or fabric. They have recently become popular in Western countries as permanent full time houses, weekend/vacation getaways and camping cabins. Modern day yurts are also typically built on decks and may have utilities (water, electric).

entries.title: Commercial_Contractors
entries.description: <strong><font color=maroon><span style="background-color:yellow">Only web sites of multi-state or international operations will be listed here.</span></font></strong> For more regionally specific company websites, please see the appropriate category in <a href="/Business/Regional/">Business: Regional</a>. If you have only one office location, please submit to the local category, e.g., <strong><i>Locality</i>: Business and Economy: Construction and Maintenance</strong> in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a>: branch.

entries.title: Chimney
entries.description: <strong>Only web sites of multi-state or worldwide operations will be listed here.</strong> For more regionally specific company websites, please see the appropriate category in Top/Regional/. If you have only one office location, please submit to that Locality/Business_and_Economy/

entries.title: Civil_and_Roadworks
entries.description: <strong>Only web sites of multi-state or worldwide operations will be listed here.</strong> For more regionally specific company websites, please see the appropriate category in Top/Regional/. If you have only one office location, please submit to that Locality/Business_and_Economy/

entries.title: Corrosion
entries.description: This category is for contractors whose main operations centre around corrosion protection and prevention. Consultants and material suppliers should submit their sites to the related categories shown at the bottom of the page of this category. Submissions to this category are restricted to International organizations and United States organisations whose operations extend throughout the 48 states. If your organization does not meet this criteria please submit your site to the appropriate regional category.

entries.title: Foundation

entries.title: Metal_Fabrication
entries.description: This category will list URLs of Metal Fabrication Commercial Contractors. It is expected that most (or all) contractors will also have an in house fabrication shop to support the field operations. Metal Fabricators that do not provide installation work should submit their URLs to Business/Construction_and_Maintenance/Materials_and_Supplies/Metals/Metal_Fabrications/

entries.title: Pest_Control
entries.description: This category lists sites for companies that provide pest control <b>services</b> for residential, commercial, and/or agricultural properties. For this category, "Pest Control Services" is defined as the actual implementation of treatment and/or control methods which are offered by the contractor directly to the end consumer.<br><br> The scope of their business must be at least national or even international (companies that provide services to areas smaller than several US states or several countries {other than US} should submit to the appropriate Regional category).

entries.title: Bird_or_Wildlife_Control
entries.description: This subcategory is designed for listing of service providers that primarily offer bird and/or wildlife control services. This category is not designed for suppliers, distributors, and/or product wholesalers. <br><br> The scope of the business must be at least national or even international (companies that provide services to areas smaller than several US states or several countries {other than US} should submit to the appropriate Regional category).

entries.title: Trade_Associations_and_Publications
entries.description: This sub-category is intended for pest control related trade associations and trade/industry publications.

entries.title: Referral_Services
entries.description: <strong>Only web sites of multi-state or worldwide operations will be listed here.</strong> For more regionally specific company websites, please see the appropriate category in Top/Regional/. If you have only one office location, please submit to that Locality/Business_and_Economy/

entries.title: Structural_Movers
entries.description: <strong>Only web sites of multi-state or worldwide operations will be listed here.</strong> For more regionally specific company websites, please see the appropriate category in Top/Regional/. If you have only one office location, please submit to that Locality/Business_and_Economy/

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: This category is for sites specifically related to Construction and Maintenance industry trade shows, events and exhibitions.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Consultants provide design services from concept development, through models and visulisations to final realisation and production oversight. Consultants are not linked with products or methods but respond to each project based upon the clients vision and budget.

entries.title: Construction_Legalities
entries.description: Companies that provide consultant services on a fee basis that are primarily involved in providing litigation or dispute resolution support,construction claims analysis and preparation, construction defects investigation and analysis. They do not supply products with technical support. All sites are thoroughly researched for compliance with these guidelines.

entries.title: Arbitrator,_Mediator_and_Dispute_Resolution
entries.description: Sites listed here are primarily involved in the arbitration or mediation of construction disputes. Before you submit your site please take the time to review the related categories to ensure that your site is appropriate to this category. Also, be sure to review the general guidelines for the Business categories. See also: Society: Law: Legal Information: Alternative Dispute Resolution Society: Law: Organizations: Alternative Dispute Resolution Society: Law: Consultants and Services: Dispute Resolution: Service Providers Society: Law: Consultants and Services: Dispute Resolution: Service Providers: North America: United States Society: Law: Consultants and Services: Dispute Resolution: Service Providers: Europe

entries.title: Permit_and_Zoning
entries.description: Sites listed here are primarily companies that provide permit, zoning and building code assistance to Owners, Developers, General Contractors, Architects and Engineers. Before you submit your site please take the time to review the related categories to ensure that your site is appropriate to this category. Also, be sure to review the general guidelines for the Business categories. See also: Business: Real Estate: Legal: Business: Real Estate: Legal: Land Use Regulation Business: Industries: Construction and Maintenance

entries.title: Cost_Consultants
entries.description: Companies that provide consultancy services on a fee basis. They do not supply products with technical support. All sites are investigated and references sort.

entries.title: General_Consulting
entries.description: Companies that provide consultancy services on a fee basis. They do not supply products with technical support. All sites are investigated and references sought.

entries.title: Illumination_Consultants
entries.description: Companies that provide lighting design on a fee basis. Please state location of offices. They do not supply light fittings or do electrical work. All sites are investigated and references sort.

entries.title: Inspection_and_Maintenance
entries.description: Sites that offer inspection and maintenance for commercial buildings. Consultants are fee based companies who operate independent of the supply chain. Sites that supply products will not be included. Home owner or house based inspection services are listed within their localities under Real_Estate or Real_Estate/Inspections.

entries.title: Multi-Discipline
entries.description: An MDP offers design consultancy in a number of design disciplines.

entries.title: Project_Management
entries.description: Companies that provide consultancy services on a fee basis. They do not supply products with technical support. All sites are investigated and references sort.

entries.title: Safety
entries.description: Companies that provide consultancy services on a fee basis. They do not supply products with technical support. All sites are investigated and references sort.

entries.title: Service_and_Product_Supply
entries.description: Consultants linked to products.

entries.title: Testing_Services
entries.description: Please submit sites that focus on Testing Services Consulting in the Construction and Maintenance arena.

entries.title: Design
entries.description: <b>This category is related to the business of design in the construction and maintenance industry. It is divided into subcategories related to specific disciplines. Please do not submit to the Design category, but rather to one of the subcategories below.</b>

entries.title: Acousticians
entries.description: <b><p>Acousticians specialize in the science of sound, dealing with its generation, transmission, control, reception, and effects. This category is for the business of the applied science. Typical markets served include the performing arts, industrial, manufacturing, aviation, and commercial sectors.</p> <p>This category lists professional consulting firms that provide acoustical design services.</b></p>

entries.title: Architects
entries.description: <b>This category is for licensed professional architects and the portfolio and resumes of architectural students. Licensed architects are licensed within a locality to perform professional services.</b>

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: <p>Commercial / industrial architecture includes office, multi-unit residential, civic, retail, institutional and other types of architecture for the business world.</p><p> Theoretical firms are welcome and encouraged, but they must display some form of practical application, even if it is only a discussion.</p>

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Directories is a category for online directories related to architects and the practice of architecture. This includes directories of architects and issues related to practice and design (green architecture, periodical directories,etc.) If your site does not meet this criteria, please refer to the description under the Architects General Category.

entries.title: Educational
entries.description: Education architects is a category providing portfolios and business information for those involved in professional practice who focus is on educational facilities. This includes schools, universities, school labs, private institutions and any other structure relevant to a teaching environment Theoretical firms are welcome and encouraged, but they must display some form of practical application, even if it is only a discussion. If your site does not meet this criteria, please refer to the description under the Architects General Category.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Employment is a category related to employment opportunities for architects and related positions within an architectural firm. This includes staff and executive recruitment, job listings, and staffing agencies related to architecture. If your site does not meet this criteria, please refer to the description under the Architects General Category.

entries.title: Entertainment
entries.description: Entertainment architects is a category providing portfolios and business information for those involved in designing for the entertainment industry. While the majority of the sites depict traditional entertainment practice (casinos, performance spaces, theme and leisure environments, etc.), quite a few are not. Theoretical firms are welcome and encouraged, but they must display some form of practical application, even if it is only a discussion.

entries.title: Health_Care
entries.description: Health Care architects is a category providing portfolios and business information for those involved in professional practice who focus is on health care facilities. This includes hospitals, elderly care, ACLF, death care, medical office, medical research facilities and any other structure relevant to the health care environment Theoretical firms are welcome and encouraged, but they must display some form of practical application, even if it is only a discussion. If your site does not meet this criteria, please refer to the description under the Architects General Category.

entries.title: Hospitality
entries.description: Hospitality architects is a category providing portfolios and business information for those involved in professional practice who focus is on hospitality facilities. This includes hotels, motels, resorts, lodges and any other structure relevant to the hospitality industry. Theoretical firms are welcome and encouraged, but they must display some form of practical application, even if it is only a discussion.

entries.title: Multi-Discipline
entries.description: <p>This category is for firms designing multiple building types without a specific specialty, or that offer multiple services. Multiple services include graphic design, architecture, web design, engineering, etc. Theoretical firms are welcome and encouraged, but they must display some form of practical application, even if it is only a discussion.<p>

entries.title: Religious
entries.description: Religious architects is a category providing portfolios and business information for those involved in professional practice who focus is on religious facilities. This includes churches, fellowship and worship hall, and any other structure relevant to a religious environment. Theoretical firms are welcome and encouraged, but they must display some form of practical application, even if it is only a discussion.

entries.title: Residential
entries.description: Registered ("licensed") architects and architectural firms currently practicing that specialize in or have a strong emphasis on residential architecture.

entries.title: Resumes_and_Portfolios
entries.description: Résumés and Portfolios is a category for the resumes of individual architects and their portfoilios, and sites that do not demonstrate work clearly related to the business of architecture. This includes individuals seeking employment, those not seeking employment currently employed by an architectural firm, and firms that do not clearly state their business services, or whose portfolio does not show built work or unbuilt work not related to competitions. If your site does not meet this criteria, please refer to the description under the Architects General Category.

entries.title: Sports
entries.description: Sports architects is a category providing portfolios and business information for those involved in professional practice who focus is on sports facilities. This includes gymnasiums, stadiums, arenas, equestrian facilities and any other structure relevant to a sports environment Theoretical firms are welcome and encouraged, but they must display some form of practical application, even if it is only a discussion. If your site does not meet this criteria, please refer to the description under the Architects General Category.

entries.title: Sustainable
entries.description: Sustainable architecture describes the practice of pursuing an energy- and ecologically-conscious approach to the design of the built environment. It is sometimes called "green architecture."

entries.title: Building_Decorative_Arts
entries.description: <p>This category is for professional designers of the decorative arts in relationship to architecture and interior design. The design and product must be unique, clearly demonstrating exceptional craftsmanship and artistic intent. <p>It is NOT for massed produced and distributed decorative products, such as trim, casings, columns, railings, housewares, and mass produced art. These material should be submitted to the appropriate category under Materials and Supplies or Shopping.</p>

entries.title: Frescoes,_Murals,_Faux-Finishes
entries.description: Companies providing services in the field of decorative art.

entries.title: Building_Designers
entries.description: <b>Building Designers are design professionals that are not licensed architects providing design services to the general public. <p>Please submit your site to this category if your design firm performs works other than residential, or if you are a multi-discipline building design firm.</b></p>

entries.title: Residential
entries.description: Residential Building Designers are building design professionals who specialize in home design but are not licensed architects.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Directories of residential/home designers.

entries.title: Decorators
entries.description: This category focuses on individuals that specialize in modifications to interior and exterior spaces, including but not limited to: <ul> <li>Interior Re-design <li>General Design Consultations <li>Paint and Color Consultations <li>Shopping Services <li>Office Organization <li>Party and Entertaining Ideas <li>Holiday Decorating <li>Decorative Painting/Faux Finnish <li>Garden/Patio Makeovers <li>Workshops/Speaking Engagements <li>Redesign for Real Estate/Curb Appeal <li>Relocation/Move-in Services </ul> Services may range from modifications of existing space configuration and furnishings. Source: <a href="http://www.weredesign.com">Interior Redesign Industry Specialists</a>

entries.title: Design-Build
entries.description: This category should contain sites that are of interstate, national, or multi-national importance. A business which serves a <i>local area</i>, such as only a city, a metropolitan area, or simply a portion of a state or province, will <b>NOT be listed here</b>; and should be listed in the locality of the companies corporate office. DO <b>NOT</b> SUBMIT TO THIS CATEGORY IF YOU ARE A PRIMARILY RESIDENTIAL OR COMMERCIAL CONTRACTOR WORKING. THE WEB SITE MUST DEMONSTRATE DESIGN ABILITIES CLEARLY WITHIN THE DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES. IF you are a contractor working in <strong>only one state within the United States</strong>, THEN please re-direct your site submission request to the appropriate local, regional or state-level <strong>Business and Economy: Construction and Maintenance</strong> category within <a href="/Regional/North_America/United_States/">Regional: North America: United States</a>. <p>A design-build firm undertakes building projects that are designed by employees of the firm and are built by its own force or subcontractors under its supervision.</p>

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: <b>This category is for design-build companies that specialize in commercial construction only.</b>

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: <b>A category for general directories related to the business of construction related design. This includes directories that list multiple design professionals (architects, building designers, landscape architects, and interior designers). If the directory lists only one of these professions, please submit the site to associated professional subcategory.</b>

entries.title: Drafting_Services
entries.description: <b>Firms that provide professional drafting services to the construction industry.</b>

entries.title: Illustration_and_Rendering
entries.description: The artistic rendering of design for architecture and interior design. Landscape architecture is included in this category.

entries.title: Interior_Designers
entries.description: Professionals who have <b>academic education </b> in the field of interior design. An interior designer is professionally trained to create a functional and quality interior environment. Qualified through education, experience and examination, a professional interior designer can identify, research and creatively resolve issues and lead to a healthy, safe and comfortable physical environment. (ASID)

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: <b>This category is for non-profit, educational and trade associations that inform and enable the support the development of the Interior Design Industries.</b>

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: This category is for interior designers (professionals with academic education in this field) who work primarily in the commercial specialty.

entries.title: Entertainment
entries.description: Entertainment interior design brings together the use of interiors, lighting, sound and other technologies for movies, television, videos, dramatic and musical theater, clubs, concerts, theme parks and industrial projects. (ASID)

entries.title: Government_and_Institutional
entries.description: A government interior designer is familiar with the very specific needs and requirements associated with working with government agencies, such as military bases, federal buildings or government offices. An institutional designer focuses on projects such as child care, educational, religious, correctional and recreational facilities, fire and police stations, courts, embassies, libraries, auditoriums, museums and transportation terminals. (ASID)

entries.title: Health_Care
entries.description: Health care interior designers create environments for hospitals; clinics; examination rooms; surgical suites; mobile units; hospice care homes; nursing, assisted living or long term care facilities; or any other health care environment.

entries.title: Hospitality_and_Restaurant
entries.description: Hospitality interior design focuses on environments that entertain or host the public, including nightclubs, restaurants, theaters, hotels, city and country clubs, golf facilities, cruise ships and conference facilities. (ASID)

entries.title: Office
entries.description: Office interior design focuses on the public and private areas utilized by corporate and professional service firms. (ASID)

entries.title: Retail
entries.description: <b>Retail interior design and store planning concentrate on retail venues, including boutiques, department stores, outlets, showrooms, food retailing centers and shopping malls. (ASID)</b>

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Directories are listings of manufacturers, design professionals and other resources, often arranged topically or by regions and which may contain links to related webpages.

entries.title: Multi-Discipline
entries.description: <P>This category is for interior designers (professionals with academic education in this field) who work in both the residential and commercial specialties. </P>

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: The Interior Designer News and Media category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, magazines, and e-zines which deal primarily with or for Interior Designers.

entries.title: Residential
entries.description: This category is for interior designers (professionals with academic education in this field) who work <strong>PRIMARILY</strong> in the residential specialty.

entries.title: Showrooms
entries.description: "For the trade only" showrooms and marts presenting furniture and other design accessories from multiple manufacturers. These facilities are not open to the public.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for software and other tools and services to aid the interior design professional.

entries.title: Kitchen_and_Bath
entries.description: <b>Kitchen and Bath Designers are design professionals that are not licensed architects providing design services to homeowners, contractors and businesses.</b>

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: News- and media-related sites regarding kitchen and bath design, including journals, magazines and e-zines, radio talk shows, or television shows.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for construction and maintenance directories that serve a worldwide or international scope.For construction and maintenance directories that serve the a narrower scope, please see the subcategories.

entries.title: Environmental
entries.description: A resource and directory for the building design community to help make environmentally informed construction, maintenance, and design decisions about building materials and technologies, contractors and suppliers.

entries.title: Environmentally_Safe_Materials
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers and providers of both environmentally safe and sustainable construction products. Environmentally safe products are products whose use or manufacturer do not harm the environment, and sustainable products are those products providing environmental, social and economic benefits while protecting public health, welfare, and environment over their full commercial cycle, from the extraction of raw materials to final

entries.title: Estimating
entries.description: Information and resources for construction estimating.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Companies that provide consultancy services on a fee basis. Contractors or FM suppliers should apply to commercial contracting.

entries.title: Historic_Preservation
entries.description: The U.S. Secretary of the Interior defines <b>historic preservation</b> as "retention of all historic fabric through conservation, maintenance, and repair." This category also includes resources for the related practice of <b>rehabilitation</b>, which includes replacement of severely deteriorated elements of the structure. This category is for architects, planners, craftspeople, and materials manufacturers whose primary speciality is historic preservation and rehabilitation and who routinely serve a national, international, or broadly regional clientele.

entries.title: Architects
entries.description: Architects specializing in historic preservation.

entries.title: Commercial_Contractors
entries.description: The intent of this category is to locate individuals or firms who provide on-site services specific to the historic preservation trades across a broad regional or national area.

entries.title: Materials_and_Supplies
entries.description: Limited to suppliers specific to historic preservation, or of relevance to the historic preservation industry, and not listed elswhere under other construction related categories on ODP.

entries.title: Landscaping
entries.description: Businesses and associations involved in commercial and residential landscaping.

entries.title: Architects
entries.description: <b>Landscape Architects is a category providing portfolios and business information for those involved in professional licensed practice, whose focus is on multiple project types and services. Multiple services include graphic design, landscape architecture, signage, urban design, planning and others that are not typically associated with a "traditional practice."</b>

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: <b>Commercial landscape architects is a category providing portfolios and business information for those involved in professional licensed practice, whose focus is on commercial projects. This includes offices, retail sites, parks, corporate centers, medical facilities, and other associated commercial projects.<p>

entries.title: Golf_Course
entries.description: <b>Golf Course landscape architects is a category providing portfolios and business information for those involved in professional licensed practice, whose focus is on golf course projects.<p>

entries.title: Resumes_and_Portfolios
entries.description: <b>Résumés and Portfolios is a category for the resumes of individual landscape architects, landscape architecture students, and sites that do not demonstrate work clearly related to the business of architecture. This includes individuals seeking employment, those not seeking employment currently employed by a firm, and firms that do not clearly state their business services.</B>

entries.title: Design-Build
entries.description: This category is for <i>multinational and international firms</i> or <i>multi-state firms (USA only)</i> that provide complete design and build services as well as landscape construction/contractor services.

entries.title: Maintenance
entries.description: This category is for sites that focus on the business of landscaping maintenance.

entries.title: Maintenance
entries.description: "Maintenance" </br> The work of keeping something in proper condition; upkeep. </br> Activity involved in maintaining something in good working order.</p>Thank you.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: This category will list institutes, companies and individuals that provide education and training to maintenance departments. This category will also list the companies that provide services to the education and training companies listed here.

entries.title: Janitorial
entries.description: This category is for sites that focus on the business of janitorial maintenance.

entries.title: Painting
entries.description: This category is for sites that focus on the business of painting services.

entries.title: Windows_and_Doors
entries.description: This category is for sites concerning the cleaning, maintenance, repair, and restoration of windows and doors.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: The <b>Marketing and Advertising</b> category comprises site links to agencies and individuals which offer advertising and marketing services <em>focused on the construction and maintenance industry</em> sector engaged in one or more of the following: <ul> <li>Advertising in print, broadcast, interactive, or other media</li> <li>Branding and corporate identity design</li> <li>Creation and distribution of promotional items</li> <li>Internet marketing strategy and analysis</li> <li>Collection and analysis of market research</li> <li>Public relations activities</li> <li>Training and development of sales representatives</li> </ul> <b>Excluded</b> from this category are: <ul> <li>Agencies and individuals which offer advertising and marketing services to all industry sectors. These are listed according to the <a href="/Business/Marketing_and_Advertising">Business: Marketing and Advertising</a> category</li> <li>Agencies and individuals which offer local services only are listed according to the <a href="/Regional/">geographic area which they serve</a></li> <li>Companies which offer web design, promotion, and hosting services are listed only in <a href="/Computers/Internet/Web_Design_and_Development/">Computers: Internet: Web Design and Development</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Marketplaces
entries.description: <strong>Marketplaces</strong> facilitate interactions and transactions between buyers and sellers in the <i>construction and maintenance industry</i>, providing a platform for promoting contracting services, jobs, materials, supplies, tools and equipment; and allowing buyers to select the most appropriate or cost-effective source.

entries.title: Materials_and_Supplies
entries.description: This category contains links to sites related to materials and supplies used in the construction and maintenance industry. Please submit sites related to materials and supplies of construction and maintenance including, but not limited to: <ul> <li>Wholesale and Distribution</li> <li>Manufacturing</li> <li>Marketplaces</li> <li>Education and Training</li> <li>Associations</li> <li>Conferences, Trade Shows, and Expos</li> </ul> <strong>ATTENTION:</strong> <em>Local retailers and showrooms</em> should be submitted to the appropriate <a href="/Business/Regional/">Business and Economy</a> category for their local/area market. <strong>ATTENTION:</strong> <em>Local installers and contractors</em> should be submitted to the appropriate <a href="/Business/Regional/">Business and Economy</a> category for their local/area market.

entries.title: Concrete

translations.jpn: セメントとコンクリート
