It is not for raw materials or industrial supplies, these should be submitted to the "Materials and Supplies" category .

entries.title: Standards_and_Codes
entries.description: This category will list the URLs that describe Business operating standards and Codes as well as the companies that provide services to implement and/or maintain these standards and codes. Examples of standards are the ISO standards and an example of codes are Building, Construction and Fire codes.

entries.title: Engineering
entries.description: This category will list companies and individual engineers that provide engineering support to substations and transmission related companies.

entries.title: Power_Factor_Correction
entries.description: Power factor is the percentage of electricity that is being used to do useful work. It is expressed as a ratio. For example, a power factor of 0.72 would mean only 72% of your power was being used to do useful work. Perfect power factor is 1.0,(unity), meaning 100% of the power is being used for useful work. Power factor correction, then, is the method(s) used to fix the problems that cause power to be wasted. Energy is saved, and penalties levied by power companies are reduced or eliminated.

entries.title: Test_and_Measurement

translations.fra: Matériel de test et de mesure

entries.description: The "Test and Measurement" category includes listings for manufacturers and distributors of test and measuring instruments, whose main product line or service consists of such things as electrical calibrators, references, standards, sources, insulation resistance testers and megohmmeters, function generators, analog and digital multimeters, signal generators, pulse generators, magnetic test equipment, electro-optical measurement products, time domain reflectometers, radio test sets, speaker testers and/or spectrum analyzers. <p> This category contains web sites of companies that sell, rent, lease or manufacture test and measurement equipment that will measure or produce an electrical quantity or signal that can be used for testing electrical or electronics equipment. <p> These products do not measure light, fat content, chemical composition, flow rate, amount of bubbles, weight or any other quantity other than electrical.

entries.title: Computer_Based
entries.description: This category contains sites that list PC or computer based test and measurement equipment.

entries.title: Electrical_Test
entries.description: This category contains sites from manufacturing companies involved with primarily electrical test equipment. Such as power line, HVAC, construction or installation of electrical systems.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: Providing Test Services

entries.title: Portable_Appliance_Testing
entries.description: Portable Appliance Testing

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Distributors & Manufacturer Representatives of electrical test equipment

entries.title: Environmental_Test_Chambers
entries.description: This cat contains submissions from companies that manufacture, make, distributes, sales, repair, and or calibrate environmental test chambers. That are used mainly for electronics component, board, device, equipment for burn in, life time cycle testing, testing or certification.

entries.title: High_Voltage
entries.description: This category deals with the measurement of HV. There is also a link to another part of ODP that lists commercial sources of HV measurement probes. 02/13/00

entries.title: Oscilloscopes
entries.description: Includes listings for manufacturers of analog, digital, storage, and special purpose oscilloscopes and waveform monitors.

entries.title: Rental_or_Lease
entries.description: This category contains sites that have rental or lease of electronics test equipment as their main focus. All companies here will typically provide other services, especially sales of ex-rental equipment and maybe rental of other products including computers etc.

entries.title: Specialized
entries.description: Sites that list or sell single function, or special function test equipment would be listed in this category.

entries.title: Surplus_and_Used
entries.description: This category lists companies that sell used, refurbished, pre-owned (same as used) and/or surplus test equipment.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Includes listings for distributors of test and measuring instruments such as calibrators, references, standards, and sources, insulation resistance testers and megohmmeters, function generators, analog and digital multimeters, signal generators, pulse generators, magnetic test equipment, time domain reflectometers, and spectrum analyzers.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category will list manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, repairers and renters of tools and equipment used within the Electronic and Electrical industry including companies that provide services to these companies. It is not for raw materials or industrial supplies, these should be submitted to the "Materials and Supplies" category .

entries.title: Transformers_and_Inductors
entries.description: Category for manufacturers of magnetic components, including ferrites, transformers, coils, chokes and inductors.

entries.title: Ferrites_and_Magnets
entries.description: This category will list companies that manufacture and/or distribute ferrite cores used for induction components magnetic powders and component of magnetic powers and permanent magnets.

entries.title: Inductors_and_Coils
entries.description: This category will list companies that manufacture and distribute coils and inductors that are used as stand alone components or as components of assemblies such as relays, solenoids etc.

entries.title: Magnetic_Heads
entries.description: This category will list manufacturers and companies that support the manufacture of magnetic heads.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category will list manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, repairers and renters of tools and equipment used within the Electronics and Electrical industry including companies that provide services to these companies. It is not for raw materials or industrial supplies, these should be submitted to the "Materials and Supplies" category.

entries.title: Transformers
entries.description: This category will list companies that manufacture and distribute transformers except the transformers used in power transmission and distribution systems (high power and high voltage) which are listed at Business/Industries/Electronics_and_Electrical/Substation_and_Transmission

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Distributors, vendors, wholesalers, brokers and representatives are companies that buy, sell, service, or install components used to manufacture electronic products. Companies listed here do not manufacture products. Distributors that primarily service a regional territory (for example, a single US state) should submit sites to the appropriate Regional category.

entries.title: Brokers
entries.description: This is a category for companies that broker or auction components and manufacturing equipment. They generally provide no technical support or backup.

entries.title: Wiring_and_Accessories
entries.description: Manufacturers and distributors of wire and cable for electrical both low and high power signal and power transmission, insulation and heat shrink materials, power cords, wire identification and labeling systems and tools, cable ties, and wire and cable harnesses.

entries.title: Cable_Ties
entries.description: Manufacturers and distributors of cable ties, tie wraps, velcro wire and cable wraps, and other mechanical means of bundling wires and cables together.

entries.title: Coaxial_Cable
entries.description: This category will list companies that produce RF coaxial cable, coaxial cable accessories and companies that provide services to these companies.

entries.title: Power_Strips
entries.description: This category will list URLs of companies that manufacture power strips for residential and office applications.

entries.title: Employment

translations.tha: งาน

entries.description: The <b>Employment</b> category focuses on bringing employees and employers together. This includes resources and establishments engaged in one or more of the following disciplines: <ul> <li>Recruitment and/or staffing services on behalf of employers</li> <li>Advice or assistance with preparation of resumes and portfolios</li> <li>Job search directories</li> <li>Career management</li> </ul> <b>Excluded</b> from this category are: <ul> <li>Individual job postings (i.e. the "help wanted" section of an employer's website) are not listed in the Open Directory due to their inherent transient nature.</li> <li>Resumes/portfolios, recruiters and staffing services, and job search directories specific to an industry sector are listed according to the <a href="/Business/Employment/By_Industry/">industry which they serve</a>.</li> <li>Agencies and individuals which offer local employment services and regionally-specific job boards are listed according to the <a href="/Business/Employment/By_Region/">geographic area which they serve</a>.</li> <li>Topics related to the management and training of existing employees are organized in <a href="/Business/Human_Resources/">Business: Human Resources</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Careers
entries.description: Sites in this category offer advice and resources for career enhancement, career selection and dealing with career choices.

entries.title: Changing_Careers
entries.description: The resources that you need to make a decision about your vocational goals and career path.<br> <br> This broad topic encompasses, but is not limited to, self-assessment (testing), resume writing, interviewing, job search techniques, salary negotiation and decision making.<br> <br> Sites that have been included are metasites (web pages that direct you to relevant links); e-zines; college web pages that have guides on line; and businesses advertising their services. <br> <br> Sites will not be listed which have a purely regional focus. If your site is directed towards a specific area of the world, please send it to the appropriate <a href="/Regional/">Regional/</a> category.

entries.title: Counseling_and_Management
entries.description: Sites offering career coaching, counseling, and/or management for individuals in pursuit of a career.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: A directory is a guide or list of resources, not an individual business. Directories are compilation of websites containing comprehensive indexes or lists of general business resources, companies, and company related information.

entries.title: Job_References
entries.description: This category contains sites offering job reference checking services for the job seeker and sites offering information on how to verify references.

entries.title: Surveys_and_Statistics
entries.description: Sites offering general career and industry statistics, salary and other surveys, and employment numbers. Sites which offer surveys and statistics on a particular industry should be listed under the appropriate industry category.

entries.title: Job_Search
entries.description: The Job Search category provides listings of employment sites, job portals, and sites which provide Job Seekers with information which specifically relates to finding a job, as opposed to career related information or resumes. The Job Search category is broken down into: Entry Level and Internships, Industries, Interview Advice, Job Fairs, Seasonal, and World-wide. Closely linked are the Recruiters and Executive Search categories which list search firms that do not specialize in one type of job or one type of industry. For industry specific search firms look in the category for the specific industry. (e.g. Business: Industries: Information Technology: Employment: Recruiters)

entries.title: Entry_Level_and_Internships
entries.description: Internships represent a great way for students and recent graduates to gain important work experience. Internships can provide interns with useful skills and insight that will prove helpful for their future careers. Sites in this category list internship openings and provide information to those seeking for internships.

entries.title: Resume_Advice
entries.description: Listing of sites which provide advice about how to write a resume, submit a resume or create a cover letter.

entries.title: Seasonal
entries.description: Employment sites offering seasonal job offers. Sites listed here will have job openings of interest to students and seasonal workers looking for a summer job. Sites also may focus on winter positions in ski areas and warm weather destination resorts.

entries.title: Camps
entries.description: These employers seek seasonal workers to staff their camps. Job seekers should enjoy working with kids in an outdoor setting.

entries.title: World-wide
entries.description: Sites offering job search information world-wide, or in a large variety of countries or regions are listed here. This category is not for sites about specific countries or regions, as these should be listed in the appropriate category under Regional.

entries.title: Executive_Search
entries.description: This category contains a listing of Executive Search companies and related services that are not industry specific or functionally specific. Executive search firms conduct searches for their clients on a retained basis. The searches they conduct are usually for top level executives. (i.e Presidents, Chairmen of the Board, Board of Directors Members, V.P's etc.)

entries.title: International
entries.description: Listing of retained Executive Search companies and related services. Executive search firms conduct searches for their clients on a retained basis. The searches they conduct are for top level executives. <P></P> <B>Submission Notes:</B> <P></P> Submit here those Executive Search companies that specialize in International searches.

entries.title: Recruiters
entries.description: This category lists executive recruiters' internet sites. Executive recruiters are professionals or professional firms that conduct searches for employees for their clients on a contingency basis. They research, source, interview and recommend candidates to their clients. Executive Recruiters are not employment agencies. Executive recruiters find people for jobs. Recruiters' fees are paid by potential employers, not by candidates.

entries.title: Management_Recruiters_International
entries.description: This sub category is for MRI affiliated companies only.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: The following is a listing of recruiting related resources. (Portal sites, forums, directories, etc.) This is not the category for staffing/recruiting firms, software or training. (There are better suited categories for these)

entries.title: Training_and_Seminars
entries.description: Recruiting Related Training and Seminars

entries.title: Sourcing
entries.description: Sourcing is the research-intensive part of the recruitment process involving identifying professionals with certain skills and experience as detailed in the employer's job description. This category only lists companies providing candidate sourcing -- frequently referred to as "recruitment research" or "executive search research".

entries.title: Staffing_Services
entries.description: This Category is designed specifically for Professional Staffing/Employment firms specializing in Employee placement on a temporary or permanent basis in the public and private sectors.

entries.title: Digital_Format
entries.description: Services that help create or convert, a resume or portfolio to digital formats.

entries.title: Executive
entries.description: Executive Resume Services is an Open Directory Project category devoted to websites that provide information and services exclusive to executive resumes.

entries.title: Posting
entries.description: Services that help create and host an online resume.

entries.title: Energy
entries.description: <p>The <b>Energy</b> sector covers distinct, but increasingly interdependent industries.&nbsp; This category tree includes the following:</p><ul><li>Industries engaged in the electric power generation industry.</li><li>Industries engaged in oil and gas exploration, refining, storage, distribution, and marketing.</li><li>Providers of electric, water, and gas services (eg. utilities).</li><li>Industries developing renewable and alternative energy sources.</ul> <p>This category also includes information resources covering these industries, such as associations, reference resources, and news.<br />Please note that industries providing environmental protection, safety equipment, and services such as pollution control products, waste management, recycling operations, and waste-to-energy products, are listed in the <a href="/Business/Environment/"><b>Business: Environment</b></a> category tree.</p>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Consultants specializing in the energy and environmental field, especially for: <UL> <LI>Electricity</LI> <LI>Hydrogen</LI> <LI>Oil and Gas</LI> <LI>Renewables</LI> <LI>Solid Fuels</LI> <LI>Utilities</LI> </UL> <blockquote> <br> <p align=center> <table bgcolor="#ffffcc" cellpadding=6 border="0"> <tr><td> <small>Before submitting your site, please review the <a href="/Business/desc.html">Guidelines for Submitting a Site</a>.</small> </td></tr> </table> </p> </blockquote>

entries.title: Electricity
entries.description: This category is for sites dealing in world class electrical generating companies and those companies that build them.

entries.title: Cogeneration
entries.description: This category will list the URLs of companies that manufacture, service, and support cogeneration facilities. Cogeneration is the simultaneous generation of electrical power and heat.

entries.title: Cooperatives
entries.description: Electricity producers or distributors who follow a cooperative business model.

entries.title: IPP-Merchant_Power
entries.description: This category is for non-regulate power generators.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Employment resources related to the energy sector. Some examples of the energy sector: power, oil, gas, petrochemical and mining.

entries.title: Job_Search
entries.description: The Job Search category provides listings of employment sites, job portals, and sites which provide Job Seekers with information which specifically relates to finding a job in the Energy field, as opposed to career related information or resumes.

entries.title: Fuel_Cells
entries.description: Fuel cell technology is used to react fuels such as hydrogen or methanol with oxygen via an electrochemical path, thereby generating electricity. While the technology has been available for decades for specialty applications, it has undergone much more rapid development in recent years, spurred in part by the promise of a hydrogen economy. Many companies participate in the field, at various stages of the product cycle (research through mature products). Websites for these companies are collected in this category. For more information about the principles behind fuel cell technology, see the corresponding <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Fuel_Cells/">Science</a> category.

entries.title: Management
entries.description: This <b>Energy Management</b> sector category includes industries and companies who provide services and products specializing in energy management to other businesses.<br> For this category, <b>Energy Management</b> is defined as: <br><br> The steps taken to minimize energy wasted in the provision of a facility or service.<br><br> An energy management program is the process of implementing energy management through: <UL> <LI>Policy setting</LI> <LI>Energy auditing</LI> <LI>Behavioural change through awareness campaigns</LI> <LI>Identifying and implementing technical and procedural solutions</LI> <LI>Planning for future facilities and services</LI> <LI>Review of current facilities and services</LI> </UL>

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This <b>Energy Management Software</b> category is for companies who make software for businesses for analysis, testing, management, monitoring in relation to energy management. It does not include sites which sell products online for consumers, or those for localized purchase only.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This <b>Energy Management Equipment</b> category includes industries and companies who provide equipment, tools, and supplies specifically for use in energy management. It does not include sites which sell consumer products online, or those for local supply.

entries.title: Marketplaces
entries.description: E-commerce marketplaces facilitate interactions and transactions between buyers and sellers within the energy and utility industries.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Professional newsletters and other periodicals for the audience of Engineers.

entries.title: Oil_and_Gas
entries.description: This main category is for vertically integrated companies that do substantial business in a number of major subcategories. For example BPAmoco is a major player in exploration, refining, petrochemicals and marketing. Many national oil companies belong in this category.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: Web sites that describe and promote conferences. In most cases these are international in scope. Annual conferences by industry organizations are expected to be described in the wed sites of those organizations, not posted here.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Companies supplying consulting services to the oil and gas industry.

entries.title: Land_and_Leasing
entries.description: Consultants that obtain oil and gas leases from owners, do title work, etc. for Exploration and Production companies.

entries.title: Management_and_Financial
entries.description: These consultants provide advice to management, including advice on planning, technology, financial matters, risk management, and environmental solutions.

entries.title: Petrophysics
entries.description: Consultants whose main business is the analysis of well logs and the application of that analysis to the exploration and production industries.

entries.title: Processing_and_Pipeline
entries.description: Specializing in processing engineering, including plant design and construction. Includes both the piping associated with processing plants and trunk pipelines.

entries.title: Reservoir_Engineering
entries.description: Consulting Organizations whose main activities are reservoir studies and estimation of oil and gas reserves.

entries.title: Job_Search
entries.description: The Job Search category provides listings of employment sites, job portals, and sites which provide Job Seekers with information which specifically relates to finding a job in the Oil and Gas field, as opposed to career related information or resumes.

entries.title: Industry_Resources
entries.description: Information resources made available to the public on-line. Sites where commercial transactions are made should be in Marketplaces category.

entries.title: Information_Technology
entries.description: Information technology used in the oil and gas business. Includes both software and consultants for managing data.

entries.title: Marketplaces
entries.description: These sites are electronic market places. Typical sites list equipment and/or properties for sale. Many sites also have the characteristics of portals, including: a directory of operators and/or service companies, current industry statistics and news stories, e-mail mailboxes and employment opportunities. Also includes Application Service Providers.

entries.title: Equipment
entries.description: Sites that deal mainly with buying and selling new and used oilfield equipment.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This is for online news and print media such as magazines and publishers of technical books for the Oil and Gas industry.

entries.title: Offshore
entries.description: Offshore is focused on companies that concentrate on the offshore oil and gas industry. Many larger companies are normally listed in more general categories as they can not be listed twice in ODP.

entries.title: Operating_Companies
entries.description: This main category includes only VERTICALLY INTEGRATED COMPANIES that include divisions for exploration, production, refining and wholesale and/or retail sales. Most operating companies fall into the various subcategories.

entries.title: Exploration_and_Production
entries.description: Organizations whose primary business is the finding and production of oil and gas. These are the companies traditionally referred to as "Oil and Gas Operators". Vertically integrated oil companies, no matter how much production they have, go under the parent category "Operating Companies"

entries.title: Prospects_and_Investments
entries.description: The principal business of these organizations is the generation of prospects. A few of these organizations also operate exploration drilling and producing properties. This category also includes organizations that package prospective acreage and/or producing properties for investors as their principal business.

entries.title: Venture_Capital
entries.description: Provide financing for oil and gas exploration and production.

entries.title: Processing
entries.description: Companies which conduct refining and processing of oil and gas.

entries.title: Propane
entries.description: Businesses and business activities involving propane as a fuel or energy carrier.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Propane gas associations and trade groups engaged in support of the propane industry and association members.

entries.title: Service_Companies
entries.description: Service Companies for the Oil and Gas industry should be listed in the appropriate sub category, and not in the main category. Companies in the sub categories must provide either/or/and equipment, support, consultancy, information, staff and training and other services to oil and gas operating companies.

entries.title: Data_and_Software
entries.description: Many vendors of data also sell software and vice versa. This category includes vendors selling data only, software only and both data and software.

entries.title: Asset_Management
entries.description: Software to monitor and manage oil and gas operations, especially lease accounting software. May also include land management and collection of data collected automatically from remote sites. May include inventory and marketing software.

entries.title: Completion_and_Production
entries.description: Software that assists with production reporting/monitoring, production analysis, perforation, flow lines, flow potential, optimum completion parameters, etc.

entries.title: Drilling
entries.description: Engineering software that assists in planning the drilling process or in drilling the well. This includes real-time monitoring software for use while the well is being drilled.

entries.title: Geologic_and_Well_Log
entries.description: Vendors of digital well logs, formation tops and all other subsurface data that is not geophysical. Also includes software that is specifically designed to use these types of data.

entries.title: Geophysical
entries.description: Service companies that sell geophysical data. Many of these same companies also sell software to manipulate that data.

entries.title: Production_Records
entries.description: Service companies whose main business is the sale of data about current and historical oil and gas production.

entries.title: Completion_and_Workover
entries.description: Downhole services for completing a well, stimulating a well or working over a well. May involve drill pipe, wireling or coiled tubing.

entries.title: Construction
entries.description: Includes both oil field "dirt-moving" work such as construction of locations, mud pits, etc. Also includes construction of gas plants and other permanent field facilities.

entries.title: Drilling_Contractors
entries.description: Companies whose principal business is drilling oil and gas wells, including those who operate entirely offshore.

entries.title: Drilling_Fluid
entries.description: Includes both suppliers of drilling fluid additives and engineering firms that optimize drilling fluid properties.

entries.title: Equipment_Repair
entries.description: These companies repair engines, turbines, pumps, processing gear and other heavy equipment in the field. Many also have a shop where similar repairs are made.

entries.title: Fire_and_Safety
entries.description: Companies that put out oil field fires and control wells blowing wild. Also includes companies specializing in dealing with H2S and other hazardous substances. Includes firms specializing in safety training for field personnel.

entries.title: Logistics
entries.description: Includes a wide variety of organizations supporting drilling, construction and other oilfield work. Includes marine transportion firms, as well as firms providing temporary housing, food service, etc.

entries.title: Mud_Logging
entries.description: Companies that provide personnel and/or equipment to monitor and describe mud gas and lithology of cuttings during drilling operations. Also may provide other well site services such as supervision of coring operations.

entries.title: Pipeline_Related
entries.description: This subcategory is for sites offering pipeline related services.

entries.title: Chemical_Testing
entries.description: Testing, analysis and advisory services related to the chemistry of a fluid or material.

entries.title: Equipment_and_Materials
entries.description: Includes all maintenance, testing, inspection and analysis of equipment (including tubular goods) and materials used in equipment for their condition and capabilities.

entries.title: Downhole
entries.description: Companies that provide equipment that is used in wellbore below the casing head. Includes logging instruments, bridge plugs, drill bits, mud motors, etc.

entries.title: Fuel_Handling
entries.description: Equipment and controls used to handling fuel at service stations, airports and other fueling locations. Some organizations in the category also install and maintain this equipment.

entries.title: Instrumentation
entries.description: Companies that manufacture and/or install various types of instruments for all parts of the oil and gas business.

entries.title: Storage
entries.description: Sites about companies providing storage equipment should be submitted here.

entries.title: Supplies
entries.description: This category is for sites that have a selection of valves, wrenches, lubricants and all the other material that is commonly used in the oil industry and which do not have a specific category under Tools_and_Equipment.

entries.title: Renewable
entries.description: <p>Any energy source that is naturally replenishable, including wind, sun, geothermal, oceans and rivers, and biomass.<br />This category tree is for manufacturers, suppliers, distributors and service providers of renewable energy products.<br /> The category is divided into a number of specific sub-categories.</p>

entries.title: Biomass
entries.description: Renewable biomass is "biological" organic mass derived from living organisms. Keywords : wood, wood by-products, plants, plant residues, animal wastes, organic substrates.

entries.title: Biodiesel
entries.description: This category is for companies that provide services or goods for the production and distribution of biodiesel, an alternative to diesel fuel.

entries.title: Biogas
entries.description: Biogas typically consists of 60% methane and 40% carbon dioxide. It is produced during anaerobic digestion of organic matter - biomass - by organisms known as archaea. keywords : biogas, landfill gas, anaerobic digestion, archaea, biological biomass conversion.

entries.title: Ethanol
entries.description: This category is for companies that are involved with the production and/or distribution of ethanol fuel production. Ethanol is a clean-burning, high-octane fuel that is produced from renewable sources. At its most basic, ethanol is grain alcohol, produced from crops such as corn. Because it is domestically produced, ethanol helps reduce America's dependence upon foreign sources of energy. Pure, 100% ethanol is not generally used as a motor fuel; instead, a percentage of ethanol is combined with unleaded gasoline. This is beneficial because the ethanol: * decreases the fuel's cost * increases the fuel's octane rating * decreases gasoline's harmful emissions Any amount of ethanol can be combined with gasoline, but the most common blends are E10 (10%) and E85 (85%)

entries.title: Vegetable_Oil_Fuels
entries.description: This category is for companies providing products relating to the use of waste vegetable oil (WVO) or straight vegetable oil (SVO) as a fuel alternative to diesel.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Consultants only, no businesses.

entries.title: Electric
entries.description: Electricity generated by conversion of sunlight. Typically a solar electric system consists of photovoltaic panels made up of multiple cells, and inverters to convert from DC (from cells) to AC (for house). Can also (but does not always) incorporate batteries, controllers, trackers, and racks. This category is for manufacturers, suppliers, distributors and service providers of solar electric products.

entries.title: Components
entries.description: This category includes manufacturers, wholesale suppliers, and distributors of the component parts of a solar electric system. Typically it will include PV panels, inverters, controllers, batteries, trackers, and racks.

entries.title: Consumer_Items,_Gadgets_and_Toys
entries.description: This category includes manufacturers, wholesale distributors, and retailers of consumer PV items that generally are not used in systems, such as solar flashlights, small battery chargers, yard lights, and solar toys, gadgets, doodads, and other unclassified stuff.

entries.title: Photovoltaic_Panels
entries.description: A device used to convert light from the sun directly into DC electricity by using the photovoltaic effect. Usually made of multiple silicon solar cells bonded between glass and a backing material

entries.title: Water_Pumping
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, and service providers of pumps and pumping systems specifically or primarily designed for solar electric power systems. This category does not include wind only pumping systems (windmills), which are listed in <a href="/Business/Energy_and_Environment/Renewable/Wind/Pumps/">Business: Energy and Environment: Renewable: Wind: Pumps</a>.

entries.title: Thermal
entries.description: Includes all businesses concerned with solar heating and solar hot water. Also includes solar cooking apparatus.

entries.title: Wind
entries.description: For manufacturers, suppliers, distributors and those who service wind pump and wind turbine products such as windmills, which take power from the wind and convert it to forms in which it may be applied to specific tasks.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Some countries have professional wind energy associations. They provide a unique service to their country and unite wind energy enthusiasts all over the world.

entries.title: Pumps
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, and service providers of wind pumps, also known as windmills. Wind pumps usually are made from metal. This category includes sites regarding wind-only pumping systems. Products designed for pumping water in solar power systems are listed in <a href="/Business/Energy_and_Environment/Renewable/Solar/Electric/Water_Pumping/">Business: Energy and Environment: Renewable: Solar: Electric: Water Pumping</a>.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: Service providers for the wind energy industry.Typically installers, consultants, software systems, repair and testing services.

entries.title: Turbines
entries.description: Wind turbines used for generating electricity .

entries.title: Large
entries.description: Wind turbines used for generating electricity with an output of >50Kw .

entries.title: Small
entries.description: Wind turbines used for generating electricity with an output of <50Kw .

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Distributors of wind pump and wind turbine products.

entries.title: Wood
entries.description: This category is for companies engaged in the business of wood fuel products including firewood and wood pellets.

entries.title: Utilities
entries.description: <b>Utilities are direct distributors of energy to end use customers such as residential, industrial and commercial consumers of energy. </b><br><br> Telecommunication providers should list their sites in the appropriate category in <a href="/Business/Telecommunications/"> Telecommunications. <br><br> <p align=center> <table bgcolor="#ffffcc" cellpadding=6 border="0"> <tr><td> <small>Before submitting your site, please review the <a href="/Business/desc.html">Guidelines for Submitting a Site</a>.</small> </td></tr> </table> </p>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Non-government and governmental organizations and associations specializing in matters and information for and about the utility field, especially for: <UL> <LI>Electricity</LI> <LI>Natural Gas</LI> <LI>Water</LI> <LI>Propane Gas</LI> </UL>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Consultants specializing in the utility field, especially for: <UL> <LI>Electricity</LI> <LI>Natural Gas</LI> <LI>Water</LI> <LI>Propane Gas</LI> </UL>

entries.title: Cost_Management

entries.description: <p>The <b>Environment</b> sector covers distinct, but increasingly interdependent industries.  This category tree includes the following:</p><ul><li>Industries engaged in environmental protection, with products and services such as pollution control.</li><li>Industries developing and providing waste management, recycling operations, and convertion of waste to products for energy, such as incinerator pellets, to supply the <a href="/Business/Energy/Renewable/Biomass/">Biomass Energy Industry</a>.</li><li>Industries developing and providing safety equipment.</ul> <p>This category also includes information resources covering these industries, such as associations, reference resources, and news.</p>

entries.title: Environmental_Management_Systems_-_ISO_14000
entries.description: The topic of Environmental Management Systems has to do with the implementation of the ISO-14000 series of international standards. This is a series of voluntary standards on environmental management tools and systems developed and maintained by ISO, the International Organization for Standardization. The ISO 14000 series includes standards on environmental auditing, life cycle analysis, environmental performance evaluation, and more. The purpose of these standards is to incorporate environmental aspects into the operations and product standards of industries and other organizations. Often, when people refer to ISO 14000, they are actually referring to one standard in the series: ISO 14001. Environmental Management Systems should not be confused with systems for managing environmental data.

entries.title: ISO_19011
entries.description: The auditing standard for Environmental Management Systems. Replaces ISO 14010, ISO 14011 and ISO 14012.

entries.title: Vibration

More often, vibration is undesirable, wasting energy and creating unwanted sound or noise.<br> This category is for companies offering products and services to reduce vibration and noise.

entries.title: Credit_Unions
entries.description: Credit unions are non-profit, cooperative financial institutions, owned and operated by the members. There are over 10,000 credit unions in the United States, with many more in other countries. Most credit unions are local, serving members in a specific geographic area, or serving the employees of a single company. Some have become national or international, growing either through mergers, expansions or simply by serving a member group that is global. This category's goal is to list all online credit unions, with a description that indicates where the credit union operates and who may join.

entries.title: Cash_Flow
entries.description: Cash Flow is the buying, selling and brokering of privately held income streams in the secondary market. An income stream can be any future payment including real estate notes, business accounts receivables, viaticals or senior settlements, structured settlements or prize winnings. Investors purchase all or part of an income stream from sellers at a discount rate. The seller receives immediate cash for an asset that may not mature for many months or years and the investor receives a good return on their investment over time. Often a seller will deal with a cash flow broker who has a network of contacts to find the appropriate investor for the seller's asset. Brokers offer expertise and experience with specific income streams and may save the seller the time and research required to find and select an investor. Brokers earn a commission on each transaction they close which is paid either directly by the investor or as a percentage of the funds to be received by the seller.

entries.title: Annuities
entries.description: This category is for companies and brokers involved in the purchase of guaranteed income streams such as annuities, lottery winnings, casino winnings, structured settlements, and sports contracts.

entries.title: Factoring
entries.description: Factoring is the purchase of accounts receivables from a business for a fee. The company selling their accounts receivables receives a portion of the invoiced total without waiting the typical 30 to 90 day period for payment and the factor (investor) receives a return on their investment when the invoices are paid. Most Factoring companies look at the creditworthiness of a company's customers rather than at the creditworthiness of the company itself. This makes factoring a viable alternative to a line of credit from a bank for startup businesses, high risk businesses and others with a poor or non-existent credit history.

entries.title: Brokers
entries.description: Factoring is the purchase of accounts receivables from a business for a fee. The company selling their accounts receivables receives a portion of the invoiced total without waiting the typical 30 to 90 day period for payment and the factor (investor) receives a return on their investment when the invoices are paid. This category lists sites for factoring brokerages.

Viatical Settlements are offered as an option to terminally ill policyholders. Senior Settlements are offered as an option to mature yet basically healthy policyholders. In some nations of the British Commonwealth, endowment policies are also traded.

Skiptracing firms perform this process for a variety of clients such as creditors, insurance companies, and government entities and a variety of reasons including debt collection, bounty hunting, and witness locating. The term "skiptrace" is not usually used for general searches for adoptees or birth parents, missing loved ones, or lost friends.

entries.title: Recruiters

They research, source, interview and recommend candidates to their clients. The goal of this categories is to provide as complete and accurate a listing of Recruiters as possible. <P></P> Executive Recruiters are not employment agencies. Executive recruiters find people for jobs. Recruiters fees are paid by their clients. They do not charge their candidates. <P></P> <B>Submission Notes:</B> <P></P> List here Executive Recruiters specializing in Accounting and Finance positions.

entries.title: Field_Service_Companies
entries.description: Segments of the field services industry include inspections (residential mortgage, insurance & commercial), property preservation, notary signing tasks, and mystery shopping. Property preservation involves securing and maintenance of vacant foreclosure properties. This may include lock changes, winterization, debris removal, lawn maintenance, boarding of doors and windows, removal of health and hazardous materials, snow removal, etc. Inspections may include appraisals, occupancy verification, delinquency interviews, insurance loss inspections, construction progress reports, and related services on behalf of lenders. -- From http://www.sofi-usa.com/id18.htm

Individuals must pass an exam devised by the CFP Board and continue to meet its practice standards reequirements.

entries.title: Debt_Consolidation
entries.description: Debt Consolidation is a technique by which a consumer lumps all of their debt together in an effort to obtain lower payments through lower interest rates, reduced/eliminated late fees, and perhaps longer terms. There are basically two types of debt consolidation services: 1) A loan taken out by the debtor to cover all of their outstanding debts. The debtor uses the loan to pay off all of their outstanding debts and then just has to deal with making the one loan payment. 2) A debt consolidation service provider which will negotiate with a debtor's creditors and obtain the most favorable terms possible. The debtor makes a monthly payment to the service provider who then makes payments to the debtor's creditors in an agreed upon apportionment. There are pros and cons to each type and the consumer is encouraged to use the links in this category in determining what is best for them.

entries.description: The category Business/Financial Services/Information Services is designed for companies specialising in the provision and manipulation of information relevant to the Financial Services industry. This includes the following categories of information : i) Current and historic price data for financial assets ii) Current and historic news feeds on financial matters iii) Forecast and historic company fundamental data (earnings, balance sheet, background) iv) Forecast and historic macroeconomic fundamental data (GDP, trade, inflation) v) Corporate debt and equity valuation analysis vi) Personal and corporate credit analysis and information vii) Financial services market research data If you have any comments or suggestions on the content and aims of this category, please e-mail the editor(s).

entries.title: Actuarial_Science
entries.description: This category is for any site related to actuarial science and the actuarial profession, members of whom are called actuaries. What is an actuary? Consider the following description from BeAnActuary.com: "Actuaries put a price tag on future risks. They have been called financial architects and social mathematicians because their unique combination of analytical and business skills is helping to solve a growing variety of financial and social problems. Actuaries make financial sense of the future. How? An actuary applies mathematical models to problems of insurance and finance. To be more specific, actuaries improve financial decision making by developing models to evaluate the current financial implications of uncertain future events. If youve never met an actuary, thats not unusual. The actuarial profession numbers only about 19,000 people in North America. But don't let that small number fool you. Actuaries put their special problem-solving skills to work in many different business situations, and their work has had an influence on peoples lives for more than a century. Actuaries make a difference. Their calculations and projections are the backbone of the insurance and financial security industries. Actuarial work involves lots of math, but actuaries must also be up-to-date on business issues and trends, social science, law, and economics. In other words, actuaries have a well-rounded business approach to problem solving. And they must be good communicators to explain things to nonactuaries. Actuaries are key players on a company's management team. They are well paid, and they like what they do for a living."

entries.title: Academic_Departments
entries.description: Although actuarial science is closely identified with the business community, many universities offer actuarial science as an academic discipline. This category lists actuarial science departments with their own web presences. It is offered primarily to the prospective student with an interest in pursuing an actuarial education in a university setting.

Clubs are to be distinguished from professional organizations in that clubs provide primarily social and networking opportunities, while professional organizations primarily set standards, approve credentials, and/or influence public policy. Professional organizations may also provide social and networking opportunities.

Websites of organizations that are <i>primarily</i> designed for social and networking opportunities are listed in the Clubs subdirectory of Actuarial Science.

entries.description: Category is for web sites of insurance agents and marketers offering individual or group health insurance that is qualified under IRS Regs for health savings accounts. A health savings account (HSA) is a combination of a high deductible health insurance policy and a tax-sheltered savings account that is used to pay qualified health expenses. A qualified health insurance policy is a prerequisite to opening and maintaining a health savings account at a financial institution.
