entries.description: Category is for insurance agents and marketers web sites which offer home insurance only.

entries.title: Earthquake
entries.description: Category is for insurance agents and marketers web sites in the United States which offer earthquake insurance only.

entries.title: Flood
entries.description: Category is for insurance agents and marketers web sites in the United States which offer flood insurance only.

entries.title: Life
entries.description: Category is for insurance agents and marketers web sites which offer life insurance only.

entries.title: Marine
entries.description: Category is for insurance agents and marketers web sites which offer recreational vehicle and watercraft insurance only.

entries.title: Multi-Line
entries.description: Category is for insurance agents and marketers web sites which offer multiple lines of insurance.

entries.title: Specialty
entries.description: Category is for insurance agents and marketers web sites which offer specialty insurance only.

entries.title: Equine
entries.description: Equine (Horse) insurance.

entries.title: Sports_and_Leisure
entries.description: Category is for insurance agents and marketers web sites which offer sports and leisure insurance only.

entries.title: Travel
entries.description: Travel insurance includes medical insurance or life insurance while traveling abroad, as well as trip specific products, such as cancellation insurance.

entries.title: Agent_Resources
entries.description: Lists sites offering services to agents and brokers.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Lists firms which provide consulting services to agents, brokers, and agencies.

entries.title: Lead_Generating_Services
entries.description: In this category, insurance agents can find resources for insurance leads. Lead generating resources can be valuable to agents looking for auto(car), home, life, home, health, and business insurance leads.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: This category offers links to tools, strategies, and other sites which assist independent agents, brokers, and agencies with their marketing efforts.

entries.title: Premium_Financing
entries.description: Lists financial companies offering premium finance services.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for not-for-profit insurance association or organization which has a state, provincial, national, or international scope.

entries.title: Carriers
entries.description: This category is for insurance carriers (actual insurance companies, not third party administrators, brokers or agents). Please submit reinsurance companies to the <a href="/Business/Financial_Services/Insurance/Reinsurance/Carriers/">Reinsurance/Carriers</a> category. Please submit third party administrators to the <a href="/Business/Financial_Services/Insurance/Consulting/Third_Party_Administrators/">Third Party Administrators</a> category. Please submit agents, brokers, or online quotes sites to the proper subcategory of <a href="/Business/Financial_Services/Insurance/Agents_and_Marketers/">Agents and Marketers</a>.

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: Insurance sold to businesses or to meet the needs of a specific profession is commercial in nature. It does not include employee health plans, employee life insurance, or other types of insurance generally available to individuals. It does include insurance for needs such as professional liability, bulk cargo, workers' compensation, and industrial risk.

entries.title: Workers'_Compensation
entries.description: Carriers who specialize in workers' compensation insurance.

entries.title: Farm_Bureau
entries.description: Farm Bureaus are not-for-profit organizations in each state which were established to help farmers in various ways. One benefit is insurance.

entries.title: Life_and_Health
entries.description: This category is for carriers or financial service companies offering products that insure people. It includes insurance for life, health, long term care, disability, and any other type for people rather than property.

entries.title: Pension
entries.description: This category is for insurance companies which primarily exist to provide retirement-related products, including pensions, annuities, 401k's, IRA's, endowments, superannuation, and other such products. The company usually also offers life insurance, but not as a major product.

entries.title: Property_and_Casualty
entries.description: Category is for insurance company web sites that offer property and casualty (P&C) insurance only. This includes Home, Automobile, Property, Flood, Earthquake, and almost any other kind of insurance not involving life and health.

entries.title: Claims
entries.description: This category is for insurance claims professionals such as adjusters, assessors, appraisers, examiners, and investigators. Adjusters, assessors, and examiners are similar. They do the routine work of processing insurance claims. In the UK, <i>assessor</i> is more common; in the USA, <i>adjuster</i>. Insurance <i>examiners</i> typically are associated with life/health carriers, and adjusters with property/casualty. <i>Appraisers</i> are expert in determining the value of insured items. They also determine the actual amount of damage, such as the loss a car received in an accident. <i>Investigators</i> are detectives who research hard cases, as when fraud might be suspected. <i>Surveyors</i> are combination appraisers and adjusters, usually associated with marine claims.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Contains not-for-profit associations of claims professionals.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category is for consulting firms which serve adjusters and assessors, not for the adjusters and assessors themselves. Also included are firms which work for insurers and third party administrators in establishing or improving the claims process in general, as opposed to firms which actually process claims.

entries.title: Insurance_Industry_Support
entries.description: Indepenedent adjusters and certain other claims-related services are paid by inurers. They serve the interests of the insurance company; however they are ethically bound to principles of honesty.

entries.title: Legal_Services
entries.description: Provides access to categories focusing on the legal aspects of insurance claims.

entries.title: Subrogation
entries.description: Lists firms which specialize in subrogation. When an insurance company pays a damage or property claim, it meets its obligations under the contract. However, if the loss was caused by negligence or intent of a third party, the insurance company has the right to collect its loss from the party at fault. Subrogation firms help them do so.

entries.title: Public
entries.description: Public adjusters and certain other insurance claim-related services are paid by claimants, not insurers. They serve the interests of claimants, mostly policy holders (1st party as opposed to 3rd party claimants); however they are ethically bound to principles of honesty, just as insurers are. In most states, public adjusters must be licensed separately from insurers' adjusters and their contracts and advertising must state "We Represent the Insured only". A typical legal definition for a public adjuster is "an adjuster who, for compensation, acts on behalf of or aids in any manner, an insured in negotiating for or effecting the settlement of a claim or claims for loss or damage under any policy of insurance covering real or personal property." Public adjusters fees are usually a "percentage of the settlement", unlike insurers' adjusters, who work on an hourly or salary basis.

entries.title: Replacement_Services
entries.description: Lists sites which offer property replacement services, including validation, appraisal, and/or salvage.

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: Provides access to commercial insurance topics. Some commercial information will be left out of this view, as when a carrier offers both commercial and property/casualty insurance types.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category includes associations and organizations which are primarily concerned with the commercial insurance such as liability, worker's comp, or business.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Lists consulting firms specializing in commercial insurance.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category is for consulting firms that provide support services to the insurance industry. All agency, brokerage, and marketing sites that market to consumers should be submitted to the appropriate sub-category of <a href="/Business/Financial_Services/Insurance/Agents_and_Marketers/">Agents and Marketers</a>

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for web sites that are a directory of insurance CARRIERS, direct links or mailing addresses leading to insurance companies which are not on the web.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Companies providing methods to train all types of insurance industry personnel.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Category is for sites devoted to the employment of people in the insurance industry only. For sites devoted to the general employment of several occupations, please go to Business/Employment.

entries.title: Recruitment_and_Staffing
entries.description: This category is for sites that are about the recruitment of insurance professionals. For sites which operate for job recruiting in several occupations please see Business/Employment/Recruiters.

entries.title: Financial_Guaranty
entries.description: This category contains sites related to financial guaranty insurance. This specialized niche of the insurance business exists in order to enhance the credit quality of financial instruments, such as municipal bonds. Financial guaranty insurance typically involves three parties: the investor, the issuer, and the insurer. The issuer pays a premium to the insurer for issuing a financial guaranty policy for the benefit of the investor. In the event that the issuer defaults on its obligations, the insurer guarantees full and timely payment of principal and interest to the investor.

entries.title: Carriers
entries.description: This category contains sites of carriers of financial guaranty insurance.

entries.title: Holding_Companies
entries.description: Insurance holding companies are not necessarily carriers. They <b>own</b> carriers and possibly branded marketing organizations. The holding company itself is really in the business of <i>ownership</i>, not <i>insurance</i>.

entries.title: Life_and_Health

translations.tha: ชีวิตและสุขภาพ

entries.description: Provides access to life and health insurance topics. Some information will be left out of this view, as when a carrier offers both life/health and property/casualty insurance types.

entries.title: Agents_and_Marketers
entries.description: Contains sites of agents, brokers, agencies, and others who market life and/or health insurance to end customers.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category includes associations and organizations which are primarily concerned with the life and health insurance industry.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Lists consulting firms specializing in life and/or health insurance.

entries.title: Life_and_Health_Consulting_Guides_and_Information
entries.description: Guides from consultants and experts in the field providing health and life insurance information to help the public better make better decisions when it comes to their insurance needs

entries.title: Consumer_Information
entries.description: Provides access to categories offering consumer information on various forms of life and health insurance.

entries.title: Managed_Care
entries.description: This category is for managed care organizations, including health maintenance organizations (HMOs), preferred provider organizations (PPOs), and other managed care arrangements.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for non-profit organizations, societies, and associations of professionals and firms working with the managed care industry.

entries.title: Health_Maintenance_Organizations_[HMO]
entries.description: A form of health insurance combining a range of coverages, usually on a group basis. Doctors and other medical professionals offer care through the HMO for a flat monthly rate. With a PPO, care is paid for as it is received.

entries.title: Preferred_Provider_Organizations_[PPO]
entries.description: A health care organization composed of physicians, hospitals, and other providers. It provides services at a reduced fee. With a PPO, care is paid for as it is received. An HMO is paid in advance as a scheduled fee.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: This category lists sites offering information <i>about</i> the managed care industry.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Insurance business magazines and E-zines that help companies and their representatives obtain more professional results, in the home, office, and field.

entries.title: Magazines_and_E-zines
entries.description: Offers web sites for English-language insurance related publications throughout the world.

entries.title: Reporting_and_Regulatory_Journals
entries.description: A category specifically listing the regulatory and reporting journals on the web.

entries.title: Property_and_Casualty

translations.tha: ทรัพย์สินและอุบัติเหตุ

entries.description: Provides access to property and casualty insurance topics. Some information will be left out of this view, as when a carrier offers both property/casualty and life/health insurance types.

entries.title: Agents_and_Marketers
entries.description: Contains sites of agents, brokers, agencies, and others who market property and casualty insurance to individuals. Some may also market to businesses.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category includes associations and organizations which are primarily concerned with the property and casualty insurance industry.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Lists consulting firms specializing in property and casualty insurance.

entries.title: Consumer_Information
entries.description: Provides access to categories offering consumer information on various forms of property and casualty insurance.

entries.title: Reinsurance
entries.description: Reinsurance is the transfer of some or all of an insurance risk to another insurer. The company transferring the risk is called the "ceding company"; the company receiving the risk is called the "assuming company" or "reinsurer."

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: reinsurance associations and organizations

entries.title: Brokers
entries.description: brokerage and intermediary firms for reinsurance

entries.title: Carriers
entries.description: reinsurance companies

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: reinsurance consulting companies

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: encompasses reinsurance newspapers and magazines

entries.title: Risk_Management
entries.description: Risk management consultants analyze a company's business practices and determine what different risk treatments are needed to protect the company from losses.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for non-profit associations relating to risk management and insurance.

entries.title: Captives
entries.description: Captive insurance is somewhat like a self-owned insurance company. It is established as part of a complex risk management strategy in the long-term hope of saving money. However, the company establishing a captive gains responsibility for accounting and reserves that it would not worry about if it had purchased insurance commercially. Captive schemes typically involve reinsurance. For example, the company may accept a million dollars in risk annually, but pay a reinsurer to cover losses beyond that point.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for non-profit captive insurance associations.

entries.title: Insurers
entries.description: Some captives are owned by organizations, inter-government entities, and groups of companies. They provide insurance to members in much the same way that traditional carriers would, except with a much more hands-on approach in efforts to reduce risk.

entries.title: Pools
entries.description: Public and non-profit entities will sometimes establish risk pools as an alternative to purchasing commercial insurance. Another kind of pool is when a state or a province mandates that insurers will offer a certain kind of insurance, such as to high-risk drivers.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Contains sites which provide considerable informational content concerning risk management topics.

entries.title: Third_Party_Administrators
entries.description: Firms which administer claims handling and other services for insurance carriers and self-funded plans.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category is for insurance wholesalers who market to and service "retail" agents and brokers or even other wholesalers. Listings include sites of general agents (GA), managing general agents (MGA), underwriters, and insurance consortia (e.g. Lloyd's syndicates).

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for non-profit associations of insurance wholesalers.

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: Lists sites for wholesalers of commercial insurance.

entries.title: Excess_and_Surplus
entries.description: Excess and surplus (or "surplus lines") insurance covers hard to place risks which are not written by the standard markets. There are three categories: <p><b>Non-standard risks</b> - have unusual underwriting characteristics <br><b>Unique risks</b> - admitted carriers do not offer a filed form or rate <br><b>Capacity risks</b> - client seeks an abnormally high level of coverage <p> (summarized from a description at the <a href="http://www.napslo.org/">NAPSLO</a> site) In the United Kingdom and possibly other countries, the word <b>bespoke</b> is used to denote such tailored insurance products.

entries.title: Life_and_Health
entries.description: Contains sites for wholesalers of life and/or health insurance.

entries.title: Property_and_Casualty
entries.description: Sites of property and casualty insurance wholesalers.

entries.title: Syndicates
entries.description: Syndicates are organized groups of individuals or companies who commit resources in order to provide the reserves necessary to offer insurance. Lloyd's of London employs many syndicates to back the insurance offered in its name. This category is not limited to Lloyd's syndicates, however.

entries.title: Workers'_Compensation
entries.description: Workers' compensation describes the "no fault" system providing medical treatment and rehabilitation for injured workers. A number of nations require that employers offer this insurance, and it is available through self-insurance, commercial and mutual carriers, and sometimes pools or group captives. In the USA and Canada, and likely other nations, different agencies regulate workers' compensation insurance than most other types.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Lists non-profit and trade associations, organizations, or societies.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Insurance consultants who specialize in the field of workers' compensation.

entries.title: Investment_Banks
entries.description: Investment Banks advise and process financial transactions for businesses and investors. Through Sales and trading, Research, and Corporate Finance, Investment Banks are the matchmakers between companies that need capital and investors. Typical Investment Bank transactions are IPOs, M&A advisory, Debt and Equity Underwriting, Merchant Banking Services, brokerage operations, Research, and Asset Management.

entries.title: Middle_Market
entries.description: These Middle Market Investment Banks provide Investment Banking services to smaller emerging growth or regional companies.

entries.title: Reverse_Mergers
entries.description: A "reverse merger" is a method by which a Private Company or an unincorporated business goes public. In a reverse merger, a Private Company merges with an existing Public Company with no assets or liabilities. By merging into such an entity, a Private Company becomes public. The Private Company obtains the majority of the Public Company's stock, will normally change the name of the Public Company (often to its own name), and will appoint and elect its management and Board of Directors.

entries.title: Investment_Services
entries.description: This category covers investment services that cater to businesses including asset and investment management, 401(K) and pension plan management, capital raising and financing services, and financial advisory services.

entries.title: Leasing_Services

translations.tha: บริการเช่าซื้อ

entries.description: Contains listings of companies providing lease financing services to businesses, organizations, individuals and/or government-owned entities.

entries.title: Automotive
entries.description: This category contains sites that offer consumers DIRECT assistance in researching, finding and acquiring vehicle leases.

entries.title: Loans
entries.description: This category contains listings of businesses that primarily offer loans to consumers.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: This category lists marketing sites targeted to financial services businesses only.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Resources specifically for people who run a medical billing service.

entries.title: Merchant_Services
entries.description: Credit card merchant services are provided to businesses by processors through registered ISO/MSP organizations and their registered sales agents who represent financial institutions that are members of one of the two bank card associations (VISA, USA or MasterCard International), or, travel and entertainment card companies such as American Express, Citicorp Diners Club, or, Carte Blanche. This category is for the primary processing companies that sponsor the ISO/MSP and their agents.

entries.title: Card_Processing
entries.description: ISO/MSP registered companies with their sponsoring member institutions, that provide credit card processing services to merchants.

entries.title: Check_Processing
entries.description: Please only submit sites that deal with check processing services such as check collection, online check processing or electronic check conversion. Software that aids in these services may also submit their sites here.

entries.title: Guides_and_Directories
entries.description: Review advice and guides for selecting and establishing a merchant account, and directories of credit card processing companies.

entries.title: Other_Payment_Systems
entries.description: This category is for listings that are directly related to payment systems (like accepting credit cards) that are conducted entirely on the Internet.

entries.title: Mortgages
entries.description: Very very few sites will be listed at this level, mainly a few unclassifiable sites or else sites _about_ the mortgage business. <p> <b>Please submit your site to the appropriate subcategory</b> <p> Sites with a United States-only focus should go to Business/Financial_Services/Mortgages/Regional/United_States or one of its state subcategories

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: <p>The <b>Mortgage Associations</b> category includes sites for global or national mortgage associations that aim to inform, support, and promote the mortgage profession.</p> <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>Associations with a narrow geographic focus</b> are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town which they cover.</li> <li><b>Associations with related professional focus</b> such as <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/">Business: Real Estate</a> are listed in categories according to that focus.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Calculators
entries.description: This category lists web sites that have online mortgage calculators. These calculators help consumers make home financing decisions.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category houses the following types of site : 1. Mortgage directories and lists 2. Interest rate pages This site is not for individual bankers, brokers or lenders. Please use the guide below to properly list your site if you don't belong here. Business: Financial Services: Mortgages: Mortgage Banking Mortgage Bankers Business: Financial Services: Mortgages: United States Mortgage services and companies that are offered for at least several states. Business: Financial Services: Mortgages: United States: (individual state) Firms applicable to their home state only.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: Includes links to sites offering advertising services in print, broadcast, interactive, or other media that are geared specifically towards the mortgage industry.

entries.title: Mortgage_Banking
entries.description: Mortgage banking is making, selling and servicing mortgages secured by residential or commercial (i.e. income-producing) real estate. Mortgage bankers serve as middlemen, arranging and making loans using short-term funding, and then selling these loans to other lenders and investors, both within the U.S. secondary market and abroad. The buyers of mortgages include private conduits, commercial banks, thrifts, life insurance companies, pension funds, and, most significantly, the secondary market agencies -- Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac and Ginnie Mae -- through various securitization programs. Though some mortgage banking companies may be subsidiaries of depository institutions or their holding companies, mortgage companies themselves do not receive money from individual depositors. <p> Mortgage bankers are the primary suppliers of loans to the secondary market through programs administered by Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac and Ginnie Mae. Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac purchase primarily conventional mortgage loans, while Ginnie Mae is involved with government loans exclusively. All three agencies were created with a mission to provide liquidity to the mortgage market and affordable housing to homebuyers and renters. They currently channel approximately two-thirds of total home mortgage credit and, working with their mortgage banker partners, they have reduced the interest rate cost of credit by as much as 1/2 percent, according to housing experts. <p> Mortgage bankers also make use of a number of federal and state government programs to provide more affordable housing credit. For example, the U.S. Federal Housing Administration (FHA) provides mortgage insurance for residential mortgages. Over the course of its over 60-year history, FHA has insured home loans for some 20 million Americans. The U.S. Department of Veterans' Affairs (VA) administers the VA Home Loan Guaranty program which enables mortgage lenders to offer long-term, low-downpayment mortgage financing to eligible veterans. Mortgage bankers have long been the primary originators of FHA and VA loans. In addition, through a wide variety of state programs, mortgage bankers are the delivery vehicle for providing low interest rate financing to moderate-income homebuyers. <p> Mortgage bankers, in conjunction with their lending partners, serve a critical need in the United States. They make homeownership possible for tens of millions of Americans. They also help to build communities by providing financing for places where people can work and shop and play. And, they create important investment opportunities for the world's capital markets. <p> [The above quote is taken from the Mortgage Bankers Association of America website at http://www.mbaa.org/about/mission.html ]

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: <p>The <b>Mortgage News and Media</b> category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, books, magazines and e-zines, and journals which deal exclusively with the mortgage industry.

entries.title: Processing
entries.description: sites that market the Loan production and management software for lenders.

entries.title: Banks
entries.description: Chartered banks with offshore services.

entries.title: Trust_Formation
entries.description: Companies that specialize primarily in forming offshore trusts.

entries.title: Bail_Bonds
entries.description: The law states that people are entitled to bail, while awaiting trial. Bail is an amount of money that the court wants to hold on to, guarenteeing that the defendent goes to court. If the defendent goes to court the money is returned, if not, the money is forfeited and the court keeps the money. If someone doesn't have the money they can purchase a Bail Bond, and use equity in property to secure the bond. The fee for purchasing a bond is usually regulated by a state agency such as the department of insurance, so the price typically doesn't fluctuate from company to company. The main difference between agencies is the service they will provide you.

entries.title: Venture_Capital

translations.jpn: ベンチャーキャピタル

entries.description: Listed directly in this category are professional venture capital firms that raise fund(s) from investors and then identify, screen, select and invest directly in entrepreneurial business ventures that are typically in their early stages. Venture capital affiliates of corporations are also listed. The subcategory Entrepreneurial Resources and its subcategories list many other sites potentially useful to entrepreneurs, including other forms of access to capital, e.g. angel investors.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for nonprofit, educational and trade associations that inform, enable and support the development and maintenance of the Venture Capital Industry.

entries.title: Capital_Access_-_Financing
entries.description: Sites primarily focused on capital access and financing for startups and young companies (See venture capital category for institutional venture capitalists)

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: Conferences of Interest to Entrepreneurs & VC's

entries.title: Seed
entries.description: Seed stage venture capitalists specialize in providing an entrepreneur or small entrepreneurial start-up company with an initial amount of capital. This capital is normally used to prototype a product or concept.

entries.title: Industry_Focus
entries.description: Industry focus venture capitalists specialize in providing investments to start-up or early-stage companies in major industries without regard for the exact location of a company. The industry focus may be, for example, retail, Internet, or life sciences.

translations.jpn: ベンチャーキャピタル

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Includes newspapers, magazines and e-zines, and other media sites which cover the venture capital industry as a whole.

entries.title: World_War_II_Dormant_Accounts
entries.description: There are many dormant bank accounts and insurance contracts dating from World War II or soon before. This category lists those official organisations (often a government or perhaps affiliated to a financial trade association) that facilitate the claiming of accounts by survivors or their heirs.

entries.title: Food_and_Related_Products

translations.tha: ผลิตภัณฑ์อาหารและเครื่องดื่ม

entries.description: <p>The <b>Food and Related Products</b> sector category includes industries and companies engaged in transforming livestock and agricultural products into products for intermediate or final consumption. Also included are manufacturers and distributors of processing supplies and equipment, wholesalers, and services supporting industries in this sector, which include consulting, employment, marketing, associations, etc. Professional and industrial resources are also included.<br> <b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b> <ul> <li><b>Local retailers</b> (bakeries, for example) which serve a very limited geographic area are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> category according to the city or town where they are located. <li><b>Retailers providing online shopping</b> are listed in <a href="/Shopping/Food/">Shopping: Food</a>.</li> <li>Sites dealing with food and beverages as a <b>recreational interest</b> (history, humor, facts, etc.) are listed in <a href="/Recreation/Food/">Recreation: Food</a>.</li> <li><b>Cooking and recipe</b> sites are listed in <a href="/Home/Cooking/">Home: Cooking</a>.</li> <li><b>Scientific, research and technical</b> sites covering food science are listed in <a href="/Science/Technology/Food_Science/">Science: Technology: Food Science</a>.</li> <li>Sites covering <b>human nutrition and dietary aspects</b> of food are listed in <a href="/Health/Nutrition/">Health: Nutrition</a>.</li> <li>Industries engaged in <b>growing crops and raising livestock</b> are listed under <a href="/Business/Agriculture_and_Forestry/">Business: Agriculture and Forestry</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Trade associations, guilds, federations providing food industry information. <A HREF="/Society/Organizations/Professional/"> Society/Organizations/Professional <A> is the category for trade unions and workers' affiliations.

entries.title: American_Culinary_Federation
entries.description: The American Culinary Federation (ACF) is comprised of more than 300 individual chapters with over 25,000 members throughout the United States.

entries.title: Beverages
entries.description: Here you will find sites for and about the beverage industry. Producers, bottlers, suppliers to the industry and business resource sites, for example.

entries.title: Beer
entries.description: Sites that concern themselves mainly with and serve the brewing industry; supplies and equipment, wholesalers, and trade associations, for example.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Trade associations, guilds, and federations representing the beer industry.

entries.title: Hops
entries.description: Hops are a flower crop added to beer to add bitterness and flavor. Hops also act as a natural preservative.

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: This is the category for all beer import and export related service companies, including agents, traders, consultants, web sites, trade portals and other intermediaries.

entries.title: Malt
entries.description: Malt is grain, usually barley, that is allowed to partially germinate to convert its starches into sugars. It is these sugars that the yeast feeds on to produce alcohol. Malt also imparts the majority of flavor to the beer. Malt extract is malt that has been mixed with water, cooked, then boiled down into a syrup or even into a dried form.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for companies and resources focused on the "hardware" of commercial beer production and consumption. Such items include, but are not limited to: brewing equipment, bottling, dispensing systems, cleaning equipment specifically for brewing tanks, and so on.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category consists of companies that purchase products from Producers and Manufacturers in bulk and resell it without transformation to re-sellers. The Wholesalers and Distributors listed in this category are primarily focused on beer. Companies that provide services to these Wholesalers and Distributors will also be listed here. This category will not list Manufacturers' Representatives or Retailers.

entries.title: Coffee
entries.description: Sites that concern themselves mainly with and serve the coffee industry; roasters, supplies and equipment, wholesalers, and trade associations, for example.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Organizations representing growers, marketers, processors, and others involved in the international coffee industry.

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: Sites of coffee import and export, and related, companies. Includes agents, traders, consultants, trade portals, and other intermediaries.

entries.title: Import_and_Export

entries.title: Atmospheric_Water_Generators
entries.description: An atmospheric water generator produces pure water by condensing water vapor from the surrounding air, operating very similarly to a dehumidifier. They are often marketed as solutions for areas where water is scarce or contaminated.

A condiment is a substance, such as a relish, vinegar, or spice, used to flavor or complement food. Seasoning (also called seasoner) is something, such as a spice or herb, used to flavor food.

entries.description: <p>The <b>Tortillas</b> category includes manufacturers and distributors of tortillas and related food items.<br> <b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b> <ul> <li><b>Local retailers</b> which serve a very limited geographic area are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> category according to the city or town where they are located. <li><b>Retailers providing online shopping</b> are listed in <a href="/Shopping/Food/">Shopping: Food</a>.</li> <li>Sites dealing with food and beverages as a <b>recreational interest</b> (history, humor, facts, etc.) are listed in <a href="/Recreation/Food/">Recreation: Food</a>.</li> <li><b>Cooking and recipe</b> sites are listed in <a href="/Home/Cooking/">Home: Cooking</a>.</li> <li><b>Scientific, research and technical</b> sites covering food science are listed in <a href="/Science/Technology/Food_Science/">Science: Technology: Food Science</a>.</li> <li>Sites covering <b>human nutrition and dietary aspects</b> of food are listed in <a href="/Health/Nutrition/">Health: Nutrition</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Disability
entries.description: Find here web sites offering Assistive Technology products and services to the healthcare industry. <br><br> What is Assistive Technology? <ul> <li>Assistive or Adaptive Technology (AT) commonly refers to products, devices or equipment, whether acquired commercially, modified or customized, that are used to maintain, increase or improve the functional capacities of individuals with disabilities.</li> <li>Assistive Technology products can assist people with disabilities with daily living tasks, communication, education, work, and recreation, and help them achieve independence or improve the quality of their life. For example, Assistive Technology devices can help prevent the worsening of a condition, help improve physical functioning, strengthen a physical or other weakness, help improve a person's capacity to learn, or replace a missing limb.</li> <li>Assistive Technology services support people with disabilities or their caregivers to help them select, acquire, or use adaptive devices. Such services also include functional evaluations, training on or demonstration of devices, and purchasing or leasing devices. </li> </ul>

entries.title: Communication_Aids
entries.description: Products and equipment designed to help persons with speech disabilities or writing difficulties to communicate. At its very simplest, augmentative communication can be a page with picture choices or alphabet letters that a person points to. It can also involve highly sophisticated speaking computers with on-screen communication boards and auditory or visual scanning.

entries.title: Computer_Access_Aids
entries.description: Hardware and software products that enables persons with disabilities to access, interact with, and use computers at home, work or school. Includes modified or alternate keyboards, switches activated by pressure, touch screens, special software, voice to text software, etc.

entries.title: Daily_Living_Aids
entries.description: Self-help devices that assist persons with disabilities in daily living activities such as dressing, personal hygiene, bathing, home maintenance, cooking, eating, etc. Includes reachers, adaptive clothing, modified eating utensils, adapted books, pencil holders, dressing aids, adapted personal hygiene aids, bathing accessories, feeding accessories, feeding devices, grab bars/grips/handles, grooming, hygiene, incontinent supplies, mechanical transfer lift, shower/bath chair, toileting accessories, transfer board, wheeled bath chair/commode, time management aids, specialized spoons for self-feeding, bathtub seats, etc.

entries.title: Durable_Medical_Equipment
entries.description: Sales, rental, manufacturing of durable medical equipment. Includes services such as training in the use of durable medical equipment.

entries.title: Environmental_Controls
entries.description: Primarily electronic systems that enable someone with limited mobility to control various appliances, lights, telephone and security systems in their room, home or other surroundings. Includes Environmental Control Units (ECU), electronic appliance switches, switch mounting systems, home automation systems, signaling and alerting devices, home alarms, television adaptations, smoke alarm and telephone ringers

entries.title: Hearing_and_Listening_Aids
entries.description: Products designed to assist the Deaf and Hearing Impaired. Includes assistive listening devices, hearing aids, infrared/personal amplification systems, audio/FM loop systems, FM amplification systems, TV amplifiers, TV decoders, visual signaling and alerting systems, tactile alerting systems, telephony and accessories, text telephones, TDDs/TTYs devices and adapted phones.

entries.title: Cochlear_Implants
entries.description: A cochlear implant is a surgically implanted electronic device that provides a sense of sound to a person who is profoundly deaf or severely hard of hearing.

entries.title: Hearing_Aids
entries.description: A hearing aid is an electroacoustic device which typically fits in or behind the wearer's ear, and is designed to amplify and modulate sound for the wearer.

entries.title: Manufacturers
entries.description: This section is for Companies directly involved in the Manufacture of hearing aids for the hearing impaired.

entries.title: Home-Workplace_Adaptations
entries.description: Includes worksite/school/home design or modification for accessibility, architectural accommodations, structural adaptations, building/home ramps, home elevators, wheelchair lifts, pool lifts, bathroom changes, automatic door openers, expanded doorways, adapted furniture, adapted doorknobs, alternative doorbells, lowered counters, specially designed bath areas, etc.

entries.title: Mobility_and_Transportation_Aids
entries.description: Products that help mobility impaired persons move within their environment and give them independence in personal transportation.

entries.title: Ambulatory_Aids
entries.description: Includes canes, cane accessories, crutches, walkers, walker accessories

entries.title: Vehicle_Conversions
entries.description: Includes car-top carriers, custom cars and vans, adaptive driving control, hand-controls, child restraint systems, ramps, lifts.

entries.title: Accessories_and_Parts
entries.description: For sites that offer wheelchair parts, accessories products and related services.

entries.title: Recreation_and_Leisure_Aids
entries.description: Products that help persons with disabilities to participate in sports, social, cultural events. Includes modified sports equipment for skiing/biking/running/boating, audio description for movies, adaptive controls for video games, adaptive fishing rods, cuffs for grasping paddles or racquets, seating systems for boats, etc.

entries.title: Seating_and_Positioning_Aids
entries.description: Products that provide mobility impaired persons with greater body stability, maintain upright posture, provide trunk/head support and reduction of pressure to the skin. Includes adapted and modular seating, cushions and wedges, contour seats, lumbar support seats, standing tables, positioning belts, braces, wheelchair modifications and cushions, seat lifts, bolster chairs, corner chairs, therapeutic seats, postural support hardware, postural support systems, pressure monitors, etc.

entries.title: Vision_and_Reading_Aids
entries.description: Products designed to assist the Blind and Visually impaired. Includes auditory and speech output devices, reading machines, scanning/document reading systems, OCR systems, electronic book readers, talking equipment (clocks/watches, calculators, etc.), Braille devices, Braille transcription and translation devices, screen magnifier/enlarger, closed circuit television (CCTV) for magnifying documents, book holders, manual and electric page turners, large button phones, speaker phones, large print books, taped/audio books, etc. Does not generally include products intended to facilitate computer access and usage (see Computer Access Aids).

entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of feminine hygiene, baby diapers, wet and dry wipes, juvenile and adult incontinence products and other hygiene disposable products.

entries.title: Baby_Diapers
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of disposable diapers and wipes for babies.

entries.title: Incontinence
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of incontinence disposables for children and adults.

entries.title: Tissues_and_Wipes
entries.description: This category lists converters of paper and nonwoven tissues, towels, napkins and related hygiene disposable products.

entries.title: Research_and_Testing
entries.description: This category lists commercial companies and public organizations and institutions, involved in research and testing activities for the hygiene disposables industry.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: This category lists informational sites, portals, directories and other resources for the hygiene disposables industry.

entries.title: Hyperbaric
entries.description: Pertaining to, utilizing or supplied with oxygen at higher than atmospheric pressure, for therapeutic purposes.

entries.title: Furniture
entries.description: Manufacturers and wholesalers specializing in massage tables, chairs, and other massage-related furniture.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Professional and trade associations focused on the medicial equipment industry. Sites listed here may be national, regional, and local organizations.

entries.title: Consumer_Products
entries.description: Contains sites relating to medical products for use by consumers.

entries.title: Healthcare_Professional
entries.description: This category contains sites relating to medical equipment for use by healthcare professionals. Specifically, this category includes websites by or about dealers and retailers of professional medical equipment.

entries.title: Remanufacturers-Remarketers
entries.description: This category is designed as a reference tool for buyers and sellers of used, remanufactured, refurbished, or otherwise remarketed medical equipment; both in the USA and internationally.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: This category contains information relating to medical equipment services. These services include calibration, testing, preventative maintenance and repair.

entries.title: Mental_Health
entries.description: This category contains sites for businesses that sell products or services to the mental healthcare industry, not the industry itself. <p>Topics include psychological testing and assessment products and tools; consulting and training services for individual providers and practices; and billing, collection, and account management services.

entries.title: Nutrition
entries.description: Businesses engaged in the manufacture or distribution of nutritional products.

entries.title: Contract_Manufacturers
entries.description: Businesses offering contract manufacturing and product development services for nutrition and dietary supplement products.

entries.title: Raw_Material_Suppliers
entries.description: Directory of firms that supply raw materials to nutrition and supplement manufacturers.

entries.title: Ophthalmology
entries.description: Business: Industries: Healthcare: Products and Services: Ophthalmology Listings here are for those businesses that sell Ophthalmology products or services to the Professional Healthcare Industry, not to the consumer.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Listing of Ophthalmic manufacturers and service providers.

entries.title: Lasers
entries.description: Manufacturers of ocular laser equipment.

entries.title: Lenses
entries.description: Business: Industries: Healthcare: Products and Services: Ophthalmology: Lenses and Optics Listings here are for those businesses that sell lenses and optical products or services to the Professional Healthcare Industry, NOT to the consumer.

entries.title: Repairs

entries.title: Software

entries.title: Surgical_Instruments
entries.description: Business: Industries: Healthcare: Products and Services: Ophthalmology: Surgical Instruments Listings here are for those businesses that sell Ophthalmology surgical products to the Professional Healthcare Industry, NOT to the consumer.

entries.title: Orthopedic
entries.description: Links for those businesses that sell products or services to the Professional Healthcare Orthopedic Industry. This means those businesses that serve the healthcare orthopedic industry, not the healthcare industry itself. If your site is targeted for the public and not the healthcare orthopedic industry please submit your site to the appropriate category in Health. Prosthetic products are to be submitted to the appropriate category in Business/Healthcare/Products and Services/Prosthetics. If you are selling products to the public/consumer, please submit to the Shopping tree: Shopping/Health and Beauty: Shopping/Health and Beauty/Orthopedic

entries.title: Bracing
entries.description: Business: Industries: Healthcare: Products and Services: Orthopedic: Bracing. Submissions to this category should be from those companies/businesses who provide products and services for Orthopedic Bracing. These products and services are for hospitals or medical practices ONLY, not to the consumer. Consumer Products are to be submitted to the appropriate category in Shopping. Please submit to the Shopping tree: Shopping/Health and Beauty/Orthopedic

entries.title: Comfort
entries.description: Business: Industries: Healthcare: Products and Services: Orthopedic: Comfort. Submissions to this category should be from those companies/businesses who provide products and services for Orthopedic Comfort. These products and services are for hospitals or medical practices ONLY, not to the consumer. Consumer Products are to be submitted to the appropriate category in Shopping. Please submit to the Shopping tree: Shopping/Health and Beauty/Orthopedic

entries.title: Posture
entries.description: Business: Industries: Healthcare: Products and Services: Orthopedic: Posture. Submissions to this category should be from those companies/businesses who provide products and services for Orthopedic Posture. These products and services are for hospitals or medical practices ONLY, not to the consumer. Consumer Products are to be submitted to the appropriate category in Shopping. Please submit to the Shopping tree: Shopping/Health and Beauty/Orthopedic

entries.title: Prosthetics
entries.description: Suggestions to this category should be from those companies/businesses who provide products and services for Prosthetics. These products and services are for hospitals or medical practices only, not to the consumer. Please suggest your site to the appropriate subcategory.

entries.title: Breast_Prosthetics
entries.description: Manufacturers and information about breast prosthetics.

entries.title: Limb_Prosthetics
entries.description: For companies which design and manufacture artificial arms, legs, hands or feet.

entries.title: Optical_and_Facial_Prosthetics
entries.description: For companies which design and manufacture optical and facial prosthetics.

entries.title: Reproductive_Health
entries.description: Includes companies whose products concern human sexuality, fertility testing, pregnancy, and birth control. Some sites may contain graphic images, but no offensive or Adult sites or material will be found here.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Sites with resource information for the Mental Health Industry.

entries.title: Sleep_Disorders
entries.description: Instrumentation (EEG, polysomnography, actigraphy) manufacturers, ancillary equipment and distributors of equipment for measuring sleep and its disorders are listed here.

entries.title: Suppliers
entries.description: This category is for suppliers to the healthcare industry. Suppliers for a specific specialty may appear in that particular category; general or wider industry suppliers will be found here.

entries.title: Sterilization
entries.description: Sterilize: To free from living organisms Sterilization: The act or process of sterilizing This category is for listing sterilization products and services offered to the healthcare industry.

entries.title: Surgical_Mesh
entries.description: Surgical mesh are essential in the modern hernia surgery. So many kinds of mesh are now on the market with a lot of materials, dimensions, destinations of use, indications and complications.

entries.title: Wound_Care
entries.description: Products involved in wound care include pressure bandages, antiseptics, dressings, and stomal supplies.

entries.title: Hospitality
entries.description: <p>The <b>Hospitality</b> sector category  is broadly defined to include industries and establishments offering customers with lodging and/or food services. Also included are establishments offering supplies and equipment, and services that support these industries. <p> Excluded from this sector are civic and social organizations, amusement and recreation parks, theaters, and other recreation or entertainment facilities and venues providing food and beverage services. <br> </p> <p>Also excluded from this sector are establishments that offer event planning and production services, which may include accommodation and food service activities.  Examples of companies in this sector include conference, exhibit, and meeting planners. Sites offering event planning services are listed under <a href="/Business/Business_Services/Event_Planning_and_Production/">Business/Business_Services/Event_Planning_and_Production/</a><br> </p> <p>Sites for individual lodging establishments (e.g. hotels, motels, B&Bs, etc.) and individual restaurants, bars and nightclubs are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch.  However, the Hospitality category does list sites for regional, national and international chains, corporations and holding companies.<br> </p>

entries.title: Bed_and_Breakfast
entries.description: Companies and resources that support the operation of bed and breakfasts, such as companies that provide education, training, and management services to owners.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Institutes and organizations providing training and education in the hospitality industry.

entries.title: Bartending
entries.description: Companies, institutions, and organizations primarily offering bartending training.

entries.title: Distance_Learning
entries.description: Companies, institutions, or organizations that provide on-line or home study training courses in bartending.

entries.title: Flair
entries.description: Companies, institutions, or organizations the specialize in the training of Flair bartending.

entries.title: Schools
entries.description: Institutions specifically for training geared towards the hospitality industry, which offer courses on their own premises.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Working in the hotel and restaurant business can be a dynamic experience that provides skills that are transportable worldwide. If you are considering a career in Hospitality or are looking for a break from your current career path, the sites in this category may prove helpful. Sites in Business/Industries/Hospitality_Industry/Employment will provide useful information about employment in the Hotel, Catering and Hospitality industries.

entries.title: Job_Search
entries.description: The Job Search category provides listings of employment sites that provide job seekers with information which specifically relates to finding a job, as opposed to career related information or resumes. It will also include sites where job seekers can post their resumes and employers can post available positions.

entries.title: Executive_Search
entries.description: This category contains sites which are retained executive search firms specializing in the placement of restaurant and hospitality industry executives.

entries.title: Recruiters
entries.description: Working in the hotel and restaurant business can be a dynamic experience that provides skills that are transportable worldwide. If you are considering a career in Hospitality or are looking for a break from your current career path, the sites in this category may prove helpful. Sites in Business/Industries/Hospitality_Industry/Employment/Recruiters will provide useful information about employment in the Hotel, Catering and Hospitality industries.

entries.title: Food_Service
entries.description: Food service is concerned with both the preparation and service of food. This covers a broad range of businesses from cafes and restaurants to institutional operations such as canteens in schools, hospitals and prisons. Contract catering also falls under this category.

entries.title: Menus
entries.description: This category is for sites with a primary focus on the manufacturing and printing of restaurant menus and menu covers.

entries.title: Personal_Chefs
entries.description: Personal chefs offer professional meal preparation in the home. Services often include menu planning, grocery shopping, food storage and cleanup, in-home and wedding catering, or cooking classes.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category is for tools and equipment typically used in the food service industry. Food service is concerned with both the preparation and service of food. This covers a broad range of businesses from cafes and restaurants to institutional operations such as canteens in schools, hospitals and prisons. Contract catering also falls under this category.

entries.title: Beverage
entries.description: Sites that offer beverage equipment specific to the Hospitality industry are typically listed here. Sites that offer equipment for beverage processors should be forwarded to Business/Food_and_Related_Products/Beverages/Tools_and_Equipment

entries.title: Display
entries.description: <strong>This area is for the listing of sites providing display or presentation items in the are of Foodservice.</strong>

entries.title: Manufacturer_Representatives
entries.description: Listings of Manufacturer Reps for the foodservice industry

entries.title: Parts_and_Service
entries.description: Sites related to food service parts and service providers.

entries.title: Concessions
entries.description: Manufacturers, wholesalers, and import/export businesses specializing in tools or equipment for the Concessions industry, such as might be found in amusement/theme parks or fairs.

entries.title: Popcorn
entries.description: Manufacturers, wholesalers, etc. of equipment used in making the edible snack food popcorn.

entries.title: Shaved_Ice_and_Sno-Cones
entries.description: Manufacturers, wholesalers, etc. of equipment for the flavored, shaved ice industry.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Food service distributors carry a number of products such dry goods, frozen foods, fresh fruit, cleaning supplies, and food containers that are sold either to other distributors or directly to restaurants, c-stores, schools, and other organizations.

entries.title: Hotels_and_Motels
entries.description: Information on companies that support the operation of Hotels and Motels, such as: companies that provide software to assist hotel and motel owners in day to day operations; companies that offer management services to owners and franchisees, etc.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category will list firms and individuals offering consulting services in the area of hotel and motel operation.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Includes news services, newspapers, magazines and e-zines, books and other media sites that are specific to the hospitality industry.

entries.title: Regional
entries.description: This category is for links to regional hospitality categories only. Regional hospitality categories such as Regional/Europe/United_Kingdom/Business_and_Economy/Industries/Hospitality contain sites that are centered on that particular region. This may include, but is not limited to, sites for companies that supply to a limited area, trade associations for a particular country and employment agencies serving a particular area.

entries.title: Restaurant_Chains
entries.description: Information about eating establishments that have the same name, menu and decorating theme in multiple locations over a broad geographical area (i.e. locations in more than one state or equivalent).

entries.title: Asian
entries.description: Information about eating establishments that have the same name, menu or decorating theme in multiple locations over a broad geographical area (i.e. locations in more than one state or equivalent).

entries.title: Barbeque
entries.description: Restaurant chains (locations in more than one state or equivalent area) and franchises serving BBQ food.

entries.title: Chili
entries.description: Chili is a spicy dish generally made of meat, chili peppers, and sometimes, beans.

entries.title: Coffee
entries.description: Information about eating establishments that primarily serve coffees and have the same name, menu and decorating theme in multiple locations over a broad geographical area (i.e. locations in more than one state or equivalent).

entries.title: Family

translations.jpn: ファミリーレストラン

entries.description: Restaurant chains which offer a varied menu and target and cater specifically to the family dining market and offer a children's menu.

entries.title: Hot_Dogs
entries.description: Also known as frankfurters, a type of sausage generally served in a long, split bun.

entries.title: Italian
entries.description: This category is for sites about chains that specialize in Italian foods. However, pizza chains are not listed here. They are in a separate category. Italian staples are tomatoes, basil, oregano, olive oil, Parmesan or mozzarella, and pasta. Many Italian restaurants will offer a wide variety of dishes including veal, seafood, and chicken.

entries.title: Mexican
entries.description: Restaurant chains and franchises serving Mexican food, including Tex-Mex, interior Mexican, Mexican-style seafood, and nouveau Mexican. Mexican food typically includes corn or flour tortillas, red or green tomato sauce flavored with chiles, beans or well-cooked meat, and rice. Regional variations and modern adaptations may feature seafood, sour cream and cheese, and lettuce or uncooked vegetables.

entries.title: Pizza
entries.description: The origins of pizza go back to ancient times. Babylonians, Egyptians and other Middle Eastern cultures ate flat, unleavened bread that had been cooked in mud ovens. Mediterranean people such as the Greeks and Romans ate the bread topped with olive oil and native spices.<br> <br> In the late 1800s, Raffaele Esposito, a baker in Naples, Italy, created pizza as a dish for visiting royalty. According to the story, the Italian King Umberto and Queen Margherita were touring the area. In order to impress them and to show his patriotic fervor, Raffaele chose to top flat bread with food that would best represent the colors of Italy: red tomato, white mozzarella cheese and green basil.<br> <br> -- adapted from AboutPizza.com

entries.title: Restaurant_Groups
entries.description: Information about companies which run more than one restaurant chain (eating establishments that have the same name, menu and decorating theme in multiple locations) over a broad geographical area (i.e. locations in more than one state or equivalent).

entries.title: Seafood
entries.description: Restaurant chains (locations in more than one state or equivalent area) and franchises serving seafood.

entries.title: Southwestern
entries.description: "Southwestern cuisine combines Tex Mex, Spanish, Indian and American flavors, ... with one cowboy boot north of the Rio Grande and one huarache sandal south of the Rio Bravo. "Whether it's chiles in Taos or chilis in El Paso, there's no getting around these often devilish little fruits which give much of the fire to Southwestern specialties like tacos, enchiladas, tortilla and albondigas soups and more. "Corn is an important ingredient, giving the nod to Navajo hominy, sweet and savory tamales, as well as casserole toppers and upscale salads using jicama, paper-thin slices of red onion and miniature cobs of corn. "Other starches include the ubiquitous bean, often pinto or pink; rice used in cooling drinks and as a base for wonderful casseroles and side dishes, and flour in its many manifestations. "... Nouvelle Southwestern just takes these fresh and indigenous products and swirls them amongst French, Thai and German cuisine. Hence, ... fat-free gorditas filled with baby greens and goat cheese or unexpected combinations of earthy Oaxocan olive spread napping silken Portabello mushrooms amidst a masa-encrusted fence of yellowfin tuna." -- Casey Stewart

entries.title: Themed
entries.description: This category is for Themed Restaurant Chains, where a very integral part of the restaurant is the theme it is based around. Examples of themes include 50's Diners, Rock 'n Roll, or a particular time period.

entries.title: Central_Reservation_Systems
entries.description: Online and central reservation systems for hospitality establishments.

entries.title: Event_Planning
entries.description: Software for meeting and conference planners.

entries.title: Point_of_Sale_Systems
entries.description: This category lists sites specific to the hospitality industry related to Point-of-Sale Software and Systems.

entries.title: Property_Management_Systems
entries.description: This category is for property management software and the companies that provide the software.

entries.title: Amenities
entries.description: The hospitality industry provides a wide variety of services and products to hotels, Timeshare, convention and conference centers, hospital, assisted living, resorts and clubs and other related businesses. Among these provided services and products are "amenities", generally defined as items which bring comfort, convenience or enjoyment to the experience.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: The travel industry has many non-governmental organizations that support, promote, or directly influence it.

entries.title: Travel_Agents
entries.description: This category lists non-profit, educational, or trade organizations for travel agents at the international or national level.

entries.title: Distribution_Systems
entries.description: Sites for switching companies, Global Distribution Systems (GDS) and Alternative Distribution Systems (ADS), Internet Distribution Systems (IDS) providers, and central reservations systems (CRS) for the travel industry. GDS, ADS, IDS, CRS, and switching companies serve as the electronic distribution infrastructure for the travel reservation industry.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Publications of interest to travel industry professionals.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Sites of general interest to travel agencies, agents and the travel industry.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Software for the Tourism Industry, including 'online booking' services.

entries.title: Tour_Operator_Computer_Systems
entries.description: Reservations, front and back office systems designed specifically for tour operators.

entries.title: Travel_Agency_Computer_Systems
entries.description: Reservation, back and front office systems designed specifically for travel agents.

entries.title: Human_Resources
entries.description: Human Resources covers a range of topics, all dealing with the "People" aspects of running a business. HR has 2 major components HRM (management of people) and HRD (learning and development for staff). Typically larger companies have their own HR department but may buy in specific services from a specialist firm. Smaller companies may opt to have all their HR managed by an external HR company. Business/Human_Resources contains sites for companies specializing in Human Resource services. This may be as an HR service provider to other companies or as a provider of advice/resources/consultancy to HR departments. It has been divided into several subcategories for companies specializing in a particular aspect of HR. Those offering a more general service can be found at the top level.

entries.title: Compensation_and_Benefits
entries.description: This subcategory contains information pertaining to employee compensation and benefits. This includes wages, medical insurance, leave plans, retirement plans, 401(k)plans, cafeteria plans and other related information.

entries.title: Brokers_and_Consultants
entries.description: Companies who broker a broad range of Health and Welfare plans, including group health, dental, disability, and retirement plans.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Businesses that are devoted to the training or education of the human resources industry. <p> Please also see http://dmoz.org/Business/Human_Resources/Training_and_Safety .

entries.title: Employee_Relations
entries.description: Information and consulting resources on how to maximize employee relations. For additional information on potential and current conflict issues - see the conflict resolution sub-category

entries.title: Conflict_Resolution
entries.description: Information and consulting services related to potential and current conflict issues.

entries.title: Motivation_and_Rewards
entries.description: The category above this says that it (Employee Relations) is for : Information and consulting resources on how to maximize employee relations. That means that the Motivation and Rewards area is for sites that either have information and consulting resources on how to motivate employees through rewards, or have results/reports regarding such attempts to motivate employees through rewards.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Sites providing employment resources for professionals in the human resources field.

entries.title: Individual_Resumes
entries.description: Individual resumes of Human Resource related professionals.

entries.title: Recruitment_and_Staffing
entries.description: Search firms working specifically in the field of HR Jobs.

entries.title: Government_Agencies
entries.description: This subcategory contains links to international, federal, state and local governments that are useful to Human Resources professionals.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: This category comprises web sites about Marketing and Advertising businesses and individuals specifically serving HR Departments or Human Resources businesses.

entries.title: Outplacement
entries.description: This category is for companies that provide either an outplacement service, or outplacement resources to other companies. Companies providing job search, or career advice should be directed to an appropriate category of Business:Employment:JobSearch.

entries.title: Recruiting_and_Retention
entries.description: This category is for companies that provide tools, consulting, or advice on recruitment and retention matters.

entries.title: Reference
entries.description: This category contains employment law related information and reference information useful to the HR practitioner or student.

entries.title: Training_and_Safety
entries.description: The Training and Safety section contains information relating to employee training and organizational safety issues that are related to the practice of Human Resources.

entries.title: Employee_Injury_Prevention
entries.description: Companies, organizations, and individuals providing products and/or services with the goal of preventing occupational injuries.

entries.title: Industrial_Goods_and_Services

translations.tha: อุตสาหกรรม
translations.jpn: 製品・サービス（産業向け）

entries.description: <p>The Industrial Goods and Services category includes sites covering the following types of industries: <ul> <li>Producers and supplies of the materials, substances, components, machinery and other industrial technology used in manufacturing goods. <li>Producers and suppliers of industrial goods used by manufacturers (e.g. Industrial Supply). <li>Engineering and consulting services for manufacturing and allied industries. <li> Information resources on diversified manufacturing and allied industries. </ul>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for industrial manufacturing associations. An association in this category is an organized body of manufacturing company representatives who have an interest, activity, or purpose in common.

entries.title: Cable_and_Wire
entries.description: This main section is mainly for full line distributors of wire and cable products and accessories.

entries.title: Assemblies
entries.description: Cable assemblies are a combination of cable and connectors or terminators.

entries.title: AC_Power_Cords
entries.description: AC power cords are line cords used to connect products to AC power. They can be terminated on both ends such as a standard computer power cord that has a NEMA 5-15P on one end and an IEC-320 on the other. They can also have terminals or connectors on one end so one end goes inside a product and the other into an outlet.

entries.title: Specialty_Wire
entries.description: Specialty wire only.

entries.title: Wire_Preparation_and_Cleaning
entries.description: Includes all types of wire cleaning equipment, including ultrasonic, mechanical, laser, and abrasive.

entries.title: Calibration_and_Testing
entries.description: Organizations providing independent testing, laboratory, calibration, and instrument repair services.

entries.title: Equipment
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the manufacture, supply, and distribution of equipment, instruments, and devices used to perform tests or calibrations for industrial purposes.

entries.title: Laboratories
entries.description: This category focuses on sites dealing with laboratories dealing with calibration and testing.

entries.title: Nondestructive_Testing
entries.description: Nondestructive testing, also known as nondestructive evaluation, nondestructive inspection, and sometimes as condition or health-based monitoring, is a wide field of testing procedures that do not damage or destroy the interrogated object. Many different NDT techniques exist, such as ultrasonics, acoustic emission, or magnetic flux leakage, but essentially NDT can be summed up as analysis of energy propagation: the presence of a flaw or anomaly will change the energy's characteristics, which is reported by the NDT technique as a signal from a flaw. This category is devoted to NDT, its techniques and analysis and companies offering NDT products and services.

entries.title: Vendors
entries.description: Companies offering NDT products and services.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: This category focuses on sites related to providing calibration services, testing services or any other related service for industrial purposes.

entries.title: Flowmeters
entries.description: Manufacturers of ultrasonic flowmeters

entries.title: Instrumentation
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, suppliers and distributors of instrumentation and systems constructed for the non-destructive testing industry .

entries.title: Level_Measurement
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, distributors and suppliers of ultrasonic level instrumentation and devices .

entries.title: Sensors_and_Transducers
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers and distributors of ultrasonic sensors and transducers .

entries.title: Casting,_Molding,_Machining
entries.description: This category covers sites related to producing a multiplicity of standard and custom parts and components for a diversity of end users, usually (although not always necessarily) on a subcontracted basis. It includes associated supply and support companies and runs the gamut of providing castings through to the application of various finishes to end products. In effect, the essential feature is the use of machinery, rather than the manufacture of the equipment itself. Thus a lathe user can belong here, whereas the lathe manufacturer will be found -- and should be directed to -- a more logical <A HREF="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Machinery_and_Tools/">Machinery and Tools</a> category. Note: Companies indexed in the main category should offer either multiple or somewhat unique manufacturing capabilities. Otherwise, sites are distributed among a number of subcategories, each indicating a particular type of machining activity. Additional note: Just as lathe manufacturers aren't indexed in this category, so companies that manufacture end products from start to finish themselves are, more than likely, better directed elsewhere. Obvious examples would be appliance manufacturers and car makers, who each have categories of their own and, at best, merely -- somewhere along the way -- use the services and parts provided by the firms whose sites are listed within this Casting, Molding, Machining category.

entries.title: Directories,_Sales_Agencies
entries.description: This category contains sites offering directories and sales agencies that represent firms involved in CONTRACT and CUSTOM manufacturing, such as machine shops and foundries.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Please post sites that relate to jobs available in contact fabrication and machining firms.

entries.title: Foundries
entries.description: This category contains sites of companies involved in or primarily focused on the variety of ferrous and nonferrous casting processes. The emphasis is on manufacturing or custom supplying both rough cast and machined end products. Most particularly, this "lead-in" category indexes firms engaged in more than one process or, in a few cases, in casting of a relatively rare nature (e.g. continuous strip and bar casting) or type of end product (e.g. band instrument parts). Otherwise, where a site reflects a concentration on one process (e.g. sand casting) more than others -- or even just that one -- it is more logically allocated to its appropriately named subcategory. Note: The Supplies subcategory is used to gather together the sites of companies that serve the foundry industry with chemicals, consumables, molds, patterns, components, and similar requirements.

entries.title: Die_Casting
