entries.description: This category indexes sites of companies producing diecast parts and components for a wide variety of customers. The process is one of several different foundry operations and involves injecting molten metal, usually under pressure and often with water cooling, into a hardened steel die that conforms with the required shape. Subsequently, the die is opened and the casting rejected. Machining and finishing the raw casting may then follow, depending on the customer's requirement. On the whole, diecasting is confined to products made in aluminum, zinc, magnesium, and brass metals or alloys. Note: Where a company produces more than one type of casting, it more logically belongs in -- and should be directed to -- either the main Foundries category (which indexes firms with multiple capabilities) or the one that best matches the major portion of the company's output.

entries.title: Grey_and_Ductile_Iron
entries.description: This category will list companies that produce grey and ductile cast iron products as well as companies that provide services to these foundries. This category will include foundries that ship rough castings as well as castings that have been partially or completely machined.

entries.title: Metal_Injection_Molding
entries.description: Please submit firms that are using this process to make contact or custom parts.

entries.title: Powder_Metal
entries.description: Please submit sites here that use powder metal to create custom or contract part.

entries.title: Semi-Solid_Metal_Molding
entries.description: Please submit sites here that represent companies performing Semi-Solid Metal Molding on a contract or custom basis.

entries.title: Glass
entries.description: This category will list business that produce glass products (NAICS #3272 through 327215) and the companies that support these businesses. The web sites for glass artisans should be submitted to the <A HREF="/Arts/Crafts/Glass/"> Arts/Crafts/Glass <A> category. Companies that produce the raw material should be submitted to the <A HREF="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Materials/Crystal_and_Glass/"> Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Materials/Crystal_and_Glass <A> category.

entries.title: Heat_Treating
entries.description: This category will list job shops and contract heat treatment services and equipment for manufacturing parts and processes.

entries.title: Industrial_Forging
entries.description: This category is dedicated to sites offering CONTRACT or CUSTOM forging.

entries.title: Machine_Shops
entries.description: The overwhelming majority of Machine Shops concentrate on general machining of metal parts, each serves what is essentially a local market, and, if only as a matter of convenience, seem best indexed in a series of Full_Service subcategories that reflect their individual locations. However, it seems useful to isolate shops that offer a particularly specialized form of machining, and they are therefore indexed under either this main Machine_Shops category or in readily identifiable categories such as Spinning and Stamping. As will be seen, sites allocated to this main Machine_Shops category are those that focus on less common machine processes as, for example, thread rolling and cold heading.

entries.title: Electrical_Discharge_Machining
entries.description: This category indexes sites of companies involved in electrical discharge machining, a process that removes metal from a workpiece by using a controlled electrical current to cut and create intricate shapes in materials that would be difficult to handle with other machining operations. Some secondary capabilities are often offered by these companies, but the focus is unquestionably upon EDM work -- and needs to be so to warrant inclusion here.

entries.title: Full_Service
entries.description: With few exceptions, Machine Shops each serve a local market rather than catering to a national (let alone an international) customer base. In turn, most of them concentrate on jobs that can be considered in terms of general rather than specialized machining. In other words, they produce parts by turning, milling, boring, and grinding metal, but they don't often go beyond these processes. Given this basis -- and recognizing the sheer volume of firms of so similar a nature -- it is considered useful, if only as a matter of convenience, to index Machine Shop sites under a series of subcategories based on location. Note: Shops that (regardless of what they may call themselves) concentrate on a particular type of machining as opposed to a variety of general operations are, relatively speaking at least, much less numerous -- and in consequence their customers are more widely scattered. Accordingly, sites of this kind are collected -- and retained -- under several appropriate headings such as Grinding, Spinning, and Stamping. In a few cases, too, shops focused on less common machining processes (as, for example, thread rolling and cold heading) are allocated to the main Machine_Shops category. Additional note: Tool and Die Shops differ from Machine Shops and have a category of their own. Their emphasis is on producing tooling, patterns, dies, fixtures, gages, and parts that involve one form or another of special or sophisticated machining. As with Grinding companies and their like, their numbers aren't too unmanageable, and there is no benefit in breaking them up into location subcategories.

entries.title: Gear_Manufacturing
entries.description: This category contains sites of companies involved in producing power transmission components. Many of them are fair sized corporations engaged exclusively in gear manufacturing, while others are relatively small machine shops focused on the same kind of product. A few serve a narrow market niche (the French AML firm is an example), but the majority cover a broad range of gear, gearbox, and geared motor requirements in the form of either standard or custom produced items.

entries.title: Metal_Fabricators
entries.description: <p>This category contains site of job shops and manufacturers that specialize in fabricating metal parts either in a more sophisticated way than by general machining or in a less than usual -- and more than likely advanced and complex -- form. It also includes site of companies that offer a diversified range of capabilities and are difficult to classify under an otherwise narrow heading (e.g. spinning, stamping, etc.).</p> <p>Note: There is a subtle but important difference between sites in this category and those indexed in the <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Casting,_Molding,_Machining/Sheetmetal/">Sheetmetal</a> one. There, the essential emphasis is on working with sheet material that is cut, pressed, bent, and, often enough, also stamped into a required shape. Or, to put it another way, sheetmetal products could be hammered flat, whereas fabricated metal components could never be returned to their original shape.</p>

entries.title: Precision_Cutting
entries.description: This category covers machine shops that specialize -- or are primarily involved -- in waterjet, plasma, or laser cutting. Where this kind of operation is merely an ancillary (i.e. additional or secondary) part of the business, the firm's site more properly belongs in its appropriate Full_Service/Regional subcategory. Note: Sites providing or focused on laser marking and engraving services are also appropriate for this category.

entries.title: Screw_Machine_Shops
entries.description: This category contains sites of shops that concentrate on what is generally known as (Swiss) screw products, which are produced -- usually from bar stock -- on a single piece of equipment. In most cases, they are small rather than large and complex as opposed to simple. Moreover, their manufacture can be seen as a "one shot affair," rather than the result of using a succession of machine tools (e.g., lathe, drill, grinder, milling machine, etc.) to produce a part. There are only a few makes of screw machines, but they all incorporate a collection of spindles, each one of which can be set and used to perform a given operation in the path towards the finished product. Note: As an alternative to what are strictly termed screw machines, some lathes and machining centers have multi-axis capabilities and can either replicate screw machine production or handle parts that fall outside the diameter and/or length capacities of screw machines.

entries.title: Tool_and_Die_Shops
entries.description: This category covers sites of shops that are primarily concerned with the design, production, and supply of dies, fixtures, jigs, and other forms of tooling for a variety of end users. As such, while they may also offer machining services -- as a number of them do -- they are focused on the tooling needs of their customers rather than simply on what they require themselves for subcontract orders. Note: There is an obvious similarity with companies that make patterns, molds, and dies for the casting and plastic industries, as opposed to producing tooling for machining and fabrication customers. However, sites of this nature are concentrated in -- and should be directed to -- the Business/Industries/Manufacturing/Polymers/Machinery_and_Tools/Molding/Mold_Making/ category. If, of course, a Tool and Die Shop serves both kinds of markets (as a few of them do), its site can -- and should -- be indexed in whichever category better reflects its focus.

entries.title: Trepanning,_Gundrilling,_Boring
entries.description: This category contains sites of machine shops -- and there are relatively few of them -- that concentrate on what is perhaps the same idea: the drilling of centered holes through lengths of tubing, and usually long ones at that. Gundrilling, as its name suggests, originated as an operation in the manufacture of firearms, but it now applies to various other deep hole drilling applications. Boring -- in the case of this category at least -- applies to the creation of large diameter rings, invariably with quite thick walls. And trepanning is a process that produces thick walled tubes in such a way that the centre core is retained rather than being drilled away (as, in contrast, it is in gundrilling and boring operations). Note: Although some shops include one or more of the capabilities covered in this category, their sites need to be focused on them to be listed here. If the business emphasis lies elsewhere, the firm should be indexed in a correspondingly more appropriate category.

entries.title: Metal_Spinning

translations.jpn: スピニング・へら絞り

entries.description: This category covers sites of companies that specialize in -- or have a business focus on -- the production of contoured hollow metal parts and components.

entries.title: Metal_Stamping
entries.description: This category contains sites of companies that specialize in -- or have a business focus on -- the production of stamped metal parts and components. It also includes firms that stamp nonmetal materials such as plastics and wood. Note: The majority of stamping shops include tool and die making among their facilities, but this is a supplementary (and, of course, necessary) aspect of their business. They rarely make dies for end users, which is more the province of the Tool & Die Shops that are indexed in a category of their own.

entries.title: Plating_and_Metal_Finishing
entries.description: This category and its subcategories cover the wide range of services involved in giving metal and non metal surfaces, products, and components a protective, decorative, or, in some cases, specially required finish. It embraces a variety of plating, coating, polishing, and special purpose processes, the providers of which are indexed under whichever heading can be seen (or at least considered) to best reflect each company's business focus. Note: There are some fine distinctions among the variety of plating, coating, and finishing processes and end results, with companies offering all (or most) of them or limiting themselves to some -- or even a single one -- of them. To best sort out the differences, sites are allocated in one of two ways. On the one hand, a company's obvious emphasis on one type of process (e.g. Anodizing or Chrome or Galvanizing) will put it into an appropriately specific category. On the other hand, a company that runs the gamut of several processes (as, in fact, the greater number of firms do) will place it in either this main category (to reflect involvement in both Plating and Coating, for example) or the main Plating one (in recognition that the capabilities are wide rather than narrow ranging). Additional note: Coating sites more logically belong in the Surface_Treating category, as do, in many case, sites relating to Polishing. The rationale for such allocations rests on a judgement (however arbitrary it may be) that coating processes add a finish with little if any change in the physical properties of the underlying surfaces, whereas plating almost always changes them. In turn, polishing depends to a large degree on a machining (or sometimes a hand) operation and belongs under a Plating heading only if it takes some form of electromechanical or electrochemical deposition or alteration to the surface.

entries.title: Anodizing
entries.description: This category covers sites related to anodizing, an electrochemical process primarily applied to provide aluminum surfaces and products with a variety of protective finishes and properties. Note: The category indexes both suppliers and users of anodizing chemicals and processing components provided they are the predominant business, manufacturing, or service feature. If anodizing is accompanied by involvement in other plating, coating, or finishing processes, the company's site will be found in whichever category best represents the overriding -- or diversified -- focus.

entries.title: Chrome
entries.description: Hard chrome is a popular form of plating and is usually available in a variety of thicknesses and for a wide range of surfaces and products.

entries.title: Galvanizing
entries.description: This category covers sites concerned with providing steel surfaces and products with a protective zinc coating, usually through a hot dip process.

entries.title: Plating
entries.description: This category covers the wide range of plating services designed to provide protection against corrosion, an increase in physical properties (such as hardness), and some kind of decorative finish to metal and nonmetal products. Both a variety of processes and end results are involved, and many companies concentrate on a limited number of them -- or even just one in particular -- while others offer a quite diversified list of capabilities. As far as possible, these differences are reflected in the allocation of sites to either this main category or those that recognize a predominant -- or even total -- focus on one given process rather than the others. Note: Many plating companies also offer (wet) painting and (dry) powder coating services and, provided neither process is the major part of the business, can be justifiably included in this main category or one of its subcategories. Where, however, either painting or coating is the overriding service, a site will -- and should -- be more appropriately listed in the Business/Industries/Manufacturing/Casting,_Molding,_Machining/Surface_Treating category. Additional note: Metal polishing is a further service that can be among a plating company's capabilities, but if this feature is the dominant one, the site more properly belongs in either the Polishing subcategory or the Bus/Ind/Mfg/CstMldgMchng/Surface_Treatment one -- with, once again, the recognizable business emphasis determining the particular allocation.

entries.title: Polishing,_Buffing_and_Grinding
entries.description: This category covers the range of finishing obtained by such processes as grinding and buffing. Occasionally it follows the application of plating or coating to materials and components, but it is more usually -- and certainly for the purpose of this category -- seen as an alternative to them. Whatever the case, the process involves machining (or sometime hand work) rather than any form of dipping or other transformation of the original material condition and appearance. Note: It's perhaps a fine point, but the better allocation of many Polishing sites exists in the Surface_Treating category (see the "Machined_Finishing" link to it). The argument for this lies in further recognition that "a final polish" is simply the last step in removing roughness, burs, imperfections, and, of course, a dull appearance from a surface.

entries.title: Resources_and_Information
entries.description: This category contains sites that offer advice, information, and support services to the metal -- and some non metal -- processing industries. On the one hand, it includes details of available publications, exhibitions, and consultancy firms. On the other hand, however, it excludes trade directories and sales agencies, which have a category of their own.

entries.title: Sheetmetal
entries.description: <p>This category contains site of job shops and manufacturers that specialize in fabricating parts out of sheetmetal and do little if anything in the way of drilling or turning to produce their end products. The operations they perform are, on the whole, confined to cutting, bending, stamping, and, quite often, painting or otherwise finishing the material they work with -- even though they do sometimes also produce tubular frames either in addition to or for incorporation into the enclosures they make.</p> <p>Note: There is a subtle but important difference between sites in this category and those indexed in the <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Casting,_Molding,_Machining/Machine_Shops/Metal_Fabricators/">Metal Fabricators</a> one. Firms listed there are involved in producing products of a less than usual -- and more than likely advanced and complex -- form that requires something more than general machining. In turn, their end products will differ significantly from anything that can be classified, in relative terms at least, as a flat or shaped sheet.</p>

entries.title: Surface_Treating
entries.description: This category covers a variety of operations required, on the one hand, to prepare metal and nonmetal surfaces and products for subsequent processing and, on the other hand, to give them a final (and usually pleasing) appearance. As such it includes sites related to an assortment of heat treatment processes (such as annealing, brazing, carburizing, and nitriding), various pre- or post- (and essentially mechanical) operations (like deburring, grinding, and polishing), and the application of (wet) painting and (dry) powder coatings as well as certain specialized (and, more than likely, chemically induced) finishes. On the whole, it assumes a quite different kind of application than that involved in plating products to give them a desired finish or significant change in physical properties. Note: Because many plating companies include pre- and post-treatment capabilities in the services they offer, additional sources for surface preparation and finishing can be found among the sites indexed in the <A HREF="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Casting,_Molding,_Machining/Plating_and_Metal_Finishing/Plating/"> Casting,_Molding,_Machining/Plating_and_Metal_Finishing/Plating <A> categoryHowever, the deciding factor in such allocations is the overriding concern with plating rather than a focus on what those companies are given to calling "value added services."

entries.title: Welding
entries.description: This category contains sites which provide all types of welding services (MIG, TIG, stick and flux) for businesses.

entries.title: Wrought_Iron
entries.description: This category covers firms that specialize in -- or have a main business focus on -- ironwork, usually of a protective or decorative nature. It also includes shops that produce aluminum structures rather than wrought iron ones. Most tend to serve a localized residential, commercial, and industrial market, and many create imaginative pieces of either their own or an artist's design. With few exceptions, their sites include numerous photos of the work they've done.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: <p>The <b>Industrial Goods and Services Consultants</b> category includes companies that provide operating advice and assistance to businesses and other organizations in areas of manufacturing operations improvement, production planning and control. <p>Consulting services focused on specific industry sectors are listed in categories corresponding to those sectors (e.g. consultants focused on Automotive manufacturing operations).

entries.title: Engineering
entries.description: <p><a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Engineering/"><u><b>Engineering</b></u></a> <br> <br> This category is a combination of informational sites and company listings for most major Engineering fields. (No companies are listed directly under Engineering, but are listed in their most appropriate subcategories of Engineering). <br> </p>

entries.title: CAD
entries.description: This category is for companies that provide CAD (Computer Aided Design) services. This category is also appropriate for CAD association or organization web sites or member directories.

entries.title: AutoCAD
entries.description: Companies that provide CADD services using AutoCAD. Information about the AutoCAD software and related products can be found at Computers: CAD: AutoCAD.

entries.title: Civil
entries.description: <p><a href="http://dmoz.org/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Engineering/Civil/"><u><b>Civil Engineering</b></u></a> <br> <br> This category is a combination of company listings and informational/resource Web sites for Civil Engineering.</p> <p>The main Engineering category page contains only listings of informational/resource Web sites of interest to Engineers. Informational resources specific to a certain Engineering field are listed under that sub-category.</p> <p>No companies are listed directly under Engineering, but are listed in their most appropriate subcategories of Engineering, such as Engineering:Civil.</p> <table bgcolor="#ffffcc" cellpadding="6" border="0"> <tr> <td><small><b>Before submitting your site, please review the <a href="http://dmoz.org/Business/desc.html">Guidelines for Submitting a Site</a>.</b></small> </td> </tr> </table> <p>If you do not see a subcategory that you think should be included included in <strong>Business:Industries:Engineering</strong>,<br> please email an Editor in the <a href="http://dmoz.org/Business/">Business</a>: or <a href="http://dmoz.org/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services//">Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services</a> section and ask them to consider including the new subcategory. (You may find a list of editors at the bottom of the category pages.)</p>

entries.title: Civil_Engineering_Management
entries.description: This category is designed for professional engineering consultants and informational/resource web sites for civil engineering, who specialize in some aspect of engineering management.

entries.title: Construction
entries.description: This category is a combination of company listings and informational/resource Web sites for civil engineering construction and construction management.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: The Civil: Consulting category contains civil engineering consultants as well as multidiscipline civil engineering consultants.

entries.title: Construction
entries.description: Civil engineering consultants specializing in construction and construction management services.

entries.title: Corrosion
entries.description: This category is for consultants whose main operations center around corrosion protection and prevention. Contractors and material suppliers should submit their sites to the related categories shown at the bottom of the page of this category.

entries.title: Land_Planning_and_Surveying
entries.description: Civil engineering consultants specializing in land surveying, topography, land planning and GPS/GIS services.

entries.title: Land_Surveying_GIS
entries.description: Civil engineering consultants specializing in land surveying, topography, land planning and GPS/GIS services.

entries.title: Structural
entries.description: Civil engineering consultants specializing in structural and structural engineering management services.

entries.title: Traffic_and_Transportation
entries.description: The Civil: Consulting: Traffic and Transportation category contains civil engineering consultants specializing in traffic and transportation planning, street design, railroad, and airport planning.

entries.title: Traffic_and_Transportation
entries.description: This is a sub-category of company listings and informational/resource web sites for professional civil engineering firms, which specialize in traffic and/or transportation engineering.

entries.title: Urban_Planning
entries.description: This category is a combination of company listings and informational/resource web sites for civil engineering urban planning and related areas.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: <p><a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Engineering/Consulting/"><u><b>Engineering Consultants</b></u></a> <br> <br> This category is a combination of company listings and informational/resource Web sites for Engineering Consultants.</p> <p>The main Engineering: category page contains only listings of informational/resource Web sites of interest to Engineers. Informational resources specific to a certain Engineering field are listed under that sub-category.</p> <p>No companies are listed directly under Engineering, but are listed in their most appropriate subcategories of Engineering, such as Engineering:Consultants.</p> <table bgcolor="#ffffcc" cellpadding="6" border="0"> <tr> <td><small><b>Before submitting your site, please review the <a href="/Business/desc.html">Guidelines for Submitting a Site</a>.</b></small> </td> </tr> </table> <p>If you do not see a subcategory that you think should be included included in <strong>Business:Industries:Engineering</strong>,<br>please email an Editor in the <a href="/Business/">Business</a>: or <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/">Industrial_Goods_and_Services/</a> section and ask them to consider including the new subcategory. (You may find a list of editors at the bottom of the category pages.)</p>

entries.title: Safety
entries.description: Safety, OSHA compliance and related engineering issues

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for "directory sites" only.

entries.title: Industrial
entries.description: Industrial engineers determine the most effective ways for an organization to use the basic factors of production - people, machines, materials, and energy. Sites listed in this category will offer services, that include production and inventory control management, optimization the use of various resources, human factors and usability engineering, work measurement, quality management, compensation and policy analysis, constraint management and facilities layout and design.

entries.title: Individual_Resumes
entries.description: Industrial Engineers generally focus on process improvement, simplification, and optimization. Areas of study and work include human factors engineering, production and inventory control, general business and technology consulting. IE's are often familiar with and skilled in various technological arenas. This category lists resumes of individuals working in or seeking to work in an Industrial Engineering capacity.

entries.title: Nuclear
entries.description: This category will list companies involved in the nuclear field. The following types of activities are included:<ul> <li> Producers and suppliers of materials, substances, components, machinery and other industrial technology used in the nuclear industry.</li> <li> Producers and suppliers of industrial goods used by manufacturers.</li> <li>Engineering and consulting services for the nuclear industry.</li> <li>Information resources on the nuclear industry.</li></ul>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category will list commercial organizations, associations, and other organized body of professionals or companies that are involved in the nuclear industry.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category will list firms and individuals offering services to the nuclear industry. Services of these firms typically include safety and technical assessment, fuel design, engineering support, fuel transportation and reviews.

entries.title: Education
entries.description: This category will list institutes, companies and individuals that provide education and training to the nuclear industry. This category will also list companies that provide services to the education and training companies listed here.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: This category will list all career and employment sites for the nuclear industry, including job listings and resumes. This category will also list companies that provide services to the companies and individuals that are listed here.

entries.title: Manufacturing
entries.description: This category lists manufacturing companies in the nuclear industry, as well as sites about the manufacturing components of this industry.

entries.title: Marketplaces
entries.description: This category will list companies that offer goods and information exchange services to the nuclear industry, and that facilitate interactions and transactions between buyers and sellers in the nuclear industry, providing a platform for promoting contracting services, jobs, materials, supplies, tools and equipment; and allowing buyers to select the most appropriate or cost-effective source.

entries.title: Product_Development
entries.description: This category will list companies that develop new products and new product lines for either in house use or for clients.

entries.title: Factory_Automation
entries.description: The manufacturers of products used to automate Factories and continuous flow processes including the integrators of automated material handling systems.

entries.title: Automation_Services
entries.description: This category lists companies that support the manufacturers of products used to automate Factories and continuous flow processes including the automated material handling systems. Examples of these companies are engineering companies that do not produce a product.

entries.title: Communications_Devices_and_Networking
entries.description: Diverse methods and standards are used for communication between factory machinery, and between the factory floor and the office.

entries.title: Construction_and_Mounting
entries.description: Construction of equipment in a factory and mounting of equipment units.

entries.title: Human_Interfaces
entries.description: Between the automated 'system' or 'process' controller lies an interface which makes the system or process visible to humans.

entries.title: ID,_Video,_Labeling_Equipment
entries.description: Equipment performs a function in the visual identification, verification, inspection, and labeling of manufactured product in an automated process.

entries.title: Integrators
entries.description: Engineering, design, procurement, and construction of factory automation systems is performed by systems integrators.

entries.title: Manufacturers_Representatives
entries.description: The representatives of manufacturers of products used to automate Factories and continuous flow processes including the integrators of automated material handling systems.

entries.title: Motion_Control
entries.description: Motion control enables automatic handling, positioning, loading and transfer of work, in an automated manufacturing facility.

entries.title: Encoders
entries.description: Lists manufacturers of all types of encoders.

entries.title: End-of-Arm_Tooling
entries.description: This category lists the URLs of companies that produce end of arm tooling and grippers for robots and pick and place units.

entries.title: Motion_Control_Components
entries.description: Components provide power for, and guidance and control of moving machinery, in an automated manufacturing system.

entries.title: Safety_Equipment
entries.description: Engineered products are used for the safeguarding of human health in industrial manufacturing plants.

entries.title: Fluid_Handling

translations.ita: Controllo dei Liquidi e dei Gas

entries.description: This category is for companies manufacturing or supplying equipment and services specifically aimed at providing for applications that require the control, regulation, and safe operation of fluid flows.

entries.title: Compressors_and_Vacuum_Pumps
entries.description: This category is for companies manufacturing compressors and compressor-derived systems.

entries.title: Vacuum
entries.description: Industrial, scientific, laboratory, and medical vacuum pumps. Does not include household vacuum cleaners.

entries.title: Fluid_Power_Components
entries.description: This category is for companies manufacturing or supplying components that use a fluid to produce a motive force.

entries.title: Gaskets_and_Seals
entries.description: Companies that manufacture or supply gaskets, seals, and packings for equipment that control the flow of fluids or gases.

entries.title: Gauges_and_Meters
entries.description: The <b>Fluid and Gas Control Gauges and Meters</b> category focuses on gauges and meters that are used in this industry to measure such things as temperature, pressure, and flow. It is appropriate for sites focused on any aspect of this field, including the sites about manufacturers, distributors, wholesalers, designers, directories, trade associations, industry news, and suppliers of any specialized tools and equipment used to make, service, or repair these products.

entries.title: Pumps
entries.description: Companies that produce or supply pumps or pumping equipment for the flow or regulation of fluids.

entries.title: Chemical_and_Process
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers and suppliers of pumps and pump systems with focus on industrial pumps (except such for water and wastewater transfer), including but not limited to the chemical, petrochemical and offshore, food processing and breweries, pharmaceutical and semi-conductor applications.

entries.title: Centrifugal
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers and suppliers of <B>centrifugal pumps</B> and centrifugal pump systems with focus on chemical and process applications.

entries.title: Positive_Displacement
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers and suppliers of <B>positive displacement pumps</B> and systems with focus on chemical and process applications. Constructions include rotary lobe, gear, screw, peristaltic, diaphragm and piston pumps.

entries.title: Dosing_and_Metering
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers and suppliers of <B>positive displacement pumps</B> and systems with focus on <B>dosing and metering applications</B>.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category lists directories of pump manufacturers and related businesses.

entries.title: Water_and_Wastewater
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers and suppliers of pumps and pump systems with focus on clean water and waste water applications.

entries.title: Packaged_Systems
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers and suppliers of <B>packaged systems</B> such as booster sets for fire-fighting and water supply application, drainage or sewage lifting stations or multi-pump units.

entries.title: Ram
entries.description: Manufacturers and suppliers of Ram pumps.

entries.title: Submersible
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers and suppliers with focus on <B>submersible and submergible pumps</B> for both clean water and waste water applications, including drainage, sewage and effluent pumps as well as borehole and deep well pumps.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Pump distributors and wholesalers may be listed here.

entries.title: Tanks
entries.description: Tanks and other containment systems used in industrial applications.

entries.title: Plastic
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, distributors and suppliers of plastic storage tanks .

entries.title: Valves,_Hoses,_and_Fittings

translations.jpn: バルブ・配管・ホース

entries.description: Valves, hoses, and fittings used for the control of fluids in containment, transportation, and handling systems.

entries.title: Fittings
entries.description: Fittings, including taps, connectors, bellow, sight glasses, gauges, and clamps used on piping and hose assemblies for the control of fluid flows.

entries.title: Hoses,_Pipes,_Tubing
entries.description: Extruded, molded, or machined conveyance media used for the handling of fluids.

entries.title: Valves
entries.description: Any kind of industrial valve; mainly for the control, regulation, and automation of fluid handling systems.

entries.title: Ball_Valves
entries.description: is for companies that manufacture, integrate, and service ball valves mainly.

entries.title: Butterfly_Valves
entries.description: Includes companies who design, manufacture, distribute and / or stock butterfly valves.

entries.title: Control_and_Regulation_Valves
entries.description: Some valves are made specifically for the control and regulation of fluid flow.

entries.title: Pinch_Valves
entries.description: A pinch valve controls the flow of media through flexible tubing. They operate on the principle that pinching opposite walls of tubing together creates a blockage past which media cannot flow. They are ideal for applications where sterility or purity is essential, or where the media is difficult to handle.

entries.title: Plastic_Valves
entries.description: is for companies that manufacture, integrate, and service plastic valve control systems or valves.

entries.title: Repair_and_Service
entries.description: Includes companies that provide repair, maintenance, consultancy and other repair related services.

entries.title: Solenoid_Valves
entries.description: Electro-mechanical devices that are assembled with a valve body.

entries.title: Supply_and_Distribution
entries.description: Includes companies which are involved in wholesale distribution of valves, are stockists, traders, representatives of other valve manufacturing company. In short, companies engaged in supplying of valves but are not manufacturing them.

entries.title: Valve_Control_Components
entries.description: Control devices for the automation and measurement of manual and automatic valve operation.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: The category may contain wholesalers, distributors, resellers in the area of fluid and gas control.

entries.title: Industrial_Supply
entries.description: <p>The Industrial Supply category includes sites related to:</p><ul><li>Supplies of materials, components and spare parts.</li><li>Supplies of machinery, equipment, tools for use in other industries, such as in refining, fabrication, manufacturing, maintenance, repair and overhaul.</li></ul><p>Please note that the construction industry has its own category tree at <a href="/Business/Construction_and_Maintenance/Materials_and_Supplies/"><b>Business: Construction and&nbsp;Maintenance: Materials and Supplies</b</a>.

entries.title: Air_Compressors
entries.description: Industrial compressors provide compressed air for use in machine tool, instrument air, engine starting and process applications. Compressors are predominantly of two types; screw compressors and reciprocating compressors. Screw compressors provide air at relatively low pressure at high flow whilst reciprocating compressors provide high pressure air at lower flow rates.

entries.title: Casters_and_Wheels
entries.description: Lists sites of manufacturers of casters (castors), small swivel mounted devices which assist moving medium sized loads, and associated small industrial wheels. This category lists sites that offer casters or wheels that are suitable for a range of applications, or contain mixed product ranges.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Lists sites containing alphabetical or classified lists of resources covering casters and wheels.

entries.title: Distributors
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily supply casters and/or wheels manufactured by another business.

entries.title: Chains_and_Belts
entries.description: Lists sites related to the manufacture and supply of chain, belting, and webbing for industrial applications. This category also listed sites for businesses undertaking associated installation services such as belt splicing.

entries.title: Cleaning
entries.description: <strong> <p> The cleaning category consists of commercial products, equipment, accessories and cleaning tools for the maintenance industry.</br> </strong> </P> Thank you.</p></p></p>torono 10.04.2002

entries.title: Tools
entries.description: <p><strong>This category is for the listing of manufacturers and distributors of cleaning tools.</strong> </p> <p> <strong> The cleaning tool category consists of devices and attachments to promote efficient results in the janitorial industry.</strong> </p> <p> <strong> Such as; brooms, brushes, sponges, handles, squeegees.</strong> </p>

entries.title: Spray_Booth
entries.description: <p>This category is for industries specializing in the supply of filters specifically used in the spraying equipment in for painting vehicles, metal components and wooden products.</p>

entries.title: Generators
entries.description: Electric Generator or Electric Alternator and Generator Set Manufacturers, Distributors, and Retailers.

entries.title: Turbine
entries.description: Turbine powered generator set manufacturers, distributors, and retailers.

entries.title: Magnets
entries.description: This category is for industrial magnets. Please submit your company's name as the title of the site. Keep your descriptions as specific and as short as possible. Factual descriptions are appreciated, marketing hype will be deleted.

entries.title: Materials_Handling
entries.description: Material handling is the short-distance movement, storage, and control of that from which things are made, throughout the process of manufacturing, distribution, consumption, and disposal. This category is focused on the supply of equipment and associated services to businesses undertaking materials handling activities. This category lists sites which either relate to the materials handling industry as a whole, or relate to materials handling in more than one industrial sector. Most sites are listed within one of three main equipment groups - <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Automated/">Automated</a>, <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Bulk/">Bulk</a>, or <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Manual/">Manual</a>. Sites relating primarily to materials handling equipment specifically used in factories and involved in actually manufacturing the material are not listed here - they are listed within <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Factory_Automation/">Manufacturing/Factory_Automation</a>. Sites related to equipment which alters the nature or condition of batches of materials, rather than just transporting it, are listed within <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Machinery_and_Tools/Process_Equipment/">Machinery_and_Tools/Process_Equipment</a>. Sites for businesses that conduct a range of machining and custom manufacturing activities, of which just one is the production of materials handling equipment, are listed within <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Casting,_Molding,_Machining/">Casting,_Molding,_Machining</a> and/or at the appropriate <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> level. Sites related primarily to packaging materials such as bags are listed within <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Packaging/">Packaging</a>. This category does not list associated management processes, such as <a href="/Business/Management/Supply_Chain/">supply chain management</a>, or warehousing and other <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Distribution_and_Logistics/">logistics and distribution</a> services.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Lists sites for trade associations and organizations primarily related to businesses producing, supplying, operating, or maintaining materials handling equipment.

entries.title: Automated
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture materials handling equipment that does not require a human operator and/or systems through which material flows, or provide associated parts or service. Equipment specifically for bulk materials are listed under <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Bulk/">Bulk</a>.

entries.title: Conveyors
entries.description: Mechanical equipment that is an assemblage of elements for moving freight over a predetermined path. These elements commonly take the form of rollers, belt running on rollers, screws, chains, or monorails. Conveyors can be powered, gravity, or momentum based. The freight can either rest on the conveyor, or be towed by the conveyor. This category lists sites for businesses that manufacture conveyors or conveyor systems, or provide associated parts or services. This category includes automated and non-automated conveyors. Equipment directly associated with moving cargo on, off, or between conveyors is also listed within this category. This equipment includes items such as handling tables, orientators, and gating systems. Sites relating to automated vertical reciprocating lifts are listed here. Sites relating to packaging equipment which is primarily part of a conveyor system are listed here. Other packaging equipment is listed under <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Packaging/Machinery_and_Equipment/">Packaging</a>. Sites that primarily relate to conveyors used in factories and actually involved in the manufacturing process are listed under <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Factory_Automation/Motion_Control/">Factory Automation</a>.

entries.title: Bulk
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that manufacture conveyors or conveyor systems for bulk materials. Bulk materials usually have no specific shape and are handled in large quantities. Common examples include unprocessed foodstuffs and minerals. Equipment based on a bulk conveyor, such as a stacker, may be listed here.

entries.title: Parts_and_Service
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that provide parts, maintenance, or associated services for bulk conveyors.

entries.title: Parts_and_Service
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that provide parts, maintenance, or associated services for conveyors.

entries.title: Unit_Load
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that manufacture conveyors or conveyor systems for individual unit load handling. Unit loads have a specific shape and are often handled separately. Unit load conveyors are common in manufacturing and warehousing industries.

entries.title: Palletizers
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that manufacture equipment for moving cargo between a conveyor system and a pallet. Equipment unrelated to a conveyor is listed in <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Packaging/Machinery_and_Equipment/">Packaging</a>.

entries.title: Parts_and_Service
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that provide parts, maintenance, or associated services for unit load conveyors.

entries.title: Distributors_and_Integrators
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily supply automated materials handling equipment manufactured by another business, or offer a combination of equipment supply, system design, and consultancy services. Businesses that are primarily manufacturers or equipment are not listed here, although integrators may undertake some engineering work as part of an installation process.

entries.title: Feeders
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture equipment used to control the flow of material into other materials handling systems, or associated parts and service. Designs are often hopper or vibratory based. Feeders that are integral to a specific type of handling system are listed within the category for that system. This category relates to equipment which can be used with various different handling systems, or is not designed for any one specific system.

entries.title: Paperless_Order_Picking
entries.description: Pick to light and barcode terminal batch and RF Order Picking

entries.title: Pneumatic_Tubes
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that manufacture, install and/or maintain systems which use air to move small capsules along pipelines. The capsules contain small items or documents, and transport is typically within one building or site. Systems are fairly common in retail, banking and medical sectors, but can be found in other industries.

entries.title: Storage
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture equipment which automatically moves, stores, and retrieves freight, normally within a factory, warehouse, or distribution center; or provide associated parts and service. It includes Automated Storage and Retrieval Systems (AS/RS), carousels, balancing equipment, and automated stacking systems. Equipment may include a limited amount of human action, but must be primarily automated.

entries.title: Vehicles
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture individual unit based trucks or trolleys, which operate without direct human control, but do not necessarily follow set paths or operate with even flow; or associated parts and service. Vehicles may be floor or ground based, or use rails, monorails, or similar methods. Rail or chain based systems with fixed routes and relatively constant flow are listed as <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Automated/Conveyors/">Conveyors</a>.

entries.title: Bulk
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture handling equipment for bulk materials, or provide associated parts or service. Bulk materials are unprocessed, such as minerals or raw foodstuffs, handled in large quantities that do not have a specific shape.

entries.title: Distributors_and_Integrators
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily supply bulk materials handling equipment manufactured by another business, or offer a combination of equipment supply, system design, and consultancy services. Businesses that are primarily manufacturers or equipment are not listed here, although integrators may undertake some engineering work as part of an installation process.

entries.title: Pneumatic_Conveying
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture pneumatic conveying equipment, or associated parts and service. Pneumatic conveying is a materials handling method in which bulk materials, regardless of particle size and shape, are forced along a pipeline by flow of a gas (air in most cases). The particles can be conveyed in suspended state (dilute phase) or "plug" or "slug" state (or dense phase) or in some cases it is also achieved in so called semi dense phase conveying. Pneumatic conveying is also (but rarely) called pneumotransport, although pneumotransport is sometimes applied to pneumatic capsule pipelines. Manufacturers commonly offer both dilute and dense phase based systems. Pneumatic conveying components may include rotary airlocks, diverter valves, conveying eductors (also called venturi), double dump valves and pressure vessels. Sites related to directly associated storage and handling equipment, which form part of a pneumatic conveying system, are also may be listed here.

entries.title: Storage
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture equipment used to hold bulk materials until they are required for another purpose, or provide associated parts and service. Equipment includes items such as silos. Sites related to dust control equipment are listed here if they relate only to bulk materials handling in general. Similar equipment for wider application is listed within <a href="/Science/Environment/Air_Quality/Products_and_Services/Equipment_and_Supplies/">Air_Quality</a> or <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Machinery_and_Tools/Process_Equipment/">Manufacturing</a>.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: Lists sites related to formal and informal conferences, meetings, trade shows, and workshops, and associated events.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses offering advisory, project management, or legal services primarily related to the materials handling industry. Businesses that offer consultancy, but also offer installation and/or equipment supply are listed within <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Distributors_and_Integrators/">Distributors_and_Integrators</a>. Businesses that provide consultancy services that cover both materials handling and a related area, such as <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Distribution_and_Logistics/Consulting/">warehouse</a> or <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Consulting/">factory</a> design, are not listed here. Businesses providing <a href="/Business/Management/Supply_Chain/">supply chain</a> management services are not listed here.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Lists sites containing alphabetical or classified lists of resources covering materials handling. Directories that are specific to one industry are listed within that industrial sector.

entries.title: Distributors_and_Integrators
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily supply equipment manufactured by another business, or offer a combination of equipment supply, system design, and consultancy services. Businesses that are primarily manufacturers or equipment are not listed here, although integrators may undertake some engineering work as part of an installation process.

entries.title: Manual
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that manufacture materials handling equipment that requires a human operator and/or is used to store, hold, or manually move material; or provide associated parts or service.

entries.title: Cranes_and_Hoists
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture cranes or hoists, or provide associated parts and service. Cranes and hoists are equipment used for lifting or lowering a freely suspended load. Hoists are commonly used solely for vertical movement, where as cranes may allow limited horizontal movement. Typical equipment includes jib cranes, gantry cranes, hoists, lifting beams, and overhead cranes. This category does not list <a href="/Business/Construction_and_Maintenance/Materials_and_Supplies/Elevators_and_Escalators/">Elevators</a> installed in buildings. Many fully automated lifting devices, such as vertical reciprocating lifts, are listed within <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Automated/Conveyors/">Conveyors</a>.

entries.title: Below-the-Hook
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture below-the-hook equipment, or provide associated parts and service. Below the hook is a term applied to lifting equipment attached to cranes or hoists which are not slings or rigging. This category includes sites related to equipment such as vacuum lifters, magnetic attachments, and grappling devices.

entries.title: Distributors
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily supply equipment manufactured by another business.

entries.title: Parts_and_Service
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that provide parts, or provide maintenance or associated services for cranes and hoists.

entries.title: Portable_Hoists
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture equipment used for vertically lifting or lowering a freely suspended load, which can be freely moved between locations; or provide associated parts and service.

entries.title: Slings,_Lashing,_and_Rigging
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture equipment or accessories used to support or hold items being lifted or stored; or associated parts and service. This includes webbings, lashings, clamps, and similar equipment used to hold cargo during transportation, which is not directly related to cranes and hoists. This category does not list sites relating to equipment specifically used to rig <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Maritime/Equipment_and_Supplies/">maritime</a> vessels, nor does it list sites related to <a href="/Business/Arts_and_Entertainment/Tools_and_Equipment/Rigging/">theatrical</a> rigging.

entries.title: Winches
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture lifting equipment based around a powered windlass; or provide associated parts and service.

entries.title: Crates_and_Containers
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture crates and containers which are mainly for materials handling or transport, rather than for the packaging of individual products; or provide associated parts and service. Typical items listed here include 'maritime' containers and boxes used to contain and transport part-processed materials. This category does not list sites related to crates and containers used for general <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Packaging/">Packaging</a> of goods or finished products. <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Manual/Pallets/">Pallets</a> are not listed here.

entries.title: Distributors_and_Integrators
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily supply manual materials handling equipment manufactured by another business, or offer a combination of equipment supply, system design, and consultancy services. Businesses that are primarily manufacturers or equipment are not listed here, although integrators may undertake some engineering work as part of an installation process.

entries.title: Lift_Equipment
entries.description: Industrial lift equipment safely lifts people and materials in the manufacturing and distribution environment. Types of lift equipment includes, Adjustable Worker Elevation Platforms, Industral /Tilters, Lift Tables, Pallet Rotator or Pallet Inverter and Stackers.

entries.title: Loading_Bay_Equipment
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture equipment used to move materials within the staging platform used to transfer items from short-range materials handling systems to long-range transportation; or provide associated parts and service. Sites related to equipment that requires or allows structural change to a load dock area are normally listed within <a href="/Business/Construction_and_Maintenance/Materials_and_Supplies/">Construction_and_Maintenance</a>. Sites related to conveyors used for load bay operations and other uses are listed within <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Automated/Conveyors/">Conveyors</a>.

entries.title: Pallets
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture pallets; or provide associated parts and service. Pallets are portable platforms used to transport or store materials. They are common made from wood, metal, or plastic, and designed to allow lifting devices, such as fork lift trucks, to handle them with ease.

entries.title: Metal_and_Plastic
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture pallets made from metal or plastic; or provide associated parts and service.

entries.title: Wood
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture pallets made from wood; or provide associated parts and service.

entries.title: Powered_Trucks
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture individual powered, but manually driven, materials handling vehicles; or provide associated parts and service. This category includes tractors, fork lift trucks, and other similar vehicles.

entries.title: Distributors_and_Rental
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily supply or rent powered trucks.

entries.title: Fork_Lift_Trucks
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture industrial vehicles fitted with material lifting devices.

entries.title: Accessories
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture value-added accessories for industrial lift vehicles. This does not include attachments nor replacement parts. Examples include: access control systems, backup alarms, battery level alarms, dispatch systems, fork alignment cameras, impact alarms, payload scales, and proximity alarms.

entries.title: Attachments
entries.description: For listing of optional attachments to forklifts. For example: paper clamps, carpet poles, scales, rotating clamps, sideshifters, dumping attachments, drum handlers.

entries.title: Dealerships
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily sell, service or rent fork lift trucks manufactured by other businesses. If the business primarily manufactures lift trucks or attachments, submit the site to another category under [Business: Industrial Goods and Services: Industrial Supply: Materials Handling: Manual: Powered Trucks: Fork Lift Trucks]

entries.title: United_States
entries.description: Fork lift truck dealerships located in the United States.

entries.title: Parts_and_Service
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that provide parts, or provide maintenance or associated services for fork lift trucks.

entries.title: Parts_and_Service
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that provide parts, or provide maintenance or associated services for powered trucks.

entries.title: Special_Purpose
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture individual vehicles similar in design to fork lift trucks, but with more specific purposes than general lifting, loading, and transport of palletized goods, such as aisle, picker, turret, walkie, or sideloader trucks.

entries.title: Pre-Fabricated_Mezzanines_and_Enclosures
entries.description: Pre-Fabricated mezzanines and enclosures are pre-constructed, pre-engineered structures that are generally used in conjunction with warehouse and distribution centers. Pre-Fabricated Mezzanines are free standing floor systems, built between two permanent stories. Pre-Fabricated Mezzanines are considered equipment and not construction. Pre-Fabricated enclosures are also considered equipment and can consist of many materials. Pre-Fabricated enclosures can be made from woven wire mesh, modular wall panels, fabric, plastic, etc.

entries.title: Racks_and_Shelving
entries.description: Racks and Shelving designed for warehouse or industrial applications. Generally larger scale to store pallets of materials or bulk products, but also shelves designed to hold smaller products.

entries.title: Trolleys,_Hand_Trucks,_and_Casters
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that primarily manufacture wheeled carts and other load bearing devices that assist in manually moving individual loads horizontally along a variable path, primarily for use in materials handling; or provide associated parts and service. This category includes equipment such as air based bearings. Fully automated trolleys are listed in <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Automated/Vehicles/">Automated Vehicles</a>. This category does not list <a href="/Business/Retail_Trade/Store_Fixtures/Shopping_Carts_and_Accessories/">retail</a> trolleys, or <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Trolleys/">tram trolleys</a>.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Lists sites offering news services, newspapers, books, magazines and e-zines, blogs and journals related to materials handling.

entries.title: Parts_and_Service
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that provide parts, or provide maintenance or associated services for materials handling equipment. Parts which can also be used in non-materials handling equipment are normally listed elsewhere, commonly within <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/">Industrial Supply</a>.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Lists sites offering computer software designed to assist in the planning or operation of materials handling systems and equipment. Sites for businesses that offer equipment and associated software are listed once within the relevant equipment category.

entries.title: Vehicles
entries.description: Contains links to categories containing sites for businesses that primarily manufacture trucks, trolleys, and similar equipment used to move materials over short distances.

entries.title: Power_Transmission
entries.description: Here you'll find suppliers (and many manufacturers) of mechanical power transmission components such as gears, bearings, motors, speed reducers, etc. This category has nothing to do with electrical power generation nor automotive transmissions.

entries.title: Brakes
entries.description: This category is for machine shop equipment used in the forming of metals. Sites devoted to equipment for stopping cars will not be listed here.

entries.title: Rope_and_Rigging
entries.description: Lists sites related to non industry specific and/or generic rope related equipment and products. This category and subcategories include wire and fabric rope, accessories such as hooks, links, and shackles, assemblies made of rope (rigging), and generic equipment used to coil and handle rope.

entries.title: Accessories
entries.description: Lists sites related to businesses providing accessories and fittings associated directly with rope and rigging. This category includes sites related to hooks, shackles, links, and strapping. This category does not list sites related to machinery used to handle or coil rope.

entries.title: Fiber
entries.description: Lists sites for manufacturers of fiber rope and products based on fiber rope, such as netting. This category includes most types of cordage and twine, except those used within the <a href="/Business/Textiles_and_Nonwovens/Textiles/">textiles</a> industry.

entries.title: History_of_Ropemaking
entries.description: Sites that provide history and background of rope making and rope technology.

entries.title: Machinery
entries.description: Lists sites related to generic rope and coil handling machinery. Most hoists and winches are listed within <a href="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Industrial_Supply/Materials_Handling/Manual/Cranes_and_Hoists/">Materials_Handling/Manual/Cranes_and_Hoists</a>. This category includes coilers, reelers, balancers, and capstans.

entries.title: Wire
entries.description: Web sites listed here are Manufacturers who produce all types of Wire Ropes.

entries.title: Safety_Equipment_Supplies
entries.description: Safety equipment supplies include: Apparel that is utilized to enhance the health and safety of workers (PPEs); equipment to prevent accidents in the work place; and products that are used by first responders in emergencies.

entries.title: Apparel
entries.description: <b>Apparel, as defined, is anything that is worn or attached to your body. This category is a subset of, Safety Equipment Supplies. So it follows that any type of apparel for safety purposes is included. </b>

entries.title: Gloves
entries.description: <p>Hand wear that has the ability to shield the hands from puncture, cuts, abrasion, infection, heat, fire, freezing, water, harsh chemicals. Also to protect the product, that is handled, from contamination.</p>

entries.title: Fire_Protection
entries.description: Fire detection and controlled products, systems and services utilized by industrial and also commercial and large scale residential occupancies to meet their obligations under the fire codes, standards and insurance agreements.

entries.title: Fire_Extinguishers
entries.description: Hand portable and wheeled (chemical and co2) extinguishers and companies which supply or manufacture them, supply or manufacture parts, supply or manufacture accessories, or inspect, service or train personnel on their use.

entries.title: Fire_Sprinkler_Systems
entries.description: All sites directly relating to standard wet and dry fire sprinkler systems as used in industrial, commercial and residential buildings. All other fire suppression systems will be found in the Special Fire Suppression Systems category.

entries.title: Special_Fire_Extinguishing_Systems
entries.description: This subcategories consists of sites relating only to fixed pre-engineered and engineered extinguishing systems, such as CO2, halon, water mist, dry chemical, wet chemical, and mixed gases.

entries.title: Gas_Detection
entries.description: This category lists mainly manufacturers and sellers of equipment for gas detection and monitoring for industry with emphasis on safety.

entries.title: Signs
entries.description: Safety Labels, Safety Signs, Warning Signs, Warning Labels, Safety Decals, Warning Decals for Industrial Equipment and Workplace Safety.

entries.title: Storage_and_Shelving
entries.description: Manufacturer and Distributors of Storage and Shelving equipment.

entries.title: High_Density_Mobile_Systems
entries.description: Manufacturer or Distributor of High Density Mobile Storage and Shelving Systems

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: For distributors of OEM and MRO products and items to industrial accounts. Manufacturers and manufacturing representatives should apply in more applicable category. Please ensure your web site is functional and links are working before submitting. Sites under construction may be held until completion.

entries.title: Machinery_and_Tools
entries.description: This category serves as a collection point for a host of sites put together by individuals, companies, and organizations that make, sell, service, or are otherwise concerned with the machinery, equipment, tooling, accessories, and consumables used by a wide range of industrial manufacturers. The category breaks the sites into groups that relate to either a main type of equipment or a particular field of industrial operation. Many of these groups are further broken down into subcategories that each assemble sites that have something in common with one another. An important point about all the sites is their focus on the equipment used in manufacturing an end product or achieving an end result. This is quite different from concern about the raw material involved in the manufacturing process. Sites of that sort belong in the relevant Resources industry categories. Note: Although over 5000 sites are distributed among the numerous subcategories that make up this Machinery and Tools section of the Open Directory, a relatively small percentage of them are indexed in five "above the line" categories: Associations, Directories, Employment, Technical Services, and Used Machinery. The focus in each case is on a general or all encompassing application to users of machinery and tools rather than on a narrower relationship to a specific industry or manufacturing process. Additional note: Several dozen sites are indexed, too, below the list of subcategories on this page. They represent companies that feature a diversified or out-of-the-ordinary range of products or services and are therefore difficult -- if not impossible -- to include elsewhere. A few of them do, at first glance, appear to have a relationship to a given subcategory, but the diversification of their interests and activities suggests that they are more justifiably listed under this "catch-all" heading.

entries.title: Assembly_Equipment
entries.description: This category focuses on companies involved in designing and supplying largely automated systems for assembling a variety of manufactured products. It includes equipment for automatically fastening, riveting, drilling, screw insertion and tightening, and performing similar operations that would otherwise have to be done manually. It also extends to systems and devices for testing and packaging finished products. Note: In effect, the sites indexed here are concerned only with a particular aspect of automated manufacturing. Those that deal with other - and often more extensive - forms of automation belong in - and should be directed to - the main category at http://dmoz.org/Business/Industries/Manufacturing/Factory_Automation/ or one of its subcategories.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Official websites of international, national, and area trade associations that focus on one kind of manufacturing or another. They usually include lists of members and often provide details of current activities, forthcoming events, and general business news, trends, and commentary.

entries.title: Auctions_and_Internet_Trading
entries.description: This category serves as a general collection point for companies engaged in selling, buying, and trading new and used manufacturing equipment. Most of them have an appeal to more than one industry and usually include photographs and technical details of their current inventory. Where auctions sites are involved, they also show the status of bids to date. Note: Despite the title of this category, it does -- and can -- include some manufacturer sites, especially where the product range doesn't readily fit elsewhere. As just one example, hand and power tools aimed at a wide variety of markets can belong here, particularly if they aren't appropriate for the Hydraulic and Pneumatic category. Additional note: The separate Used Machinery category also contains a list of possible sources for equipment of a general nature. However, where equipment is restricted to use by a specific industry or applies to a particular type of processing, a site is usually more appropriately indexed elsewhere -- as in the numerous listings to be found throughout the various subcategories that make up this Machinery and Tools section of the Open Directory. Thus, someone with an interest in balancing machines is more likely to find what they're looking for under that heading rather than in either this Auctions and Internet Trading or the Used Machinery one.

entries.title: Balancing_Machinery_and_Tools
entries.description: This category is concerned with the range of systems and components that test and overcome imbalances and vibration in a wide variety of manufacturing and processing machines, particularly those that involve rotating parts. Note: The emphasis in this category is on balancing equipment used in various industries, but there is a notable exception in the case of wheel balancing equipment and weights used in the car and truck aftermarket. Sites of this nature are more logically included in the Vehicles_Repair_and_Maintenance category. Additional note: Although a few manufacturers also provide balancing services, such activity is more the province of local machine shops. Sites of this nature can be found at -- and should be directed to -- the appropriate Regional location, which can be found within the breakdown shown at Business/Industries/Manufacturing/Casting,_Molding,_Machining/Machine_Shops/Full_Service/Regional/

entries.title: Building_Materials_Manufacturing_Machinery

translations.deu: Maschinen und Anlagen zur Herstellung von Baustoffen

entries.description: This category indexes sites dealing with equipment and supplies used in the building and construction trades. The focus is on the processing of building materials, the manufacture of end products and building components, and the tools used by installers and tradespeople.

entries.title: Blast-Cleaning
entries.description: Specialized equipment for removing graphiti and other stubborn contaminants from walls, floors or other large surfaces.

entries.title: Carpet_and_Floor_Cleaners
entries.description: Equipment for industrial cleaning of floors and carpets; Janatorial cleaning machines.

entries.title: Laundering
entries.description: Equipment for industrial laundering.

entries.title: Vehicle_Washers
entries.description: Car, truck, bus, and train washing equipment

entries.title: Manufacturers
entries.description: Manufacturers of vehicle wash equipment, components and systems for cars, trucks, buses, trains, etc.

entries.title: Converting_Equipment
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with the manufacture and servicing of machinery and equipment involved in converting web and sheet material from a raw state to a partial or fully finished form. The material is generally confined to paper, board, film, foil, and some nonwovens, although there is an occasional but warranted exception. The converting processes include a wide range of operations such as unwinding/rewinding, cutting/slitting, glueing/coating/laminating, formation of bags and packages, embossing/perforating/hole punching, and counting/batching/packaging/delivery systems. Note: To a degree, sites related to converting machinery can also be found in the Printing, Packaging, Paper, and Textile/Nonwovens categories. In such cases, however, the equipment tends to be an internal extension of the industry's manufacturing focus rather than the basis of a distinctly separate converting business.

entries.title: Custom_Machinery_Builders
entries.description: This category contains sites involved in the design and building of one-of-a-kind machines and equipment for a wide range of manufacturing and processing companies. The emphasis is on a needs analysis, appropriate conceptual design, and eventual production and installation. Note: Any firm that simply offers customized machinery in its customary field of equipment should direct its site to the category in which it and its competitors are normally to be found. Thus, a special purpose laminating machine manufacturer belongs in the Converting category, while a company offering customized industrial heating equipment should be allocated to the Furnaces,_Incinerators,_Kilns one. Note: Some parallel exists between this Custom Machinery Builders category and the Technical Services one, in which, there too, the emphasis is on a source of advice and supply that a given manufacturer is unlikely to find available within the normal scope of things.

entries.title: Cutting_and_Machining
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with the sale and service of equipment used in the metalworking industry and, in several cases, with extended or alternative applications for shaping and forming plastic, stone, and wood materials.
