The selection varies from hand tools to advanced and sophisticated machinery, and the objective is the fabrication of parts and components needed for a wide variety of purposes. Such products are at the heart of the Machine Shop business and are also frequently turned out in house by machinery manufacturers for their own use -- and, not the least, for incorporation in the machinery the companies build. Note: The focus in this category is on the manufacture, supply, and service of equipment. In contrast, sites put together by users of the equipment (such as Machine Shops) are listed in the Casting, Molding, Machining categories.

entries.title: Cutting_Machinery
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with the manufacture, supply, and servicing of equipment used to cut metal, plastic, stone, and wood materials. It also embraces sister categories for laser and waterjet based machinery, as well as for equipment primarily used in the woodworking trades.

entries.title: Lasers
entries.description: This category features sites related to the manufacture and supply of laser cutting machines and systems, with the ability to handle a wide range of metal and nonmetallic materials. Several of the listed sites incorporate detailed explanations and discussions of laser technology and its applications. Note: In some cases, product lines include engraving and marking capabilities, but, where these are the pre-eminent business focus, the site is -- and should be -- more appropriately indexed in the <A HREF="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Machinery_and_Tools/Etching,_Embossing,_Marking/"> Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Machinery_and_Tools/Etching,_Embossing,_Marking/<A> category.

entries.title: Waterjet
entries.description: This category is intended for manufacturers and distributors of waterjet cutting machinery and equipment. Companies specializing in the use of this equipment for fulfillment of customer requirements are separately listed in the category at <A HREF="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Casting,_Molding,_Machining/Machine_Shops/Precision_Cutting/"> Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Casting,_Molding,_Machining/Machine_Shops/Precision_Cutting/<A> Note: A few suppliers offer both waterjet and laser based cutting equipment. Where this situation exists, the listing's allocation will be determined by whichever of the two types of equipment predominates.

entries.title: Garnet_Suppliers
entries.description: Companies that supply abrasive for waterjet cutting and blasting applications.

entries.title: Manufacturers
entries.description: Waterjet Cutting Equipment Manufacturers.

entries.title: Parts
entries.description: Companies that offer new and used parts for various brands of waterjet equipment.

entries.title: Service_and_Support
entries.description: Companies that offer service and support for waterjet cutting equipment.

entries.title: Machine_Tools
entries.description: This category is focused on equipment used to machine components in a variety of ways. These include drilling, tapping, milling, turning, deburring, buffing, and polishing. Although the terminology varies -- and sometimes rather inconsistently -- there is a widespread habit of placing all the equipment under a generic heading of "Machine Tools." This nomenclature helps, in turn, to differentiate guillotines and saws that simply cut material ahead of the machining processes -- and are allocated to the Cutting Machinery category.

entries.title: Distributors
entries.description: This category contains sites of Machine Tool Distributors. The information is focused entirely on machining equipment, with several sister categories being used as assembly points for sites of a service nature.

entries.title: Manufacturers
entries.description: This category contains sites put together by manufacturers of Machine Tools. The information is focused entirely on the equipment and its uses, with a number of sister categories being used to assemble sites of a service nature.

entries.title: Programming_and_Training
entries.description: This category contains sites of companies specializing in the provision of training and supply of software. The general focus is on CNC equipment, although instruction courses in conventional machine tool subjects are also available. Note: Some additional sources of background information are listed in the Resources_and_Information sub-category, which implies a self-directed study of such information as opposed to participation in training courses and/or involvement in their design and delivery.

entries.title: Reconditioning_and_Repair
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with the reconditioning, rebuilding, repair, and repair of machine tools.

entries.title: CNC_Electronics
entries.description: Within the Machine Tools industry, there are several types of controls, this category is for CNC (computer numercal control) systems, which comprise of all the electronics within the cnc system to make the machinery operate in the manner a human operator wishes.

entries.title: Resources_and_Information
entries.description: The sites in this category provide directory and overview information regarding the metalworking industry. In most cases it is made up of searchable databases and links to specific websites. Note: Additional sources of information are contained in the Programming_and_Training subcategory, but these sites are specifically focused on the development and supply of software and the availability and delivery of training.

entries.title: Used
entries.description: The focus of this category is on companies that buy and sell used and surplus machine tools, metal fabricating machinery, and, here and there, other industrial processing equipment. In most cases, sites incorporate searchable databases of currently available items. Note: Companies that act more as brokers and concentrate, at least somewhat, on auctions to dispose of equipment are -- and should be -- found in the Auctions_and_Internet_Trading category. Additional note: New equipment manufacturers and distributors often take in trades and accordingly offer a selection of pre-owned items, usually -- but not necessarily exclusively -- of their own brands. Their sites are to be found in the Machine_Tools Manufacturers and Distributors categories.

entries.title: Tooling,_Tools,_Consumables
entries.description: Although metalworking terms are often used imprecisely by manufacturers and users alike, they are given some special meanings in this Tooling,_Tools,_Consumables segment of the Cutting_and_Machining section of the Directory. Moreover, many companies serving the machining and fabrication industries offer a diverse range of products and often name them in a variety of different ways. However, if only for the sake of some consistency, the following assumptions form the basis of allocating sites in the numerous pages that make up this major category. 1. Tooling is considered to be items such as toolholders and workholders that add to the capabilities and capacity of cutting machines and machine tools. It also refers to add-on equipment that doesn't normally come with an original machine. Quite often it is described as a capital addition as opposed to a product that will wear out and eventually need replacing. (In what may be a useful analogy, a Tooling product can be seen as a computer peripheral.) 2. Tools are adjustable and reusable items that produce a desired result when fitted into a cutting or fabricating machine. The range covers saws, knives, and blades, as well a host of drill bits and inserts, grinding tools, cutting dies, and end mills. (Extending the computer analogy, Tools can be seen as printer ribbons and ink cartridges.) 3. Consumables are items such as lubricants that facilitate cutting, drilling, and machine operations in general, as well as media used with grinding, buffing, and polishing equipment. As the term implies, there's an ongoing use of the product during a machine operation. (A computer analogy isn't readily available, but printing paper and floppy discs are somewhat comparable examples.) Note: A number of sites are indexed in this main Tooling,_Tools,_Consumables category itself. The rationale for this allocation lies in the fact that the companies involved supply the full range -- or at least a diversified selection -- of these ancillary products. Additional note: This same "catch-all" principle applies to the three main subcategories (Accessories; Parts_and_Consumables; and Tools) -- i.e. the companies involved have a product or activity range that is varied rather than narrow in focus.

entries.title: Accessories
entries.description: This category and its four subcategories are concerned with add-on products that facilitate the use of cutting and machining equipment. Note: The fluid power component category lists pneumatic and hydraulic products for moving tools and workpieces.

entries.title: Die_Design
entries.description: The focus of this category is on the design, supply, and use of cutting and stamping dies, especially in terms of software driven applications. It also includes sites of companies involved in supplying diemaking parts and consumables. Note: The category doesn't concentrate on tool and die making companies, which are more appropriately indexed in -- and should be directed to -- the Casting,_Molding,_Machining/Machine_Shops/Tool_and_Die_Shops category

entries.title: Tooling_and_Workholding
entries.description: The content of this category is focused on a wide range of add-on fixtures and devices that control the movement of tools and workpieces. It includes items that have a software or mechanical basis.

entries.title: Parts_and_Consumables
entries.description: This category -- as well as each of its subcategories -- is concerned with supplementary products and supplies used to facilitate and/or enhance various cutting and machining operations.

entries.title: Replacement_Parts
entries.description: This category contains sites put together by companies specializing in the supply of replacement and renewable parts for the full range of cutting and machining equipment.

entries.title: Tools
entries.description: This category contains sites put together by manufacturers and distributors of blades, knives, saws, drills, taps, broaches, end mills, and other cutting and machining tools. The focus is on more than one classification (e.g. Carbide AND Diamond tools) or, in the case of the subcategories, deals with just one specific type (e.g. Carbide OR Diamond tools).

entries.title: Carbide
entries.description: This category is focused on tools made exclusively from carbide and high speed steels.

entries.title: Diamond
entries.description: The emphasis in this category is on diamond based tools, especially for cutting and processing stone and other non-metallic materials and components.

entries.title: Drills,_Punching_and_Stamping
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with punches and dies used to produce shaped components that may or may not require subsequent machining. It also serves as a collection point for specialized drilling assemblies.

entries.title: Hand_Tools
entries.description: Hand tools, which are used within the engineering or design of industrial cutting machinery whether automated or manual.

entries.title: Knives_and_Blades
entries.description: This category serves as a collection point for manufacturers and distributors of cutting knives, blades, and saws.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Sites that provide detailed information of companies and individuals engaged in a broad range of manufacturing industries. A number of online publications, which serve much the same purpose, are also indexed in this category. Note: Although many of the sites listed in this Directories category have a commercial aspect to them (and this is in contrast to the overall information provided by the sites indexed in the Associations category), a greater emphasis on the haves and wants of the marketplace can be found in the sites that are contained in the Auctions_and_Internet_Trading category -- or in the used machinery segments of categories such as Process_Equipment and Machine_Tools.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Sites related to job openings in the range of industries served by the Machinery and Tools categories. Includes recruiting and employment agencies. Job seekers who are so inclined may post their resumes here, too.

entries.title: Engines
entries.description: This category lists sites for (re-)manufacturers or suppliers of combustion <a href="/Science/Technology/Energy/Devices/Internal_Combustion_Engines/desc.html">engines</a>, engine components or related equipment, serving more than one application type.

entries.title: Etching,_Embossing,_Marking
entries.description: Sites identifying sources of equipment, services, and accessories involved in adding marks, textures, or decorative finishes to metallic and non-metallic surfaces, industrial and commercial products or components, and, in a few cases, specialized materials and items. The process technology varies, but the end result is invariably one of two things. There is either the addition (or occasionally the removal) of a mark, imprint, or texture to (or from) the original. Or the process leads to the creation of an intricate shape or uniquely finished product. Note: Suppliers of etching equipment often have a particular, and even exclusive, focus on the semi-conductor industry, and sites of this nature are better indexed in the <A HREF="/Business/Electronics_and_Electrical/"> Business/Electronics_and_Electrical/<A> categories. Additional note: Manufacturers of laser marking and engraving equipment often include models designed for cutting, drilling, and welding materials -- and sometimes the reverse applies. Where the emphasis is on cutting type machines rather than marking ones, sites should be more properly directed to -- and will be found in -- the <A HREF="/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Machinery_and_Tools/Cutting_and_Machining/Cutting_Machinery/Lasers/"> Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Machinery_and_Tools/Cutting_and_Machining/Cutting_Machinery/Lasers/<A> category. Note re commercial embossing work: The printing industry includes embossing as one of its capabilities, although the results are obtained through the use of dies rather than with industrial embossing machinery. An extensive, alphabetized collection of sources for this kind of work can be found in the <A HREF="/Business/Publishing_and_Printing/Printing/Full_Service_and_Commercial/"> Business/Publishing_and_Printing/Printing/Full_Service_and_Commercial/<A> category, with the geographical location being indicated in most cases.

entries.title: Furnaces,_Incinerators,_Kilns
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the manufacture, distribution, and servicing of industrial equipment and systems that are primarily used for heat generation and for melting or incinerating a range of materials and waste byproducts. It includes furnaces, ovens, kilns, crucibles, and other devices that use direct or indirect heat provided by solid fuel, gas, oil, or electricity, or, in a few cases, rely on heat generated by alternative means. The applications vary widely and cover a host of different industries. Note: Heat treatment processes also frequently depend on the use of furnaces and similar equipment. Thus, the Thermal_Process category -- which is focused on the steps taken in advancing the condition of materials and manufactured parts towards a desired finished state -- contains an additional number of furnace type sites. It therefore makes some sense for searchers and submitters to look at both this Furnaces_Incinerators_Kilns category and the Thermal_Process one to determine where their interests are likely to be best served.

entries.title: Hydraulic_and_Pneumatic
entries.description: This category indexes sites involved in the supply and service of relatively simple hydraulic and pneumatic tools; a broad range of more complex machinery and equipment (such as presses and handling/lifting systems) that make use of fluid and air power technology; and the components (such as hose and valves) and accessories (such as power packs) that make everything possible.

entries.title: Presses
entries.description: This category contains links to sites offering Hydraulic and Pneumatic presses.

entries.title: Industrial_Metrology
entries.description: Metrology is the scientific study of measurement. Legal metrology is the part of metrology where regulations are implemented in order to ensure an appropriate level of credibility in measurement results whenever conflicting interests exist, or when incorrect measurement results may adversely affect individuals or society itself. (Not to be confused with meteorology -- the study of the processes and phenomena of the atmosphere, especially as a means of forecasting the weather.)

entries.title: Calibration_and_Repair
entries.description: This category will list companies that provide a repair and/or calibration service to other companies for industrial equipment and components. The type of equipment and components involved are manual and electronic gauges, transducers, transmitters etc.

entries.title: Consulting_and_Layout_Services
entries.description: This category will list companies that provide Industrial Metrology services and Consulting services to manufacturing companies on the topic of Industrial Metrology. The type of companies listed here will include dimensional analysis of workpieces, training companies, CAD / CAM / CMM conversion companies etc.

entries.title: Coordinate_Measuring_Machines
entries.description: This category will list companies that manufacture and sell Coordinate Measuring Machines (CMM), software for CMMs and accessories for CMMs. This category will not list dimensional services that employ CMMs.

entries.title: Gear_and_Roll_Gauges
entries.description: This category lists companies that manufacture and service metrology equipment that measure gears and circular workpieces by turning the workpiece and measuring roundness, tooth form etc.

entries.title: Hand_and_Fixed_Gauges
entries.description: This category will list companies that manufacture and sell products that assist in inspecting and checking workpieces with high accuracy (sub-millimeter and often ±0.01mm) according to design drawings and specifications. This includes linear dimensions, diameters, location of features, levelness, flatness and geometric form fitting. The type of products listed here are micrometers, calipers, plug gauges, thread gauges, surface plates, columns and all fixed gauging for manufacturing process.

entries.title: Non-Contact_and_Video_Inspection
entries.description: Metrology systems/companies which rely on non-contact methods to make measurements (e.g. video, laser scanners, etc).

entries.title: Machine_Vision
entries.description: Machine vision is the ability of a computer to "see." A machine-vision system employs one or more video cameras, analog-to-digital conversion (ADC), and digital signal processing (DSP). The resulting data goes to a computer or robot controller. Machine vision is similar in complexity to voice recognition. <p>Source: <a href="http://whatis.techtarget.com/definition/0,,sid9_gci212508,00.html">Whatis.com</a>.

entries.title: Leatherworking_Machinery
entries.description: This category contains sites of special purpose equipment and accessory suppliers serving the leather processing and shoe manufacturing industries. It can also be of some interest to manufacturers making plastic and rubber footware.

entries.title: Plasma_Technology
entries.description: This category includes private companies dealing with plasma physics applications and technology

entries.title: Plating,_Polishing_Equipment
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with two main aspects of finishing or altering the nature or surfaces of parts made from metal and a small variety of other materials. On the one hand, the focus is on such processes as cleaning, deburring, degreasing, polishing, and generally improving the appearance of something. On the other hand, the interest is in changing its original or final composition through such processes as electroless or electrolytic plating. Note: There is a certain degree of overlap in the sites gathered in this category and others that are scattered through other parts of the Machinery_and_Tools segment of the Open Directory Project. To mention only two examples, centrifuges have a category all of their own and many machine tool sites feature deburring equipment. However, although the distinctions are perhaps somewhat fine, the essential rationale for including a site in this Plating,_Polishing category is the focus on the finishing industries rather than the process and metalworking ones.

entries.title: Process_Equipment
entries.description: This category -- and the subcategories included with it -- brings together sites concerned with the supply and service of machines, systems, and associated ancillary equipment that, in one way or another, alter the nature or condition of batches of materials, components, or parts that have so far probably been only partially manufactured. In some cases, the end result is a finished product. In others, the processing is merely a step along the way. Whatever the case, a change certainly occurs between the input and output stages. Note: Process Equipment sites usually have applications to a range of industries rather than one specific type of manufacturing. In contrast, sites that have an obvious relationship to a particular area of manufacturing are indexed in categories that conform with that relationship. (For example metalworking machinery is allocated to the Cutting_Equipment and Machine_Tools categories, just as tanning equipment and shoe making machines will be found in the Leatherworking_Machinery category.)

entries.title: Filtration
entries.description: The emphasis in this category is on machinery, equipment, and systems that remove unwanted contaminants from gaseous, liquid, or dry material. Often enough, the cleansing/purifying process will leave a residue, but this will have no value and, at some time or other, will need to be discarded as waste. Note: Where a residue is of value and can be put to further use, the process involves separation rather than filtration, even though some form of filter may be employed. In such cases, the associated equipment more correctly belongs in the Process_Equipment/Separators category. (For example, a "filtering" system will produce clean water and leave sludge behind, whereas a "separator" system will remove oil from water so that both liquids can be used again.) Additional note: The filters and screens used with filtering equipment are indexed on their own in the Process_Equipment/Separators/Filters category.

entries.title: Glass_and_Glass_Lined
entries.description: Sites in this category cover the manufacture, distribution, inspection, repair, and reglassing of glass lined equipment that is used quite extensively in the chemical and pharmaceutical industries. The objective is resistance to corrosion and the provision of protection from other adverse reaction when chemical materials and products are being handled, processed, stored, and transhipped.

entries.title: Magnetic_Separation_and_Detection
entries.description: This category contains sites put together by companies that manufacture and service magnetic separation and detection equipment, primarily for use in mining, foundry, scrapyard, and metal processing environments. The purpose is twofold: either lifting and transporting metal or removing it when its presence isn't required.

entries.title: Mixers_and_Dispensers
entries.description: Sites in this category relate to a wide range of machinery, equipment, and systems that mix, blend, dispense, and deliver a host of wet and dry materials and components. Applications exist in numerous industries, but the common denominator is the use in some form of processing that results in an output that differs from the input. Note: In contrast, equipment and devices that separate and sort materials and components, rather than, as it were, turning them into all-of-a-piece, are more properly allocated to the Process_Equipment/Separators category and its subcategories.

entries.title: Dispensers
entries.description: This category separates dispensers from mixers because they are relatively unrelated.Post only machinery used fordispensing material or ingredients in this category

entries.title: Separators
entries.description: This category and its subcategories are concerned with the recognition, handling, and processing of materials and components that have more than one constituent part. The systems, machinery, and equipment, as well as the various ancillary products they employ, are designed to analyze, categorize, sort, and separately store or dispose of the different parts. The end results can vary, but they will invariably comprise at least a couple of distinct elements. Note: Sites related to joining or merging materials and their parts are more properly indexed in the Process_Equipment/Mixers_and_Dispensers category. Additional note: On the whole, sites concerned with the removal of contaminants in air, gases, and water belong in the Process_Equipment/Filtering category. (This differentiation is based on a recognition that a single cleansed/purified element/condition is the end result of filtering, whereas a separating process [as already implied above] produces at least two parts of the original whole.) At the same time, however, there's something of a fine distinction when it comes to oil/water, liquid/solid, and wastewater treatment systems, which invariably result in two reusable elements and are therefore more properly allocated to this Separators category.

entries.title: Centrifuges
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the manufacture, supply, and servicing of industrial centrifuges, which are rotating machines designed to separate multi-phase fluids into component elements.

entries.title: Distillation_and_Evaporation
entries.description: This category contains sites that are concerned with a particular application of chemical engineering whereby waste and impurities are disposed of during what is called "mass transfer" of gases and liquids. The technology is also used both to extract and separate elements from composite materials and to reduce liquids to a solid state. On the whole, applications are confined to the chemical, petrochemical, pharmaceutical, and food processing industries.

entries.title: Filters_and_Strainers
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the manufacture and supply of filters, screens, sheet materials, housings, stand alone units, and accessory products used in a wide variety of filtering and separating systems and devices. Note: The emphasis in this category is on the filters and screens rather than the equipment and systems that make use of them. Sites of that sort are indexed in either the Process_Equipment/Filtering category or the main Process_Equipment/Separator category or one of its subcategories.

entries.title: Size_Changing
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with the size alteration, constituent separation, and sifting, measurement, and classification of various products handled by the processing industries.

entries.title: Used_and_Surplus
entries.description: The focus in this category is on used and surplus processing machinery, equipment, and parts. It does not -- and should not -- contain sites whose main business is the supply of new machinery, which more properly belong in the categories that cover their particular type of equipment.

entries.title: Sandblasting
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with the manufacture, sale, and service of surface preparation and finishing equipment that uses some form of abrasive media to produce a deburred, descaled, cleaned, or finished result. By extension, the category includes sources of supply for such related products as air compressors, fittings, guns, hoses, and, of course, the abrasives themselves. Note: Some equipment manufacturers offer to do sandblasting and the like for customers, but the majority of companies that specialize in this type of service tend to confine themselves to a reasonably local market. Sites of this kind should therefore be more properly directed to appropriate Regional/Localities categories, rather than expecting to have themselves indexed in this or any other Business section of the Open Directory.

entries.title: Snowmaking
entries.description: <p>The <b>Snowmaking</b> category focuses on the business of manufacturing, distributing, and marketing of snowmaking machines such as snow machines, and snowguns.</p>

entries.title: Technical_Services
entries.description: Engineering and similar companies that provide specialized services of a generally advanced or unique nature to manufacturers who are unlikely to have inhouse access to them. Examples include performance analysis, emergency repairs, significant equipment upgrades and retrofits, and the dismantling, movement, and reassembly of heavy machinery.br>In most cases, these services are available to a broad range of manufacturers and often on a worldwide basis.

entries.title: Test_Equipment
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the manufacture, supply, and servicing of instruments, devices, and equipment used to ensure the safe, efficient, and effective operation and condition of machinery, machine parts, and a variety of manufactured items. Some sites have a narrow application to an industry or product, but most have a broad range of applicability. In turn, while outside testing is preferred from time to time, the norm is to carry it out on the shop floor, as an attached or integral part of machinery, or through an in-house laboratory. Often enough, too, the testing process forms part of a predictive or preventive maintenance program.

entries.title: Environmental_Test_Chamber
entries.description: A subdirectory of manufacturers and suppliers of environmental test chambers. These manufacturer would include the large environmental room manufacturers and the smaller test chambers like altitude, thermal shock, vibration, humidity, temperature, etc. These chambers are used in various industries including automotive, battery, pharmaceutical, medical, etc

entries.title: Leak_Measurement
entries.description: This category will list companies the manufacture and service equipment that is used to detect and/or measure leaks in products on the manufacturing line.

entries.title: Thermal_Process
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the manufacture, distribution, and servicing of industrial equipment used in a variety of heat transfer processes. The objective is to heat or cool products as a part of a process application or manufacturing procedure. Examples include annealing, brazing, hardening, and tempering metal parts, as well as baking, drying, curing, and bonding materials and products in several different industries. Note: A quite considerable number of furnace type sites are also indexed in a category of their own, reflecting their application beyond the heat treatment one. Searchers and submitters are therefore advised to look at the Furnaces_Incinerators_Kilns category and well as this Thermal_Process one to determine where their interests are likely to be best served. Note: The accompanying Heat_Exchanger subcategory has its own description. In a sense, it deals with equipment designed to transfer heat from one medium to another.

entries.title: Electric_Heaters
entries.description: This subcategory includes manufacturers of electric heaters for the drying, curing, process, and other industries. These manufacturers have products which covers several types of equipment such as dryers, heat treating furnaces, and other applications. If you are looking for specific application of electric heaters and you do not find it here, please look at the category for that equipment, such as Heat_Treating .

entries.title: Heat_Exchangers
entries.description: This subcategory indexes sites put together by companies and individuals concerned with the manufacture, distribution, and servicing of heat exchanging equipment. In somewhat oversimplified terms, the intention of this equipment is to transfer heat from one surface, component, machine, or source to another, for the purpose of heating or cooling either one of them. Note: To a limited degree, some additional heat exchanger sites are included in the Furnaces_Ovens_Kilns category. Their existence is justified by the companies involved having a main focus on heat creation but a sufficiently important ancillary interest in its exchange/transfer/disposal.

entries.title: Heat_Treating
entries.description: This subcategory deals with equipment specifically used for heat treatment in the manufacturing industries. Due to this equipment being heated by several methods, there are other similar categories which you may want to look at. These include: Furnace,_Incinerators,_Kilns and Electric_Heaters .

entries.title: Induction_Heating
entries.description: This subcategory deals with induction equipment used in manufacturing industries. Due to this equipment being heated by several methods, there are other similar categories which you may want to look at. These include: Electric_Heaters and Thermal_Process.

entries.title: Ovens_and_Dryers
entries.description: This subcategory deals specifically with ovens and dryers in the manufacturing industries. Due to this equipment being heated by several methods, there are other similar categories which you may want to look at including Electric_Heaters and others which are linked from this category.

entries.title: Refrigeration
entries.description: Manufacturers and suppliers of industrial refrigeration and freezing equipment, and companies servicing and maintaining such equipment.

entries.title: Used_Machinery
entries.description: This category provides sources of used and reconditioned machinery for a variety of industrial and fabricating fields. They differ, at least to some degree, from the sites indexed in the Auctions_and_Internet_Trading category in which the emphasis is on the bidding method of disposal. Note: When used and surplus inventory is confined to one specific industry or machine type, with almost no applications outside it, a source is more likely to be found in the related category rather than in this more general one. Examples of this difference in indexing can be found in such categories as <a href="http://www.dmoz.org/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Machinery_and_Tools/Cleaning_Equipment/">Cleaning_Equipment</a> and <a href="http://www.dmoz.org/Business/Industrial_Goods_and_Services/Machinery_and_Tools/Cutting_and_Machining/Machine_Tools/Used/">Machine_Tools/Used</a>.

entries.title: Vehicle_Repair_and_Maintenance
entries.description: The intended use of this category is for manufacturers and or distributors of equipment and or tools designed for professional use by businesses that provide technical and or repair service for private or public sector vehicles utilized for the transportation of products or people.

entries.title: Body_Repair_Tools
entries.description: The intended use of this category is for manufacturers and or distributors of equipment and or tools designed for professional use by autobody or businesses that provide technical and or repair service.

entries.title: Diagnostic_Equipment
entries.description: This category contains links to suppliers of diagnostic equipment for the automobile industry.

entries.title: Hoist_Equipment
entries.description: To submit to this category one must be a manufacturer or distributor of vehicle lifting equipment for the transportation industry.

entries.title: Wheel_Maintenance
entries.description: This category contains links to wheel maintenance tools including tyre removers, alignment and balancers for the automobile industry.

entries.title: Filler_Metals
entries.description: Manufacturers and suppliers specialized in filler metals for welding applications.

entries.title: Woodworking_Machinery
entries.description: This category contains sites put together by manufacturers and distributors of woodworking machinery. Product lines include production machinery, material handling systems, and tooling used to manufacture furniture, doors and windows, architectural millwork, picture frames, dimensional lumber, and wood products in general. Note: The focus of this category is on industrial applications. Where sites are aimed at the home hobbyist instead, they more properly belong in either the <A HREF="/Shopping/Tools/Woodworking/"> Shopping/Tools/Woodworking/<A> category or the <A HREF="/Arts/Crafts/Woodcraft/Woodworking/"> Arts/Crafts/Woodcraft/Woodworking/<A> one. Additional note: Sites concerned with sawmill and plywood and panel production also fall outside the scope of this category. Instead they should be listed in the <A HREF="/Business/Agriculture_and_Forestry/Forestry_Products_and_Equipment/"> Business/Agriculture_and_Forestry/Forestry_Products_and_Equipment/<A> category.

entries.title: Dealers_and_Distributors
entries.description: Industrial woodworking machinery dealers for new and used equipment. Stocking distributors as well as brokers, catalogs, and used machinery classified advertising services.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: <U>Online magazines, newsletters</U> as well as websites from traditional journals <U>with industry related content</U>. Before submitting your site, please review the <a href="/Business/desc.html">Guidelines for Submitting a Site</a>.</small>

entries.title: Optics
entries.description: This category is for listing COMPANIES, so please submit company sites, not product sites. The title of your site should reflect your company name, nothing more. Note that this is for companies who sell or resell high technology, high precision, optical equipment, such as precision lenses, mirrors, detection or imaging equipment, and prisms. Laser entertainment (such as light shows) does not belong in this category. It belongs in a business or entertainment category. Companies selling low-tech products which can be purchased at a local general store probably is not appropriate for this category. This would include small He-Ne lasers for use as laser pointers, 3-D glasses, and light bulbs. A business category would be best in that case.

entries.title: Coatings_and_Thin_Films
entries.description: <b>About this category:</b> This category lists companies that design and create optical coatings. Some companies work with precision optics including mostly reflection and antireflection thin-film coatings. Some are opthamalic which include thin-film antireflection coatings, and also wet-process scratch-resistant coatings.

entries.title: Infrared_Optics
entries.description: Vendors for infrared optical systems and components.

entries.title: Optical_Components
entries.description: <b>About this category:</b> This category lists companies that design or manufacture precision optical components including lenses, mirrors, beamsplitters, windows, diffraction gratings, and assembled optics such as prisms and beamsplitters.

entries.title: Optical_Materials
entries.description: This category is for COMPANIES, which concentrate on optical materials manufacturing. Should not be confused with optical materials PROCESSING, that is prism, mirror and lens manufacturing.

entries.title: Packaging
entries.description: Packaging companies Packaging equipment companies Packaging research firms Engineering pertaining to packaging

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Associations, organizations, trade groups, societies related to the packaging manufacturing industry.

entries.title: Containers
entries.description: Containers used to transport products or equipment.

entries.title: Carrying_Cases_and_Shipping_Containers
entries.description: Reusable shipping containers, carrying cases and related products of rigid construction generally designed for protecting the contents from environmental damage during handling or shipment. Does not include bags, totes, crates or large bulk or ocean-going containers.

entries.title: Non-rigid_Carrying_Cases
entries.description: Manufacturers of flexible carrying cases.

entries.title: Archery_Cases
entries.description: Hard-sided and soft-sided protective cases for bows and arrows.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: Includes, plastic and glass; bottles, jars, cans, etc. Also includes bulk containers such as totes etc.

entries.title: Contract_Packaging
entries.description: Manufacturing facilities that package goods for private label companies or for their own product with services for private label companies. Example: Company that packages the end product which is going to a market or store. Manufacturing facilities that make supplies or components for packaging should be submitted to Manufacturing/Packaging.

entries.title: Paper_Products
entries.description: Packagers of products that are paper based. Example; envelopes, paper, towels, baby wipes, toilet tissue.

entries.title: Crating,_Boxes_and_Drums
entries.description: This category is for sites of businesses that focus on crates, boxes and drums which are mainly for manufactured or processed goods or general packaging.

entries.title: Accessories
entries.description: This category focuses on sites that deal with the accessories for crating, boxes and drums like lids and liners.

entries.title: Custom
entries.description: This category focuses on sites that deal with custom crating, custom boxes, custom drums and other related products and issues.

entries.title: Gift_and_Decorative
entries.description: Packaging designed for individual goods and promotional pieces.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Includes directories that include numerous links to packaging related sites.

entries.title: Envelopes
entries.description: For sites about the manufacturing and wholesaling of envelopes.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Associations of firms/organizations having to do with envelopes.

entries.title: Machinery_and_Equipment
entries.description: Category only for the manufacturing and maintenance of Envelope machinery.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category lists sites related to flexible packaging wholesale and/or distribution, which do <b>not</b> also offer manufacturing.

entries.title: Filling_and_Dispensing
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of filling and dispensing machinery and equipment.

entries.title: Wrapping,_Sealing_and_Shrinking
entries.description: Wrapping and shrinking machines use polymer plastic thin films. When we apply heat on these plastic films, they shrinks tightly over the objects they are covered on. Sealing machines include machines used to seal metal/plastic tubes, pouches, etc. Also machines used to seal containers like bottles, cans, drums, etc using heat or other mechanical mechanisms.

entries.title: Multi-Media
entries.description: Packagers or manufacturers and packagers of but not limited to cd's, records, tapes, and computer programs.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: This category lists companies providing services to the packaging industry.

entries.title: Crating
entries.description: This category is for sites related to Crating Services which are provided from multiple geographic areas.

entries.title: Food
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers and suppliers of packaging products used for packaging food and beverage products.

entries.title: Tape_and_Strapping
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers of tape and strapping products used in packaging.

entries.title: Shipping_Materials
entries.description: The category is for wholesalers of shipping materials. Members sell a large selection of shipping supplies, packaging materials, shrink wrap, shipping boxes, carton sealing tapes, and strapping. Sites listed here here supply a wide variety of shipping materials, offer on-line commerce capabilities and stock the majority of what they sell.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: General manufacturing services.

entries.title: Information_Services
entries.description: The Information Services industry broadly includes those establishments that create, disseminate, or provide the means to distribute information. Specifically, the scope of this category includes companies that collect, retrieve, and deliver various types of information, including real-time data via online services, electronic transmission, the Internet, or other means.

entries.title: Binderies
entries.description: <P>This category contains sites for commercial enterprises that primarily focus on providing bindery services to libraries. Services typically provided by these companies include binding of paperbacks, journals, and loose-leaf publications held in library collections. <P> Bideries that primarily serve the publishing and printing industries are listed under <a href="/Business/Industries/Printing/Bindery/">Business/Industries/Printing/Bindery/</a>

entries.title: Information_Technology
entries.description: <p>This category is for sites about Information Technology, a term which refers to the use of a variety of computer and other technologies, and their associated business practices, to support efficient and effective business operations </p> <p><i>The editors reserve the right not to list your site, and to delete it after its addition. Multiple submissions, especially to inappropriate categories, will not be tolerated. </i></p>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category consists of links to associations intended for information technology professionals in business.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: This category lists sites announcing Conferences, Expos, Trade Shows and Seminars where the main focus is Information Technology. Both sites announcing single events and sites covering series of events are listed.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: <p>This category is for sites related to Information Technology consulting. </p> <p>Consultants have many roles, varying from a supportive one within an existing team, to providing temporary leadership over an identified problem area, to other independent activities conducted at the request of the organization. </p>

entries.title: Consultant_CVs
entries.description: CVs of individual consultants

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for Information technology directory sites.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: This category lists the sites that offer job resources and resumes related to the Information Technology industry.

entries.title: Job_Search
entries.description: Resources that allow job seekers to search for jobs in information technology.

entries.title: Recruitment_and_Staffing
entries.description: This category is for web sites related to firms that provide Information Technology recruitment, staffing and employee search services internationally.

entries.title: Executive_Search
entries.description: This category contains sites which are related to firms specializing in multi-national Information Technology executive search, typically for senior management and board level positions.

entries.title: Recruiters
entries.description: <p>This category contains sites which are related to firms specializing in international Information Technology recruiting. </p> <p>Recruiters are professionals or firms that conduct searches for employees for client companies, usually on a contingency basis. Recruiters research, source, interview and recommend candidates to their clients. Fees are paid by potential employers, not by candidates, as recruiters are not employment agencies. </p>

entries.title: Staffing_Services
entries.description: <p>This category contains sites which are related to multi-national staffing firms and employment agencies specializing in the placement of temporary and/or permanent Information Technology personnel. </p>

entries.title: Regional
entries.description: This category is for web sites which cover Information Technology employment information or offer IT employment services to a specific region or country.

entries.title: Application_Development
entries.description: On the example of a Cics Application Developer we'd like to show those who don't what a application developer does: - Develop and modify existing applications - CICS Java environment, Java wrapper for a COBOL applications - Develop a web front end using servlets, JSP and JavaBeans - Link the web front end to an existing COBOL application using CORBA - Write Visual Basic applications to develop a customer GUI - CICS Client ECI call - Develop Java applications using Swing as an MQSeries Client - Use the MQSeries-CICS bridge to access an existing COBOL application - Debug CICS applications

entries.title: Internet_Development
entries.description: IT Professionals with Skills in: - Web environment, monitors, and browsers - HTML and Server Side Includes, including browser support for every tag and attribute - GIF, JPEG and PNG graphics, including designing with the Web Palette - Multimedia and interactivity, including audio, video, Flash, Shockwave, and JavaScript - Cascading Style Sheets, browser compatibility information - HTML tags, attributes, deprecated tags, proprietary tags, and CSS compatibility

entries.title: Management
entries.description: This category is for resume websites of Information Technology managers, directors, and executives.

entries.title: Network_Administration
entries.description: For those who don't know what a Network Admin does versus a Sysadmin: - Designing an IP network - Evaluating equipment and vendors - Selecting routing protocols - Configuring common interior protocols (RIP, OSPF, EIGRP) - Connecting to external networks and configuring exterior protocols (BGP) - Ongoing network management: troubleshooting and maintenance - Security and privacy issues - Configuring network and serial hardware - Domain Name Services - Serial line communications using SLIP and PPP - NIS and NFS - Taylor UUCP - Administering electronic mail, including sendmail and Exim - Administering Netnews, including INN and several news readers - Firewalling using ipfwadm, ipchains, and iptables (netfilter) - Masquerading and accounting - IPX configuration for a Novell Netware network General and advanced configuration, including DHCP, DNS, WINS, routing, and RAS.

entries.title: Systems_Administration
entries.description: User account administration, including managing large numbers of accounts on NT, Unix or Apple Servers. Creating file systems, including striped and fault-tolerant file systems, and securing their contents from unauthorized access. Sharing file systems via the network, using Windows NT's native share facility and other facilities such as Samba and NFS. Managing printers, including local printers, network printers, and printer pools. Managing processes, including the Windows NT schedule service, as well as performance optimization and capacity planning. Securing Windows NT systems, including implementing security policies and system auditing. Automating system administration tasks with scripts.

entries.title: Imaging
entries.description: <p>This category is for web sites related to businesses that sell imaging hardware or services, <b>except</b> imaging consultants. </p> <p>Document imaging is the conversion of paper documents into electronic images. Learn more about document imaging: <br><a href="/Computers/Software/Document_Imaging/faq.html">FAQ</a> <br><a href="/Computers/Software/Document_Imaging/desc.html">Description</a> </p>

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Providing selected web sites and links to other sections of the Open Directory that contain listings of news and information sources on Information Technology, including news about computers and the internet.

entries.title: Columnists
entries.description: Computer/Internet/technology columnists in both the popular and(to a lesser extent thus far)the trade press. Usually, the sites have the current column as well as an archive of past columns (To be included the columnist must have, at the very least, a static URL). The name of the author is followed by the name of the column.

entries.title: Weblogs

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category is for the webpages of international consultancies.

entries.title: Political_and_Economic_Risk
entries.description: Political and economic risk consultants provide information and analysis on how certain political, economic or social developments within a country or region will affect their clients' operations. Therefore, some, but by no means all, of the issues that could be covered by a political and economic risk consultant would be the impact and/or likelihood of war, debt repayment problems, labour unrest, electoral results, coups, terrorism and corruption.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: A directory is a guide or list of resources, not an individual business. Directories are compilation of websites containing comprehensive indexes or lists of general business resources, companies, and company related information. Users should be able to visit the listed directories and obtain information about business and commerce between nations.

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: This is the general category for all import and export related service companies, including agents, traders, consultants, trade portals and other intermediaries.

entries.description: This category should contain General Business and Commerce Associations that deal with business between nations, to promote and facilitate Import and Export. General Business and Commerce Associations that deal specifically with business within a country, should be found at that country's regional business category, for example: Regional/North_America/Canada/Business_and_Economy/Associations/ Other Industry Specific Associations are found as a subcategory of the Industry such as Business/Industries/(Insert Industry Name)/Associations

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: A directory is a guide or list of resources, not an individual business. Directories are compilation of websites containing comprehensive indexes or lists of general business resources, companies, and company related information. Users should be able to visit the listed directories and obtain information about business and commerce engaged in Import and Export Industry.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: "A Resources directory is analogous to the Reference Room of a library." Resources which assist, or of use to persons involved in, or learning about the Import and Export Industry.

entries.title: International_Organization_for_Standardization_-_ISO
entries.description: The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) is a worldwide federation of national standards bodies from some 100 countries, one from each country. ISO is a non-governmental organization established in 1947. The mission of ISO is to promote the development of standardization and related activities in the world with a view to facilitating the international exchange of goods and services, and to developing cooperation in the spheres of intellectual, scientific, technological and economic activity. ISO's work results in international agreements which are published as International Standards. ISO is not an acronym for International Organization for Standardization, but a Greek word meaning equal. (remember isoceles triangles from school, meaning equal sided), and is valid in English, French and Russian, the three official languages of ISO.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category includes firms and individual consultants that offer services with respect to ISO standards. These services may include, but are not limited to, advice, guidance, implementation and certification. For consultants whose services are limited to the ISO 9000 standard only, a specific category exists under that standard.

entries.title: International_Taxation
entries.description: Informational sites, resources and consultants that deal with international taxation issues. Sites that pertain to individual countries should be listed under the appropriate business or regional category.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: Web sites for organizations and companies that provide services which facilitate international trade and business. Services that are specific to a certain industry or region should be listed in their appropriate regional or industry category.

entries.title: Marketing
entries.description: This category lists web sites which provide marketing related services for those involved in international business or trade.

entries.title: Investing

translations.tha: การลงทุน

entries.description: <p align=center> <table bgcolor="#ffffcc" cellpadding=6 border="0"> <tr><td> <small>Before submitting your site, please review the <a href="/Business/desc.html">Guidelines for Submitting a Site</a>.</small> </td></tr> </table> </p> Any investment related site may apply for placement here. Check subdirectories: Brokerages, Chats and Forums, Commodities, Companies, Day Trading, Games, International, Investment Guides, Managed futures, Mutual Funds, Options, Organizations, Publications, Retirement Planning, Socially Responsible, Software, Stocks, and so on. Please do not submit your site to more than one category. Please do not try to use different URL's to receive more than one listing. If you have a site pertaining to venture capital, please submit that to <a href=http://dmoz.org/Business/Financial_Services/Venture_Capital">Business: Financial Services: Venture Capital</a>.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category contains websites of international associations in the finance or investing industry. Typically these associations are fora in which common standards and legal agreements are composed, and in which prices sources and their backups specified.

entries.title: Brokerages
entries.description: Brokerage firms that offer services to the public for trading stocks, bonds, and/or mutual funds as well as speculative instruments. Such firms usually charge a commission for carrying out the purchase, sale, trade or disposition of securities or other assets for which they are licensed.

entries.title: Chats_and_Forums
entries.description: Online discussions, and trading-related chats and message boards.

entries.title: Full_Service
entries.description: Full Service brokerage firms usually offer investment advice, stock and bond portfolio management, research and stock recommendations, and typically have a physical address where a client can meet with a broker or representative. To be listed in this category the firm needs to have offices, real or virtual in the United States.

entries.title: Online_Brokers

entries.title: Alternative_Trading_Systems_ECNs
entries.description: An alternative trading system (ATS), as the name suggests, provides the means for investors to execute transactions in the capital markets, usually via the Internet or a private network, without using traditional exchanges. Often known as ECNs (electronic communication/crossing networks), ECNs usually cater for stock trades but also exist for bonds, syndicated loans and foreign exchange (FX).

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Trading systems are used to trade stocks or derivatives via a computer with out user intervention. They issue buy and sell signals based on complex mathematical models.

entries.title: Chats_and_Forums
entries.description: Online discussions, and investment chats and message boards.

entries.title: Clearing_Houses_and_Securities_Depositories
entries.description: In some financial markets there are Clearing Houses. These act as central counterparties, and thus reduce or eliminate settlement risk, and often allow netting of transactions.

entries.title: Commodities_and_Futures
entries.description: Websites about commodities, futures, derivatives, and options on futures. Before submitting your site, please review the <a href="/Business/desc.html">Guidelines for Submitting a Site</a>. The futures markets evolved because of the necessity to control price fluctuations, large differences between supply and demand, and to minimize price risk to producers and merchandisers. The commodity exchanges bring buyers and sellers together so they can agree on a price. This is done by open out cry, and computerized trading. Bid/Ask information is readily accessible so prices are better able to reflect realistic economic conditions.

entries.title: General
entries.description: Advisory services that cover a range of topics and methods or congregate advisories from several sources.

entries.title: Brokerages
entries.description: Commodity Brokerages.

entries.description: Brokerages listed here specialize only in <b>deep discount</b> commodities and futures trading.

entries.title: Managed_Accounts
entries.description: Companies listed here specialize in Managed Futures or are Commodity Pool Operators. Managed Futures and Commodity Pool Operators raise money to be traded in large blocks and make all trading decisions for money under their control. They publish their track record and are required to register this information with the National Futures Association.

entries.title: Performance_Data
entries.description: Sites that report the performance of Commodity Trading Advisors and Commodity Pool Operators.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Sites that focus on listing resources for the commodity markets.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Sites that focus on education and training for investors that wish to learn more about trading commodities & futures.

entries.title: Forex
entries.description: Forex or Foreign Exchange covers instruments employed to facilitate payments between countries: currency notes, checks or electronic transfers.

entries.title: Brokerages
entries.description: Brokerages that specialize in forex (currency) trading for profit and investment purposes.

entries.title: Chats_and_Forums

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Sites that provide general information about the foreign currency market, offer training courses and seminars for forex traders/investors.

entries.description: Sites that provide forex market news and live coverage, as well as forex related periodic publications and e-zines.

entries.description: Sites which provide a comprehensive overview of foreign currency trading or investing. Sites may contain references to other more specific sources of information and tools.

entries.description: Find links to sites for or about future brokers.

entries.title: Chats_and_Forums
entries.description: Online discussions, and chats and message boards about futures.

entries.title: Precious_Metals
entries.description: Websites related to investing in precious metals. There are numerous ways to invest in precious metals, including: owning the metal itself; owning a certificate that is backed by physical metal; owning shares in mining companies; owning precious metals through Exchange Traded Funds; and owning precious metals within your own Independent Retirement Account (IRA). There is more than one way of putting precious metals into your IRA (you can store physical metal at a specialized IRA Custodian) or you can buy mining shares, precious metal trusts, or Exchange Traded Funds that specialize in precious metals. A number of Bullion Dealers are listed here. These dealers specialise in buying and selling precious metal bullion based on current market spot prices. Bullion dealers do not usually offer historical coins at premium "collectors' prices". If you are not sure which investment vehicle is best for you then you should try to find out more about investing in precious metals by doing some research and/or speaking with a financial advisor.

entries.title: Gold
entries.description: Gold is one of the most valuable substances in the world, and has been for thousands of years. Sites about investing gold can be found in this category.

entries.title: Mining_Stocks_and_Shares
entries.description: Websites specializing in how to invest in mining stocks and shares. Also websites about mutual funds that invest in mining equities.

entries.title: Silver
entries.description: Websites related to silver investment. Of all the precious metals silver has the most potential to increase in value. Supply has been greater than demand for decades.

entries.title: Day_Trading
entries.description: Day trading has seen rapid growth in the past few years, especially online day trading. See sites with revolutionary ideas in the online day trading field.

entries.title: Brokerages
entries.description: Brokerage Firms offering services in Day Trading, either specializing in Day Trading or seeking Day Trading investors.

entries.title: Derivatives
entries.description: Derivatives are financial instruments, such as futures and options, which derive their value from underlying securities including bonds, bills, currencies, and equities. This category lists businesses and services related primarily to investing in derivatives.

entries.title: Options
entries.description: Typically, Investment "options" are rights to buy or sell some underlying instrument. The "call" is typically the right, but not the obligation, to buy the underlying instrument and the "Put" is the right, but not the obligation, to sell the underlying instrument. Except for stock covered calls, this class of investments can lead to the total loss of one's money and therefore, education and experience in investing should be prerequisites for entering option transactions.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Please include only newspapers, magazines, blogs, and web sites that cover options trading. Sites not listed in this category include:

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: This category shall include websites whose primary content is related to education and training specific to the topic of investing (not general business topics). Suitable websites would include commercial and non-commercial sites where the majority of the content is related to investment education and training, including educational articles, glossaries, books and videos, both online and offline training courses and seminars, and investing simulation resources. This category shall focus primarily on education and training pertaining to investing or trading in stocks, bonds, mutual funds, and other “paper” assets.

entries.title: Funds
entries.description: This category refers to collective investment vehicles. For business-funding services, please visit Business/Financial_Services/Investment_Services/

entries.title: ETFs_and_CEFs
entries.description: A closed-end fund (CEF) is a fund that doesn't redeem and sell new shares continuously, as open-end funds do. It is traded at a stock exchange, as if it was ordinary stock, and usually sells at a premium or discount with respect to the value of its underlying assets (i.e. net-asset value o NAV). An exchange-traded fund (ETF) also trades in a stock exchange, like a CEF. But it is open-end, like a mutual fund, so it doesn't suffer price variations with respect to its NAV. ETFs and CEFs are the vehicles of choice for fund investors who operate through a stock broker.

entries.title: Closed-End_Funds
entries.description: This category lists individual closed-end funds and CEF families. Closed-end (or "close-end") funds (CEFs) are distinguished from open-end funds (eg., mutual funds and exchange-traded funds) because they don't increase available shares as investment dollars received by the fund come in. Moreover, with open-ended funds, the quantity of shares decreases when investors withdraw money by selling shares. This is the basis of some investors preferring certain, specific kinds of well managed closed end funds. Its manager has the freedom to avoid selling illiquid, slowly traded shares they hold and further protects the closed end from massive "all at once" liquidations. However, buyers must learn the ropes, because being closed end in no way assures the quality of the managers or the investment potential of the fund. Another major difference between CEFs and mutual funds, is that the shares of the former are traded in stock exchanges, as if they were ordinary company stock.

entries.title: Exchange-Traded_Funds
entries.description: This category lists individual exchange-traded funds (ETFs) and ETF families. Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) are open-end funds that trade in real-time in stock exchanges, like if they were ordinary company stock. They combine some of the advantages of stocks with those of mutual funds. ETFs are generally based on tax-efficient indices, and are therefore good choices for passive, buy-and-hold investment strategies. Unlike stocks, which cannot be shorted on a 'down-tick', they can be shorted on a down-tick. Moreover, unlike mutual funds, ETFs can have stop and/or limit orders.

entries.title: Fund_Companies
entries.description: Investment companies that manage, sell and market collective investments known as funds.

entries.title: Guides
entries.description: Guiding information related to investment funds, including tutorials, commented directories and research data.

entries.title: Hedge_Funds
entries.description: Hedge funds are open-end funds of different kinds, that are traded through their management companies or intermediaries, and differ from mutual funds because they are not as heavily regulated, thus being suitable for large investments (in the order of 1 million US dollars or more). Hedge funds traditionally have used models of risk management intended to offset one form of risk by another form of risk reduction through, for example, instruments that do not correlate with each other. However, the popularity of the concept, as well as their acceptance outside of U.S. jurisdictions, has resulted in websites and businesses offering services, products or other resources concerning hedge funds that may not manage risk or may entail increased risk.

entries.title: Information_and_Service_Providers
entries.description: Sites which are part of the hedge-fund industry, but which are not actual hedge-funds companies. They include those that specialize in hedge funds, such as accountants, lawyers and information providers.

entries.title: Managers_and_Advisors
entries.description: Companies and individuals offering money-management and advising services related to investing in funds, including managed-account services but not including fund companies, which can be found at <Business/Investing/Funds/Fund_Companies/> and the subcategories indicated there.

entries.title: Mutual_Funds
entries.description: Mutual funds are a kind of open-end collective investment vehicles. "Open end" refers to their shares being created and redeemed continuously, according to the demand from investors. Shares of mutual funds are bought and sold through the fund companies and fund supermarkets, unlike exchange-traded and closed-end funds, which are traded at stock exchanges. Their difference with hedge funds is that they are heavily regulated, to make them adequate for smaller investors who don't have the amount of information and financial strength necessary to get involved in the strategies used by some hedge funds.

entries.title: Fund_Families
entries.description: When a mutual fund company offers two or more mutual funds, it is considered to have a "Family" of funds. Most Fund Families are composed of numerous, categorized, specific mutual funds.

entries.title: Foreign_Funds
entries.description: Mutual funds offered in and regulated by countries other than the United States.

entries.title: Individual_Funds
entries.description: Web sites for individual mutual funds.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: News services, newspapers, books, magazines, e-zines and journals about mutual funds.

entries.title: Newsletters
entries.description: Investing newsletters typically provide buy and sell recommendations, market commentary, and sometimes articles on a weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly basis. It is a way for investors to manage money on their own with the guidance of a professional system. This category is dedicated to newsletters that focus on using mutual funds.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: News services, newspapers, books, magazines, e-zines and journals about investment funds.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: Companies that provide services for companies operating in the investment fund industry. For business-funding services, please visit <a href="http://www.dmoz.org/Business/Financial_Services/Investment_Services/">Business/Financial_Services/Investment_Services/</a>. For end-user services related to investment funds, we refer you to <a href="http://www.dmoz.org/Business/Investing/Funds/">Business/Investing/Funds/</a> and its other subcategories.

entries.title: Games
entries.description: Simulated Investment training sites as well as investing games one can play.

entries.title: Hollywood_Stock_Exchange
entries.description: The Hollywood Stock Exchange is a fun stock market simulation game played on the web with about 200,000 registered users and about 30-40 thousand active traders. These links are to additional reference material which go beyond the basic site by HSX Entertainment, most of which are by devoted fans of the game. Some additional links are listed which are useful for fans of the game.

entries.title: Box_Office_Numbers
entries.description: The Box Office numbers are vital to actually playing the Hollywood Stock Exchange, as the value of the Movie Stocks are based upon how much the movie brings in for gross box office dollars. Links here are for both current top movies in release as well as historical data for comparison research.

entries.title: Fan_Pages
entries.description: These sites are generally non-commercial (some exceptions) web pages devoted to active fans, generally with daily updates in their page contents. A need exists to break up this category, and possibly rank the better sites. If there are suggestions, please contact the editors.

entries.title: New_Player_Help
entries.description: New Players are encouraged to explore the links in this category, which will contain FAQs for HSX as well as new player tutorials. The key to doing well at playing HSX is to read, learn, and study from the players doing well themselves.

entries.title: Related_Games
entries.description: This category will probably change quite a bit. For now, it is dedicated to collecting links for web-based games similar to HSX but are not directly related. If there is enough development in some of these other web sites, perhaps the Hollywood Stock Exchange category will be changed to include all movie-based webgames. If you have any ideas for the organization of this directory, please e-mail the editors.

entries.title: Guides
entries.description: Sites aimed at instructing, teaching, offering extensive reviews and/or critiques of investing. Includes "How to" invest.

entries.title: Regional
entries.description: Investing guides corresponding to a particular region of the world (eg., a continent, country or city).

entries.title: Humor
entries.description: Humor and jokes about investing.

entries.title: Money_Managers
entries.description: A Money Manager firm is paid a fee to supervise and make the investment decisions of others. The term is normally used in reference to the asset manager of large institutions such as bank trust departments, pension funds, insurance companies and mutual funds. However, it may also be applied to those firms who manage the investment assets of smaller individual investors as well. Money Mangers may also be known as Investment Managers, Investment Advisers, or Investment Advisors.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Portfolio Management software is used by both professional and individual investors to better understand, track, construct and communicate the dynamics and performance of a financial portfolio.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Investment news services or resources with a significant portion of investment news.

entries.title: Magazines_and_E-zines
entries.description: All publications available to the general reader which cover investing. See appropriate sub categories for more information.

entries.title: Newsletters
entries.description: News letters with investment information or advice. Readers should realize that the newsletters in the field of investing range in quality and reliability from ones that are written by fully licensed and regulated financial professionals (with excellent long term track records) as well as by writers with virtually no financial background but who may have taken this on as a hobby or business (for example, offering advice from their limited personal experience). Check independent reviewers for background, longevity and performance of funds and please read the fine print of any site you visit if you are more than a casual "browser."

entries.title: Real_Estate
entries.description: Information on Investing in Real Estate. <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>All local and regional real estate agents, agencies, and businesses</b> are listed in the <a href="/Regional">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town where their office is located. This is discussed further in the <a href="/guidelines/regional/realestate.html">real estate guidelines</a>.</li> <li><b>Mortgage</b> sites are listed under <a href="/Business/Financial_Services/Mortgages/">Business: Financial_Services: Mortgages</a>.</li> <li>Establishments primarily engaged in <b>construction and land development</b> are classified under <a href="/Business/Construction_and_Maintenance/">Business: Construction and Maintenance</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Auctions
entries.description: Find links to sites specifically related to purchasing real estate through the auction method.

entries.title: Chats_and_Forums
entries.description: Online discussions, and chats and message boards about Real Estate investments.

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: Find links to sites offering information on commercial real estate investments. This category lists companies offering information on investing in commercial real estate, it does not hold listings for individual properties for sale. Property for sale and real estate agents should be submitted to <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> in the proper locale or country category.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: This category includes sites featuring schools, training classes, seminars, workshops and courseware focused on real estate investing. It does not include sites limited to books or blogs.

entries.title: Exchanges
