entries.description: Qualified Intermediaries administer Internal Revenue code Section 1031 Tax Deferred Exchange transactions.

entries.title: Replacement_Property_Services
entries.description: These websites provide assistance with locating and identifying replacement properties for taxpayers' IRC Section 1031 Tax Deferred Exchange transactions.

entries.title: Foreclosures
entries.description: This category lists sites related to real property investing through the purchase of foreclosures. It does not list sites offering assistance or information for those with homes going into foreclosure or real estate agents selling foreclosures.

entries.title: Bank_Owned
entries.description: Properties that have previously been foreclosed on and the lender was the successful purchaser at the foreclosure auction. These properties are now listed for sale. Some lenders use Real Estate Brokers to handle all transactions, while a few are selling direct to the public; thus reducing commissions, and lowering the cost of the property.

entries.title: Service_Providers
entries.description: Websites offering various foreclosure related services - commercial and non-profit - to lenders and financially distressed homeowners.

entries.title: Guides_and_Calculators
entries.description: Find links to sites for or about real estate investing in general, investment calculators, and other useful resources for property investors. Please note, sites relevant to a specific region should be submitted to the proper Real Estate category in <a href="http://dmoz.org/editors/editcat.cgi?cat=Regional">Regional</a>.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, magazines, newsletters and e-zines which deal exclusively with real estate investing.

entries.title: Real_Estate_Investment_Trusts
entries.description: See the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_estate_investment_trust">Wikipedia "Real estate investment trust" article</a> for an explanation of REITs. This category contains links to individual companies that are REITs.

entries.title: Investment_Models
entries.description: Quantitative approach toward investing using numeric screens to isolate specific variables and relationships.

entries.title: Quotes
entries.description: These sites specialize in stock market quotes and historical price data.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Software allowing users to perform their own charting or technical analysis of financial data.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Business: Investing: Resources:

entries.title: Clubs
entries.description: Individuals who band together, typically to pool their investment monies or knowledge. Various resources to support those investment clubs.

entries.title: Retirement_Planning
entries.description: Businesses which sell retirement planning services or products to individuals. 'Get Rich Quick' or 'Secrets to Retirement Riches' or similar entries are not likely to be listed. Free advice or information related to retirement planning is best found in Home/Consumers/Consumer_Education/Financial/

entries.title: Socially_Responsible
entries.description: Socially responsible investing (SRI), ethical investing, or sustainable investing is practiced by individuals and institutions. The strategies incorporate environmental, social, governance criteria in the investment process. Such criteria may be applied via screening of portfolios, shareowner advocacy or activism campaigns, and community development investing. A distinct form of investing, sustainable investing (or SRI) has matured into a rapidly growing global industry and community.

entries.title: Associations_and_Directories
entries.description: Associations and directories primarily focused on one or more of the key areas of sustainable, socially responsible, or ethical investing.

entries.title: Community_Investing
entries.description: Community investing is one of the four key strategies of socially responsible investors. Community development financial institutions' primary business is supporting local economic empowerment, reducing poverty, financing affordable housing, and job creation. Such a bank, credit union, or other financial institution may work within a small locality, regionally, or globally.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: Annual or more often recurring conferences primarily focused on one or more of the key areas of sustainable, socially responsible, or ethical investing.

entries.title: Financial_and_Investment_Advisors
entries.description: Financial planners, investment advisors, brokers, and other advisors whose primary service is providing sustainable, socially responsible, or ethical investing, and related services to individuals and sometimes institutions.

entries.title: Money_Managers
entries.description: Managers routinely utilizing one or more of the major sustainable, socially responsible, or ethical investing strategies. These are money management firms primarily engaged in day-to-day management for individual separate accounts, mutual funds, pensions, and other institutions. Could be a significant special department in a traditional investment management firm providing these services.

entries.title: Mutual_Funds
entries.description: Sustainable, socially responsible, and ethical mutual funds that disclose in their prospectus or offering circular non-financial investment management techniques such as screening, shareholder advocacy, and community investing. Such funds may have narrowly focused or broad-reaching screens and/or investment activities.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: News services, newspapers, books, magazines and e-zines, and journals dedicated to socially responsible, ethical, and sustainable investing.

entries.title: Research
entries.description: Professional papers, studies, projects, and summaries pertaining to sustainable, socially responsible, or ethical investing. Institutional research services and resources for professionals involved in socially responsible or ethical investing.

entries.title: Shareholder_Advocacy
entries.description: Shareholder advocacy is one of the four key strategies used by sustainable, socially responsible, and ethical investors. Organizations listed here are primarily in the business of providing general services and information to institutions and individuals involved in shareholder advocacy work, related campaigns, and strategies.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Investment software includes commercial as well as noncommercial software products that are intended to assist some area of investor functions. NOTE: Software producers in the investing arena may or may not have any financial training or expertise. There is virtually no regulation or fidcuciary licensing of many of these products.

entries.title: Back_Office
entries.description: The software, services and products listed here must bring benefits to traditional and alternative asset managers for financial investments and portfolio management including trading , mid-office and back-office. This directory only deals with corporate software and software providers.

entries.title: Consultants
entries.description: Consultancy practices providing services related to Institutional and Back Office investment (business) software.

entries.title: Events,_Conferences_and_Shows
entries.description: Public Events, Conferences and Trade Shows relating to the (Financial) Institutional and Back Office software Industry

entries.title: Magazines_and_Listings
entries.description: Magazine and Listing sites for Institutional and Back Office software, consultants and software providers

entries.title: Product_Providers
entries.description: Listing of software provider company names (not the software)

entries.title: Stocks_and_Bonds
entries.description: Business:Investing:Stocks and Bonds is intended as a broad category of publicly available equities. Please see subdirectories herein for where your submitted web site might best be placed.

entries.title: Bonds
entries.description: Bonds are debt instruments that typically can be rated as to quality and the amount of income they produce over specific time period.

entries.title: Chats_and_Forums
entries.description: Online discussions, and equities (stocks or shares) related chats and message boards.

entries.title: Newsletters
entries.description: Find links to newsletters specifically pertaining to equity investments.

entries.title: Exchanges
entries.description: Formally called "exchanges," this category may include broad and inclusive trading systems such as the "NASDAQ," as well as conventional exchanges such as New York Stock Exchange.

entries.title: Management

translations.tha: การจัดการ

entries.description: The Management category is a directory of resource sites containing information related to the broad field of management. This category will contain a combination of informational sites broadly related to management theory and its application, of interest to managers and related professionals, and it will also contain listings of practitioners engaged in some aspect of management (companies, governmental, academic). Check subdirectories for specific topics.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This sub-category is for Business Process Analysis software and applications only. Services, publications and other Business Process material should be submitted elsewhere.

entries.title: Business_Transformation
entries.description: The Business Transformation category is a directory of resource sites pertaining to the planned reframing, redesign, restructuring, revitalization and renewal of organizations. This directory will include coverage for a broad range of theories, applications and resources related to business and organizational transformation including: Reengineering; Reorganization and Organizational Design; Organizational Improvement; Process Improvement & Organizational/Process Mapping; Performance Measurement (including Balanced Scorecard, Efficiency/Effectiveness); Total Quality Management; and other related topics.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: For web sites of firms or individuals providing or relating to the provision of consultation services or products to manager(s) of businesses.

entries.title: Business_Relocation
entries.description: This category includes professional services firms and management consultants that assist corporations with their decision to locate a facility or office in any geographic location of the world. Also known as site selection consultants. This category is not for moving-related services or economic development agencies. Companies that provide services relating to moving, employee adjustment, financing, project management, or facility-related services should be listed in one of the following: Business: Business Services: Corporate Relocation Business: Business Services: Corporate Relocation: Moving Business: Industries: Construction and Maintenance: Consulting: Facility Management Business: Real Estate: Consultants: Tenant Relocation Companies that provide these services for a specific city (e.g. relocating to Atlanta) should be listed in the appropriate Regional directory. Economic development agencies or chambers of commerce that seek to recruit companies to their community should be listed in: Business: Real Estate: Commercial: Economic Development Agencies

entries.title: Facilities_Relocation
entries.description: Companies that move offices, facilities, or equipment as part of the relocation of a business or business division

entries.title: Site_Selection_Consulting
entries.description: Consulting firms that specialize in the strategy behind business location decisions

entries.title: Executive_Coaching
entries.description: Executive coaching focuses on helping business executives improve their performance. This category is not for consultants or trainers who have programs, training, books, or seminars to offer. Instead executive coaching is only for sites whose primary aim is to support executives accomplish business focused goals.

entries.title: Small-Medium_Sized_Businesses
entries.description: This is a specialized listing of individuals and companies providing business management consulting services to small and medium sized firms. _____ Small Business is defined as those generating less than five million in sales per year. _____ Sites listed in this area may include large and small consulting firms focused on providing management consulting services and resources to sole proprietors and small to medium sized businesses. Sites representing independent consultants, partnerships, private practices, and very small firms should be listed under the category: Independent or Private Practice. Please also review: <a href="/Business/desc.html">general guidelines</a>. Please review other related business management consulting categories before determining where your website should be listed.

entries.title: Cross-Cultural
entries.description: Cross-cultural communication education and training can include cross-cultural training of ex-patriates, cultural sensitivity training, and briefings.

entries.title: Time_Management
entries.description: This category is designed for individuals and organizations who offer training in time management to businesses, organizations, and/or individuals. <p> If time management training is your specialty, or is an integral part of your service offerings, then feel free to submit your site. We look forward to reviewing your site for inclusion in the directory!

entries.title: Resumes
entries.description: This category contains individual resumes of Management professionals, from students to well-known established executives.

entries.title: Ethics
entries.description: This category is for sites which promote, teach or inform in the area of organizational and managerial principles, beliefs and practices which lead to a greater degree of integrity and business ethics.

entries.title: Leadership
entries.description: The category covers information on theory and research oriented toward increasing our knowledge of the many different varieties of leadership. Within the category, providers are divided into two major subcategories: consulting & coaching and training & development. Sites can have services or products oriented toward developing skills that help leaders run organizations, build teams, and positively influence individuals.

entries.title: Articles
entries.description: Information on leadership and its development.

entries.title: Assessments
entries.description: Developing ability is helped by having a understand of where on is at the moment. The category of for different types of assessments on can use to better understand one's strengths and weaknesses.

entries.title: Articles
entries.description: Information on leadership and its development

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Listing of societies, organizations and associations with the primary charter to study or provide programs to members in the area of leadership and its development.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Businesses offering education and/or training about management leadership.

entries.title: Seminars_and_Workshops
entries.description: For service providers who specialize in day programs directed related to leadership or for training organizations that have unique one-day programs.

entries.title: Executive
entries.description: This category is designed for information of special interest to executives in large organizations or the upper ranks of small-medium sized enterprises.

entries.title: Management_Science
entries.description: The Management Science category is a directory of sites pertaining to the theory and application of the science of management and related topics.

entries.title: Management_Information_Systems
entries.description: This is a directory of sites that are related to academic scholarships in Management Information System (MIS). According to G. Davis and M. Olson in <em>Management Information Systems</em> (1984, p. 5-6): <dl> <dd> <em> There is no consensus of the definition of the term "management information system". Some writers prefer alternative terminology such as "information processing system", "information and decision system", "organizational information system", or simply "information system" to refer to the computer-based information processing system which supports the operations, management, and decision-making functions of an organization [...]. <p> A definition of a management information system, as the term is generally understood, is <b>an integrated, user-machine system for providing information to support operations, management, and decision-making functions in an organization. The system utilizes computer hardware and software; manual procedures; models for analysis planning, control and decision making; and a database</b>. [...] </em> </dl>

entries.title: Call_For_Papers
entries.description: The Call For Papers category is a directory of sites that are related to academic scholarships in Management Information Systems, especially for Call for Papers and Call for Chapters.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: The Conferences category is a directory of sites that are related to academic scholarships in Management Information Systems, especially for Conferences and Proceedings.

entries.title: MISQ
entries.description: This category is a directory of sites that are related to <a href="http://www.misq.org/">MISQ Central</a>, "an electronic production of the peer reviewed scholarly journal, MIS Quarterly (MISQ).".

entries.title: Online_Articles
entries.description: The Online Articles category is a directory of sites that are related to academic scholarships in Management Information Systems.

entries.title: WorkingPapers
entries.description: A Working Paper Directory in Information Systems

entries.title: Online_Courses
entries.description: Online Courses in MIS

entries.title: Regional
entries.description: MIS around the world.

entries.title: Online_Articles
entries.description: For online articles related to management, including research material, how to improve, management development and related topics, like performance appraisal/management.

entries.title: Online_Courses
entries.description: Online Courses in Management Science.

entries.title: Personal_Pages
entries.description: This is an experimental directory of sites that are related to notable academics in Management Science.

entries.title: Organizational_Change
entries.description: The Organizational Change category is a directory of sites pertaining to the leading and managing change in organizations of all types. This directory will include coverage for a broad range of theories, applications and resources related to business and organizational change, but all sites listed here should be primarily focused upon leading or managing change from that broad perspective.

entries.title: Organizational_Development
entries.description: Organizational Development (OD) is concerned with <b>planned change</b> in an organizational context. OD is <b>applied behavioral science</b> targeted at changing the total organization or system. The major <b>goal</b> of OD is increased organizational effectiveness and individual development. <p> <b>Culture</b> and <b>process</b> are typical high priority targets of OD. Culture consists of basic assumptions, values, and norms of behavior that are viewed as the correct way to perceive, think, and feel. As culture has a heavy influence on both thinking and feeling even in highly technical/scientific fields, culture change is seen as necessary for lasting organizational improvement/ change/ transformation. <p>Primary distinguishing characteristics of OD include: <ul> <li>Focus on culture and process. <li>Encourages <b>collaboration</b> between leaders and members in managing culture and process. <li><b>Teams</b> and groups are typical targets of intervention. <li>Focus on the human and social aspects of the organization and in so doing also intervenes in the technological and structural aspects. <li><b>Problem solving</b> and <b>decision making</b> at all levels. <li><b>System</b> thinking and total system change. <li>Goal to improve the organizations ability to solve its own problems. <li><b>Continuous learning</b> and self-reflection / <b>self-analysis</b>. <li>Action Research - a participative model of iterative diagnosis and taking action. <li>Seeks the betterment of both individuals and the organization. </ul> <p>Topics or fields that use methods also used in OD include: the learning organization, change management, organizational transformation, knowledge management, leadership, meeting facilitation/ effective meetings, process analysis, process improvement and business process re-engineering (BPR), strategic planning, total quality improvement, team building. Most of these topics or fields have their own sub-categories in the directory.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Consultants, trainers, services, instruments, games, literature, software and other products in the field of organizational development.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Find links to schools and institutions offering project and program management certificates and degrees.

entries.title: Risk_Management
entries.description: "Risk Management - Is the practice of adjusting exposures for the firm's positions or portfolios. It tries to stabilize variability of returns while trimming large - dominant - net exposures as well. It can also be used to secure more favorable financing for inventories or pricing of securities or commodities." - Barkley's Financial Glossary

entries.title: Best_Practice
entries.description: This is for sites that specialize in Best Practices for Service Management Software. Best practices would include ITIL, PRINCE, and COBIT.

entries.title: Customer_Relationship_Management
entries.description: This category contains sites which describe software specific to managing customer relationships in the context of service management.

entries.title: Warranty_Management
entries.description: This category contains sites with particular focus upon general warranty management software.

entries.title: Strategic_Management
entries.description: Resources for Strategic Planning. ----------- This category is devoted to Strategic Planning: a process by which we can envision the future and develop the necessary procedures and operations to influence and achieve that future. The strategic plan answers six primary questions: Why are we in business? How do we do business? Where are we now? Where do we want to be? How can we get there? How will we know we've arrived? Commercial sites are listed to the extent that they are not just promotional but actually contain information or resources of value to those interested in strategic planning.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category is for web sites related to consultants specializing in strategic planning.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: The <b>Strategic Planning News and Media</b> category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, magazines, and e-zines which deal primarily with Strategic Planning.

entries.title: Weblogs
entries.description: Blogs from writers commenting on strategic management issues in business.

entries.title: Strategy_and_Forecasting
entries.description: Got big decisions to make? Strategy is a process for thinking those choices through. This category collects sites on strategic thought and action. Thinking ahead is basic. But the techniques for describing the future are sophisticated. Some of these sites provide ways of estimating, assessing, and using possible futures to frame decisions. These sites should introduce you to interesting ideas that lay the groundwork for policy formulation, business plans, and your organization's path through the future.

entries.title: Guidance
entries.description: Organizations that help with strategy or forecasting activities.

entries.title: Supply_Chain
entries.description: Supply Chain in Management category of Business.

entries.title: Value_Based_Management
entries.description: Value Based Management is the management approach that ensures organizations/companies are run consistently on value (normally maximizing shareholder value).

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising

translations.tha: การตลาดและโฆษณา
translations.jpn: 広告・マーケティング

entries.description: The <b>Marketing and Advertising</b> category comprises sub-industries and establishments engaged in one or more of the following: <ul> <li>Advertising in print, broadcast, interactive, or other media</li> <li>Branding and corporate identity design</li> <li>Creation and distribution of promotional items</li> <li>Internet marketing strategy and analysis</li> <li>Collection and analysis of market research</li> <li>Public relations activities</li> <li>Training and development of sales representatives</li> </ul> <b>Excluded</b> from this category are: <ul> <li>Agencies and individuals which offer advertising and marketing services to a specific industry sector. These are listed according to the <a href="/Business/">industry which they serve</a>.</li> <li>Agencies and individuals which offer local services only are listed according to the <a href="/Regional/">geographic area which they serve</a></li> <li>Companies which offer web design, promotion, and hosting services are listed only in <a href="/Computers/Internet/Web_Design_and_Development/">Computers: Internet: Web Design and Development</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Advertising
entries.description: This category is for companies specializing in advertising and promotional services. This category is NOT for advertising your products. Please submit your site to an appropriate subcategory of this section. Companies specializing in web promotions are welcomed at Computers: Internet: Web Promotions:

entries.title: Agencies
entries.description: An advertising agency prepares the advertisements, or campaigns for multiple companies, in multiple forms of media from conception, through production, to finished product. Marketers, Consultants, Promotion Companies, Printers and Web Site Designers are welcomed at ODP, but NOT in this category. For faster listing in the Open Directory Project, please read http://www.dmoz.org/add.html and submit your site to the proper category.

entries.title: Business_to_Business
entries.description: Agencies and marketing firms involved in the creation and or the placement of advertising for the Business-to-Business community.

entries.title: Full_Service
entries.description: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in creating advertising campaigns and placing such advertising in periodicals, newspapers, radio and television, or other media. These establishments are organized to provide a full range of services including advice, creative services, account management, production of advertising material, media planning, and buying.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Non profit, educational and trade associations that inform, enable, and support the development and maintenance of advertising related businesses.

entries.title: American_Advertising_Federation
entries.description: Should describe what one will find on the site, especially anything that differentiates the site from other AAF chapter sites.

entries.title: Coupons
entries.description: This category is for companies offering printing services to promote businesses using coupons, or the packaging of coupon based sales promotions such as printing coupons on grocery tapes and bags, printing of mail-out coupons, and all sorts of other coupon manufacturing. This category NOT for offering coupons or promotions to consumers.

entries.title: Design_Services
entries.description: Businesses which design the advertisements of firms, or which add design enhancements to advertising, or which serve the design needs of the advertising industry.

entries.title: Logo_and_Stationery
entries.description: <strong> This category is for listing companies specializing in the development of logos and stationery. Firms that develop identity and also offer a variety of other design services will be listed in Business: Business_Services: Design: Graphic_Design: Firms</strong> Firms where the core of the business is audio-visual design, i.e. training videos, multimedia CD-ROMs and presentations should submit to Business: Business Services: Audiovisual: Graphic Design.

entries.title: Logo_Design
entries.description: Business: Marketing and Advertising: Advertising: Design Services: Logo and Stationery: Logo Design is for companies specializing in the development and design of logos.

entries.title: New_Media
entries.description: Sites offering design services in multi-media CD-ROMs, Business card CD-ROMs, streamlining video, flash and other new technologies used in advertising can be found here. Sites which sell interactive CD-ROM business cards can be found at Business: Advertising: Promotional Items: Business Items: CDs

entries.title: Package_Design
entries.description: Marketing, advertising and design companies which specialize in package design.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This directory category is a guide or list specifically for advertising resources only, NOT a directory of non-advertising general services, individual ad or marketing agencies, advertising services or media for sale, or individual businesses. Directories must feature compilations of web sites containing comprehensive indexes or lists of advertising business resources and related company's information. Users of this category should be able to visit the listed directories and obtain information pertaining to advertising.

entries.title: Indoor_Advertising
entries.description: Companies that specialize in indoor advertising displays in public facilities.

entries.title: Media_Buying_and_Planning
entries.description: For the listing of advertising agencies providing media buying and planning services.

entries.title: Media_Production
entries.description: The production of advertising media. <br> <p align=center> <table bgcolor="#ffffcc" cellpadding=6 border="0"> <tr><td> <small>Before submitting your site, please review the <a href="/Business/desc.html">Open Directory Guidelines for Submitting a Site</a>.</small> </td></tr> </table> <P> The Open Directory editors reserve the right to delete sites under construction, duplicate domains or submissions and sites submitted to incorrect categories.

entries.title: On_Hold_Services
entries.description: Listing of sites that produce music on-hold, custom audio for on-hold and voice mail systems.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Advertising news and media resources not limited to one geographic area. News and media resource sites should provide information and assistance for the persons using them. The primary purpose of a resource site should not be to sell a produce or service.

entries.title: Newspaper
entries.description: Sites specializing in providing resources for print newspaper advertising. These could be regular or classified ads.

entries.title: Outdoor_Advertising
entries.description: Businesses that provide outdoor advertising products and services.

entries.title: Aerial
entries.description: <p>This category is for businesses that provide aerial billboards and banners which are typically flown over crowded beaches and sporting events.

entries.title: Billboards_and_Large_Media
entries.description: A billboard is a large panel designed to carry outdoor advertising. This category is for companies that concentrate on promoting a business using billboards and other forms of similar outdoor advertising.

entries.title: Inflatables
entries.description: Companies listed here focus on the use of balloons and ground inflatables as advertising tools.

entries.title: Mobile
entries.description: Mobile Advertising companies place ads on cars, trucks, moving billboards, t-shirts, and other interesting places.

entries.title: Promotional_Products
entries.description: This category is for companies that sell advertising specialties, promotional items, and customized products that promote a business or organization.

entries.title: Apparel
entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses specializing in customized promotional apparel.

entries.title: Embroidery
entries.description: This category is for companies offering finished, embroidered promotional items. This category is not for companies offering digitizing services only.

entries.title: Gloves_and_Neckwear
entries.description: Many logo printed products are often sold by agents who sell advertising specialties as part of sales promotions. This category is reserved for those businesses that specialize in the sale of promotional gloves, mittens, scarves, ties, and other neckwear.

entries.title: Hats_and_Headwear
entries.description: This category is reserved for those businesses that specialize in imprinted promotional hats, caps, and other headwear.

entries.title: Jackets_and_Windbreakers
entries.description: Many logo printed products are often sold by agents who sell advertising specialties as part of sales promotions. This category is reserved for those businesses that specialize in the sale of promotional coats, jackets, and windbreakers.

entries.title: Shirts
entries.description: Many logo printed products are often sold by agents who sell advertising specialties as part of sales promotions. This category is reserved for those businesses that specialize in the sale of promotional t-shirts and sweatshirts.

entries.title: Buttons_and_Badges
entries.description: A promotional button or badge is an advertising device with a pin on the back of it that is typically worn on a shirt, jacket, backpack, or handbag.

entries.title: CDs
entries.description: Sites that fit the LITERAL description of this category will also be included. Any promotional CD's which are used for advertising (whether music premiums, or CD-ROM cards will be reviewed). CD-Business card manufacturers will also be included in this category. Sites offering design SERVICES in multi-media CD-ROMs, Business card CD-ROMs, streamlining video and other new technologies used in advertising can be at Business: Advertising: Design Services: New Media

entries.title: Premiums
entries.description: CD Premiums differ from CD business cards, in that they are often designed to promote a product and they often lack information material about the product. For example, a new brand of perfume might come with an accompanying CD music disc. The disc is a reward to the customer for buying the product.

entries.title: Clocks_and_Watches
entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses specializing in promotional clocks and watches.

entries.title: Diaries_and_Calendars
entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses specializing in customized promotional diaries and calendars

entries.title: Drinkware
entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses specializing in promotional cups, mugs, glasses, steins, drinking bottles, and related items.

entries.title: Leather
entries.description: Sites offering leather promotional products.

entries.title: Lenticular_and_Holographics
entries.description: Holograms are 3D images that are produced in much the same way as a photograph but using laser light. They are commonly used as an anti-counterfeiting device. Lenticular images are usually printed on a press but also can show 3D imagery. Often mistaken for holograms, they can also show movements or "flips" and are characterized by the tiny lines or lenses which run across the image.

entries.title: Magnets
entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses specializing in customized promotional magnets.

entries.title: Mouse_Pads
entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses specializing in promotional mouse pads.

entries.title: Postcards
entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses specializing in promotional postcards.

entries.title: Prepaid_Phone_Cards
entries.description: Prepaid phone cards imprinted with an advertising logo or message, for use as a promotional tool.

entries.title: Golf
entries.description: Golf-related promotional items.

entries.title: Stickers_and_Decals
entries.description: Labels, stickers, and decals are often sold by agents who sell advertising specialties or as part of sales promotions, in that context they belong in this category. <p> Large paper printers may offer similar services and they are listed in <A HREF="/Business/Publishing_and_Printing/Printing/Products/Labels,_Stickers,_and_Decals/">Printing: Labels, Stickers, and Decals</a>.

entries.title: Varied_Merchandise
entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses offering a wide variety of advertising specialties, promotional items and customized products that promote a business, organization, or event. <P>Sites that contain primarily catalog entries from affiliate companies are far less likely to be included in the directory than sites with significant original content.

entries.title: Radio_Jingles
entries.description: This category is intended for radio broadcast professionals and jingle collectors.

entries.title: Radio_Self-Promotion
entries.description: Self-Promotion jingles and audio bits utilized by radio stations for their own promotional purposes.

entries.title: Yellow_Pages
entries.description: Design Agencies specializing in yellow page ad design, assisting advertisers in the creation and placement of yellow pages advertising in phone directories throughout the United States.

entries.title: Certified_Marketing_Representatives
entries.description: A CMR or Certified Marketing Representative is an individual or entity that provides placement assistance to yellow page advertisers in phone directories in local and national markets.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Non profit, educational and trade associations that inform, enable, and support the development and maintenance of marketing related businesses. Associations that deal specifically with business within a locality, should be found at that locality's regional business category. Associations that deal specifically with business within a country, should be found at that country's regional business category, for example: Regional/North_America/Canada/Business_and_Economy/Associations/

entries.title: Academic
entries.description: Marketing associations founded by academic organizations

entries.title: DECA
entries.description: National association of marketing students. The most influential in the undergraduate marketing society.

entries.title: American_Marketing_Association
entries.description: Sites relating to the American Marketing Association (AMA) are listed in this category. If you know of a chapter site for the AMA which is not listed, submit it. This category is not for companies, and not for anything other than American marketing Association sites.

entries.title: Business_Marketing_Association
entries.description: Sites relating to the Business Marketing Association (BMA) are listed in this category. If you know of a chapter site for the BMA which is not listed, submit it. This category is not for companies, and not for anything other than Business Marketing Association sites.

entries.title: Branding
entries.description: Branding enables an organization to differentiate its goods or services from those of its competitors. The process of branding involves developing a product's name with a logo, colors, and packaging.

entries.title: Naming
entries.description: Naming agencies and verbal branding companies are firms that specialize in the development of the words used to label or describe goods, services, and organizations. This list is comprised of firms that provide unique and valuable content online in addition to providing naming services. It is not intended to be a comprehensive list of all agencies providing naming or verbal branding services.

entries.title: Software_&_Tools
entries.description: This section is for services available directly to the end user and require no input from experts or consultants to develop a name.

entries.title: Weblogs
entries.description: Naming weblogs (or "blogs") are those that pertain to the naming industry or analysis of company, service, product, or organizational names.

entries.title: Positioning
entries.description: <p>Positioning is the art of creating a unique, memorable place for your company within the landscape of your competitors. It involves market research, brand strategy, business strategy, visual identity, and corporate messaging. </p> <p>Well-positioned companies can "own" a piece of customers' mindshare through being known for expertise within a particular industry segment. </p> <p>(PLEASE NOTE: This category does NOT refer to positioning within search engine listings.) </p>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Positioning firms help businesses consider their brand identity, messaging, and where their companies fall in their industry's competitive landscape. Utilizing market research, strategic thinking, and creative writing, good positioning consultancies can help a company speak to their specific, unique value amid a noisy marketplace.

entries.title: Product_Placement
entries.description: Product placement services arrange for their clients' products and logos to appear in motion pictures and television.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: The <b>Marketing and Advertising Conferences</b> category covers conferences, trade shows, and expositions for marketing and advertising professionals.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Marketing consulting firms provide advisory services contracted for and provided to organizations by specially trained and qualified persons who assist, in an objective and independent manner, the client organization to identify problems, analyze such problems, recommend solutions to these problems, and help, when requested, in the implementation of solutions.

entries.title: Direct_Marketing

translations.jpn: ダイレクトマーケティング

entries.description: Direct marketing involves marketing products and services directly to consumers and businesses. Typical forms of this marketing involve print media (such as flyers, mailing pieces, catalogues, and magazines), direct-response television and radio advertising, telephone solicitations, and the internet.<br><br> This category is for sites related to businesses that specialize in providing technical and creative support, goods, and services to organizations that market their products and services in this way.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for sites about trade associations focused on the direct marketing industry.

entries.title: Database_Marketing
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the creation and maintenance of databases of a client business in its direct marketing programs. Such databases include such things as postal addresses, email addresses, phone numbers, and other information (such as past response history) that the client business wishes to maintain.

entries.title: Mailing_Lists
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the development, maintenance, and rentals of lists used for direct marketing. These lists may include postal addresses, email addresses, phone numbers, and other information.

entries.title: Businesses
entries.description: Sites dealing with the selling/management of mailing lists dealing specifically with businesses or business contacts.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Information on recruiters specializing in the placement of advertising and marketing professionals, as well as job-related information for those employed in the field of advertising and marketing.

entries.title: Job_Search
entries.description: The Job Search category provides listings of employment sites, job portals, and sites which provide job seekers with information that specifically relates to finding a job in the marketing and advertising industry, as opposed to career related information or resumes.

entries.title: Recruitment_and_Staffing
entries.description: This category is a listing of Executive Recruiters internet sites. <P></P> Executive Recruiters are professionals or professional firms that conduct searches for employees for their clients on a contingency basis. They research, source, interview and recommend candidates to their clients. The goal of this categories is to provide as complete and accurate a listing of Recruiters as possible. <P></P> Executive Recruiters are not employment agencies. Executive recruiters find people for jobs. Recruiters fees are paid by their clients. They do not charge their candidates. <P></P> <B>Submission Notes:</B> <P></P> List here Executive Recruiters specializing in Sales and Marketing positions. <P></P>

entries.title: Resumes_and_Portfolios
entries.description: This category contains individual resumes of Marketing/Sales and Advertising professionals, from students to experienced managers.

entries.title: Internet_Marketing
entries.description: First, what this category is NOT! <p> If you are a site designer, builder, promoter, submission service, even if the words marketing appear on your site or in your business name, this does not make you an Internet Marketer automatically. <p> This would be for companies who do needs assessment, market research, production design and development, pricing and product cycles and positioning, government and regulatory issues, focus groups, identity development, media planning and development, long range activities ... <p> In other words, a well established company or consultant with verifiable expertise and contacts. Marketing does not happen, every inch is planned with contingencies for every plan. Many of these sites have case studies of current or past clientele.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Internet Marketing is the process of promoting a website on the internet. Effective internet marketing requires a comprehensive strategy that encompasses the client's goals and takes into account website function & appearance. What internet marketing includes: Organic Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Search Engine Marketing (SEM) (A more general term for internet marketing) Pay Per Click campaign management (PPC) Link building, copywriting on-page optimization to improve conversion rate, website server optimization including; evaluating website analytics creative advertising campaigns, (banner ads, text link ads, etc) and limited search engine submissions.

entries.title: Marketing_Services
entries.description: Internet Marketing Services is for companies that offer a variety of Internet Marketing Services. Specialist companies such as those focusing on search engine promotion are listed in specialist categories. Please search the directory for the most appropriate category before submitting. It will speed the listing of the site.

entries.title: Market_Research
entries.description: <p>Internet market research is a process of specifying and locating information to make business decisions related to the Internet. It can include designing methods for collecting data into the Internet, managing and implementing data collection, analyzing results, communicating findings, and/or consulting on the trends and implications of Internet market research findings. <p> Many sites CONDUCT research on the Internet into a broad range of topics. Although they use the Internet as a tool, these sites are not about "Internet Marketing" and <b>do not</b> belong in this category.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Publications (such as e-zines, magazines, newsletters, news sites, and discussion lists) covering internet marketing.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: The Marketing Resources category is for sites that provide unique content that may be of interest to those wanting to learn about Internet Marketing, web site promotion, or search engine positioning.

entries.title: Tips
entries.description: Resources with Internet marketing tips.

entries.title: Social_Media
entries.description: Find links to resources and tools for marketing via social networks and online communities.

entries.title: Traffic_Measurement
entries.description: Commercial services firms that specialize in traffic measurement and analysis. Traffic measurement and analysis may include research firms that track and provide raw statistics, visitor demographics, or web site rankings for sites across the web.

entries.title: Marketing_Support_Services
entries.description: Web sites, publications, information suppliers, and resources that are provided to individuals and companies who are part of the marketing industry.

entries.title: Fax
entries.description: The web sites listed in this category provide outsourced fax services that allow for broadcasting, mass faxing or marketing activities via fax.

entries.title: Market_Research

translations.jpn: マーケティングリサーチ

entries.description: Firms supply research or strategies to perform research in marketing.

entries.title: Online_Surveys
entries.description: Contains websites that present online commercially-oriented surveys in which web visitors participate.

entries.title: Volunteer_Focus_Groups
entries.description: Market research companies (or occasionally research institutions) that are soliciting individuals or families to participate in surveys, usually on a continuing basis, over a period of time. They may or may not offer rewards.

entries.title: Micromarketing
entries.description: Micromarketing uses information about local areas for applications such as targeting direct marketing, analysing customer loyalty, branch location, planning merchandise mix,or turnover forecasts. The information for this analysis is usually derived from a database of lifestyle surveys and/or census demographics. The basic principle is that people who live in similar areas will, to some degree, have similar purchasing power and spending habits. This idea allows one to build mathematical models predicting likely purchasing behaviour.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: The <b>Marketing and Advertising News and Media</b> category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, magazines, and e-zines which deal exclusively with marketing and/or advertising.

entries.title: Weblogs
entries.description: This subcategory of Marketing & Advertising/News and Media contains will contain all sites with relevant material that is presented in blog format.

entries.title: Agencies
entries.description: Global listing of companies whose business focuses primarily on PR services to third party clients.

entries.title: Affinity
entries.description: <p> Affinity group marketing is marketing to members of a group. Marketing to existing groups of customers already interested in a certain topic, product or cause, allows affinity marketers to leverage relationships and the existing brand, loyalty, attention and buying power of the group. </p> <p> In affinity group marketing, typically third parties offer members of affinity groups discounted merchandise, services, rebates, insurance, or other benefits for participating in their marketing programs. </p> <p> Affinity group marketing programs are used as a way for employers and associations/groups to offer additional benefits to employees and members at little to no added cost to the company or organization. It can also be used as a way to raise funds for schools and non-profit groups. </p>

entries.title: Salesmanship
entries.description: Training laboratories, salesmanship consultants, sales management firms, sales improvement organizations, providers and inspirational resources for sales people fit here. This focus is because effective salespeople are at the heart of many enterprises.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Sales Training in the form of seminars, courses, programmes and boot-camps.

entries.title: Media
entries.description: This category contains links to sites offering printed or recorded sales training media.

entries.title: Online_Courses
entries.description: This category contains links to sites offering on-line sales training courses and services.

entries.title: Seminars
entries.description: This category contains links to sites offering sales training seminars and on-site courses.

entries.title: Strategic
entries.description: Strategic Consulting professionals in the field of Marketing and Advertising provide training materials, services, and other resources related to the field. The topic of sales is relevant, while general management is not.

entries.title: Telemarketing
entries.description: This category is for those that are looking for products and services that they can use in their call centers, customer care departments and help desks. This category will also list outsourcing companies such as service bureaus.

entries.title: Automation
entries.description: This category lists devices for automated telemarketing.

entries.title: Materials
entries.description: Materials are the raw stuff used in manufacturing and industry. Some examples are steel, fibers, glass, and plastics. This category lists manufacturers and distributors of raw materials.

entries.title: Grinding_Wheels
entries.description: This category is concerned with what can be considered a group of cutting and machining tools that can be usefully assembled under a heading of its own.

entries.title: Polishing_Media
entries.description: This category contains sites concerned with the supply and use of products designed to remove cutting and machining burs and/or create a smoothly finished surface.

entries.title: Diamond
entries.description: This category contains sites belonging to companies whose primary business is the commercial production of industrial grade diamond.

entries.title: Aerogels
entries.description: Suppliers of silica aerogel and related products.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category lists trade and technical organisations of the global composites industry.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Software used to design composite parts, or to predict properties

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category lists companies involved with the wholesale and distribution of composite materials.

entries.title: Alloys
entries.description: This category is for sites dealing with the science and technology of metals and alloys. Suppliers of products or services should submit their sites to an appropriate category in our Business section. Specific links to which can usually be found as an @linked sub category of this main category, or in the list of related categories.

entries.title: Bronze
entries.description: An alloy of copper and tin and sometimes other elements.

entries.title: Metal_Joining
entries.description: Materials used in the process of joining metals. Typically soldering, brazing and welding .

entries.title: Brazing
entries.description: To solder with a nonferrous alloy having a lower melting point than the metals being joined .

entries.title: Solder
entries.description: This category will list the companies that manufacture solder is all of its forms and the companies that support them.

entries.title: Aluminum
entries.description: A bluish silver-white malleable ductile light trivalent metallic element that has good electrical and thermal conductivity, high reflectivity, and resistance to oxidation and is the most abundant metal in the earth's crust .

entries.title: Tube_&_Pipe
entries.description: Sources of aluminum tubing and pipe products.

entries.title: Copper
entries.description: A common reddish metallic element that is ductile and malleable and is one of the best conductors of heat and electricity .

entries.title: Distributors
entries.description: Distributors and stocking distributors for metal materials. These companies provide the connection between the materials manufacturers or their representatives and the industries that use the materials.

entries.title: Non-Ferrous
entries.description: This category contains links to exporters and importers of non-ferrous metals.

entries.title: Precious_Metals
entries.description: This category contains links to exporters and importers of precious metals.

entries.title: Recycling
entries.description: This category contains links to exporters and importers of recycled metals.

entries.title: Magnesium
entries.description: A silver-white light malleable ductile metallic element that occurs abundantly in nature and is used in metallurgical and chemical processes, in photography, signaling, and pyrotechnics because of the intense white light it produces on burning, and in construction especially in the form of light alloys .

entries.title: Manufacturer_Representatives
entries.description: These companies represent manufacturers of raw metal materials in their sales to the industry.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category should contain publications in the metal industry only.

entries.title: Porous_and_Foamed
entries.description: Businesses and business activities primarily engaged in the production and supply of metals in porous (e.g., sintered) and foamed (open- and closed-cell) forms.

entries.title: Import_and_Export
entries.description: This category contains links to exporters and importers of steel products.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category will list manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, repairers and renters of tools and equipment used within the Steel industry including companies that provide services to these companies. It is not for raw materials or industrial supplies, these should be submitted to the "Materials and Supplies" category .

entries.title: Vacuum_Coating
entries.description: Vacuum deposition of a coating consists of a source of the material to be deposited, transport of the material through a low-pressure gaseous (or plasma) environment, and condensation on a substrate. In some cases the depositing material reacts with the gaseous environment, or a co-deposited material, to form a coating of a chemical compound such as a nitride or a carbide (reactive deposition). This category contains manufacturers of materials used in vacuum coating, including sputtering targets and evaporation materials.

entries.title: Zinc
entries.description: A bluish white crystalline metallic element of low to intermediate hardness that is ductile when pure but in the commercial form is brittle at ordinary temperatures and becomes ductile on slight heating, occurs abundantly in minerals, is an essential micronutrient for both plants and animals, and is used especially as a protective coating for iron and steel.

entries.title: Pulp_and_Paper
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers which' primary focus is on the manufacture of pulp and paper for further processing. Manufacturers and converters of finished paper industrial and consumer products will NOT be listed here.

entries.title: Brokers
entries.description: Paper Brokers are companies that buy and sell paper on a wholesale basis. They often provide financing to parties on either end of the transaction.

entries.title: Chemicals_and_Additives
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of process chemicals and additives for the pulp and paper industry.

entries.title: Machinery_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category contains sites related to the supply and service of paper and board making machinery and a range of specialized products for use by the pulp and paper industry. It also indexes companies involved in equipment for producting single and double sided corrugated rolls and sheets. Note: Sites that are concerned with equipment for converting paper and board products should more properly be directed for indexing in the Business/Industries/Machinery_and_Tools/Converting_Equipment category. Additional note: In effect, a fine line is drawn between equipment used, on the one hand, in the production of corrugated board and, on the other hand, in producing corrugated containers and display products. Where a supplier deals in both kinds of equipment, its site can be (and, because of the its relationship to boardmaking, should be) indexed in the Pulp and Paper category. However, firms that supply only the means for converting corrugated board belong in the Converting_Equipment category instead.

entries.title: Distributors
entries.description: This category lists distributors, agents, refitters and similar companies involved in the trade of machinery, tools and equipment for the pulp and paper industry.

entries.title: Testing_and_Quality_Control
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers and dealers of pro-owned, surplus and refitted systems, equipment and instruments for the pulp and paper industry.

entries.title: Marketplaces
entries.description: Pulp and paper industry marketplaces that facilitate information exchange, interactions, and transactions between buyers and suppliers in the industry.

entries.title: Paper
entries.description: This category lists companies which' primary focus is on manufacturing pulp and paper for further processing and converting into industrial and consumer products.

entries.title: Cigarette_Papers
entries.description: This category lists papermaking companies which have specialised in the production of cigarette papers.

entries.title: Handmade_Papers
entries.description: This category lists companies, and individuals involved in the commercial production of handmade paper.

entries.title: Manufactured_Product
entries.description: This category will contain only links to other areas within the Open Directory Project where manufacturers and suppliers of finished paper consumer and industrial products are listed. No sites will be listed here. Please, browse the links and submit your site to the category most appropriate to your business. Thank you for your cooperation.

entries.title: Packaging_Paper_and_Board
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of paper and board for the packaging industry.

entries.title: Printing_and_Publishing
entries.description: This category lists companies which make paper for the publishing industry (newspapers, books, magazines, etc.).

entries.title: Specialty_Papers
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of thermal and inkjet papers, transfer and release papers, specialty print imaging media, and papers for related specialty and technical applications.

entries.title: Tissue_and_Crepe_Papers
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers of tissue and crepe papers for personal care, medical, and sanitary wipes, napkins and towels.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category is for wholesale paper distributors and converters. Paper distributors are companies that provide distribution and sales services for paper mills. By definition a distributor should have inventory.

entries.title: Pulp
entries.description: Pulp is an intermediate product, usually further processed in making paper and cardboard products. This category is for businesses and business activities <b>specifically aimed</b> at the production and sale of pulp. Companies whose activities extend into papermaking or production of manufactured paper products are listed in the corresponding categories.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category lists web based directories related to the global pulp and paper industry only.

entries.title: Environment
entries.description: This category lists sites offering information on, or promoting the usage of environmentally safe or friendly manufacturing processes, materials and uses of paper and board, to consumers and industry.

entries.title: History
entries.description: This category lists sites about the history of papermaking technology and its inventors, paper machinery and mills, and the raw materials used in the papermaking process.

entries.title: Research_and_Education
entries.description: This category lists sites from individuals, companies and institutions involved in scientific and applied research, education and training in the pulp and papermaking industries.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: This category lists web sites from individuals, companies and organizations, involved in the development, manufacture and provision of services and products for, or related to the pulp and paper industry.

entries.title: Converters
entries.description: This category lists industrial paper converters only.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This category lists companies and individuals involved in the development and/or distribution of software programs for the pulp and paper industry.

entries.title: Wholesale_and_Distribution
entries.description: This category includes businesses active in the distribution (but not manufacture) of a variety of products of/for the pulp and paper industry. Distributors focusing on a particular product type (for example, only paper(board) products) are listed in the corresponding subcategories, linked from this one.

entries.title: Wood
entries.description: This category is meant to serve those industries producing such materials as hardwoods, softwoods, plywoods, veneers, or manufacturing wood based products such as particle board or MDF.

entries.title: Mining_and_Drilling
entries.description: <p>The Mining and Drilling sector comprises industries and companies involved in extracting naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.</p> <p>Industries and companies involved in Oil and Gas extraction are listed under <a href="/Business/Energy_and_Environment/Oil_and_Gas/">Business/Energy_and_Environment/Oil_and_Gas/</a><br> <br> </p> <p><i>(Source: This category description is based on the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS), 1997).</i>

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Sites that provide directories to mining topics specifically related to production mining. This is not for prospecting and metal detecing, but for technology of mining. Prospecting and gold hunting are not part of this site and should go under science:technology:mining:prospecting.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, repairers and renters of tools and equipment used for <b>Dredging</b>, including companies that provide services to these companies.

entries.title: Mineral_Exploration_and_Extraction
entries.description: Businesses that explore for, or extract, mineral resources. Includes businesses that supply products and services in support of these activities in the fields of geology, geophysics, mining , and other earth sciences.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Associations, trade groups and professional societies specific to the mineral exploration and extraction industries.

entries.title: Base_Metals
entries.description: Business sites relating to the extraction and processing of base metals which typically include iron, copper, zinc, molybdenum, titanium, aluminum, and other base metals .

entries.title: Exploration_and_Development
entries.description: Business sites relating to the exploration and development of mineral reserves and do not undertake extraction and processing.This will also include organizations who control land holdings containing these reserves.

entries.title: Gems_and_Precious_Stones
entries.description: Business sites relating to the extraction and processing of gems and precious stones.

entries.title: Industrial_Minerals
entries.description: Business sites relating to the extraction and processing of Industrial Minerals which typically include phosphate, gypsum, salt, potash, nitrate, lime, clay, quarried stone,and sand and gravel.

entries.title: Precious_Metals
entries.description: Business sites relating to the extraction and processing of precious metals which typically include gold, silver and platinum.

entries.title: Gold
entries.description: Websites of gold producing companies.

entries.title: Tools_and_Equipment
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, repairers and renters of tools and equipment used within the Mining and Drilling industries, including companies that provide services to these companies. It is not for raw materials or industrial supplies.

entries.title: Drilling
entries.description: This category lists manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, repairers and renters of tools and equipment used within the <b>Drilling Industry</b>, including companies that provide services to these companies. It is not for raw materials or industrial supplies.

entries.title: Mining
entries.description: Equipment specifically related to production mining. This is not for prospecting equipment, but for technology of mining. Prospecting and gold hunting are not part of this site and should go under science:technology:mining:prospecting.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: The <b>Business News and Media</b> category includes newspapers, magazines and e-zines, and other media sites which cover the business industry as a whole.

entries.title: Book_Reviews
entries.description: Book reviews include statements of whether a reader considered the publication a worthwhile read and defense of their position. Frequently, a review writer may give intensely detailed summary information about characterization, plot, and theme.

entries.title: Magazines_and_E-zines
entries.description: The <b>Business Magazines</b> category includes magazines and e-zines that cover the business industry as a whole.

entries.title: Print_Only
entries.description: Listing of publications that are available in print only. In other words publications without continuously updated online content.

entries.title: Newspapers
entries.description: Newspapers whose reporting specializes in general business news, issues and the economy.

entries.title: Research_Reports
entries.description: This category includes sites that offers market research reports for free or for purchase.

entries.title: Working_Papers
entries.description: Category contains links to sites the provide discussion and working papers on current research being performed in the fields of business and economics. -- rdkeating25

entries.title: Opportunities
entries.description: The "Opportunities" category is generic and intended for general information about business opportunities for individuals, and general approaches to opportunities in business. For Web sites and companies involved in <em>specific</em> aspects of business opportunities including sales, employment, jobs, MLM, Internet, home-based, franchises, distributing, internet and partners programs, and so on, please see those sub-categories.

entries.title: Franchising
entries.description: Franchises requiring a physical address or location and which have a product or service that cannot be solely purchased, engaged, executed, conducted, or built without meeting with people in some way. A method of doing business whereby a franchise is granted the right to engage in the business of offering, selling or distributing goods or services under a marketing plan or system prescribed in substantial part by the franchiser and which is substantially associated with the franchiser's trademark, name, logo or advertising.

entries.title: Affiliate_Programs
entries.description: Associate, affiliate, reseller, commission, bounty, pay-per-lead, referral or pay-per-sale programs are profit sharing arrangements companies use to pay commissions to webmasters for referring them customers. Submission Guidelines: 1. URL: Link to your main page. If your site covers a range of different topics, then link to the main page for the Associate Programs section. Url's containing an Affiliate ID will not be accepted. 2. Title: Keep as brief as possible and make it either the name of your site or the name of your program. 3. Description: One or two sentences, written in the third person, describing the unique features of your site. 4. Updating: keep your listing current, amendments to your title, url or description can be submitted via the 'update URL' link.

entries.title: Two_Tier_Associate_Programs

Two Tier affiliate programs reward affiliates in two ways: you are paid for your own sales plus a percentage of the sales made by webmasters that you referred into the program. URL's containing an affiliate ID will not be accepted, however it is acceptable to list your own page, which in turn can have links to affiliate sites, provided that your pages add value to the viewer in the form of information, advice, hints, tips etc. that they would not be able to find on the affiliate site itself.

entries.title: Publishing_and_Printing

translations.tha: สำนักพิมพ์และการพิมพ์

entries.description: <P>The Publishing_and_Printing sector category covers two distinct, yet very interdependent industries. <P> <b>Publishing:</b> Entities engaged in publishing and distributing newspapers, magazines, other periodicals, and books, as well as electronic materials. <P> <b>Printing:</b> Establishments involved in the manufacture, production, and distribution of print products, such as newspapers, books, periodicals, business forms, greeting cards, and other materials. This includes companies that perform perform support activities, such as bookbinding, platemaking services, and data imaging. This subsector includes printing on clothing because the production process for that activity is printing, not clothing manufacturing. <P> Publishing of printed and electronic products is the main theme of this category. All printing sites are colocated under the Printing subcategory. <P> <i>(Source: This category description is based on the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS), 1997).</i>

entries.title: Binding_and_Finishing
entries.description: This category is intended for sites covering processes that are after the printing process and involve the finishing of the product. Processes would include counting, folding, cutting, trimming, stitching and sewing, binding, and coating and laminating.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Schools, programs, and informational sites that teach the techniques of bookbinding.

entries.title: Hand_or_Short_Run
entries.description: For sites that specialize in hand binding or in short runs of binding (typically less than one thousand).

entries.title: Restoration_and_Rebinding
entries.description: For sites who specialize primarily on restoration of old or antique books and Bibles rather than new bookbinding.

entries.title: Coating_and_Laminating
entries.description: this category is for companies which provide coating and/or laminating services as their primary business.

entries.title: Equipment_and_Supplies
entries.description: This category is for companies which provide either equipment or supplies to the coating and laminating industry

entries.title: Prepress
entries.description: The Prepress category refers to services and products in support of the printing industry. Prepress companies supply what is needed for a printer to run a print job. You will find both informational and business sites listed here. Business sites that serve specific localities or regions may be found under their respective Regional categories.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This category is for providers of software and related products to the prepress industry.

entries.title: Typesetting
entries.description: This category features companies who primarily focus on providing either traditional or computer based typesetting services.

entries.title: Printing
entries.description: The Printing category is divided into smaller sections, which are categorized by either printing technique or product type. You will find both informational and business sites listed here. Business sites that serve specific localities or regions may be found under their respective Regional categories.

entries.title: Brokers
entries.description: Printing brokers act as agents for print buyers in finding an appropriate printer for their jobs. In return, they receive a fee or commission.

entries.title: Auction_and_Bidding_Services
entries.description: In this category, you will find service that will submit you quote request to a large number of vendors vying for your printing business.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for *directories* of printers, a type of manufacturing, and is not a listing of individual printing firms. The category includes directories of printers worldwide.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: This category contains sites dealing with Employment in the Printing Industry.

entries.title: Equipment_and_Supplies
entries.description: This category is for sites about businesses whose primary focus includes both printing equipment and printing supplies for more than one printing process. Sites that focus on just equipment, just supplies, or on only one printing process are located in separate categories.

entries.title: Equipment
entries.description: This category is for sites whose primary focus is printing equipment related to more than one printing process. Sites that apply to only one printing process will be found in the "Equipment and Supplies" category for that process.

entries.title: Heat_Transfer
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on equipment and supplies used with heat transfer techniques to customize clothing, mousepads, mugs, and promotional items.

entries.title: Dye_Sublimation
entries.description: Dye Sublimation, also known as transfer printing, involves printing with dyes onto transfer paper. The paper is then placed on the product and heated to a temperature sufficient to transfer the dye to the product. Popular uses include creating photographic images on clothing, tile, and mousepads.<br><br> Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with this printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Pigmented_Archival
entries.description: Pigmented inks are used with transfer paper. The pigments provide the user with the ability to create a product that will not noticeably fade or bleed in most siutations. Pigmented inks work with cotton content material. Pigmented inks are often also known as archival inks.

entries.title: Stock_or_Custom_Transfers
entries.description: Primarily Screen printed transfers

entries.title: Supplies
