entries.description: This category is for sites whose primary focus is printing supplies related to more than one printing process. Sites that apply to only one printing process will be found in the "Equipment and Supplies" category for that process.

entries.title: Optically_Variable
entries.description: Optically variable materials reflect light in ways that create a different look or image depending on the angle from which it is viewed. They include holograms and other techniques. These materials are incorporated into other products for a variety of purposes.

entries.title: History
entries.description: Printing has an immense history which encompasses several disciplines and millions of unique individuals, all of whom sign each piece of printed material produced today. This category is meant for sites related to the history of printing, typography, Bookbinding, and related businessees.

entries.title: Artistic
entries.description: This category is for artistic printers.

entries.title: Processes
entries.description: This category is for sites about specific processes used in the Printing industry. This includes related sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about these processes. In contrast, the sites of companies that use these processes are not listed here; instead, each is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Digital_Printing
entries.description: Digital is a printing method that transfers digitized text and images from the computer directly to paper or any other substrate via various types of printing devices, most commonly using a laser or LED to affix toner. Ink jet also falls under this definition but now has its own subcategory. Note that this category is focused exclusively on digital printing. Sites about digital creation of printing films or plates do not belong here. Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with the digital printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of printing companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each printing company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces. Note: This category is currently undergoing revision, as sites related to a specific products or to general commercial printing are being moved to more appropriate categories elsewhere.

entries.title: Ink_Jet
entries.description: This category is focused exclusively on digital printing via the ink jet process. Sites placed in this category should deal exclusively with ink jet. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about ink jet. Site that deal with ink jet along with other digital printing processes belong in the parent Digital Printing category. In contrast, the sites of reprographic, signage or printing companies that use ink jet are not listed here; instead, each company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Flexography
entries.description: Flexographic printing is a printing technology deriving its name from the use of flexible plates. It is a method of direct (as opposed to offset) printing that uses resilient relief image plates of rubber or photopolymer material and fast drying water-based or UV inks. It is frequently used for printing newspapers, self-adhesive labels, flexible packaging, corrugated containers (boxes), and plastic bags. <br><br> Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with this printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of printing companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each printing company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Foil_Stamping
entries.description: Foil Stamping is a type of letterpress printing which is unique for its bright metallic finish most commonly in gold or silver. Also called hot foil stamping, hot stamping, gold foil stamping, gold stamping, gold blocking and foil embossing.<br><br> Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with this printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of printing companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each printing company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Equipment_and_Supplies
entries.description: This category is designed for sites that deal with foil stamping equipment and supplies such as stamping foils, dies and make readies.

entries.title: Letterpress
entries.description: Letterpress printing is done using cast metal type or metal plates on which the image or printing area is raised above the surface of the type or plate. The top surface of the raised areas are inked and the inked image is transferred directly to the paper.<br><br> Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with this printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of printing companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each printing company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Offset_Lithography
entries.description: Offset Lithography is a printing technique that places ink and water on a chemically treated printing plate. The ink is attracted to the image area and the water is attracted to the non-image area. The inked image is then transferred to a rubber blanket and finally to the paper.<br><br> Sheetfed offset presses print on paper that has been cut into individual sheets prior to printing. Web offset presses print from rolls of paper, and any cutting is done after the printing.<br><br> This process is frequently used to print publications, catalogs, newspaper supplements, labels, boxes, direct mail pieces, and for other commercial applications.<br><br> Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with this printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of printing companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each printing company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Pad_Printing
entries.description: Pad Printing, also called transfer pad printing, is an indirect offset gravure process characterized by a silicone rubber transfer pad that transfers the image from a printing plate on which the image is etched below the surface of the plate. It is commonly used to print 3D objects with irregular surfaces, such as golf balls.<br><br> Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with this printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, companies specializing in using pad printing to do contract work for other manufacturers and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of printing companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each printing company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Contract_Manufacturing
entries.description: Contractors are pad printers who print for other companies under contract.

entries.title: Rotogravure
entries.description: Rotogravure is the modern adaptation of the gravure process, and uses a rotary press with a copper cylinder. On the cylinder, the image to be printed is cut or etched below the surface of the non-image area in the form of thousands of tiny cells that hold the ink. This process is frequently used to print publications, catalogs, newspaper supplements, labels, cartons, wall and floor coverings, packaging, and gift-wrap.<br><br> Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with this printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of printing companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each printing company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Screen_Printing
entries.description: Screen printing involves using a squeegee to force ink through a mesh containing a stencil. The process can be used to print on a wide variety of materials, including fabrics, paper, plastic, glass, and metal. It is frequently used to print on clothing and on irregularly shaped items.<br><br> Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with this printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of printing companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each printing company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.<br><br> Note: This category is currently undergoing revision, as sites related to a specific product are being moved to more appropriate categories elsewhere.

entries.title: Equipment_and_Supplies
entries.description: Web pages related to equipment manufacturers and suppliers for the screen printing industry.

entries.title: Thermography
entries.description: Thermography, also known as raised printing, involves applying a powder to paper with wet ink on it, and then heating the paper to make the powder adhere. Popular uses include business stationery, presentation folders, annual report covers, announcements, greeting cards, packaging, wrapping paper, and point of purchase displays.<br><br> Sites placed in this category should deal primarily with this printing process. This includes sites of trade associations, companies selling equipment and supplies, and any site providing resources about the process. In contrast, the sites of printing companies that use this process are not listed here; instead, each printing company is listed in a category based on the type of product it produces.

entries.title: Products
entries.description: This category is for sites about products for which printing is a major component.<br><br> Note: Other categories featuring printed products are found elsewhere in the Directory. Some of the most important ones are indicated by the "See Also:" links.

entries.title: Books_and_Publications
entries.description: This category is for sites whose primary focus is the printing of books, magazines, journals, directories, and catalogs.

entries.title: Book_Printers
entries.description: Designed for those companies which print books. Whether it be hard back, soft bound or technical. Also the home of P.O.D. for book printers.

entries.title: Print_on_Demand
entries.description: Print On Demand offers short run lengths and no need for large inventories. It is becoming popular in the book printing/publishing industry due to the ability to print small numbers of books without the high initial costs associated with traditional book printers. Traditional methods are still the most economical for longer printing orders.

entries.title: Publication_Printers
entries.description: Designed for those whose specialty is printing Publications (magazines).

entries.title: Buying_Online
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on selling printing directly from the website. The sites include information about products, prices, and ordering information, so that customers can order standard types of printing directly from their home or office, without having to request specific quotes.

entries.title: Commercial_Printing
entries.description: This category is for sites about commercial printing, and the firms that provide these services.<br><br> The defining characteristic of commercial printers that they handle a wide range of printing jobs, rather than specializing on one particular type of product. The same company is likely to print brochures, corporate annual reports, catalogs, business cards, posters, booklets, menus, advertisements, forms, letterhead, and product literature -- anything that its presses can handle, on a job-by-job basis.<br><br> Commercial printing is not defined by the type of equipment used. Many commercial printers use sheetfed offset equipment, while others use web offset or digital inkjet, or a combination of these plus other techniques.

entries.title: Direct_Mail
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the creation, printing, and mailing of direct mail pieces.

entries.title: Postcards
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the creation, printing, and mailing of direct mail postcards.

entries.title: Financial
entries.description: Financial printing involves the specialized printing services involved in US SEC EDGAR filings, initial public offerings (IPO's), mergers and aquisitions, and other compliance documents required of publicly traded companies. Note that it does not involve check printing, which is located in <a href="/Business/Publishing_and_Printing/Printing/Forms"> Business/Publishing_and_Printing/Printing/Forms</a>.

entries.title: Forms
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the printing of forms.

entries.title: Checks_and_Financial
entries.description: Business: Industries: Printing: Forms: Checks and Financial lists companies that print and provide printed checks and forms used by banking and financial institutions.

entries.title: Tax_Forms
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on printed tax forms.

entries.title: Invitations_and_Announcements
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the printing of invitations and announcements.<br><br> Sites that offer online shopping by including products, prices, and ordering information, are not listed here. Instead, they will will be found in <a href="/Shopping/Gifts/Stationery/Invitations_and_Announcements/">online shopping for invitations and announcements</a>.

entries.title: Labels,_Stickers,_and_Decals
entries.description: For sites about companies that print labels, stickers, and decals.

entries.title: Accessories
entries.description: Sites that specialize in the accessories that a customer would likely want or need when purchasing and using lables, stickers or decals. These would include dispensers and similar items.

entries.title: Industry-Specific
entries.description: Sites that are geared to a specific target industry but are not suitable in that specific category can be placed here. For instance, some make labels for only medical filing while others make decals for only union workers.

entries.title: Large_Run
entries.description: Sites that specialize in larger volume label, sticker or small decal printing. These sites often use flexography or screen printing and are able to produce larger quantities (more than 1000), helping to keep costs down. Many charge set up fees as they require creating special tools, accessories or equipment that will create a consistent, quickly reproducible product.

entries.title: Organization_Systems
entries.description: Sites that focus primarily on the labels, stickers or decals used with organizing and setting up filing systems.

entries.title: Overlays_and_Name_Plates
entries.description: Sites that focus their primary production on name plates (like those that include serial numbers and wattage information) and overlays (like dashboards). While many of these sites also manufacture other products, listed here will be those who focus more on overlays and name plates than their other products.

entries.title: Short_Run
entries.description: Sites that specialize in low volume label, sticker or small decal printing. These sites often use laser or inkjet printers and are able to produce smaller quantities (less than 1000); often without charging a set up fee.

entries.title: Plastic
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the printing of products made of plastic.

entries.title: Cards
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the printing of plastic cards.

entries.title: Presentation
entries.description: This category is for businesses specializing in folders, looseleaf binders, and related products.

entries.title: Reprographics
entries.description: The reprographic industry provides large- and wide-format reproduction services. The techniques used depend on the product and the quantity needed, and include diazo (blueline), electrostatic (xerographic), photographic, laser, and digital ink jet equipment.<br><br> The largest customers for these services are the architectural, engineering, manufacturing, retail, and advertising industries. Typical products are architectural and engineering blueprints and renderings, indoor and outdoor signage, maps, billboards, backlit displays, trade show graphics, and legal and medical exhibits.<br><br> Websites listed here will be primarily those of trade associations and industry resources. Businesses providing reprographic services to a very limited geographic area, like a single state (or equivalent), city, or metro area, are not listed here. These businesses may be found in their respective <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> categories

entries.title: Security
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the printing of products in which high security and protection against counterfeting are prime considerations. Examples include share certificates, banknotes, postage stamps, and certificates of authenticity.

entries.title: Stationery
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the printing of stationery.<br><br> Sites that offer online shopping by including products, prices, and ordering information, are not listed here. Instead, they will will be found in <a href="/Shopping/Gifts/Stationery/">personal stationery shopping</a> or <a href="/Shopping/Office_Products/Supplies/Stationery_and_Paper/">business stationery shopping</a>.

entries.title: Tickets
entries.description: This category is for sites focused on the printing of tickets.

entries.title: Publishing
entries.description: Publishing involves the preparation and issuing of printed or electronic materials for public distribution or sale. This category is for the sites of publishing businesses, and for sites related to, and focused on, the publishing process.</p> <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b> <ul> <li>Sites that offer to sell books and other publications directly from the website. These sites are found in <a href="/Shopping/Publications/"> Shopping: Publications</a>.</li> <li>Sites about self-published books or publications by a single author. If they offer sales directly from the site, these sites are found in <a href="/Shopping/Publications/"> Shopping: Publications</a>. If they do not, they are found in appropriate areas of <a href="/Arts/Literature/Genres/">Arts: Literature: Genres</a> and <a href="/Arts/Literature/Authors/">Arts: Literature: Authors</a>.</li></p>

entries.title: Academic_and_Technical
entries.description: Publishers in this category primarily produce works that include one or more of the following characteristics: the dissemination of current scholarship; the publication of classic works; the publication of journals; The subjects of their publications include almost all fields in which humans have traditionally sought to gain knowledge, although publishers who concentrate on the sciences are more appropriately listed in the Academic and Technical: Science subcategory.

entries.title: Books
entries.description: Book publishing involves the preparation and issuing of printed or electronic books for public distribution or sale. This category is for the sites of book publishing businesses, and for sites related to, and focused on, the book publishing process.</p> <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b> <ul> <li>Sites that offer to sell books directly from the publisher to the consumer. These sites are found in <a href="/Shopping/Publications/Books"> Shopping: Publications: Books</a>.</li> <li>Sites about self-published books by a single author. If they offer sales directly from the author to the consumer, these sites are found in <a href="/Shopping/Publications/Books"> Shopping: Publications: Books</a>. If they do not, they are found in appropriate areas of <a href="/Arts/Literature/Genres/">Arts: Literature: Genres</a> and <a href="/Arts/Literature/Authors/">Arts: Literature: Authors</a>.</li></p>

entries.title: Biographies
entries.description: Lists web sites of all publishers of biographical books, including historical, official and unofficial accounts of lives, public or private, as well as autobiographies and family histories.

entries.title: Personal_History
entries.description: Publishers of memoirs, autobiographies, life stories, personal histories and similar first-person narratives, who work privately or in open commerce for individuals, families, and small businesses.

entries.title: Business
entries.description: Publishers or publishers

entries.title: Computers
entries.description: This category is for PUBLISHERS of computer books. Individual computer book links belong elsewhere.

entries.title: Pre-K_through_12
entries.description: Publishers focusing exclusively on PreK through 12th grade.

entries.title: Fiction
entries.description: Publishers of fiction products available on the web or from the web.

entries.title: History
entries.description: Publishers of history books.

entries.title: Politics_and_Government
entries.description: Publishers who specialize in books about political topics, public affairs, public policy, philosophy of government, and political science.

entries.title: Reference
entries.description: Includes publishers of general reference publications, print, non-print and electronic.

entries.title: Phone_Directories
entries.description: <p>This category includes sites that publish and sell telephone directories, which may include address/location information. It also includes sites that offer telephone/address information available over the Web on a fee-based, subscription basis. <p>Sites that provide free Web based telephone/address look up services are listed under <a href="/Reference/Directories/Address_and_Phone_Numbers/"> Reference/Directories/Address_and_Phone_Numbers/ </a> <p> Sites that provide Yellow Page listing services for advertisers are listed under <a href="/Business/Marketing_and_Advertising/Advertising/Agencies/Yellow_Pages/"> Business/Marketing_and_Advertising/Advertising/Agencies/Yellow_Pages/ </a></td></tr></table></center> <blockquote> <p>This category includes sites that publish and sell telephone directories, which may include address/location information. It also includes sites that offer telephone/address information available over the Web on a fee-based, subscription basis. <p>Sites that provide free Web based telephone/address look up services are listed under <a href="/Reference/Directories/Address_and_Phone_Numbers/"> Reference/Directories/Address_and_Phone_Numbers/ </a> <p> Sites that provide Yellow Page listing services for advertisers are listed under <a href="/Business/Marketing_and_Advertising/Advertising/Agencies/Yellow_Pages/"> Business/Marketing_and_Advertising/Advertising/Agencies/Yellow_Pages/ </a>

entries.title: Religion_and_Spirituality
entries.description: This category is for the listing of publishers of religious and spiritual books, magazines, and other publications.

entries.title: Electronic
entries.description: Electronic publications are those that are made available on a variety of digital and magnetic media, including magnetic tapes, CDs, DVDs, and downloadable computer files.<br><br> This category is for sites that focus on electronic publishing. Primarily it contains sites of businesses that specialize in this field, although it is also appropriate for sites of consultants, informational articles, and trade organizations.<br><br> Sites whose primary focus is the technology underlying e-books are not listed here, but instead in <a href="/Computers/E-Books">Computers: E-Books</a>. Sites whose primary focus is the selling of e-books are not listed here either. They are found in <a href="/Shopping/Publications/Digital">Shopping: Publications: Digital</a>.

entries.title: E-Books
entries.description: Electronic books are full length books that can be viewed as electronic files on a computer or other electronic device.

entries.title: Literary_Agents
entries.description: A literary agent is someone who sells rights (usually book publication rights - but increasingly, other rights too - such as film rights, television rights, electronic rights) in work created by writers. Not all writers need a literary agent. However, many major publishers and virtually all film studios or production companies prefer that submissions (manuscripts or screenplays sent to them for consideration) should come via an agent. Having a good agent will increase - but not guarantee - your chances of getting published. A good agent will also negotiate a satisfactory contract on your behalf, ensure that you're paid on time, and do a hundred and one other things that writers need doing.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: These sites have information about literary agents including why you want an agent, how to get an agent, things to look for in an agent and what to avoid.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Directories of literary agents

entries.title: Magazines
entries.description: This category lists publishers of magazines and periodicals. Sites that sell magazine subscriptions and specific magazine titles should be submitted to the appropriate subject category.

entries.title: Newsletters
entries.description: A newsletter is a periodically issued report prepared for a business, institution, or individual. In general, newsletters focus on a single subject for a particular group of people. Newsletters are usually available through a specific organization or are distributed for free to members of a group. While newsletters tend to only be one or two color, four-color newsletters may also be published.

entries.title: Subscription_Management
entries.description: This category includes companies that provides circulation fulfillment and subscription management software and services for magazine, journal and newspaper publishers.

entries.title: Maps
entries.description: This category is for map publishers who do not sell their products online. Many publishers offer online sales, and those are listed in http://dmoz.org/Shopping/Publications/Maps .

entries.title: Music
entries.description: In this category you can find sites of companies that publish sheet music of any kind.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category lists sites of Associations and/or Organizations of Music Publishers worldwide.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category is for sites about conducting the business of publishing. Sites in it cover topics such as industry news, trends, and business practices.

entries.title: Retail
entries.description: The <b>Publications Retail</b> category contains sites for major retail chains and retail resources for the publishing industry.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: Companies or consultants offering services to publishers

entries.title: Design
entries.description: <p>This category lists companies offering design services to publishers of books, literature, periodicals, etc.</p> <p>Please note this category is <b>NOT</b> for the listing of Web Design or Graphic Design companies. </p>

entries.title: Free_Content
entries.description: Sources for free content and content exchange for ezine and other self publishers. This does not include individual writers offering articles in addition to their professional services.

entries.title: Real_Estate

translations.tha: อสังหาริมทรัพย์

entries.description: <p>The <b>Real Estate</b> sector category includes industries and establishments that are primarily engaged in renting or leasing real estate to others; managing real estate for others; selling, buying, or renting real estate for others; and providing other real estate related services, such as appraisal services.</p> <p><b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>All local and regional real estate agents, agencies, and businesses</b> are listed in the <a href="/Regional">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town where the office is located. This is discussed further in the <a href="/guidelines/regional/realestate.html">real estate guidelines</a>.</li> <li><b>Mortgage</b> sites are listed under <a href="/Business/Financial_Services/Mortgages/">Business: Financial_Services: Mortgages</a>.</li> <li>Establishments primarily engaged in construction and land development are classified under <a href="/Business/Construction_and_Maintenance/">Business: Construction and Maintenance</a>.</li> <li>Real Estate investing (e.g. REITs) sites are listed under <a href="/Business/Investing/Real_Estate/">Business: Investing: Real_Estate</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Agents_and_Agencies
entries.description: <p>The <b>Agents and Agencies</b> category includes global real estate agencies as well as sites for associations, education and training, and other support industries specifically for agents and/or agencies.</p> <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>All local and regional real estate agents and agencies</b> are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town where their office is located. This is discussed further in the <a href="/guidelines/regional/realestate.html">real estate guidelines</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: Sites listed in this category are international in scope and focus on aspects of commercial real estate, including but not limited to the sale and/or leasing of corporate, office, industrial, or commercial space.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for web sites that are directories of Real Estate Agents and Offices. Only those with a scope covering multiple countries on multiple continents can be included in this category. This is not a category for individual realtor or broker web sites. Sites that require an agent to pay for a listing are noted as "membership based".

entries.title: Residential
entries.description: <b>All local and regional real estate agents and agencies</b> are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town where their office is located. This is discussed further in the <a href="/guidelines/regional/realestate.html">real estate guidelines</a>.

entries.title: Appraisal
entries.description: <p>The <b>Real Estate Appraisal</b> category focuses on sites involving the appraisal of real estate. It does <b>not</b> include sites for Broker Price Opinions (BPO), or Automated Valuation Models (AVM) as these are not legally appraisals</p>

entries.title: Appraisers
entries.description: The subcategories of <b>Appraisers</b> includes sites for appraisers and appraisal companies.

entries.title: Agricultural
entries.description: This category is for appraisers with a primary specialty in agricultural land including farms and timber property.

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: This category lists sites dealing strictly with commercial appraisers. This will include shopping centers, free standing buildings, industrial parks, hotels, and recreational properties.

entries.title: Appraiser_Resources
entries.description: Real estate appraisal related resources other than appraisal services.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Find links to sites sites that are primarily or completely composed either of links to sites for or about real estate appraisal and/or related appraisal services, including directories of real estate appraisers with complete contact information and links to their sites. Please note, sites in this category should be have a coverage area of more than one county or on a national basis.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: This category includes schools and instruction for appraisers.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Sites that aid those seeking employment as a real estate appraiser, and also those that are seeking appraisers employees.

entries.title: Management
entries.description: Appraisal management is a business method in which an individual or group administers a network of certified and licensed appraisers to fulfill real estate appraisal assignments on behalf of mortgage lending institutions. Appraisal management companies have become popular in recent years because the add a layer of insulation between the mortgage originator and the actual appraiser, supposedly providing an unbiased business relationship.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, books, magazines and e-zines, and journals which deal exclusively with the appraisal of real estate or real estate appraisers.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: <p>The <b>Real Estate Associations</b> category includes sites for global or national real estate associations which have membership in many real estate professions that aim to inform, support, and promote the real estate profession.</p> <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>Associations with a narrow geographic focus</b> (for example, local or municipal real estate boards) are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town which they cover.</li> <li><b>Associations with a specific professional focus</b> are listed in other <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/">Business: Real Estate</a> categories according to that focus.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Commercial
entries.description: <p>The <b>Commercial Real Estate</b> sector category includes industries and establishments that are primarily engaged in the commercial (non-residential) component of the real estate industry.</p> <p><b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>All local and regional real estate agents, agencies, and businesses</b> are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town where their office is located. This is discussed further in the <a href="/realestateguidelines.html">real estate guidelines</a>.</li> <li>Several commercially focussed categories exist elsewhere in <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/">Business: Real Estate</a>. This includes <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Agents_and_Agencies/Commercial/">global commercial agents and agencies</a>, and sites dealing with <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Appraisal/Commercial/">commercial appraisal</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category contains sites relating to non-commercial associations of individuals active in business brokering.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for national and international directories of business brokers.

entries.title: National_Companies
entries.description: <strong> <font color=red size=+2>Real estate agents and local companies will NOT be listed in this category.</font> <BR><BR> This category is for companies and franchises that have office locations across an entire country. It is not designed for companies that want to conduct business worldwide.

entries.title: Specialty_Markets
entries.description: This category is for brokerage companies involved in buying and selling one type of business across an entire nation.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This subcategory lists firms operating on a consultancy basis in real estate-related matters; including valuation, REITs, land use, urban planning, corporate property investment, etc.</p> <p> If you function as a trainer or management consultant to real estate agents or brokers, please list your site under the <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training/</strong></a> category, or <a href="/Business/Management/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business: Training and Schools: Management Training</strong></a>. </p>

entries.title: Economic_Development_Agencies
entries.description: Find links to sites for or about economic development agencies.

entries.title: Hospitality
entries.description: This category is for sites that contain listings of hospitality related properties including restaurants, bars, inns, bed and breakfasts, lodges, hotels, or motels for sale. The sites in this category do business on a national or global basis. Real estate agents and brokerages should submit their sites to Regional for inclusion and not this category.

entries.title: Lenders
entries.description: <p>Lenders, mortgage bankers, equity partners, etc. serving the commercial real estate community. Sites must have commercial real estate finance content.</p>

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: Resources for market data related to commercial real estate.

entries.title: Multiple_Listing_Services
entries.description: Sites in this category allow users to list and find commercial (office, industrial, retail, investment, etc.) real estate for sale and/or lease. Unlike a directories category, this category lists industry related listing services similiar to a Multiple Listing Service.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, books, magazines and e-zines, and journals which deal exclusively with commercial real estate.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: This category includes sites featuring national and international real estate conventions such as exhibitions, trade shows, conferences and expositions.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This subcategory lists firms operating on a consultancy basis in real estate-related matters; including valuation, REITs, land use, urban planning, corporate property investment, etc.</p> <p> If you function as a trainer or management consultant to real estate agents or brokers, please list your site under the <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training</strong></a> category, or <a href="/Business/Management/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business/Management/Education_and_Training</strong></a>. </p> <p> Sites offering products, services, or information designed to enhance the appearance of real property or prepare it for sale, should be submitted to the <a href="/Home/"> <strong>Home</strong></a> section. </p>

entries.title: Foreclosures
entries.description: There are a few different kinds of sites that can be added to this category. Sites that offer clients options to avoid property foreclosure. Sites that offer personal consultants to assist in finding foreclosure information for investors. Sites that offer personal consultants to assist in finding pre-foreclosure and bankruptcy information for investors.

entries.title: Measurement_and_Space_Analysis
entries.description: Measurement and Space Analysis is a service used to verify the existing square footage of a building, floor, or other rent able space. It is a growing industry, with standards set by BOMA - the Building Owners and Managers Association, and generally offers a wide variety of space calculation products designed to assist the customer in making purchasing decisions, handling legal arbitration, or negotiating leases and contracts.

entries.title: Taxation_Issues
entries.description: This subcategory lists firms operating on a consultancy basis in taxation matters.</p> <p> If you function as a trainer or management consultant to real estate agents or brokers, please list your site under the <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training</strong></a> category, or <a href="/Business/Management/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business/Management/Education_and_Training</strong></a>. </p> <p> Sites offering products, services, or information designed to enhance the appearance of real property or prepare it for sale, should be submitted to the <a href="/Home/"> <strong>Home</strong></a> section. </p>

entries.title: Development
entries.description: This category lists companies which own and develop parcels of commercial real estate on an international basis.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: <p>This category includes sites for professional associations that aim to inform, support, and promote the real estate development profession.</p> <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>Associations with a narrow geographic focus</b> (for example, local developer associations focused on one city, one metro area, or one state) are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town which they cover.</li> <li><b>Associations with a different specific professional focus</b> are listed in other <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/">Business: Real Estate</a> categories according to that focus.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This subcategory lists firms operating on a consultancy basis in real estate-related matters; including valuation, REITs, land use, urban planning, corporate property investment, etc.</p> <p> If you function as a trainer or management consultant to real estate agents or brokers, please list your site under the <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training</strong></a> category, or <a href="/Business/Management/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business/Management/Education_and_Training</strong></a>. </p> <p> Sites offering products, services, or information designed to enhance the appearance of real property or prepare it for sale, should be submitted to the <a href="/Home/"> <strong>Home</strong></a> section. </p>

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Find links to sites related to real estate training. Possible topics include licensing schools, coaches, academic departments, and tutorials.

entries.title: Academic_Departments
entries.description: This category is for sites featuring university and college real estate programs. This may include undergraduate, graduate, and certificate programs.

entries.title: Designations
entries.description: Real Estate related institutes, societies, and councils provide a wide-ranging menu of programs and services that assist members in increasing skills, productivity and knowledge. Designations or certifications acknowledging experience and expertise in various real estate sectors are awarded by a group upon completion of required courses.

entries.title: Schools_and_Instruction
entries.description: This category is for sites featuring vocational schools and training institutes offering educational curricula for real estate professionals. Schools may offer classroom instructor-led training or distance learning programs or both.

entries.title: Seminars_and_Coaches
entries.description: This category is for sites featuring live training programs offered for real estate professionals by means of group seminars, workshops, speakers and coaches.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: This category contains sites dealing with Employment in the field of Real Estate.

entries.title: Individual_Resumes
entries.description: This category contains non-commercial sites featuring the resumes of individual professionals in the real estate industry.

entries.title: Job_Search
entries.description: This category contains sites that specialize in matching employers and employees in real estate related fields.

entries.title: Recruitment_and_Staffing
entries.description: Recruiters and staffers are professionals or professional firms that conduct searches for employees for their clients on a contingency basis. They research, source, interview and recommend candidates to their clients. The goal of this categories is to provide as complete and accurate a listing of Recruiters specializing in the real estate field. Recruiters are not employment agencies, they find people for jobs and their fees are paid by their clients. They do not charge their candidates.

entries.title: Guides_and_Directories
entries.description: This category is for sites that are primarily or completely composed either of links to other real estate sites or of property listings. Of particular importance is to note that this category should contain sites that do business primarily in many regions or on a global basis. Sites for local real estate agents/brokers should be submitted to the appropriate Business: Real Estate: Regional subcategory, even if they contain real estate property listings. Most states already have a subcategory for Directories and Guides. Most people will look for real estate agent sites by locality served.

entries.title: Inspection
entries.description: <p>The <b>Inspection</b> category includes property inspection organizations with a global presence. Other sites appropriate to be listed here include professional associations, those offering education and training to the profession, and directories of home inspectors.</p> <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b> All local and regional inspections firms and independent inspectors</b> are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town where their office is located.</ul>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Find links to sites for real estate inspection associations.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: <p>This category is for websites that are composed of links to other home inspection companies on the web. This is an International category. To be considered for inclusion here, the listings which make up your web directory should be broad and cover a wide area. If your directory site offers listings of home inspection companies on a local or regional level, please add your site to the <a href="/Regional">/Regional</a> branch instead.</p>

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Category includes training opportunities, schools and institutions offering courses in the home inspection and real property inspection processes.

entries.title: Legal
entries.description: <p>The <b>Legal</b> category includes global legal services and consultants specializing in real estate.</p>

entries.title: Title_Services
entries.description: This category will list companies that provide title services and service related to processing real estate titles. Listing will include escrow services, lawyers, law firms, title insurance services, abstract services, title search services, etc.

entries.title: Settlement_and_Escrow
entries.description: Title and abstract service providers.

entries.title: Title_Insurance
entries.description: <p>This category will list title insurance carriers, underwriters, and companies that support them. Settlement agencies and escrow firms will be listed in Business: Real Estate: Legal: Title Services: Settlement and Escrow. </p>

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: <p>The <b>Real Estate Marketing and Advertising</b> category includes marketing and advertising businesses who specifically serve the real estate industry. This includes companies that: <ul> <li>Market real estate companies through print and other advertising media</li> <li>Perform analysis of real estate markets</li> <li>Create promotional items specifically for real estate professionals</li> <li>Manufacture signs and displays for use by real estate agencies</li> </ul>

entries.title: Direct_Marketing
entries.description: This category is for sites featuring direct marketing services designed specifically for the real estate industry. Sites may feature mailing lists, electronic (email) lists, and other direct marketing techniques.

entries.title: Internet
entries.description: Find links to sites offering information and services on Internet marketing to the real estate industry.

entries.title: Virtual_Tours
entries.description: Software for creating virtual home tours for REAL ESTATE PROFESSIONALS ONLY.

entries.title: Promotional_Items
entries.description: This category is for companies that manufacture and distribute advertising gifts, incentives, novelties, and promotional products designed specifically for the real estate industry. Affiliates and other programs which distribute product for another company will not be listed.

entries.title: Signs_and_Displays
entries.description: This category includes the listing of sites featuring companies that manufacture or distribute signage, 3D architectural or model displays, and sign holders (such as flyer boxes and sign frames).

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: <p>The <b>Real Estate News and Media</b> category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, books, magazines and e-zines, and journals which deal exclusively with real estate.

entries.title: Weblogs
entries.description: Includes links to real estate weblogs covering a broad range of topics. Please note that sites about specific topics should be submitted to the more specific category.

entries.title: Property_Management
entries.description: Property management firms specialize in the management of residential, office, retail, industrial and commercial buildings, land, and/or spaces.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: <p>This category includes sites for professional associations that aim to inform, support, and promote the real estate property management profession.</p> <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>Associations with a narrow geographic focus</b> (for example, local property management associations focused on one housing property, one metro area, or one state) are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town which they cover.</li> <li><b>Associations with a different specific professional focus</b> are listed in other <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/">Business: Real Estate</a> categories according to that focus.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This subcategory lists firms operating on a consultancy basis in rental real estate management.<p> <p> If you function as a trainer or management consultant to real estate agents or brokers, please list your site under the <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business/Real_Estate/Education_and_Training</strong></a> category, or <a href="/Business/Management/Education_and_Training/"><strong>Business/Management/Education_and_Training</strong></a>. </p> <p> Sites offering products, services, or information designed to enhance the appearance of real property or prepare it for sale, should be submitted to the <a href="/Home/"> <strong>Home</strong></a> section. </p>

entries.title: Residential
entries.description: <p>The <b>Residential Real Estate</b> sector category includes industries and establishments that are primarily engaged in the residential (non-commercial) component of the real estate industry, including rentals (ex. apartments, etc.).</p> <p><b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>All local and regional real estate agents, agencies, and businesses</b> are listed in the <a href="/Regional/">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town where their office is located. This is discussed further in the <a href="/realestateguidelines.html">real estate guidelines</a>.</li> <li>Some residentially focussed categories exist elsewhere in <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/">Business: Real Estate</a>. This includes <a href="/Business/Real_Estate/Agents_and_Agencies/Residential/">residential agents and agencies</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Affordable_Housing
entries.description: Generally, "affordable housing" is defined as housing made available to and affordable for very-low, low and moderate income persons and families. In most cases, affordable housing is produced and maintained with some level of financial assistance from Federal, state, or private sources. Affordable housing may include homeownership, rental housing, special needs housing, and housing for the homeless.

entries.title: Advocates
entries.description: This category contains web sites of affordable housing advocacy groups. Housing advocacy groups of all kinds including those for the homeless, elderly, handicapped, farmworkers, persons with AIDS, or the rural or urban poor are welcome here.

entries.title: Affordable_Housing_Providers
entries.description: This category contains sites for or about the providers and developers of affordable housing projects. For-profit developers, non-profit developers, public housing authorities, homeless shelters and housing cooperatives should be listed here.

entries.title: Technical_Assistance_Providers
entries.description: This category contains web sites of affordable housing technical assistance (TA) providers. TA providers assist non-profits in acquiring, developing, and managing affordable housing.

entries.title: Cooperatives
entries.description: Housing cooperatives, collectives, and associations based on a cooperative business model.

entries.title: Corporate_Housing
entries.description: <p>The Corporate Housing category lists alternative accommodations, usually for business travelers. Corporate housing units, sometimes called "extended stay", "short term rentals" or "temporary housing", are furnished and are available for between two weeks and several months.</p> <p>This category lists sites offering information on corporate housing that are national or international in scope.</p>

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for web sites that offer international searchable databases of residential real estate for sale in <b>multiple countries on multiple continents</b>.

entries.title: Grants,_Credits_and_Assistance
entries.description: Find links to sites offering information on housing grants, tax incentives, and general assistance. Please note, this category does not list businesses offering related services.

entries.title: Luxury_Homes
entries.description: This category includes sites with national and international listings for luxury homes.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: This category contains sites containing information and statistics about real estate markets and housing in general.

entries.title: Rentals
entries.description: Find in this category web sites with national and international listings for apartment rentals proposed by individuals or real estate agencies; roommates finder; and services for property homeowner to help them rent.

entries.title: Students
entries.description: Find in this category sites with listings for apartment rentals proposed by individuals or real estate agencies; including roommate finders.

entries.title: Undeveloped_or_Vacant
entries.description: <p>The <b>Undeveloped or Vacant</b> sector category includes industries and establishments that are primarily engaged in lots and land that are <b>not</b> agricultural in nature.</p> <p><b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>All local and regional real estate agents, agencies, and businesses</b> are listed in the <a href="/Regional">Regional</a> branch according to the city or town where their office is located. This is discussed further in the <a href="/realestateguidelines.html">real estate guidelines</a>.</li> <li>Agricultural sites with an international focus are listed in the <a href="/Business/Agriculture_and_Forestry/Farm_Real_Estate">Agricultural</a> category.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Sites listed in this category include information resources of interest to a businessperson. Sites should not solely focus on promoting a business enterprise (e.g. a company's web site), or selling a product or service. Sites listed directly under Business/Resources should provide a comprehensive overview of the field of Business. The information contained in these sites should cover multiple areas of business. Resources typically include search engines *and* directory information. They usually provide directories, FAQs, chats, forums, news, publications, etc. all on one site. Sites that are solely directories or search engines should be placed in either the Directories or Search_Engines subcategories. -- rdkeating25, updated 6/16/00

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: Sites with details of national and international business events such as exhibitions, trade shows, seminars, conferences and expositions.

entries.title: Standards_and_Codes
entries.description: This category will list the URLs that describe Business operating standards and Codes as well as the companies that provide services to implement and/or maintain these standards and codes. Examples of standards are the ISO standards and an example of codes are Building, Construction and Fire codes.

entries.title: Retail_Trade
entries.description: <p>The <b>Retail Trade</b> sector category includes industries and establishments that focus primarily on providing products and services to retailers. Included in this category are sites covering the retail merchandising industry, retailer resources, suppliers and manufacturers of retailing products, and services that support the industry.</p> <p><b>Retailers listed in <a href="/Business/">Business</a> vs. <a href="/Shopping/">Shopping</a></b></p> <p>Corporate sites for regional, national, and international retail chains, corporations, and holding companies may be listed within Business if they are focussed on providing information about the retailer rather than functioning as a consumer shopping destination.</p> <p>For example, <a href="http://www.walmartstores.com/">http://www.walmartstores.com/</a> is WalMart's corporate site, and may be listed in the Business branch. However, <a href="http://www.walmart.com/">http://www.walmart.com/</a> is a consumer shopping site, and would thus be listed in <a href="/Shopping/">Shopping</a>.</p> <p>When a retailer's site functions as both a corporate site and a shopping destination, the site is generally listed only in the <a href="/Shopping/">Shopping</a> branch (e.g. <a href="http://www.landsend.com/">http://www.landsend.com/</a>).</p> <p><b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b></p> <ul> <li>Individual retailers are listed in one of three places, according to the above criteria. <ul> <li><a href="/Business/"><b>Business</b></a>: Those which qualify for a listing in Business are listed according to their industry. For example, sites for major automotive retail chains are listed in <a href="/Business/Automotive/Retail/">Business: Automotive: Retail</a>.</li> <li><a href="/Shopping/"><b>Shopping</b></a>: Retailer sites designed as online destinations for distance shopping.</li> <li><a href="/Regional/"><b>Regional</b></a>: Sites for local retail outlets are listed according to the city or town where they are located.</li> </ul> </li> <li>Manufacturers of the goods sold by retailers are listed according to their primary industry within Business. Many are listed in <a href="/Business/Consumer_Goods_and_Services/">Business: Consumer Goods and Services</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: The <b>Retail Trade Conferences</b> category covers conferences, trade shows, and expositions which are for the retail industry as a whole.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category is for web sites related to consultants specializing in one or more areas of retail trade, and specifically serve retail businesses.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: This category is for directories related to retail trade as a whole.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: The Retail category contains sites offering employment opportunities in the retail industry.

entries.title: Job_Search
entries.description: The Job Search category provides listings of employment sites, job portals, and sites which provide Job Seekers with information which specifically relates to finding a job in the Retail field, as opposed to career related information or resumes.

entries.title: Loss_Prevention
entries.description: This category is meant as a resource for retail businesses to research Loss Prevention methods and services.

entries.title: Electronic_Article_Surveillance
entries.description: This category is for sites that <i>primarily</i> deal with Electronic Article Surveillance systems and accessories. Most of the sites in here are suppliers, however any EAS site is welcome in here. Some of the sites in here may also deal with RFID.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: This category lists marketing sites targeted to retailers only.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: The <b>Retail Trade News and Media</b> category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, magazines, and e-zines which deal exclusively with retail trade.

entries.title: Retailers
entries.description: This category contains informational, not shopping, sites for <b>major retail corporations</b> which operate multiple retail outlets on a national or international level.

entries.title: Convenience_Stores
entries.description: Convenience stores usually offer groceries and fuel to travelers and local customers. Some offer restaurant or other prepared food.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, magazines, and e-zines which deal exclusively with Convenience Store retailing.

entries.title: Informal_Selling
entries.description: Informal sellers include garage sales, estate sales, jumble sales, yard sales, etc. This category <b>does not</b> list individual sales. Instead, it lists directories of sales and similar online resources.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: For services provided TO the Retail Industry for the operation and support of a retail business or the support of a particular aspect of retailing.

entries.title: Inventory
entries.description: This category is for sites that provide inventory or counting services to retailers.

entries.title: Merchandising
entries.description: This category is for companies and sites that offer merchandising services to brick and mortar retailers.

entries.title: Specialty
entries.description: This category is meant as a resource for retail businesses. Specialty items such as "Retail Cigar Cases", "Seasonal Mall Displays", and other sites that may have very specialized display products.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category is for web sites related to consultants specializing in one or more areas of retail technology, and specifically serve retail businesses.

entries.title: Electronic_Shelf_Labels
entries.description: This category is for sites related to businesses that provide electronic shelf label (ESL) technology.

entries.title: Pedestrian_Counters
entries.description: This category is for people counters, pedestrian traffic monitors and related technology.

entries.title: Point_of_Sale
entries.description: This category is for sites related to point of sale technologies, including hardware, software, and POS selection.

entries.title: Hardware
entries.description: Non-Proprietary Open Based Point of Sale (POS) Hardware Peripherals

entries.title: Cash_Registers
entries.description: Cash Registers and EPOS Systems.

entries.title: Credit_Card_Processing
entries.description: This category is for sites related to credit card processing <b>hardware</b>, which includes terminals, check readers, imprinters and related equipment.

entries.title: Supplies
entries.description: Supplies for point of sale, ribbons, paper, ink, etc.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This cat is meant for retail software providers and resources.

entries.title: Home_and_Garden
entries.description: Software for use in managing retail furniture businesses.

entries.title: Jewelry
entries.description: Software for use in managing retail jewelry trade.

entries.title: Small_Business

translations.tha: องค์กรขนาดกลางและย่อม

entries.description: <p>The <b>Small Business</b> category is a resource-based category aimed at owners and operators of small businesses. It contains sites about small businesses, small business operations, advice for starting a small business, and other resources.</p> <p><b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b></p> <ul> <li>Sites for individual small businesses are not listed here. Most will be listed geographically by <a href="/Regional/">the city or town where they are located</a>. Those which offer online sales to a non-local audience may qualify for a listing in the <a href="/Shopping/">Shopping branch</a>.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for non profit, educational and trade associations that inform, enable the support the development and maintenance of <B>Small Businesses.</B> General Business and Commerce Associations that deal specifically with business within a locality, such as a local chamber of commerce, should be found at that locality's regional business category. General Business and Commerce Associations that deal specifically with business within a country, should be found at that country's regional business category, for example: Regional/North_America/Canada/Business_and_Economy/Associations/ General Business and Commerce Associations that deal with business between nations, should be found at Business/International_Business_and_Trade/Associations Industry Specific Associations are found as a subcategory of the Industry such as Business/Industries/(Insert Industry Name)/Associations

entries.title: Business_Plans
entries.description: <p>Business plans are strategic documents which detail: the nature of a business and its key goals; the marketing plan; the financial management strategy; and the management plan for a business venture. The <b>Business Plans</b> category includes:</p> <ul> <li>Sites discussing the purpose, scope, or key components of a business plan, and <li>Sites offering tools or advice for the preparation of a plan <li>Enterprises offering consulting services specific to business plans </ul>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: This category lists enterprises whose primary service is to assist with the creation of business plans.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This category lists software providers whose primary focus is to provide software, templates or online tools to assist with the creation of business plans.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Professional advisers who offer consultation, criticism or constructive feedback, improvement services, or other advice to Small Business or small business owners or managers. This category is NOT marketers, developers, opportunity offers or any solicitations to small businesses outside of the realm of professional advice.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Directories are compilation of websites containing comprehensive indexes or lists of general business resources, companies, and company related information. They are usually searchable. Users should be able to visit the listed directories and obtain information about websites pertaining to Small Business.

entries.title: Business_Listings
entries.description: Directories that primarily list small businesses in a given area, field, or subject.

entries.title: Finance
entries.description: Resources for financing small businesses are often found at the local level. This category is for national resources on small business finance. See the link to Regions/US if seeking small business finance. We suggest that you look within your local region for financial institutions, especially ones with whom you can have face to face discussions.

entries.title: Home_Office
entries.description: <p>The <b>Home Office</b> category is a resource-based category which includes sites containing advice, information, or online tools for setting up and effectively managing a home office.</p>

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Advice and information resources for the person operating a business from their home.

entries.title: Work_at_Home_Parents
entries.description: Sites offering information or advice on how to start, run, and stay in business along with offering information or advice on various stages of business operations (financing, insuring, and promotion), which cater to the needs of work at home families are listed here.

entries.title: Marketing_and_Advertising
entries.description: <p>The <b>Small Business Marketing and Advertising</b> category includes marketing and advertising businesses who specifically serve the unique needs of small businesses. This includes companies that: <ul> <li>Market small businesses through print and other advertising media</li> <li>Perform analysis of small business markets</li> <li>Create promotional items specifically for small businesses</li> </ul>

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: The <b>Small Business News and Media</b> category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, magazines, and e-zines which deal exclusively with small business topics.

entries.title: Magazines_and_E-zines
entries.description: The <b>Small Business Magazines and E-zines</b> category includes magazines and e-zines that specifically cover small business.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: "A Resources directory is analogous to the Reference Room of a library." ie. resources which are of use to Small Business owners.

entries.title: Australia
entries.description: Small business resource sites focused on businesses in Australia.

entries.title: Canada
entries.description: Resources addressing country-wide aspects of small business in Canada.

entries.title: Networking_and_Peer_Support
entries.description: Groups and networks that provide peer-to-peer and mentoring support for small business owners.

entries.title: United_States
entries.description: Small business resource sites focused on businesses in the United States of America

entries.title: Start_Up
entries.description: <p>The <b>Start Up</b> category lists sites focused on the topic of starting a small business.</p>

entries.title: Business_Formation
entries.description: Companies that prepare and file company formation documents with state and federal authorities such as articles of incorporation for a new corporation. Registered Agents, Resident Agents and other domiciliary services.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Professional advisers who offer consultation, criticism or constructive feedback, improvement services, or other advice to small business start ups or small business entrepreneurs. This category is NOT marketers, developers, opportunity offers or any solicitations to small businesses outside of the realm of professional advice.

entries.title: Entrepreneurship
entries.description: Entrepreneurship involves the study of the process of starting new businesses, and the factors that affect their success or failure. Sites in this category focus on academic research and assistance programs devoted to entrepreneurship.

entries.title: High-Tech
entries.description: <p>The <b>Start Up: High-Tech</b> category lists resource-based sites that provide advice, information, or self-help tools about starting a high-tech business.</p>

entries.title: Incubators
entries.description: This category is for sites for and about small business incubators. A small business incubator is a physical facility, which provides offices, warehousing and manufacturing space, shared board/meeting space, kitchen facilities and a common reception area. The incubator provides a receptionist to greet visitors and to assist tenants in using a shared copier, fax, and audio-visual equipment and often times computers. The incubator manager assists tenants in preparing business plans, securing financing, business counseling and management advising. Tenants are expected to graduate from the incubator within a reasonable time frame to allow others to use the service. The incubator recoups costs by charging reasonable lease rates and fees and charges for the use of specialized services and equipment. Sites for companies providing finances and consulting services, but no physical facilities should be listed under <a href="/Business/Financial_Services/Venture_Capital/"> Business/Financial_Services/Venture_Capital/</a>.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: <p>The <b>Start Up Resources</b> category lists resource-based sites which provide advice, information, or self-help tools for starting a small business.</p>

entries.title: Telecommunications

translations.tha: โทรคมนาคม

entries.description: <p>The <b>Telecommunications </b>sector category comprises industries and establishments primarily engaged in operating, maintaining or providing access to facilities for the transmission of voice, data, text, and video between network termination points and telecommunications reselling. Transmission facilities may be based on a single technology or a combination of technologies. This category also contains industry information, support services, as well as sites for equipment suppliers and manufacturers.</p> <p><b>Sites generally <u>not listed</u> in this category include:</b></p> <ul> <li>Scientific, technical, and research oriented sites are listed under <a href="/Science/Technology/Electrical_Engineering/Communications/">Science: Technology: Electrical Engineering: Communications</a>.</li> <li>Informational and resource sites covering computer network data communication are listed under <a href="/Computers/Data_Communications/">Computers: Data Communications</a>.</li> <li><b>Affiliate sites or co-branded sites are not listed in the Directory</b>. Affiliate sites include (but are not limited to): Cognigen Communications, American Telecom Network, Excel, Internet Call Manager, Telegroup, Voice Net, World Quest, and WorldxChange.</li> </ul>

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Professional organizations and trade associations serving the Telecommunication Industry.

entries.title: Call_Centers
entries.description: Call centers are service operations that handle routine communications by telephone, email, fax, or other electronic means, between an organization and outside parties. The communications typically involve such things as product information, technical support, live messaging, ordering, and telemarketing.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Companies which offer consulting services to the call center industry.

entries.title: Equipment
entries.description: Hardware and software products which support the operations of call centers.

entries.title: Computer_Telephony_Integration
entries.description: Businesses which offer solutions enabling computer applications to take control of telephone systems to provide enhanced call control capabilities.

entries.title: Providers
entries.description: Call center providers are businesses that handle routine communications by telephone, email, fax, or other electronic means, between an organization and outside parties. The communications typically involve such things as product information, technical support, live messaging, ordering, and telemarketing.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Software to assist in the development and operation of call centers. CTI and Help Desk software are not shown in this category.

entries.title: Carriers
entries.description: Telecommunications providers which own their own switching equipment and network.

entries.title: Landline
entries.description: This category is for landline (also known as wireline) carriers that own and operate their own networks. Businesses that are both landline and wireless carriers are listed in the main Carriers category, rather than this subcategory.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Public relations news and media resources from companies in the wireless industry.

entries.title: Wireless
entries.description: This category is for wireless carriers that own and operate their own networks. Wireless includes satellite communications as well as terrestrial cellular/PCS. Businesses that are both landline and wireless carriers are listed in the main Carriers category, rather than this subcategory.

entries.title: Colocation
entries.description: Colocation service companies host the servers of other businesses. This allows a business to control its own server configuration, while having the colocation service company handle hosting the server and connecting it to the internet. This category focuses on the business of providing neutral carrier colocation services.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Submit sites whose primary focus is to list multiple colocation providers - whether the directory is for profit or is a free service. Examples include the sites of directories that list multiple carrier-neutral colocation service providers.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: Time specific conferences, trade shows, seminars about telecommunications .

entries.title: Construction,_Installation,_and_Maintenance
entries.description: Contractors' sites that install, maintain and upgrade Central office equipment, cable installation. Large companies that have a work force that Telco's sub out for major overhauls, maintenance and repairs. For more regionally specific company websites, please see the appropriate category in Top/Regional/. If you have only one office location, please submit to that Regional/Locality/Business_and_Economy/ and a new category has been added for Telephone Interconnects <a href="/Business/Telecommunications/Equipment/Suppliers/Vendors/">Telephone Vendors</a>. for those companies who sell, install and wire phone systems with-in the Business community.</p> For those companies who sell, wire and or install Networks please submit your site to: <a href="/Computers/Data_Communications/Installation/">Data Installers</a>.</p>

entries.title: Towers
entries.description: Wireless equipment Towers and Antennas installation and maintenance for Business applications.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Association sites about the Tower Industry.

entries.title: Management
entries.description: This category is for companies which provide management , rental, and leasing services for communication towers.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Businesses which provide impartial advice on telecommunications issues.

entries.title: Solutions_Providers
