entries.title: Fleet_Disposals
entries.description: Bus and coach sales direct from operators.

entries.title: Used
entries.description: Dealers specialising in the sale of second-hand buses and coaches.

entries.title: Car_Sharing
entries.description: For sites related to car-sharing (where a fleet of cars is jointly-shared in a flexible short term membership based manner). These can be organized as democratically-controlled companies, for-profit corporations, public agencies, and/or cooperatives.

entries.title: Cooperatives
entries.description: This category will list carsharing companies that are Cooperatives (also called Co-Ops) and operate under the cooperative business model i.e. worker-owned, customer-owned, farmer-owned, consumer-owned or some collective-owned business model.

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category will list URLs for news services, newspapers, books, magazines and e-zines, and journals that are dedicated to the car sharing industry.

entries.title: Specialty
entries.description: For sites related to high-value, exotic, classic, historical, and other specialty car sharing organizations.

entries.title: Conferences
entries.description: Formal and informal conferences, meetings, trade shows, and workshops, and associated events related to Transportation Industry.

entries.title: Couriers_and_Messengers
entries.description: Courier companies, small freight, express and messenger services worldwide and local. Also hot shot services.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: A member served accociation for the benefit of the Courier and Messenger industry.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Software developed with the Transport industry in mind.

entries.title: Customs
entries.description: Customs are the duties, tolls, and imposts imposed by a government on imports or exports. Customs brokers help importers and exporters comply with the laws and procedures. This category is for sites about customs and businesses focused primarily on providing customs services. Companies that offer customs services, but are primarily involved in freight forwarding, are listed in the Freight Forwarding category.

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: General category for all consulting companies related to any kind of transportation, eg. public transport, forwarding, logistic, physical transport, etc.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: The Distribution-industry specific software area covers software companies and products of interest to distributors and wholesalers. Types of software found under this category include inventory management, order entry, warehouse management, electronic data interchange (EDI), and the emerging area of electronic commerce and XML and BizTalk. The reason for distribution being a separate from general business or enterprise resource management (ERP) is that the distributor occupies a distinct place in, what is called, the extended supply chain, that reaches from manufacturer to the end-customer. Some business trends attempt to remove the distributor from the supply chain (a process called disintermediation). A distributor's choice of business management software is critical in streamlining business processes, increasing profitability, reducing transaction costs, enhancing customer service, maximizing inventory investment, and remaining competitive and a valuable contributor in the supply chain.

entries.title: Fleet_Maintenance
entries.description: The Fleet_Maintenance Category is for companies that provide systems, specialized equipment, or other services that assist in maintaining a fleet of vehicles.

entries.title: Freight_Forwarding
entries.description: Freight forwarders facilitate the movement of goods in international trade by playing an intermediary role between their clients and the companies who pick up, transport, and deliver goods to their destinations. Freight forwarders negotiate freight rates with transport providers. Considering cost, speed, and reliability, they recommend the best mode of transport to their customers. Once a plan has been approved, they work to make sure the goods are transported and delivered as agreed. In carrying out their work, freight forwarders frequently provide associated services, such as customs services, NVOCC services, warehousing, and advice about risk management, financing, and methods of payment. This category is for sites about the topic of freight forwarding, and for the sites of businesses whose primary business activity is freight forwarding. A subcategory named for a specific country is for sites focused primarily on shipping goods from that country to places elsewhere.

entries.title: Maritime
entries.description: This category covers all aspects of the maritime industry, from Ship Owners to Ports. Category is divided into several specialized subcategories, each dealing with a particular aspect of the maritime industry, i.e. Agents, Brokers and Charterers, Maritime Administrations, Shipyards etc. See also Recreation/Boating and relevant subcategories.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Listing of shipping (maritime) related associations and organisations - government and non-government - around the world.

entries.title: Pilots
entries.description: Listing of associations and organisations relevant to marine pilots world wide.

entries.title: Shipbuilding_and_Naval_Engineering
entries.description: This category will list organizations, trade associations, clubs, and any other organized body of people or companies involved with the Shipbuilding and Naval Engineering industry.

entries.title: Crewing_Agencies_and_Services
entries.description: Listing of companies/businesses involved in supplying crews to the maritime community.

entries.title: Equipment_and_Supplies
entries.description: Sites related to the manufacture, supply and distribution of ship and marine equipment.

entries.title: Port_and_Harbour_Equipment
entries.description: Sites concerned with the manufacture, supply and use of quayside equipment. Including mooring, berthing, harbour and port installations and associated kit.

entries.title: Insurance
entries.description: Companies specializing in maritime insurance.

entries.title: Personal_Pages
entries.description: Listing of personal homepages with a strong maritime content, i.e. unofficial one-ship specific sites etc. Only sites deemed to be of genuine interest to the maritime community will be accepted, if sites are covering the same subject, i.e. "Titanic", then only the best and most informative sites will be accepted.

entries.title: Ports
entries.description: Guide to ports and port services around the world. See relevant subcategories for country specific ports.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: Listing of companies servicing the maritime industry such as crew management, training, employment and products relevant to the maritime industry. Marine Surveyors, Agents and Ship Chandlers listed in own sub-categories.

entries.title: Buying_or_Selling_Ships
entries.description: Includes Sale and Purchase Brokers.

entries.title: Container_Leasing
entries.description: Maritime container leasing companies.

entries.title: Surveyors_and_Adjusters
entries.description: Includes marine surveyors, average adjusters, classification societies, and associations. In general, it lists all sites having something to do with marine insurance claims or ship/boat value and condition.

entries.title: Average_Adjusters
entries.description: An average adjuster is a marine claims specialist responsible for adjusting and providing the general average statement. Usually appointed by the shipowner or insurer.

entries.title: Classification_Societies
entries.description: Classification societies determine the structural and mechanical fitness of ships and other marine structures for their intended purpose. Many have branched into broader industrial safety verification areas.

entries.title: Marine_Surveyors
entries.description: Marine surveyors are appraisors with a significant degree of knowledge about ships/yachts/boats and evaluating their condition and worth.

entries.title: Vessel_Delivery_and_Transport
entries.description: For sites providing crewed yacht delivery and inland transport.

entries.title: Transporters
entries.description: This category is for the listing of sites offering boat transport services across any given country.

entries.title: Shipyards
entries.description: A shipyard is a place where <b>ships</b> are built or repaired. In addition to sites for shipyards, this category includes sites such as directories or associations of ship builders.

entries.title: Shipbreaking
entries.description: Ship breaking, also known as ship recycling, disposal, or demolition, involves deconstructing vessels into saleable or conventionally disposable components. Most ship breaking now is done in Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, and China, with a small amount in Turkey. Most of these operations are technically unsophisticated, generally involving beaching the vessel under power, removing motors, electronics, and such, then cutting up the vessel's steel for scrap. Ship breaking is the source of millions of tons of steel each year. Concerns have been raised about environmental and worker safety in ship breaking yards.

entries.title: Ship_Owners_and_Management
entries.description: Guide to shipowners and ship management companies involved in general cargo, container transportation, gas and oil tankers, salvage and towing and similar maritime activities. The above companies are listed in applicable sub-categories depending upon where (which country) the company's head office is based - not which area it serves. See also Business/Transportation/Ferry Services Business/Transportation/Ocean Cruiselines

entries.title: Ferries
entries.description: Listing of ferry operators and services around the world.

entries.title: General_Cargo
entries.description: Listing of Ship Owners and Ship Managements companies involved with car-carriers, container, ro-ro, lash, reefer and general cargo vessels.

entries.title: Liquid_Bulk_and_Gas

translations.jpn: タンカー・ガス運搬船

entries.description: Listing of Ship Owners and Ship Management companies involved with oil, petrol, chemical and other liquid bulk cargoes and gas tankers.

entries.title: Yacht_Management_Companies
entries.description: This category is for sites that provide management, consulting, advice, care and maintenance, evaluations, personnel management, repair, and other general services for yacht owners.

entries.title: Auctions
entries.description: Where the transportation of cargo and freight is put to auction. This is not the Category for freight brokers.

entries.title: Freight_Exchanges
entries.description: A Freight Exchange is a market place for transporters and transport users.

entries.title: Trucking
entries.description: This category is for road transport freight exchanges. A market place where road transport providers and road transport users can utilize empty vehicles.

entries.title: Moving_Services

translations.jpn: 軽貨物・引越しサービス

entries.description: This category and its sub-categories list sites for businesses that offer services directly related to the one-off, exceptional movement or temporary storage of equipment, items, or possessions.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category lists sites of trade associations and organizations related to moving services.

entries.title: Auto_Transport
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that provide automobile moving services and products.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This category is dedicated to software designed for the automobile transport industry.

entries.title: Brokers_and_Bid_Services
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that arrange and trade space on vehicles already being used in moves.

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: Lists sites containing alphabetical or classified lists of moving resources and businesses.

entries.title: Truck_and_Van_Rental
entries.description: Lists sites for businesses that rent light trucks and vans for short periods of time to allow self-driven moves. Local businesses are listed within <a href="/Regional/">Regional/</a> only. Most businesses listed here have networks of depots, where vehicles may be rented from one location, and returned to a second location following the move.

entries.title: Non-Vessel_Operating_Common_Carrier_-_NVOCC
entries.description: Non-Vessel Operating Common Carrier (NVOCC) is a cargo consolidator of small shipments in maritime trade, generally soliciting business and arranging for or performing containerization functions at the port. An NVOCC does not own the seagoing vessel. This category is for sites about NVOCC and the businesses focused primarily on providing NVOCC services.

entries.title: Rail
entries.description: Businesses involved in rail transport or infrastructure, including operators, manufacturers or suppliers of products, services and equipment to the rail industry.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: Listing of rail, railroad and railway related associations and organisations, governmental and non-governmental, world wide

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: *** THIS IS NOT A CATEGORY FOR INDIVIDUAL BUSINESSES *** A directory is a guide or list of resources, not an individual business. Directories for recreational, hobbyist, enthusiast or heritage rail topics should be included under the <a href="/Recreation/Trains_and_Railroads/">/Recreation/Trains_and_Railroads/</a> category.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: Listing of rail, railroad and railway related employment agencies and recruiters.

entries.title: Network_Infrastructure
entries.description: Owners and maintainers of railway network infrastructure, such as rail track, bridges, sidings, stations, freight yards etcNetwork Infrastructure companies do not operate trains. Companies operating trains as well as owning infrastructure, should be listed in the appropriate category under <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Operators/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Operators/</a>

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: Includes only rail business related publications, whether news sources, magazines, or periodicals which are aimed specifically at professionals in the rail industry. Publications covering recreational, hobbyist, enthusiast or heritage rail topics should be included under the <a href="/Recreation/Trains_and_Railroads/">/Recreation/Trains_and_Railroads/</a> category.

entries.title: Operators
entries.description: Businesses involved in rail operations (either passenger or freight) which maybe national or local, public or private, which operate predominantly on a 'for profit' or 'public service basis. <BR><BR>Operators which are of a heritage, charitable or predominantly recreational nature should be listed under <a href="/Recreation/Trains_and_Railroads/Organizations/">/Recreation/Trains and Railroads/Organizations/</a>

entries.title: Products
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying products for the rail industry. Permanent way or rolling stock products should be listed in the appropriate sub category. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Permanent_Way
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying permanent way products for the rail industry. Permanent way is railway trackwork, switches, turnouts crossings and other infrastructure upon which trains run.<br><br>Permanent way products should be listed in the appropriate sub category. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Infrastructure
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying permanent way infrastructure for the rail industry includes such things as drainage, bridgeworks etc. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Maintenance
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying permanent way maintenance materials for the rail industry. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Signalling
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying permanent way signalling equipment and safety products for the rail industry. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Trackwork
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying permanent way trackwork products, including rail, pointwork/switches etc. for the rail industry. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Rolling_Stock
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying railway rolling stock (i.e. wheeled vehicles for use on railways) and ancillary products. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Components_and_Parts
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying components and parts for railway rolling stock. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Freight
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying freight rolling stock, including wagons. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Locomotive
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying stand-alone locomotives. Rail cars, motor powered carriages, multiple units etc. should be listed under <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/Rolling_Stock/Passenger/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/Rolling Stock/Passenger/</a> <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Maintenance_and_Specialist
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying railroad rolling stock for maintenance or other specialist purposes including such items as tampers, rail movers, rail cranes etc. <BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Passenger
entries.description: Businesses involved in manufacturing, fabricating or supplying passenger rolling stock, including carriages, rail cars and multiple units.<BR><BR>Services are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Services/</a>

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Sites listed in this category include information resources of interest to a rail professional. Sites should not solely focus on promoting a business enterprise (e.g. a company's web site), or selling a product or service. Resources typically include search engines *and* directory information. They usually provide directories, FAQs, chats, forums, news, publications, etc. all on one site. Sites that are solely directories should be placed in the Directories subcategory.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: Businesses involved in services for the rail industry. Services should be listed in the appropriate sub category. <BR><BR>Products are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/</a>

entries.title: Consulting
entries.description: Businesses involved in general or multi-disciplinary consulting services for the rail industry.<BR><BR>Products are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/</a>

entries.title: Contractors
entries.description: Businesses involved in general or specialist contracting services for the rail industry.<BR><BR>Products are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/</a>

entries.title: Leasing
entries.description: Businesses involved in providing leasing services for the rail industry.<BR><BR>Products are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/</a>

entries.title: Logistics
entries.description: Businesses involved in logistics services including freight services and miscellaneous forwarding and handling services for the rail industry.<BR><BR>Products are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/</a>

entries.title: Software
entries.description: Businesses involved in providing software services for the rail industry.<BR><BR>Products are listed in a separate category <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/">/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Rail/Products/</a>

entries.title: Training_and_Safety
entries.description: Sites containing information relating to employee training and organizational safety issues for the rail industry.

entries.title: Software
entries.description: This category will list Software that is used in the Transportation Industry.

entries.title: Special_Goods_and_Terms
entries.description: A area for companies who offer specialist services to, or actually transport, less run-of-the-mill items. These could include Dangerous Goods (chemicals), abnormally large items, livestock and pets, or items that will require specialist handling and storage.

entries.title: Animals
entries.description: This category will house those sites specifically dealing with the transportation of animals.

entries.title: Equine
entries.description: While many people have their own trailers and horseboxes, there are also companies that specialise in transporting horses, locally, within a country or overseas. This category lists companies that provide transport and related services for horse owners.

entries.title: Pets
entries.description: <b>Businesses that transport animals country-wide or globally.</b>

entries.title: Taxis
entries.description: This category includes general links about the Taxicab Industry. Sites for local taxicab companies should be listed in the appropriate city category in the Regional branch.

entries.title: Companies
entries.description: The <strong>Towing and Recovery</strong> sector category includes industries providing transportation of autos, boats, large vehicles, trailers, planes and any other vehicle on land, air or sea, emergency roadside assistance and collision recovery for the general public, commercial or financial institutions. Also included in this category are industries and companies whose main form of business is consisting of the towing and recovery services. <ul> <li>Garage mechanic and mobile mechanic oriented sites that do not have their own towing or recovery service, are listed under <a href="/Regional/"><strong>Regional </strong></a></li> </ul> <p><strong>(Example:</strong> If you have an auto repair facility in Houston, TX, you would go to: <a href="/Regional/North_America/United_States/Texas/Localities/H/Houston/Business_and_Economy/Automotive/Repair_and_Service/"><strong>Regional: North America: United States: Texas: Localities: H: Houston: Business and Economy: Automotive: Repair and Service</strong></a></p> <ul> <li>Sites dealing with the repossession or asset recovery businesses are listed under <a href="/Business/Financial_Services/Credit_and_Collection/Repossession/"><strong>Business: Financial Services: Credit and Collection: Repossession</strong></a></li> </ul> <p> </p> <ul> <li>Industries involved in the manufacturing, distribution, and sales of towing and recovery products and services are listed under <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/Towing_and_Recovery/Equipment_Suppliers/"><strong>Business: Transportation and Logistics: Towing and Recovery: Equipment Suppliers</strong></a></li> </ul>

entries.title: News_and_Media
entries.description: This category covers news services, television or radio programs, newspapers, magazines, and e-zines which deal exclusively with towing and recovery.

entries.title: Signage
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers, distributors and suppliers of traffic control and warning signs and related equipment .

entries.title: Trolleys
entries.description: <p>This category is limited to following types of sites:</p> <ul> <li>Companies that manufacturer and service trolleys</li> <li>Companies that offer trolleys for sale or lease</li> <li>General sites about the trolley industry</li> <p>This category <b> does not </b> include travel and tourism oriented sites selling, marketing or promoting trolley tours.</p>

entries.title: Trucking
entries.description: All aspects of the commercial trucking business. Includes on and off highway heavy duty trucks. New and used truck and trailer sales, truck repair shops, OEM and aftermarket truck parts sales, truck transport companies, and other related sites of interest to those in the commercial trucking business.

entries.title: Associations
entries.description: This category is for Associations that provide information, industry news, services, advocacy or representation for the trucking industry.

entries.title: Education_and_Training
entries.description: Educational resources specific to the trucking industry.

entries.title: Employment
entries.description: This category contains sites that offer trucking related employment opportunities.

entries.title: Employers
entries.description: Sites offering actual Employment by individual Companies, or available Job listings of the Human Resource department of an individual Company.

entries.title: Products
entries.description: Products of interest to those in the commercial truck and trailer industry.

entries.title: Resources
entries.description: Sites containing general resources for truckers and the trucking industry.

entries.title: Services
entries.description: Sites listed in this category are for companies that provide services such as accounting, bookkeeping, safety systems and reporting directly to trucking companies or owner-operators.

entries.title: Software

translations.jpn: システムとソフトウェア

entries.description: Sites focussed on a variety of trucking software types useful in the trucking industry.

entries.title: Trailers
entries.description: Semi trailers are large commercial trailers and tankers used to haul freight, equipment, and bulk goods and use a fifth wheel to connect to a truck or tractor. This category contains businesses that manufacture, sell, or provide parts and service.

entries.title: Manufacturers
entries.description: This category is for manufacturers of large commercial trailers, flatbeds, low-boys and tankers used to haul freight, equipment, and bulk goods and use a fifth wheel to connect to a truck or tractor.

entries.title: Truck_Parts_and_Repair
entries.description: Heavy duty truck parts sales. If it's NOT heavy duty then submit your site to <A HREF="/Business/Automotive/Parts_and_Accessories/"> Business/Automotive/Parts_and_Accessories<A> or <A HREF="/Shopping/Vehicles/Parts_and_Accessories/"> Shopping/Vehicles/Parts_and_Accessories<A>

entries.title: Aftermarket
entries.description: Parts offered as alternatives to new OEM parts. These include, replacement parts, rebuilt and remanufactured parts and used parts.

entries.title: OEM
entries.description: Original equipment manufacturers parts sales.

entries.title: Truck_Sales
entries.description: Sellers of Class 6, 7 and 8 trucks for highway and off-highway use.

entries.title: New
entries.description: New Class 6, 7 and 8 trucks for highway and off-highway use for sale.

entries.title: Used
entries.description: Used medium and heavy duty (Class 6, 7 and 8) trucks, tractors and similar vehicles for sale.

entries.title: Truck_Transport
entries.description: Carriers, local and long haul, Class 6, 7 and 8. Truck transport of goods. Heavy hauling. Couriers and messengers belong in the Couriers and Messengers subcategory. Shipping that is non-maritime may belong in the Freight and Customs category.

entries.title: Freight_Brokers
entries.description: Person or entity that receives compensation for selling, offering for sale, negotiating, or otherwise arranging the transportation of property by an authorized motor carrier.

entries.title: Pilot_Cars
entries.description: Companies providing motorized escort to trucking companies involved in the transport of oversized and super loads.

entries.title: Truck_Drivers
entries.description: Sites providing discussion, forums or information on issues related to trucking, trucking companies, drivers and owner operators.

entries.title: Chats_and_Forums
entries.description: Message boards or discussion forums where one can interact with other people interested in truck driving.

entries.title: Weblogs
entries.description: Truck driver blogs and personal pages related primarily to driving and the trucking industry.

entries.title: Urban_Transport
entries.description: Businesses relating to the movement of people within urban areas.

entries.title: Tramways_and_LRT
entries.description: Sites with information on specific tramway or light rail transit systems.

entries.title: Transit_Systems
entries.description: Companies or public agencies that offer fixed route or publicly subsidized dial-a-ride transportation service to the public. Official sites and well-maintained volunteer sites are welcome. Companies that advocate technologies should go into the main Urban Transport category. Use Society/Issues/Transportation for transportation ideas that are not in commercial production.

entries.title: Products_and_Services
entries.description: Companies with new technologies or ideas for transit systems are welcome to place their webpages here.

entries.title: Subways
entries.description: This is the place for pages of transit Systems in the US, and around the world, particularly ones offering subway transit.

entries.title: Cities
entries.description: Information on subway systems for various cities. Systems in Paris, New York, and Washington DC should be placed in the appropriate subcategory. Official pages and publicly-owned sites are welcome.

entries.title: Wholesale_Trade
entries.description: <p>The <b>Wholesale Trade</b> category comprises establishments whose primary function is to purchase goods and merchandise from producers and manufacturers and sell those goods, generally without transformation, to re-sellers, often in bulk.</p> <p><b>Sites <u>not listed</u> in this category:</b></p> <ul> <li>Sites for entities involved in the transportation of goods are listed in <a href="/Business/Transportation_and_Logistics/">Business: Transportation and Logistics</a></li> <li>Entities whose primary function is to facilitate wholesale transactions across international borders are collected in <a href="/Business/International_Business_and_Trade/Import_and_Export/">Business: International Business and Trade: Import and Export</a></li> </ul>

entries.title: Directories
entries.description: <H1 align="center"><font color="red">Wholesale</font></H1> The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.<br> The wholesaling process is an intermediate step in the distribution of merchandise. Wholesalers are organised to sell or arrange the purchase of sale of (a) goods for resale (i.e. goods sold to other wholesalers or retailers), (b) capital or durable nonconsumer goods, and (c) raw and intermediate materials and supplies used in production.<br> Wholesale/ contains sites of companies of whose primary focus is to purchase goods and merchandise from producers and manufacturers and to sell them to re-sellers in bulk.<br> <A HREF="/Business/Wholesale_Trade/"> Business/Wholesale_Trade/<A> lists the sites of companies which concentrate to the definition (a) above.

entries.title: Fine_Arts
entries.description: This category comprises establishments whose primary function is to purchase fine art work from manufacturers and sell, generally without transformation, to re-sellers, often in bulk.

entries.title: General_Merchandise
entries.description: <H1 align="center"><font color="red">Wholesale</font></H1> The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.<br / > The wholesaling process is an intermediate step in the distribution of merchandise. Wholesalers are organised to sell or arrange the purchase of sale of (a) goods for resale (i.e. goods sold to other wholesalers or retailers), (b) capital or durable nonconsumer goods, and (c) raw and intermediate materials and supplies used in production.<br / > Wholesale/ contains sites of companies of whose primary focus is to purchase goods and merchandise from producers and manufacturers and to sell them to re-sellers in bulk.<br / > <a href ="/Business/Wholesale_Trade/"> http://dmoz.org/Business/Wholesale_Trade/ </a> Wholesale/ lists the sites of companies which concentrate to the definition (a) above.

entries.title: Liquidators
entries.description: <H1 align="center"><font color="red">Wholesale</font></H1> The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.<br> The wholesaling process is an intermediate step in the distribution of merchandise. Wholesalers are organised to sell or arrange the purchase of sale of (a) goods for resale (i.e. goods sold to other wholesalers or retailers), (b) capital or durable nonconsumer goods, and (c) raw and intermediate materials and supplies used in production.<br> Wholesale/ contains sites of companies of whose primary focus is to purchase goods and merchandise from producers and manufacturers and to sell them to re-sellers in bulk.<br> <A HREF="/Business/Wholesale_Trade/"> Business/Wholesale_Trade/<A> lists the sites of companies which concentrate to the definition (a) above.
